Our team would be happy to speak to you about your experience at the resort.  You may contact Customer Advocacy directly at 800 936 6824 or by email at customer.advocacy@vacationclub.com.

Summary Heading: Good resort at a good location
Summary: I think title says it all. We stayed for one night. Located on a hillside with distant ocean view. We watched the sunset from the pool. Two bedroom suite with plenty of room to roam and a nice kitchen and laundry. It’s a long walk to the beach. Closest beach is a short drive to Crystal Cove State Park.
Manager Response: Hi EarthSpinner, thank you for your review of Marriott's Newport Coast Villas. We are delighted that you enjoyed your stay with us and hope you visit us again in the future!

Summary Heading: A review from a non-owner stay
Summary: We were a little worried staying here because we were just hotel guests and not owners. I read some reviews that hotel guests were given last choice for rooms, and views. It makes sense, but still frustrating. Check-in was chaotic. Or course everyone wants the best room and the best view. You can tell who owns a time share by how very demanding they are to the front desk staff. We ended up mostly getting what we wanted but not really a view. I was more concerned about an updated room anyway and close to the main pool. We got both of those so that's fine.   We've stayed at several hotels during Covid and I must say, this location was the best as far as how clean the room was. The carpet, floors, everything was spotless! White socks, stayed white. We did have a slight bug problem
Manager Response: Hi, thank you for your review of Marriott's Newport Coast Villas. We are happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. We are very saddened to hear of a bug opportunity in your room, we will share this with the site leaders to ensure the room is checked by the pest control team. We are happy that you enjoyed some of the amenities the site has to offer. We hope you visit us again soon.

Summary: The sculptures, fountains and architecture on the beautiful resort grounds evoked fond memories of pre-pandemic travels to Italy. Envy those guests in rooms with panoramic vantage of the blue Pacific (probably on everyone’s wish list). Wonder if repeating ocean-view request at check-in might have altered room placement; no change allowed after room assignment for sanitary reason. Our 4th floor suite perched on high ground looked out to a peaceful neighboring green hillside. We appreciate the well-kept, clean villa with comfy beds (queen size in 2nd bedroom), spacious layout & closets, robust complimentary WiFi, quality kitchenware, and a sideway vista of the ocean from the balcony (cranking the neck a bit). The nearby Canyon Pool required a steep ascent up flights of stairs
Manager Response: Hi, thank you for your review of Marriott's Newport Coast Villas. We are delighted that you chose our location to spend your staycation. We are happy that you enjoyed all the resort has to offer as well as the surrounding area. We hope that you visit us again!

Summary: Do not rent a villa from the property owners Rachel and Susan of premier rentals.  They lie about the amenities available during Covid.  Go through Marriott directly.  They will scam you like they did me and my family. They have several rentals on the internet.

I was impressed with the cleanliness and attention to Covid rules and cleaning.  We were not sure what to expect and they exceeded our expectations.  The quality of the management of this resort is apparent.  Thank you!
Manager Response: Hi, thank you for your review of Marriott's Newport Coast Villas. We are delighted that you satisfied with the new Covid-19 policies. The safety of our owners and guests is our first priority. We hope to welcome you back in the future.

Summary Heading: Beautiful View and Amenities - Room Terrible
Summary: I usually skip right over the negative reviews because as you can't please everyone but as I sit in this room there are a couple of things that could be changed to knock it up to the excellent rating. The beds seem like they have not been changed out in a long time. When you lay in the master or guest beds you just sink into each side with the middle of the bed is about 10 inches higher, woke up after night 1, and felt like I was beaten with a bat. Sore and stiff to where golf was not possible. Called the desk, they sent someone up with a "bed board" not sure if it was a sheet of plywood or what but it did get rid of the sinkholes, however not nearly as comfortable as the other Marriott properties. That's the main complaint, then last night we are sitting on the couch and the
Manager Response: Hi, thank you for your review of Marriott's Newport Coast Villas. We are very sorry to hear that your mattress cause discomfort during your stay. We will share your feedback with the site leaders to the mattress can be changed.

Summary: Beautiful place ! Every is within your reach ! The room or I should say your two bedrooms condo ! Very large room and a kitchen you can cook in  love the size of all the bathrooms as well  If you want to be pampered this is it  Can’t wait to come back !

Summary Heading: Great place for a couples get away
Summary: The place was amazing. The 2 bedroom suites have everything you need. The pools were very clean and they sanitized each place once guest got up. I felt very safe. The staff worked extra hard to ensure all was clean and safe. They rooms were large and spacious. The service for fresh towels or other stuff like toilet paper etc... was delivered so fast to the room once requested. The grounds were immaculant. Everyone was so nice. My only suggestion was to have a mirror in the living room. One of the couples slept in the living room area and waiting for the bathroom for a mirror to apply her makeup and blow dry her hair was a little frustrating. It would have been nice if the living room had a mirror next to an outlet. I suggest bring a small mirror with you.

I was told by a friend  the property was descent, but nothing great. The reviews were mostly positive,  but not outstanding so we were not expecting anything great. It’s always nice when you get more than what you are expecting and this is one of those times. The property is beautiful and expansive .  They have everything you can imagine from a family resort from tennis to volleyball.  The rooms were very spacious and nice.  I thought the price was very fair for what you get and the location.  We will definitely be returning as SoCal is one of my favorite places to visit in the summer months.
Manager Response: Hi Jeffrey, thank you for your review of Marriott's Newport Coast Villas. We are delighted to hear that your stay was above your expectations. We look forward to welcoming you back!

Summary: As owners of Marriott timeshares, we love coming to this property for the total rejuvenation it provides.  Especially during Covid -19.  Marriott adheres to all protocols.  We spend all day out after breakfast in the room.  We head down the hill to Crystal Cove State Park and walk the full paved trail 2.7 miles at least once before beach time and rambling around the full 15 miles of trail. This property is a gem.  Scenic views from the balconies; fitness gyms; pools and and Adirondack chair areas at the hillside and umbrella chaise lounge areas.  Pretty fountains.

This was our first visit to MVCI's Newport Coast Villas. We're Owners at MVCI's Ko Olina and Maui locations.  Due to Hawaii's quarantine requirements, we decided to take a road trip to SoCal and try the Newport Coast Villas resort.  We weren't sure about taking a family vacation during a pandemic, but we needed a getaway to rest, relax, and rejuvenate near the ocean.  We all loved our villa, which was spacious (for family of 4 with two college-age kids), very clean, equipped with w/d and full kitchen, and had great views of the Pacific Ocean.    Although the resort's occupancy rate was high (over 85%) during our August 2020 stay, we only encountered another guest in the elevator once (we opted to wait for an empty elevator).  Each of the 3 pools were also closely monitored to

Summary Heading: Incredible Marriott Villas in Newport Coast
Summary: We have owned this timeshare since 2001 and have used it every year. The weather is much cooler than inland cities & the property is beautiful. We enjoy the pool, the BBQ areas, the games and the close proximity to the beach. Great family memories over the years. Highly recommend. Steve Concialdi

Summary Heading: Mini Honeymoon during the COVID-19 re-opening phases
Summary: My wife and I was excited to visit this beautiful location considering how everyone’s lives had change with the coronavirus pandemic. Our marriage wasn’t how we planned but we got a chance to have a mini honeymoon. We thought we would experience what the other guest experience, which was an amazing fun time relaxing by the pool and socializing with other guest. Once there we noticed as African Americans in this particular part of Newport Beach our stay at this expensive resort was quickly disappointed with racist stares, strange looks and no friendliness from the other guest. The staff was very nice but considering how the guest were so stand-off ish from us we felt very uncomfortable and we wanted our stay to end fast. We actually brought our experience to the manager on
Manager Response: Hi Spencer, thank you for your review of your recent stay!  We are sorry to hear you had a negative interaction with other guests.  We are always happy to speak with you and assist with situations that arise during your visit.  With social distancing guidelines in place, some guests may not feel as comfortable meeting new people in public spaces.  We apologize if this came off as rude or unwelcoming.  Thank you again for your feedback and for choosing Newport Coast Villas!

Summary: We stayed for a week and checked out on the 4th.  We stay every 4th of July week.  This year was much different.    The Marriott is doing a great job keeping the property clean.  We watched the lawn chairs getting cleaned a few times a day.  They hotel was at 70% capacity with unit rentals.  Pool chairs are spaced out and they are monitoring to make sure people are not putting them together.  The chairs were full, main pool was busy. Sue did a great job at the pool, we felt bad watching her having to remind people of the rules.  The new slides at the lower pool were fun and a great addition.  The shuttles were running to Crystal Cove only.   At Crystal Cove the Beach Comber is a great place for breakfast and you can rent beach chairs and umbrellas for the day.    We were sad
Manager Response: Hi, thank you for your review of your recent stay at Marriott's Newport Coast Villas. We are delighted that you had a great stay and an even better view. We look forward to welcoming you back next year!

Summary: We stayed one night in a 2 bedroom villa. It was roomy enough for the 5 of us.  It was clean and it had a kitchen with a full size refrigerator and freezer, a dining area, living room with pullout sofa and even a washer and dryer. The beds and even the pull out sofa were comfortable. We stayed on the second floor of building 2200 which had a porch and partial ocean view. I was grateful that it was not that far from the main pool. You just have to walk up a flight of stairs to get there. There’s an elevator and a dolly for you luggage which made it easier to haul our stuff. The main guest gets a parking pass that you can use to park anywhere. The other guests gets a pass to park inside the garage or parallel park at designated areas. We enjoyed the beautiful pools. Front desk

Summary Heading: Going forward, every reduction in staff and amenities will be blamed on the Coronavirus!
Summary: Just returned from a week here, where we've stayed many times. From an initial hassle with a few prickly people about a previously arranged early check in, you know, at the front desk, noted by another reviewer, to a miraculous check in  an hour later, the entire place seemed way overdone in terms of stinginess wrt what was open and what was not. Despite a good number of people staying there, no gyms were open, no Jacuzzis, only one pool, and the only shuttle service was provided to the over-rated Crystal Cove Beach. HOWEVER, the over-priced pool restaurant was open!!! The room we occupied was adequate except for the extreme noise of cars and motorcycles driven by rich, macho boys, revving their engines up and down the highway in front of the hotel and up and down Newport Coast
Manager Response: Hi, thank you for your review of your recent stay at Marriott's Newport Coast Villas. We are very sorry that your vacation was impacted by the effects of Covid-19. We have shared your feedback with the resort leaders.

Summary Heading: Don’t purchase here. No benefits for owners.
Summary: We bought at Newport Coast in 2006. Since then whenever we have stayed here we have requested an ocean view on a corner. We got it one time. Currently in June only owners are allowed to stay at the property there is only 50% occupancy so room request should not be a problem. We were assigned a partial Oceanview in the middle of a building. Once you walk into the room you are assigned you cannot move because it is taking “four hours to clean and sterilize rooms.“ The first night it rained and the second bedroom developed a leak in the ceiling over the fold out couch that my daughter was sleeping in. Fortunately the ceiling did not collapse on her. I called the desk and they sent an engineer.  While waiting,  I spoke with the desk manager, Kim, and explained my disappointment with
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback on your stay with us.  Our team would welcome the chance to personally follow up with you and apologize for the issues you experienced.   You may contact Customer Advocacy directly at 800 936 6824 or by email at customer.advocacy@vacationclub.com.

Summary: We have been here many times, but not recently in the past 4 years.  To  get out of the house due to cabin fever, we decided to go here for a week.  Even though many services were closed, the pool was open.  We did not use it though.  We had food delivery to our room.  We got a full ocean view, which was lovely.  We missed coming here and hope to come back after COVID-19 is over.

Summary Heading: Pandemic Cancelled our Trip, Resort kept our money
Summary: Covid-19 forced us to cancel our vacation. We originally considered trying to go anyway before it became clear that traveling was both risky and irresponsible.  Marriott and owner reminded us that, despite a global pandemic, an agreement is an agreement and kept our money since we didn't cancel earlier. Owner did offer us 35% of our money after we badgered them but was clear they were doing us a favor.  The resort looks beautiful and we wish could have enjoyed it but, given these circumstances, we will never consider it again nor will we ever do business with Marriott again.
Manager Response: Hi James, we are sorry to hear COVID-19 impacted your travel plans.  With an agreement made with you and a private individual, we are unable to provide assistance given the agreement is between two private parties.  With all reservations booked directly with Marriott, a flexibile cancellation policy was implemented and guests received refunds.  We do recommend this option for future travels to avoid any type of issue.  Thank you for your review and feedback on this.

Summary: We decided to drive to So. CA during Spring Break as many places were closing down amid the COVID-19 pandemic.  We didn't have a reservation but when we arrived they had availability and we were able to book four nights in one of their 2 bedroom villas.  This resort is 5 star all the way. The condos are so beautiful with enough space for the entire family. The beds are comfortable, the kitchen and dining room make it very easy to enjoy meals in and the balcony is a great way to breath in the fresh ocean air.  Most of the amenities were still available but on our 2nd day they did close down the hot tubs, spa, sauna and fitness activities.  But the pools were all still open and the pool cafe was also open with tasty drinks and food.  You just can't beat the views as it's

We vacationed at Marriott Newport Coast Villas 2 weeks ago and we couldn't have loved it more!  Before arrival, Bunny was very helpful in taking requests for an ocean view and close to amenities for small children.  She placed us perfectly- ocean view, 2nd floor- right by the playground/ basketball hoops/ mini golf.  Still only a short walk to the pool.  The pool was amazing- we got lucky with an unusually warm week which made it only better!  Every staff member we encountered was top notch!  We did yoga sessions several mornings and took advantage of the beach walk that is offered.  Brittany was fabulous- very talented yoga instructor!  Also, plenty of activities for kids.  The magic show on Sundays is great!  Susie also did a great science show and was very engaging with the

Summary Heading: One of the best of Marriott Resorts
Summary: Nicely located in Newport Beach, CA.  This resort is outstanding and beautiful.  Next to a golf course.  Get a ocean view room!  View is fantastic.   The pools are beautiful.  The lower pool is big and more people there.  The upper pool is smaller but less people and quite to relax.

Summary Heading: COMPLETELY BLOWN AWAY BY THIS PLACE
Summary: I booked a weekend here over the President's weekend for a getaway with my Wife. We had a great time and loved our accommodations. I cannot wait to bring the kids to this resort for some family fun and R & R.

We stayed here two nights to visit relatives.   It’s a beautiful property.  Excellent service.  We had a great view of the ocean.  The villas climb up a hill a few miles from the ocean.   The villas are five stars.  Parking is easy.  A shuttle can take you between places on site.  Expensive.

I came here in February so maybe because it's the down time or something felt the rates were a very good value. I came here with my wife and 1.5 year old toddler and would do it again as the apartments were extremely spacious and clean.   Of note, I primarily booked for location so I did not use many of the amenities on site and cannot comment on the on site activities however the resort does offer free shuttle to the surrounding attractions and I found that extremely valuable. There is also free parking for your car if you chose to drive here which is great.   Overall, if you are paying in the $200 range and want a spacious place close to the beach, OC, etc, that can sleep a lot of people comfortable then this is the place.

Summary Heading: Thin walls and kids running wild!
Summary: Great views and the staff are friendly but if you are looking for peaceful experience stay away!!   Although the grounds are beautiful, bar and the room attendant staff are top notch professionals, I am not impressed with the villas. The noise level is insane to the point I could not get a good night sleep. I tried calling the front desk but I was on hold for the next available agent! I had to walk down to the front desk and even after telling me security would show up, nothing!! The walls and floors are so thin you can hear everything!!  Crappy construction! The stomping, slamming of neighbors doors, kids running wild is enough for me to say I will not stay here again. This was building 4700, 2nd floor. If you do plan to stay,  may the odds be forever in your favor!!

I am a Marriott Bonvoy Silver member. I USUALLY try to stay at Marriott owned properties but no more b/c of the rude and discourteous way I was treated at this particular property. Front desk at check-in was kurt and not very helpful. We barely used the property and had a late flight out, i.e., 7:30PM from John Wayne. Spoke to the first front desk clerk; no have to be out by 10AM. Then asked to speak to the on-site manager, Eddie Garcia. Told him my story and was the least helpful hotel (and I travel and stay at a lot of hotels) employee I think I've spoken to in yrs. He could have made an exception but refused, "Maybe I can give you to 10:30AM (instead of 10:00AM), maybe 11:00AM." Thanks for nothing Eddie. I will be sure to share my Marriott experience w/ everyone I can think

We were impressed with the large 2bed 2 bath villas.  They are like furnished apartments complete with housewares.  Our room had a great view of the ocean and pool.  They had activities each day.  Staff was friendly.

We thoroughly enjoyed a week's stay at Marriott's Newport Coast Villas. The resort grounds are well manicured, the staff is attentive in every way, the amenities are plentiful, and the view is breathtaking! I have traveled quite a bit in the last year and found this to be the perfect respite.
Manager Response: Hi Kelly, we are so happy to hear that you had a fantastic stay and were able to relax with a beautiful view. We hope to see you back in the future.

Summary: Nice property, location and service...Fun place to stay with the kids and enjoy the amenities...nice views of the ocean and all units are two bedrooms...the market/cafe was redone and looks great, the grounds are well maintained

Summary Heading: Good value for a 2 bed/ 2 bath but no Marriot Platinum Benefits
Summary: The Marriott's Newport Coast Villas is a beautiful property. The sprawling grounds are huge with 3 gigantic pools, pool bar, jacuzzis, fitness center, spa, arcade, movie theater, general store and more. There is plenty to do at the resort without leaving the property. Unfortunately, there are no Marriot Platinum benefits at this hotel. No upgraded room, breakfast, late check-out, club lounge. I asked for an early check- in and I was given the standard response “check-in is at 4:00 pm but we will try and get you in earlier.” I was told there was a room that was empty but needed to be cleaned and was told it could take up to 6 hours to clean it. I asked why it takes 6 hours to clean the room and the receptionist said that there is a kitchen and some people are messy. I was in my

It was my first time at Newport Beach. The Villas are great. What a huge property. You’ll need a car or bike so you can get to know all sites and activities at the hotel. The rooms are well equipped and you’ve got everything you need for you and your family have a great time while being there. The staff were very friendly. I even could purchase tickets to Disneyland through the front desk. No extras fees included. It was great too. I’ll be back any time soon - probably in the summer to get to enjoy the pools and the beach.

This is our third stay as the location is convenient but each time we have encountered reservation issues, they always claim to never have received your requests ( upper floor ) etc, this time arriving late in the evening after an 11.5 hour flight we were told that there were no other rooms available & that their members always took priority over normal reservations...we felt so valued ( NOT ) 07.00 & the gardeners began work outside of our room, closely followed by the workmen with all kinds of machinery working on the block right next door, as the entire block was covered in scaffolding it was obviously a long term construction or reform, we were not told about this on reservation or at reception when booking in, went to go outside & the discovered that the sliding door lock
Manager Response: Hi Julie, thank you for your review from your stay at Marriott's Newport Coast Villas. We are very sorry to hear that each stay you encounter a reservation opportunity. When making requests it is best to call the resort directly. While we do appreciate each guests patronage, as a vacation ownership property our owners do receive priority in villa location. We will provide your feedback about the gardeners, site construction, and condition of the villa to the leadership team in order to improve future stays.

Summary: We have stayed here the past two Januarys for a week. Not much going on at the resort but it is a great place to relax and provides a base for traveling around Southern California. The rooms are spacious with a large 60” TV in the living room. The bed  rooms have 55” TV’s.   Very impressed with housekeeping who would bring supplies (towels, coffee, etc) on request. They always followed up to see if our requests were delivered.     Some noise from the painters could awaken late sleepers. These type of properties receive year around maintenance. Plenty of parking is available and the Chrystal Cove State Park is across the street.   All the help is friendly and happy yup please the customer.

Summary Heading: Great Property - Just Don't Leave Your Stuff!
Summary: Newport Coast Villas is an awesome place to stay. The location is ideal, close to the PCH and Highway 73. Our room was very quiet, easy to access, and super spacious. It was a great setup to allow our two kids to sleep while we could still access the kitchen and living area. The entire property is just awesome. Great pools, fun activities for kids (play room with toys, playground, movies and games to rent), and ample space to walk and run.  We absolutely loved staying here and would stay again. My only two areas of disappointment were that the in-room dryer was pretty loud and the Lost & Found process at the hotel is in need of improvement. We accidentally left two swimsuits hanging in the shower rod on the day we left. We called that day once we realize it and filled out the

We stayed across from the fountain which is also entrance to main pool area. Great location. Would request that area again. We have stayed here several times. A Beautiful  property. Definitely will continue to stay at this property again.
Manager Response: It is great to hear that you enjoyed your stay at Marriott’s Newport Coast Villas and the villa location was ideal for your family. We look forward to hosting you again in the future!

Summary: My kids and myself just returned from a stay in Newport Beach at this location.  The accommodations were amazing. The beds were very very comfy.  This is like top quality bedding and linens.  The bathrooms were nice sized and shower was huge with great shower heads.  The unit had 2 bedrooms and 2 bathrooms plus private washer dryer and a full size kitchen dining room living room and patio facing the ocean.  Plenty of parking in front.  We didn’t go to the clubhouse but we did go across the street by car to have dinner at Pelican Hill which is in itself amazing.   I am a Marriott Titanium Elite so I love to frequent Marriott properties when I have the option for points with the Bonvoy program.   This place is amazing though and I would highly recommend. And traveling with two

Summary Heading: Very comfortable stay at beautiful property
Summary: Beautiful property. Spacious rooms, very comfortable. Clean. Breathtaking grounds and surrounding area. There were some minor issues the staff assisted with immediately. I wish Californians were just nicer people overall but that’s not the resort’s fault. :) Thanks for having us!!

You can hear everything from The people above you. Our bougie neighbors below us kept complaining we were too loud at 9 pm. The insulation sucks here. It’s a family place and yet people can’t handle the “noise.”
Manager Response: Thank you for stay with us at Marriott's Newport Coast Villas. We do apologize the room did not have as much privacy as needed during the stay. We do welcome families to our resort, but also expect all of our guests and owners to conduct themselves in a respectful manner.

Summary: This Marriott Vacation Villas are in a wonderful location, with fantastic surroundings and views of the ocean. The exterior of the development was tastefully designed and extremely well maintained which made for a very pleasant holiday stay.  Unfortunately, I feel badly that Marriott had not done justice to this piece of property which could really be a 5 star vacation spot. First of all, the villa floor plans was badly designed, with lots of waste of space in some area and tiny space inside the bathrooms. There is no room to stand inside the bathroom while trying to open the shower door to get in or out. The vanity lighting is 100% brighter than it needs to be so we just did not turn it on for it's practically not usable.  The beds in both bedrooms sorely need replacement as

This resort is very very nice and the villa is very spacious unfortunately yet you still played music in the lobby during overnight hours you need to turn off your music during overnight hours because it is disturbing guests who are staying near the lobby. 2nd during our stay housekeeping came at 3 to clean our villa and we were leaving and we told them to come after 30 min they said no they can’t which I though they refused service either retrain your housekeeping staff or get new ones overall very nice property and we will definitely return thank you and happy new year

Beautiful place to visit. Bulboa beach island is phenomenol. A must visit. Marriott villas are very relaxing and peaceful in serene environment.Fashion island is a high end Mall. One of the most beautiful place to visit.

This is great for couples, families or friends. Very gorgeous landscaping, palm trees, birds of paradise and much green and flowering landscape.  Friendly and welcoming staff.  We love walking around the grounds and can walk to beach if you’d like to.  Some units have a nice ocean view, we don’t - very disappointing. ☹️.  We will keep coming back here and will request ocean view next time.

Pools, pickle ball, tennis, hot tubs, shuffle board and others when we were not on the beach. Plenty of activities just a few steps from any room. The suites are well equipped and comfortable. Plenty of space and storage. The W/D worked well and the cleaning service made sure we had the coffee we needed.

We greatly enjoyed our 2 week stay at the Marriott NCV.  The location is great. We had a 4th floor ocean view villa. The unit is perfectly appointed, everything you may need. Staff is very friendly and accommodating. Truly " at your service."  Highly recommend Marriott properties.

Summary Heading: Newport Marriott Villas -- a California coastal gem!
Summary: We vacationed at the Marriott Newport Coast Villas using it as home base for our drives around and explorations of southern California beach communities that included Huntington (north) and Laguna and Laguna Niguel (south) -- locations within easy driving from the Marriott. We love this part of California with its breath-taking scenery, picturesque drives, and charming little towns that invite pedestrian browsing. The Marriott Villas is spectacular in and of itself with every suite comprised of two bedrooms and two baths (also full kitchen and adjacent dining and living areas) — no need to compete for coveted square footage, with a sense of all-inclusiveness that invited our family to remain on Marriott premises. Our 4th floor suite enabled us to record a spectacular sunset.

Condos have a fantastic layout with two bedrooms on opposite sides.  Only drawback is the super early checkout at 10am, they need to fix that, otherwise great pools and beautiful views.  Good for families, kitchen had all the basics to prepare a full meal.

We had 4 adults and 2 teens on our trip. The rooms were spacious, 2 bed 2 bath worked great for us. There also was 2 hide a beds for the kids. With a functional kitchen we were able to make breakfast for everyone. For Thanksgiving  we went to Hook and Spear another Marriott near by. There is a goos size balcony with great views of golf course and ocean.  This was our 2nd trip here and we will definitely return.

Terrific property and staff. The views are amazing and the villas well equipped too.  Lots of daily activities, especially the daily happy hour with different choices every day👍  If you live or are visiting SoCal this is a must stay resort.

Summary Heading: October was the perfect time of Year!
Summary: First time at Marriott's Newport Coast Villas.. Stayed on Destination points and received a nice ocean/golf course view room in the 2200 building which is close to main pool. Only negative would be the Hwy1 noise at night. I would be curious how the buildings further in with ocean views hear the traffic.Needed to keep widows closed at night but what can they do about the noise anyways. Still loved the location. Staff friendly and attentive. Loved watching the sun rise each morning while sipping coffee on the balcony. Did participate in a sales presentation but not a hard sell environment at all. Yvonne was so nice and we received very helpful information and tips for using our ownership.This is a great Marriott Vacation Club property. Shout out to Housekeeping mgr/ Rigoberto and

This resort was perfect for my older kids. The two bedroom villa gave us all enough space to comfortably stay. The check in line was a bit daunting and they were not great about delayed check out, but the resort was wonderful. The kids could run around from the pool to the arcade and the movie room - they had a great time and so my husband and I did too. The views are great too.

Beautiful timeshare villas. We went on a Marriott offer of 3 nights 4 days with a presentation of the Marriott vacation plan. The presentation was low pressure, quick, and pleasant. We also received a $50 gift card which was a surprise. The villas are all two bedrooms / two bath with full kitchen, very well appointed with balcony and large closets, beautiful shower in master and spa tub. The grounds are gorgeous. No on site restaurant but does have a grill at the main pool. The food was just so-so and the drinks not so good. Both pricey. Better to go to local grocery and use their kitchen or to an area restaurant. They have a shuttle that takes you to nearby beautiful beaches and fashion island. Also they have an on-site shuttle to take you to the pool and back. The property is
Manager Response: We are happy to be your home away from home, Sherry!  Thank you for your review and for sharing your comments about Newport Coast Villas.  We hope you will return soon!

Summary: We booked this resort for a week through Interval. We stayed 11/9-11/16.  Madison at the front desk was great.  We attempted to check in early but we not able to do so, even so, we were given room keys and when our room was ready, we were notified of the room # via text message.  We stayed in room 4112 which is on the 1st floor with a great view of the golf course and the ocean.  The villa was spacious and nicely decorated. The king room has a large tub and a large walk in shower with 2 shower heads.  The beds were comfortable enough but the pillows were WAY too soft for all of us.  We didn’t ask for any other pillows so are not sure if different pillows were an option. The kitchen was well stocked.  Throughout the resort, there are BBQ grills and a lot of pools.  In the

Had the privilege of staying here for 3 nights as first time visitors  we found it to be an excellent choice .  the location is perfect with magnificent views of the ocean, and the facilities are top class. Odviously not cheap but you wouldn't expect it to be . Also locally Laguna beach and Crystal Cove are well worth seeing ..  Enjoy !

We enjoyed our vacation at Newport Coast Villa's, the accommodations were very clean & decorated very nice. We were in building 4100 which has a beautiful view of the golf course & full view of the ocean. There are many activities for children, each day we were treated to wine & cheese, beer & snacks etc. Every staff member we met was more then accommodating with excellent customer service skills. We will be back!
Manager Response: Thank you, Pat!  We are greatful for your 5-star review on TripAdvisor and are happy your stay was wonderful.  We cannot wait to have you back!

Summary: We stayed in a 2 bedroom villa with limited ocean views. Our family of four was very comfortable there.  We had a nice outdoor balcony which we enjoyed in the morning and late at night.  The complex is massive but well laid out. We enjoyed the pool area one afternoon and the service there was great.  We visited nearby Laguna for dining and shopping which is always a treat.  Very good place to just relax and enjoy all the area has to offer.  Of course we made a visit to Fashion Island. Also went about 20 minutes south to rent kayaks and explore the marina there.  Very pleasant stay.  The front desk staff if a bit standoffish that would be my only complaint.  Funny how other reviewers point this out and they were spot on.  Not very accommodating or invested in making your stay

Great accommodations with ocean and golf course views. Easy stroll to the Reception Center for the Cinema, fitness center, market place and La Vista Pool Bar & Grill. Enjoyed tea and cookies every day at 3 by the Koi pond and meeting other guests. Convenient BBQ just outside around the corner from our door.

I try to visit this wonderful resort once a year! This year we were able to stay for a week in September. The weather was great! Our room was beautiful and overlooked the ocean. Awesome sunsets were seen! The room was very clean and the kitchen was well stocked. The staff was very friendly and extremely helpful. This year staff helped me with our luggage to the room! That was great!

The resort has a special free drink every day at 3 PM near the Coy Pond.  There is a small shop that includes some food items and staples for your visit.  The pastry section is especially good.  My favorite is the large apple fritter for $3 or half price on all pastries, salads, and premade sandwiches after 5 PM. The suites are spacious.  I think they are all 2 BR condo.  Upper floors usually give an ocean view.  The resort is on the hillside above Highway 1. There is a shuttle that runs thru the resort to get you to the main building and the pool area which also has a bar with some fod.  Anothe shuttle run you to Laguna Nigel where you can shbk op or eat at excellent restaurants as well as check out the beach there or walk the paved areas above the beach.  Up to 3 DVDs are

Our two bedroom suite was beautiful and stocked with anything you could need. We had a great view from our balcony. The poo was very comfortably heated. Staff was lovely as well! I would highly recommend this resort especially if you have children

When we got to our room late Friday night we put our four kids to bed, and noticed some ants crawling up the door frame. We went to bed, called in the morning, and the hotel said they would come and spray....and that we needed to give them 3 hours without being in the room so they could do that!!! Am I crazy? I would never spray chemicals around my four kids, and then I think it’s absurd to have to be out of the room for 3 hours! The ants were in our beds, in the sinks, on our pillows, on our nightstands, tv stand, bathrooms and kitchen! We didn’t know where to put our bags because the ants were everywhere! After talking with someone at the front desk, they finally moved us to another villa. We had to wait outside with all our luggage for over an hour while they got the next
Manager Response: Hi TesAnn, we are sorry to hear about the ants that were in your villa upon check-in.  We appreciate your feedback and will share your comments with the front desk leadership team.  We hope the rest of your stay was wonderful and thank you for choosing Newport Coast Villas.

Summary: I rely on tripadvisor for reviews when I make plans. We have presidental level Marriott Status so have high expectations. This resort is just okay. It is old. It is gigantic. Hard to get around due to lots of hills and stairs. They will tell you there are golf carts and shuttles to take you around but it is not true. The golf carts whiz by and never look up as you struggle up, up the walkways. The units are okay. Stack washer and dryer. We did have a nice view. Nice bar area but of course very expensive,as you would expect. They nickel and dime you for activities that should be free.  This is not our home resort with MVC and probably won't return. Actually probably won't return to California. Too much traffic and way too expensive. Lovely weather,though.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review, Debby.  We appreciate your feedback and are happy you gave Newport Coast Villas on your trip to California.

Summary: First of all this place is extremely accessible. We stayed in a suite with walk in shower huge bathroom and open kitchen and roll in under counters.  There are ramps everywhere and hoyers at the pools.  This resort is beautiful and highly recommend staying here

Summary Heading: Do not stay here and do a timeshare presentation
Summary: We made our reservation several months ago and paid in advance.  Then a few days prior to our departure to the Villa, they e-mailed and stated they would have to change our presentation to 1:30 from the 9:00 time slot.  After reading several reviews I see this seems to be a bait and switch technique they are using on their customers.  If I would have read the reviews prior to signing up for the presentation and stay I would run the other way.  Unfortunately we aren't even at the resort and Marriott is already doing the same thing to us as to various customers.  I tried calling, e-mailing several times to say we only have two days at the Villa and have plans both afternoons.  They keep saying the same thing over and over.   STAY AWAY FROM THIS RESORT!!!!  Don't waste your time or
Manager Response: Hi Winsor, thank you for your feedback on your recent stay.  We are sorry to hear there was an issue with your time booked for the presentation.  We will share this with the sales team and do hope the rest of your time with us was wonderful.

Summary: First the good stuff. Location. That's it. You can get to everything easily from here - Newport, Laguna, Corona Del Mar, etc. We accepted a very enticing offer to visit and attend a timeshare presentation. Planned for my husband's bday and friends coming into town from TX. When booking, we scheduled the timeshare thing at 9am on one of our days so that it wouldn't interfere with plans for the week. A couple weeks before, we get an email updating our time to 1:30 on my husband's bday. I write back explaining issue and the coordinator says, that's what we do now and you have to attend or pay full price for the nights at the resort. Really? I followed your rules and you agreed, then now you change and it's my problem? I re explain we will not be on property and they graciously move
Manager Response: Hi Bailey, we hope everyone has a wonderful time during their stay at Newport.  We apologize for the challenges you had on your visit and will share this with the resort leadership team.  Thank you for bringing this to our attention and we hope you will give us another chance in the future.

Summary: Came out for a quick 3 nights which regretted not planning a longer stay. Resort property is beautiful. There are 5 pools, koi pond, outdoor grills, a park, games for the kids, outdoor bar, live music in the evenings. Breath taking sunsets over looking Catalina Island. Shuttle will take you to the beach, Laguna Beach, or Fashion Island for shopping. Only negative- no real on property dining (just pool bar food) and the shuttle evening hours are not ideal. We ordered out and had pizza delivered one night. But next visit will plan ahead more for grilling out meals, or renting a car to get around better.

Summary Heading: In the Heart of Southern California Beaches with world class resort location
Summary: Great property, it reminds me of a village in the south of France, spectacular views of the Pacific Ocean. Perfect location is situated in a very private secluded area that is minutes away from Laguna Beach, Costa Mesa, Disneyland and of course Newport Beach.   Several pools and evey resort feature you may want

Summary Heading: Sister Trip--Couldn't have been more perfect!
Summary: The view from our villa was amazing.  We were in the area near the Canyons pool--where they have yoga classes at 7:30 am!  Amilamia G. did an outstanding job preparing our unit--it was spotless!  She also folded a lovely towel turtle that was complete with paper eyes.  Very sweet. Jeremy at the front desk was cheerful, outgoing and had a contagious smile.  We had a feeling our room would not be ready when we arrived at 11 am, but Jeremy explained the amenities of the resort, showed us the building we would be staying in and was even able to give us our keys.  A few hours later the front desk texted us with our room number.  Liza Williams, the asst. front office manager, was also very welcoming.   Dalia Onofre, our pre-arrival specialist, was helpful in making sure that we had a

First off, the location alone pays for the price to stay here. Being walking distance from the coast is a dream spot to stay in California. The villas also have many activities to partake in within its property. One can play sand volleyball, tennis, basketball, or golf in multiple spots throughout the resort. The resort also boasts several pools and hot tubs for all guests to enjoy. While by the pool, guests can also play a game of shuffleboard, ping pong, corn hole, and more. Along with all of this, the resort hosts daily activities for guests to compete against each other or hang out together at many locations around the resort. 	The staff of the resort are also exceptionally respectful and accommodating. They were able to accomodate my family and I any time we called with an
Manager Response: We are happy you had a wonderful stay, Jonathan!  Thank you for sharing your #VacationGreatness on TripAdvisor!

Summary Heading: Perfect locale for girl's get away
Summary: Annual girls trip this year was in Newport Beach. The Villas were the perfect place to stay! Centrally located for activities (eg: beach, Catalina), dining (lots of restaurants close by - not walkable but the Villas offer a local shuttle service), shopping (again, not walkable but a short drive/Uber) and lots of time together in our lovely accomodations.

Celebrated my sister’s birthday and just being together with all our family! The unit was spacious and very nice! The grounds were well kept and the pools were clean. The poolside bar and grill had many choices for all! Another nice thing was Parking my car and jumping on the trolley. We will be back!
Manager Response: Thank you for celebrating your sister's birthday with us, Denise!  We are happy to hear you had a great time and we cannot wait for your return to Newport Coast Villas.

Summary: We loved this very upscale resort. Our two bedroom unit was spacious and nicely appointed. The pools were lovely and the shuttle to Crystal Cove State Park beach was wonderful. This is a great resort for families and couples. The grounds are very tropical and they are well maintained. We did not eat at the on site restaurant but did shop in the small gift shop, convenience store. A bit pricey but it came in handy for a few items we needed.

We are Platinum Members and always request a top floor. This was not our first time staying at a Villa Type Resort with Marriott.  My husband and I along with 2 teen children checked in at the resort. -Noticing that we were not on the top floor grabbed a cart and we quickly realized there wasn’t any elevator up/down. - Had to carry our bags up 2 flights of stairs. We have young healthy boys so it wasn’t a hardship. -After our first night we kindly asked to be moved. The people staying above us liked to make lots of noise between the hours of 10pm and 2am. Walking very heavy, banging, in/out of the sliding door to patio and talking very loudly. Our request was NOT granted. This noise continued every night until we checked out five days later. On that last evening I had to call
Manager Response: Thank you for you for your review, Dawn.  We appreciate your feedback and will share your comments with the resort leadership team.  We hope you will return soon so we may have the chance to exceed your expectations.

Summary: Our room description indicated a balcony room and displayed pictures of an ocean view.  This was not the case at all.  We had a room in a dungeon with a patio, not balcony, and a view of a temporary green fence incasing a pool under renovation.  This is a huge property and we were approximately a 10-15 minute walk to the nearest facility.  I called to kindly request a room change/upgrade and was told we would have to be out by 10am and would not be reaccommodated until after 4pm - not very good customer service in my opinion.
Manager Response: Thank you for letting us know about your recent visit to the resort.  We apologize the view received was not what you expected.  For Newport Coast Villas, there are no view types chosen when booking.  For some resorts, you may have this option and it will be a part of the room name that you book.   We do hope the rest of your visit was wonderful at the resort and thank you for sharing your feedback.

Summary: MY son and his family joined my wife at I for a 6 day 5 night stay at Newport Coast Villas. We stayed in Villas 4710 & 4711. Villas were clean, private and we all enjoyed good sleep. We went to Disneyland twice and enjoyed our time together. Also drove dwn the coast to Mission San Juan Capistrano. The pools, grounds, rooms and service was perfect. Highly recommend this fine resort!

Summary Heading: Fifth time, can't wait for the 6th!
Summary: Since becoming Marriott Vacation Club owners nearly 7 years ago (we bought at an Orlando resort), we've fallen in love with this particular property, so much that we're buying another week so we can have 2 weeks here every year. (As Empty Nesters, we prefer to visit when kids are in school and it's quieter.)  We love the area, and this resort is situated in the perfect place in the OC.  The property has been updated since we've been going - this was our 5th stay - and all the improvements have been perfect.  This time, we were thrilled to see that the old, quite uncomfortable, metal outdoor furniture has been replaced by much more comfortable, more modern pieces.  Which is a plus since if you're fortunate to have an ocean view, you will spend a lot of time out on the balcony!

Summary Heading: This resort is great for families
Summary: We stayed here with our grandchildren and can't find enough good things to say about it.  The grounds are beautiful.  The two bedroom suites are spacious and well cared for. The swimming pools and other facilities are wonderful and not overcrowded and the kid's activities are reasonably priced and well thought out.
Manager Response: We appreciate your review, Carroll!  Thank you for sharing your feedback and for choosing Newport Coast Villas for your family vacation.  We hope to see you again soon!

Summary: I stayed at this hotel with my friend and our two young daughters.  The rooms are nicely decorated and clean.  The pools are great and pool service was good at the main pool.  The main pool is busy but not too much of a “scene”.  Lots of kids and families.  If you are looking for a quieter experience, the salt water pool is quiet.  We had no problem finding a place to sit at either pool and there are plenty of umbrellas.

We are Marriott Vacation Club owners. We have stayed in a few different places but Newport Coast Villa's is by far our favorite location. Every other year we get two units and take all of our kids and grandkids. The staff work it out so the rooms are next to each other so the kids can wander back forth from room to room. The rooms are spacious and great for meals and gathering, the resort has lots to do for young and old, and it's close to everything we love i.e. the beach, restaurants, shopping, events, etc. The whole resort is clean and well kept...in fact, we learned this trip, they clean the carpets in each room after each stay. Now that's clean! Our kids look forward to this trip more than any other! We love it!!!!
Manager Response: Thank you for being an Owner, Ben!  We appreciate your review and hope you will return soon for more #VacationGreatness

Summary: We spent Labor Day weekend there and moved our daughter back to her college near there.  I think we were in an older unit where we could clearly hear people next door talking.  Maybe the newer units quieter?

I have stayed here several times. Each time I enjoy the Location and attention to detail of this property. It is updated - immaculate- offers numerous activities. There is Plenty of parking - and courteous and helpful employees.  Very Welcoming!  Highly recommend.

Summary Heading: don't book here if you want oceanview
Summary: they send you a request email but don't guarantee anything, then when check in they told you Hotel will prefer timeshare owner first and put 1 night stay customer in the end of request, so not worth it at all
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your review of your recent stay with us.  As an vacation ownership resort, we do prioritize Owner's view requests.  We are sorry this was a disappointment to you and do hope the rest of your visit was enjoyable.

Summary Heading: Nice Resort In A Nice Area!
Summary: Stayed here for two weeks in a building right across from the main resort building. Had a partial ocean view which was nice, but room was very loud due to being 50 feet from the Newport Coast Highway and the parking lot for the check-in area. Would have liked to be in a more quiet area, although this was convenient to the main pool area. Speaking of pools, the main pool area is huge and a little crazy. We preferred to walk up to the Canyons pool for a little more relaxing atmosphere. My wife did the pool exercise classes every morning and really thought they were great. Rooms are spacious and comfortable - plus having a full kitchen is nice. Grills around the resort are a nice touch too. The surrounding area and weather are top-notch. Would definitely stay here again.

Great place for staycation, especially if you have a few little ones. The kitchen is well equipped.   The location is breathtaking, with minutes drive to Laguna and Newport Beaches.   The rooms were fine. It's Marriott, so amenities are adequate but average, which means the prices are somewhat on the high side for what it offers, especially when the nearby pool was still under construction, and we would drive for 5 minutes to reach another pool (enormous resort).

I was surprised at how mediocre this place was, especially for the price. We paid for an oceanview but it was obstructed. Our unit had an aunt problem and some staff were unhelpful when asked questions about transportation, etc... not really worth a return visit

Giant property with spectacular views.  Not much better than enjoying the perfect weather while eating breakfast on your balcony!  We go every year and would not consider missing it.  Rooms are kept very well maintained and the staff is very pleasant.  When all there is to complain about is the kitchen missing a cutting board, you've got it good!
Manager Response: Thank you for your review, Jim!  We appreciate your feedback and hope to see you again soon!

Summary: Don’t book here if you want to guarantee an ocean view. I requested one at booking through Marriott along with a higher floor. We got neither even when I stated at check in that I am not comfortable on the first floor. Our unit supposedly was considered golf course and partial ocean view and we saw neither due to grown trees and bushes which was very disappointing since we traveled from the east coast to celebrate our 40th anniversary and my retirement. The 2 bedroom units are however really nice and comfortable. We spent a lot of time at the main pool so we were  able to bond with our son who lives in LA.

VRBO was wonderful in a great location and very clean.  The owners were amazing. We loved California and hope to be back again this summer.  We were close to San Diego and San Monica. We loved just being across the street from the beach and great places to eat.

This property is very large. The buildings are spread out all over the area. Upper buildings have ocean views, while lower ones do not. The main pool area/restaurant/kids club is up near the lobby, which can mean quite a climb, depending on one’s location. We were in villa 1424, which backed up against the golf course. It was quiet,  but required a long walk including two very long, steep staircases to reach the pool and a longer walk to reach the very nice kids playground.   The pool area is large, and typical of Marriott Vacation Clubs, chairs are saved early in the morning so it can be difficult to find a place to sit. The lounges are jammed close together, sometimes two rows deep. The gentleman next to us said he felt like he was on a cruise ship! We drove down to Crystal
Manager Response: Thank you for letting us know about your visit!  With the resort being on a cliff overlooking the ocean, there are more stairs than usual.  However, you are able to drive to each of the buildings if you choose.  We apologize if this was an inconvenience and thank you for pointing it out to fellow travelers.  We hope you will return soon to Newport Coast Villas!

Summary: This was our first time staying here and it was nice overall. We had a room with a nice view of the ocean. The only downside of our location was the proximity to the BBQ area below and the Basketball courts. We had to keep our Balcony doors shut more often than we would have liked to due to noise and smoke smell. We stayed in the 2nd room and gave my parents the Master suite as we were here to celebrate their anniversary.   Being during the summer we knew there would be a lot of people but had no idea it would be as crowded as it was. Went down to the pool on our 2nd day and couldn't find an empty seat anywhere. Finally after walking around for a bit we opted for a table by in the bar area. We sat for nearly 20min and no server came by so we left. Seemed very understaffed
Manager Response: Thank you for your review of your recent stay!  We appreciate your feedback and hope you will return soon to Marriott's Newport Coast Villas.

Summary: We have been coming here for years. It’s a great resort & very safe. We spend lots of time around the pool and make trips to the beach which is close by.  The food around the pool is pretty darn good and the weather in Newport Beach is outstanding.

I am spending my summer vacation here and it has been one of my worst experiences ever with marriott, its my fourth stay in this place and we used to love the place but this time was really terrible. I was really surprised by how rude most of the employees are especially front desk staff and I had the worst experience with a manager named Kim who was very very rude and disrespectful. The excuse for the rudeness is always we are sold out and very busy!!! Also raccoons are all over the place and walking in hallways!  It’s really sad to see a place we used to love become such an unwelcoming place.
Manager Response: Hi Me, we are sorry to hear about the challenges you had during your visit.  We will share this with the front desk leadership team and appreciate you bringing this to our attention.  We hope you will return soon so that we may have a chance to exceed your expectations.

Summary: First time staying here with our children and grandchildren. Last two years stayed at Monarch Beach Resort, while nice this is better suited for kids and families. Two bedrooms and two full baths with pull out sofa in room with two doubles. Other has King with jacuzzi tub as well as double shower. Lots of kids activities if you choose and lots to do on your own. Each unit has a full adequately supplied kitchen and plenty of outdoor BBQ areas that are very. convenient. Not many food options but pool bar and grill along with convenient store / Starbucks. Found staff very pleasant when interacted with. Will try to get you to a preview presentation to purchase but not as pushy as other time share properties in Cabo. Prices are fair, sure if you search there are better deals than we

Summary Heading: nice, huge rooms in a big timeshare place
Summary: My partner and I stayed at this Marriott timeshare property on a whim, and overall, the military price is very cheap and the rooms are all new.  We did not come here as part of the timeshare deal, just merely searching on the Marriott website. They have a lot of discounts, especially for short stays. Because this is a timeshare property, there are no upgrades for status, since all the rooms are the exact same. That sounds odd considering how huge this property is, but everything is a two bedroom two bath “villa“. There also is no free breakfast for Loyalty members, because they don’t have any restaurants on site.  Even though we were only staying here for one night, the room was very nice. All the furnishings felt new and the floorplan was rather open. Even with another couple

Location is fine, but the property is a continuous mess. There is very little staff for such a large property, all of the installations feel old and are filthy. Reception staff are not customer orientated - a particular suggestion to buy a new charger as I was locked out of my room with no battery I felt particularly draconian and not up to par with the Marriott values and their promise.
Manager Response: Hi Jaspar, we appreciate you taking the time to let us know about your recent stay at Newport Coast Villas with the staff and property.  Please know, your comments will be shared with the resort leadership team.  Thank you for your review and we look forward to hearing about your next stay with a Marriott resort.

Summary Heading: Location is very beautiful but service is not up to par with Marriott Category 7
Summary: Location is BEAUTIFUL... view of the Pacific Ocean and Catalina... gorgeous sunset. Other than that... nothing spectacular about this place.  We were there for 5 days 4 nights.  Service is so so... employees are not that friendly. Poolside bar-- horrible.  2 bedroom suites are pretty much standard and could use some updating.  Activities are very much standard as in other Marriott Vacation Clubs. Would I recommend? NO!!!
Manager Response: Thank you for letting us know about your recent stay at Newport Coast Villas.  Your comments on the staff and bedroom suites are much appreciated and will be shared with the resort leadership team.

Summary Heading: Beautiful resort property on the California coast
Summary: I had the pleasure of staying here for 4 nights while visiting family in California.  The resort is an easy 20 minute drive from the John Wayne/Santa Ana airport (SNA).  We had a two bedroom, split plan unit with a full kitchen (complete with dining and cooking utensils), two bathrooms (both with shower/tubs), dining room for 6, living room, washer/dryer combo (detergent provided) and a lovely covered balcony with table and chairs.  There was plenty of storage (closets and dressers) throughout.  As this is a time share, there's no daily maid service but requests for extra towels were quickly handled.  Check in at the main club house was friendly and efficient.  There are several swimming pools at the clubhouse, ping-pong, giant chess and corn hole in addition to an indoor

Summary Heading: Beautiful property.   amenities very well maintained and  staff is very polite, helpful
Summary: The property is built on several hills across PCH from the beaches.  Crystal Cove is just down the hill.  No restaurants on property, plenty to choose from within short drive. We were on the third floor of building 2100 at the end of the building, so no neighbors on either side of the 2 bedroom 2 bath unit, no walkway past our unit, very quiet and private.  Great building for families with children, as playground and play areas very close to building, and main pool just up the stairs. Limited view of the ocean. Patio overlooked street level parking and private.  We kept patio doors open most of the time.  Well equipped full kitchen and dining area plenty of room for 4 adults, sleeps 8 with two sofa beds.  Master bedroom/bath has large tub, with separate shower.  All furnishings
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your five-star experience, Gwen!  We are so happy to hear you enjoyed your two bedroom unit and we cannot wait to hear about your next stay with a Marriot resort!

Summary: This has been our place when in Orange. We came here after a hectic 2 days in Disneyland. The resort is still as beautiful and well-maintained. The staff are accommodating and courteous. There are activities for every age. The kids enjoyed the pool, the arcade and fire pit. There are activities everyday that the kids enjoyed. They had s'mores at the fire pit where they had a blast after watching the 4th of July fireworks. Newport beach can be very busy during 4th of July and it was neat that you can actually see 2 fireworks display at their view deck. The rooms are spacious. Their 2-bedroom suites can easily fit 8 people. Their suites are equipped with a full kitchen. They also have grill stations in the grounds. If you want to have a staycation, this is one perfect place for it.

Summary Heading: Beautiful location and great amenities-but night not be for everyone
Summary: The resort property is beautiful but this is not a beach resort - though there is a view of the ocean from a lot of the property. It seems like most of the units do not have an ocean view and if you come during a busy holiday week like we did, don’t expect to get an ocean view unless you are an owner. Marriott Bonvoy status doesn’t help. Our building, 2100, was great for a family with a toddler because the tot lot was right outside our door and basketball and two large sandboxes nearby. We were on the ground floor - nice for getting in and out but not for privacy if you are sitting on the patio, which had a street view. The units are large with two bedrooms but the layout of the master bedroom is not for everyone. The bathtub and sinks are literally in the room - only the

First time visiting, excellent facilities.  Great night's sleep, beautiful ocean view even from second floor.  Oddly enough, the nearest breakfast facility is 1/2 mile away, with only the gift store serving light snacks.  Good pool, plenty of parking, elevators to higher floors.  Definitely recommend.

Summary Heading: Great Location and Beautiful Property with amazing staff.
Summary: This property is in a great location. A few minutes from Laguna Beach. The views are amazing and the property is beautiful and well kept.  Our condo was gorgeous with an amazing view.  There is a great deal for children to do on the property besides the pools.  Staff is friendly and helpful.  There is a shuttle that runs certain times and will drop you off at the local mall, etc.  The drive along the coast stunning.  The main pool is busy and the the  food eatery is small and very busy, not a lot of tables to sit..But it is tasty.  We can't wait to return.
Manager Response: Hello Cheryl, we cannot wait for you to return to Newport Coast Villas in the future!  Thank you for sharing your five-star experience on TripAdvisor!

Summary: Newport Coast lives up to Marriott standards.  We have a nice view of the ocean from our balcony.  Be prepared to do a lot of walking uphill to get to things, but it is worth it.  You can see the golf course and ocean while walking around the resort.  Lots to do on the property.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review, Lisa!  We are so glad you enjoyed the view of the ocean from your room.  Please give us another visit soon!

Summary Heading: Beautiful Marriott property with an A1 location!
Summary: Great spot for families as all units are 2 bedrooms with nice size living and kitchen area. Well maintained and up to date furnishings. Super clean. Staff is super friendly. Nice grounds spread over large area with guessing 25 buildings or so. Many rooms have ocean views and some have ocean views plus views of the Pelican Hill golf course. Definitely want a top floor. 3 pools spread out over the complex with one currently under construction adding water slides, etc. Super convenient to Crystal Cove State Park (Beachcomber for lunch). It also is very convenient to Crystal Cove shopping center which has several good to excellent restaurants including Marche Moderne which is the best in Newport. Great spot and thoroughly enjoyed our stay! Highly recommend!

Marriott Newport Coast Villas is one of the nicest timeshare properties I have utilized.  The location is perfect.  It is located a top the hills around the beach and all of the buildings are nestled in the hills to provide maximum privacy, excellent views from the villas and gorgeous landscaping.  Although it is not beach-side, the views of the beach from the pool and the villas are spectacular and the Marriott provides free shuttle service to the beach (and other shopping areas). The villas are very well appointed.  Ours had amazing views and the location was perfect -far enough from the pool to not have any noise, but close enough to provide easy access. The staff was very friendly and met our high expectations.  From the cleaning crew to the poolside restaurants and the
Manager Response: We are so happy to hear you enjoyed your time at Newport Coast Villas with the gorgeous view and the facilities we have available!  Thank you for taking the time to share your review!

Summary Heading: Strategic location for coastal day trips
Summary: The resort is expansive and there are things to do on the property such as large pools and field games.  The resort is spread out in a few dozen buildings that each have about 40 or 50 rooms.  This helps with parking, but it makes it a bit of a walk (max 1/2 mile) to the central amenities if your building is on the perimeter.  However, this is not on the beach.  There is a shuttle to the beach area which is across the main coastal highway.  There are a lot of things to do in the area as Newport is between San Diego (1.5 hours to the South) and Los Angeles (one hour to the North) and there are MANY highly-developed areas in between.  Of course, being Southern California the weather is usually great and the people can be quite self-centered.  Of course, they have no monopoly on

Great location for families. We had a 2 bedroom condo which was ideal with a 2,8 and 10 year old. The arcades, pool and clubs make this ideal for kids. The pool bar is great for food, drinks and kids ice cream. Our kids loved this place and the cinema showings also helped keep them occupied. Nearly Balboa Beach and Irvine left us with lots of things to do when we went offsite. Will stay again - only challenge is the weather - need to avoid June Gloom!!

Summary Heading: Warning - Poor Customer Service - Your Possible View
Summary: The single worst resort stay in the thousands of locations around the world that we've stayed.  Without prior notice, we were given keys to a room with completely obstructed views, absolutely no warning prior to check in that this would be the only available room. Told they are at capacity, why would they put any guest in a room with completely obstructed view?  Poor customer service at the front desk, did not want to solve this issue to our satisfaction.  Clerk kept repeating there were no other rooms.  Would have been courteous if someone could have phoned us a week or so in advance that the only room for us would be one with obstructed view.  I've lost faith completely in any Marriott property because of this terrible experience.  Take a look at the pictures to see the
Manager Response: Hi Vince, thank you for letting us know about your recent visit to Newport Coast Villas.  We sincerely apologize about the negative experience you encountered during your stay with the staff and fence obstructing your view.  Our team would like to learn more about your experience and personally follow up with you.  At your convenience, please contact our team at 800 936 6824 or by email at customer.care@vacationclub.com. We look forward to hearing from you soon.

Summary: Great condos, but the huge number of units decreases enjoyment. Why? Not enough people at reception, not enough pool space, not enough parking, not enough shade, not enough services. Registration is painful: long lines and nowhere to park when you are trying to register.  You can take a shuttle to Crystal Cove beach (every hour on the hour) and it is a great beach but it does not have, obviously, hotel services. No showers or shade, for example.   I am comparing this with with the Hotel Del or the Hyatt at Huntington Beach and both of these will make it easier for a family to have access to the beach.   In short, it depends how much you value beach and hotel services vs. a full kitchen.  Incidentally, your Bonvoy status means less than nothing here. Only timeshare owners

I'm a platinum elite Marriott member. Stayed at this beautiful resort many times over the years with fantastic memories.  We are moving to CA and our home is not quite ready yet, so I thought staying at  MNCV would be a fantastic option.   Booked last minute at a super high nightly rate. Ok. No big deal. Been a great place to stay in the past. I can get over that   We check in and the guy at the front desk could not seem more uninterested in welcoming us. He puts us in a room bordering the busy Newport Coast Rd and the parking structure.   We ask for a different room and were put in the 3700 building which is right next to the main building. Cool. Near the big pool.  No parking close by, so trekked across the property with all of our belongings. Get to the third floor and our

Marriott Vacation Club Newport Coast Villas was an amazing place to stay. So close to the beach, rooms with a view and more. Two bedroom villas had plenty of space and great to enjoy meals together in the Villa. The property is amazing. We spent the majority of our time at the main pool and the activities around. We had so much fun in the pool and watching the amazing sunsets.   La Vista Pool Bar & Grill had amazing burgers, fries, and smoothies. We also enjoyed a family meal on Taco Tuesday. This is defentily one of our top five places to stay. Staff was friendly and helpful. Looking forward to another visit and great memories.

We really enjoyed our stay at the Newport Beach Villas. It was surprisingly chilly at the end of May, but the heated pools meant we could still swim. Their shuttles to Crystal Cove State Park were super convenient, too. I'd recommend that you sign up for a timeshare presentation, though. This place is super expensive without a discounted rate.

Summary Heading: Marriott's Newport Coast Villas are super
Summary: We stay 4 nights and had our son with 4 grandkids join for several days.  They loved all that there was to do-beautiful pool, lawns to play, play sets, etc.  Seemed perfect for a family get away or staycation type trip. Beautiful setting and close by to shopping and the beach so traffic impact of So Cal isn't an issue once there.

Beautiful, Beautiful, Beautiful. This resort  is one of the best Marriotts I have every stayed at and friendly customer service.  Cannot say enough about this Hotel....a must stay if you are in the area.
Manager Response: Thank you for your TripAdvisor review, Maria!  We appreciate your feedback and look forward to your  next stay at Marriott's Newport Coast Villas.

Summary: Myself and my family (wife plus three daughters in their 20's) just got back from Marriott's Newport Coastal Villas.  The place is fantastic.  Perfectly groomed grounds with beautiful 2 bedroom villas overlooking the Pacific Ocean.  As an added bonus, the weather was a perfect 10, sunny, cool and no humidity.  I am definitely going back.  If you decide to check it out, stay at villa number 4000, 4100, 4200, 4300, 4400, 4500, 4600, or 4700.  Also, you should fly into John Wayne International Airport (SNA).  It will cost a little more but you will avoid LAX and all of the infamous LA traffic.

***Marriott Vacation Club Owner & Titanium Member Review*** The Newport Coast Villas are an excellent use of your Marriott Vacation Club points.   Environment: a beautifully constructed resort in the hills of Newport, the villas have plenty of space for the family to live, dine, eat, swim, and explore the surrounding area.  The property has an abundance of pools, bbq pits, outdoor games, and other spaces for all to enjoy. It also has many restaurants/bars located indoor and outdoor.  Rooms: the villa was a spacious two-bedroom with a huge living room, huge kitchen (fully stocked with cooking supplies), and a balcony.  The main bedroom and bathroom are amazing!  Parking: Parking is included and located right outside of our villa building.  You need to pull up into the front desk

Summary Heading: A Great Place For A Family Vacation
Summary: Newport Coast Marriott Vacation Club was built in 2000 with about 675 2-bedroom and 2- bathroom villas with 77 acres. It has two pools and SPA, including two indoor steam rooms. The gym is open 24 hours.  It has an elegant KOI pond. Please note that the oldest documented KOI was 216 years old in Japan. She weighed 20 pounds, 30 inches long, and died in Japan.  Two of us took a complimentary shuttle bus to Crystal  Cove State Park and had a brunch at the Beachcomber at Crystal Cove with Beachcomber Beignets (a Frenvh famous dish), Avocado Toast, and Spinach & Mushroom Frittata. I also enjoy a lower sales tax at 7.75% in Orange County.  We enjoyed watching a magic show on Sunday evening.

Summary Heading: Always Fun for the Whole Family
Summary: What a beautiful setting and wonderful place to visit. A host of activities for everyone. Pool Side Bingo, Tye Dye T-shirts, Candle Making, Kids Club, Movies and More. Warm welcome and nice staff for your stay. Parking can be scarce on busy weekends. Great Gym and Steam room for both men and women as well as a Spa. Shopping and beach are close. Tram service provided by Marriott.

We absolutely love our annual trip to Newport Coast and have owned at the property for 10 years. We recently stayed in Villa 5043 and the bed just about killed us. It was incredibly uncomfortable. It had me waking up multiple times a night with extreme hip pain and cause significant back pain for my husband. I am not sure if the beds have been recently replaced but in all of our years visiting this property we have never had this problem. It is something that management needs to address. Reading through other reviews it seems we are not the only guests who have experienced this problem. It has us rethinking next year's visit. Otherwise we love this resort and find all the the employees to be extremely helpful. Please FIX THE BED ISSUE!!! This is the first time I have ever given

MVC delivers again.  Our multi-generational family stayed between Christmas and New Year's Eve.  Easy access to Crystal Cove State Park.  We had 2 day trips to Rose Bowl Parade and Disneyland.  Great activities for the kids: swimming, corn hole/bags, ping pong, and beach volleyball.  This was are 2nd stay at MVC Newport Coast.

We enjoyed this property on previous visits, so we booked it again. Our last visit the property was showing wear and tear.  I am happy to report that our villa was refurbished and freshly painted.  The décor has a modern theme and is very nice - Well done Marriott! The property is located just above Pacific Coast Hwy and many of the rooms have a views of the ocean. Some of the higher floors offer better ocean views. The grounds are well maintained and there is golf course just below the Villas that adds to the surrounding beauty.
