Manager Response: Thank you for your perfect review.  We are happy to hear that you found the resort well-kept and up to date!  We look forward to your next return visit to Newport Coast Villas!

Summary: Went here for a birthday celebration, it did not disappoint!! Property is nestled high on the hill right above crystal cove. What an Amazing property, so close to everything in newport, so many daily activities for older crowd and for families with children. Really nice pool bar, food was excellent out at the pool! We loved the little marketplace in the morning for coffee and quick breakfast snacks !! Rooms are amazing and well kept, views are beautiful of the ocean and catalina islands!!  Definitely worth the price, Great stay!
Manager Response: Thank you for your five star review, Nikki! We are so honored you chose us to help with your birthday celebrations!

Summary: Our stay at the Marriott's Newport Coast Villas was absolutely perfect.  The location in right off PCH highway, very close to great restaurants, bakeries and the beaches.  The villas are spacious and luxurious.  The staff is helpful and knowledgeable. It's a short drive to both Laguna and Huntington Beaches. Crystal Cove is a short walk away. I would go back in a minute.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We're happy to hear you enjoyed the spacious villa and friendly staff. We hope to welcome you again soon!

Summary: first let me say we stayed here on a promotional rate. I like a room with a view. on this property the location of your unit makes a huge difference. we saw some rooms that were sunny, bright and beautiful. ours was not sunny or bright, it was like a cave. the large sliding door from the living area was completely blocked by a tree and bushes. I don't mind a garden view, but there was no view a all here and it made the whole unit dark. if I stayed again I would request an upper floor for a better view. next, the location. if you are looking for something in Newport Beach, this really isn't. it is located 7 miles north of Laguna Beach and 3 miles south of Corona del Mar. about 7 miles south of Newport Beach proper. this location worked for us. located on a bluff overlooking the
Manager Response: Thank you for your review! We are delighted to hear that you enjoyed our activities and appreciate your feedback.

Summary Heading: Fabulous facilities, but inconsistent customer service
Summary: The facilities at this location was perfect for my young family. The accommodations were spacious, newly renovated and very well laid out. The kitchen and sleeping areas were great. My children loved the pool area and game room. The resort is a very close drive to many great beaches, and shopping areas.  I would have given it a 5 star if it was not for all the spotty customer service. Housekeeping, was very inconsistent. Coming at crazy hours during the day, and just one day not showing up at all. It was impossible to get through to the front desk, because they must have been busy. If the resort knows it is going to be busy, they should hire more front desk staff so you do not need to be on hold for 15 minutes to get through. Also some of the front desk staff were so nice and
Manager Response: We appreciate your comments and feedback regarding the housekeeping service and front desk staff, Indie.  While we are pleased to hear that you found your accommodations spacious and well laid out for your family, we apologize that it was difficult to reach any one on the phone at the front desk. Thank you for your review, and we hope that you will give us another opportunity to host you and your family again.

Summary: The service we received was one of the best. We requested a top floor, canyon, and ocean view. We got excitedly what we requested. Building 5100. Top floor. Room was also refurbished. Only wish.  Wife wanted stainless  steel appliances Close walk to the gym. Nice pool, with quite a few amenities. We purchased the plastic wristband. It gave us excess to everywhere on the resort.  It also helped a  charity. The resort is in a perfect location The one thing that set this resort apart was the excellent customer service, with a smile. Thank you. We have already booked our Sept 9th week 2017.
Manager Response: It's nice to hear that the service you received from the team at the Newport Coast Villas was one of the best!  We appreciate your review and look forward to welcoming back to Newport Coast in September next year!

Summary: We were invited to stay with friends at their villa at the Marriott. It's a beautiful resort high on the cliffs with a great view. All the amenities. Looks very Mediterranean. A great way to spend a week. Close to Chrystal cove and the famous Beachcomer seaside restaurant.
Manager Response: Kenneth, thank you so much for your perfect review. We are happy you had a great week and look forward to your next stay.

Summary: Very good location and the apartments are spacious, well equipped and comfortable. Services offered are excellent: at the pools and gymnasium. The only negative points are the check-in (16:00) and check-out (10:00) times.
Manager Response: We are thrilled to hear that your stay was excellent! Thank you for your review of your stay at Marriott's Newport Coast Villas.

Summary: We are Marriott Vacation Club owners and love to trade for different Marriott locations.  We asked for ocean view and got it.  Large 2 BR that was renovated. Comfortable and Quiet where we were located.  Beautiful, expansive  grounds and so much for families to do.  I would walk 30 minutes each morning and cover a little over 1/2 of the resort!  .So walk the grounds to get acclimated.  Go to either end of resort for a quieter pool.  We didn't realize that the grand stair case to pool was by our villas...2200.  Friendly suggestion, put a sign indicating pool. Ask for 2100 if you have younger kids as you'll be close to playground, sandbox, basketball, etc.  ALL from staff were friendly and responsive to any request!!  Less than 30 minutes to Disneyland and convenient to Balboa and
Manager Response: Thank you for your prefect review! We are ecstatic to hear, as Marriott Vacation Club Owners, that you enjoyed your stay, the amenities, and the local attractions at Marriott's Newport Coast Villas.

Summary Heading: Second Time, Same as the First - Just Beautiful!
Summary: Well this was our second visit to this Marriott Vacation Club property and we were not disappointed.  The facility and grounds were well manicured and taken care of and the resort location is just spectacular.  We did arrive prior to check in but checked in anyway.  What was great was they provided an access card so we could use all the amenities and they took down my cell phone number.  When our 2 bedroom villa was ready, I received a text letting me know  and which villa number and they activated the access card to allow me to go directly to the villa.  No need to go back to the lobby.  We got the text and just went directly to the villa.    Everything in the villa was fantastic from the decor, to the furnishings, to the kitchen utensils, etc.  The master bathroom shower was
Manager Response: Chris, we are delighted to hear that your stay was spectacular. We are so happy that your family enjoyed the resort, especially your grandson! We look forward to your return to Marriott's Newport Coast Villas.

Summary: Marriott's is a very good location for the beaches from Dana Point up to Balboa Island. The resort shuttles folks to Crystal Cove, Laguna Beach area and Fashion Island. Staff is excellent and very helpful. The condo units are 2 bedroom most with very nice views and well  maintained like most of the Marriott vacation Clubs. Lots of places to visit around the area.
Manager Response: We are absolutely thrilled to hear that you found our associates to be helpful and provided excellent service. Thank you for your perfect review!

Summary Heading: Another nice stay - - but the activity cost has gone up a lot
Summary: We just returned from a lovely week at Marriott's Newport Coast.  We own timeshares at a different Marriott resort.   So, we were staying here on an exchange.  This is probably our 5 or 6th time to Newport Coast.  So we are familiar with the units.  We were in 5124 and the unit had been refurbed.  New tile, new faucets and new refrigerator.  We had only a minuscule or sliver view of the ocean.    I noticed that for the adult activities that involved alcohol (like beer tasting and tequila tasting) that the cost had been raised a lot and was around $18-20 bucks each.  I spoke with Jim, the operations manager regarding that.  I mentioned that when we last stayed at the Canyon Villas and the Grand Chateau that those activities were free and that when we stayed at the Palm Desert
Manager Response: Thank you for your review of your stay at Marriott's Newport Coast Villas. We are happy to hear that, as valued owners, you enjoyed your stay and we appreciate your valuable feedback about our activities and cushions. We look forward to your next stay with us.

Summary: We own Marriott Vacation Club time shares and are very impressed with our first time visit to the Newport Coast Villas.  75 acres of 2 bed/2 bath 1400 sq-ft villas some with gorgeous views of the Pacific Ocean, located in Orange County, about halfway between LA and San Diego and about halfway up the mountain from the ocean to the really expensive real estate at the top!    This property runs day long shuttles around the expansive grounds and to 5 off site locations, including Laguna Beach and Newport Coast Fashion Park.  The feel of the place architecturally remind me of the Marriott property at Marbella, Spain.  The staff is very organized and active in helping guests enjoy their vacations.  Plenty of organized events, exercise time, local attractions to attend.    We did the
Manager Response: We are excited for your return, too, Brian! Thank you for your perfect five star review. We are happy to hear we were helpful and you enjoyed your time at Marriott's Newport Coast Villas.

Summary: Very accommodating at check in.  Rooms were very nice for our family when we needed a two room option.  Spacious and clean and more modern than I was expecting.  One thing I didn't know before is there wasn't a restaurant on site which would have been nice.  Lots of bbq pits and full kitchen in your room, if your up for that.  I would have just preferred a restaurant.   Walked the properly and they have a great view of the ocean in the distance and lots of amenities for families, park, basketball, several swimming pools.  Looks like there's a lot of activities if you are there for an extended amount of time.
Manager Response: Thank you for your perfect five star review of Marriott's Newport Coast Villas! We are delighted that your villa was beyond your expectations. We look forward to your next stay with us.

Summary Heading: Marriott Vacation Club does it right!
Summary: Marriott does it right!  We've been extremely pleased with all 9 of the Marriott Cacation Club properties we've visited since we purchased our ownership 7 years ago! Very comfortable beds, quality linens, clean updated spacious and well decorated units in prime locations! Fantastic service! Very nice fitness centers with plenty of high quality, well maintained equipment. Immaculately maintained grounds that are very nicely landscaped. Clean high quality barbecue grills. Attention to fine details - ice water with orange slices and a basket of wash clothes soaked in ice water located in the fitness center locker room! Wow - spoil me some more! I could go on.....
Manager Response: Will, we are so happy to hear about your great feedback as a valued Marriott Vacation Club Owner. We are delighted to hear that you received great service and were spoiled by our resort. Thank you for your review of your stay at Marriott's Newport Coast Villas and we look forward to your next stay!

Summary Heading: Beautiful surrounding and very comfortable villa
Summary: This place offers very comfortable villas and great views of the pacific ocean.  Set atop cliffs the resort has lots of stairs.  The villa was a 2 bedroom unit that was modern, clean and comfortable with a large balcony.  The pools were large with plenty of seating and a good atmosphere.  Resort offers shuttle to Newport Beach only a few minutes away.  Weather was not great during our stay (cool, cloudy).  But with perfect weather this resort would be a perfect getaway from life.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to give Marriott's Newport Coast Villas a perfect review! We are so happy that you found your villa comfortable and enjoyed your ocean view.

Summary Heading: Nice place but inconvenient if you are a pool / beach person.
Summary: Stayed here recently, Sept.2016. Very nice villas. 40+ buildings on the hillside some with very nice views overlooking the ocean, some partial ocean views. Pools are by the main check in building. One salt water pool is located at the  opposite end of the property . They do run shuttle transportation to the pools. Not convenient if you would like to go back to your villa for anything. They also provide transportation to the beach.It is not close enough to walk to the beach. Staff was very friendly and the grounds were well maintained.
Manager Response: Thank you for your Trip Advisor review.  It's nice to hear that you found the villas to be very nice and the staff to be very friendly as well as the grounds well maintained.  We hope to see you for another return visit in the future.

Summary Heading: Busy villas at Newport coast Marriot
Summary: While these villas are spacious and designed to accommodate 8 they really only for 2 couples and a few small children. The exterior grounds are beautiful but it can get soooo crowded during the summer season.  Limited parking near your villa. Excellent restaurants near by but only expensive pool fbar food on the grounds. Overlooks the Pacific and great location. Go to the Beachcomber for great breakfast in Crystal Cove.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review of your stay at Marriott's Newport Coast Villas. We appreciate your feedback and are happy that you enjoyed your villa as well as the resort amenities.

Summary Heading: Once again, a beautiful place to stay.
Summary: My husband & I were planning on staying longer, but a family emergency caused us to shorten our trip.  The staff was very helpful, and allowed us to not be charged for the entire original reservation.  The grounds are beautiful, and the villas are very adequatly equipped.  Looking forward to returning.
Manager Response: Heidi, thank you for taking the time to give Marriott's Newport Coast Villas a perfect review. We are happy to hear that our team was able to take care of you and we are thrilled that you enjoyed your time that you spent with us. We are looking forward to your return!

Summary: Marriott's Newport Coast Villas is a fantastic place for families to get together and bond. This facility isNOT ocean-front;  but almost all the villas from 2nd floor to 4th floor have ocean views. This facility is part of the Marriott Vacation Club. My husband and I invited his 3 sisters and two other relatives for a "Sibling Reunion". We stayed in a 2BR villa, equipped with a full kitchen. While the facility is pretty large with many villas, you can get around by using the 24x7 shuttle service which comes around every 10 minutes. If you don't want to wait, you can dial 0 and ask for a shuttle to pick you up. The facility has two large pools and several hot tubs around the facility. The "Shack" has lots of activities for children of all ages, including an arcade room, a cinema
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We're happy to hear you enjoyed your family time at your sibling reunion in our spacious villas. We hope to welcome you back soon!

Summary: We enjoyed the stay here and it was really good but there was some thing missing the services are mostly paid. It would of been better if there was a kids or slides pool. But still and fantastic And lovely place to stay.
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments and your Trip Advisor review.  It's nice to hear that you thought your stay was fantastic and the resort is a lovely place to stay.  We hope to see you on your next return to Newport Coast.

Summary: Nice place, awesome views! Balboa Island is just ok. Very expensive! Definitely fly into Orange County. Not sure the trip was worth the $. Beach activities. Catalina Island to try scuba diving, snorkeling!
Manager Response: Hi Debbie.  We appreciate your Trip Advisor review.  It's great to hear that you appreciated the awesome views.  We hope you will choose to visit our resort in the future.

Summary: I had a great time here! It really exceeded my expectations. We had a great villa with an oceanfront view. Our room was spacious, clean, and quite comfortable. The grounds are massive, but beautiful. There is something for everyone here...spa, pools, fitness room, golf, ping pong, tennis, BBQ grills. The list goes on. Staff were friendly and check in was a breeze. I am definitely coming back!!!
Manager Response: Thank you for your positive review.  We like to hear that you appreciated your ocean front view, and that the resort had exceeded your expectations.  We look forward to your return to Marriott's Newport Coast villas soon!

Summary: We came just before Labor Day and the resort was very busy.  It was very busy but all changed Monday afternoon.  The place returned to the tranquil and relaxing resort we remember.  People are friendly.  Marriott are making major refurbishing of the villas.  New decor is modern chic California.  It is brighter ambience with less clutter.  The resort is very well kept up.  Service remains first class.  If you prefer quieter pool area, go to the one near Building 5100.
Manager Response: Hi Albert.  Thank you for your review.  We are happy to hear that you were able to enjoy a tranquil and relaxing vacation, and that you approve of the renovations.  We hope you will choose to visit us again soon!

Summary: Newport Coast is a beautiful location.  The down side is everything is such an inconvenient when traveling with kids and elders.  The pools were so far away...you basically have to drive to get to one of the 3 pools depending where your room is locate at.  Parking is an issue.  If parking lot near the room is full you had to park your car in the parking garage which is a hike down and up a hill...it gets old after 1 or 2 days!  Check in is also a pain...late check in and staff was so slow.  I have stayed at better Marriott Vacation Club location!
Manager Response: Thank you for your review of your stay at Marriott’s Newport Coast Villas. We appreciate the time that you took to give us valuable feedback.

Summary Heading: Lovely place to vista highly recommend a visit
Summary: This was a beautiful place to stay, location good. 2 large bedroom villas with full kitchen/dining facilities, dish washer big fridge freezer. Comfortable beds. Washer and dryer. 2 bathrooms. Free car parking.  Free shuttle scheduled to local beach and Crustal Cove several times a day, locally shopping outlets ( Fashion Island) and lots of places to eat. Suggest a car is ideal for getting around as a good 10 mins from Beach. Most of the Villa's appear to have sea views due to the positioning of the Villa's as high up. Villa's have lifts. Bar and venue to order food, lots of daily activities on site to keep everyone entertained, magicians, ice cream making, etc. Pool tables, cinema room with regular movies. 3 big swimming pools which appeared heated and are open till late at
Manager Response: We are delighted that you enjoyed your view and that our team went over and beyond to make your stay memorable. Thank you for your perfect review of Marriott's Newport Coast Villas.

Summary Heading: One of the best Marriott timeshares
Summary: My wife an I have been regular annual visitors to the Newport Coast Villas for a number of years.  They overlook the Pacific and are a wonderful place to spend a week relaxing.  There are four pools, a poolside bar/restaurant and numerous sporting venues.  Many activities (all voluntary) are scheduled during the week.  The staff is very attentive and helpful.  The location is great for visiting Newport/Laguna Beach and Long Beach.  All and all, fantastic.
Manager Response: Thank you for your perfect five star review, John! We are so happy that we have become a home away from home for you. We look forward to your next visit!

Summary: Came out on a Marriott promotion on our way to San Diego. We try to avoid promotions as you never get a good room. This time was no exception. The first room was in a building without an elevator and the room was down two long flights. It had a dehumidifier running on the counter full of water. The second room was in a renovated building and lovely. Still no view but it is a promotion however we are owners at another property. If Marriott really wants us to increase our level then give us a good room with no hassles. When I am trying to sell someone something I treat them like royalty. This happens in the awards program too where our room is for a dishonored guest instead of an honored guest.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write your review. As Marriott Vacation Club owners, you are very important to us and we appreciate your feedback about your recent stay.

Summary: We arrived on a Saturday afternoon a little early for check in and were surprised to be told by cheerful and very pleasant Alexia at the front desk that our assigned villa was ready for us. We had requested one of the buildings close to the main building as my daughter-in-law is petite and pregnant and hilly topography is very difficult for her.  We were placed in building 2400 on the second floor which worked out perfectly. We had a lovely view of the ocean from our balcony over the red tile roof tops. The villa was furnished with all of the expected supplies and we quickly settled in.   We bought groceries at the Pavillions up the street and ate breakfast every morning in the villa usually on the balcony. We also bought provisions for lunch which we turned in to a picnic at
Manager Response: Thank you for your review.  We are happy to hear you enjoyed our villas, especially the view from the balcony.  It is sad to learn pool side service and sofa bed concerns detracted from your overall stay.  We thank you for taking the time to share your feedback.  It is greatly appreciated.  We look forward to welcoming you back to Marriott's Newport Coast Villas on your next vacation.

Summary: I would have to say this is the most beautiful Marriott property we have ever been to! I would live here! It's awesome! The pool is amazing..great view of the ocean from every angle! We happend to be there on a Tuesday and they had Taco Tuesday night. Fresh homemade tortillas and alcohol, can't complain there. We only got to stay one night but next time will definitely make a weeks trip out of it.  Close to everything. Must see place. Will for sure be back to this place in the future  :)
Manager Response: Erica, Happy Belated Birthday! We are excited you spent it with us and your stay was awesome. We look forward to your return to Marriott's Newport Coast Villas. Thank you for your prefect review.

Summary: This is our 3rd stay at Marriott Newport Coast Villas.  The location of the resort is great as it is right about Pacific Coast Highway.  On the other side of of PCH is Crystal Cove State Park so the views from the property are great.  All three times we have received the view that we requested.  the property has great activities for both kids and adults. We did the whiskey tasting ($15pp) and wine/cheese social (free).  Property could use more dining options / wait staff at the pool area.  We utilize the full kitchen for breakfast, lunches on days we are at the resort and dinner a couple nights. There is a nice grocery (Pavilions) just east on Newport Coast drive.  Good selection of wine.
Manager Response: Thank you for leaving a perfect review. We are pleased to hear you enjoyed your stay and the onsite activities. We hope to welcome you back to Newport Coast soon.

Summary: This is a beautiful property.  Very close to tons of things to do in Newport Beach or Laguna Beach.  Rooms were spacious and beautifully appointed.  Views are stunning... and the grounds are gorgeous.  I called the front desk and asked where an Ice machine was... they sent a man to our room with a 10 pound bag of ice.  Great service.
Manager Response: We appreciate your five-star review!  It's nice to hear that you found the resort to be beautiful and in close proximity to a variety of things to do.  We hope you will visit Marriott's Newport Coast again soon.

Summary: So this is our time for the family to spend some quality time. We go every other year  for the week. It's great because it's close to our homes and we know the area. We have owned this property for over a decade and if you cab become a time share owner this would be the one I recommend. They also own the Ritz, so if one chooses one can partake. I love staying in the Marriott when we travel over seas. I can't say enough. Just stay a week and see for yourself.
Manager Response: Hi Dar.  It's great that you are able to spend quality time with your family and that your timeshare ownership has worked out well for you.  Thank you for returning to Newport Coast villas.  We look forward to seeing you again next year!

Summary Heading: Beautiful Property for a Family Vacation
Summary: I traveled to the Marriott Newport Coast Villas with my husband and 2 adult children. The villa and is beautiful is beautiful, and had every starter amenity that you can think of- coffee, filters, paper towels, dishwasher soap, sponge ect. There were plenty of towels. We rented a 2 bedroom villa, and would have preferred 2 beds in the second bedroom instead of one. There are 2 pull out couches. One of my sons didn't think the sofa bed was that uncomfortable, however the other said it was awful. We knew this was the set up, but I wonder why the second bedroom doesn't have 2 beds.  Aren't most people renting a 2 bedroom villa traveling with family? The villas are in a community on the cliffs with 3 pools. The property up is breathtaking, especially when you are in a place where
Manager Response: Hi Julie.  Thank you for your Trip Advisor review.  We appreciate that you found the Marriott's Newport Coast Villas a beautiful retreat for you and your family vacation, and for your feedback with the sofa beds, adult pool/hot tub.  We look forward to your next family vacation with us!

Summary: My husband and I along with several other family members recently spent a week at the Marriott Newport Coast Villas.  The property is lovely and the ocean view from our villa was gorgeous.  The villa was spacious for the five adults who stayed and one night we even had 2 more adults stay over and it was fine.  Hotel staff was friendly and helpful and housekeeping quickly responded to our calls for more towels!  I will say though that as lovely as the rooms were all us complained that we didn't sleep well all week.  The main reason was the room temperature, it kept fluctuating. Either it was freezing in the room with the air blowing loudly or it was warm.  We tried different settings and even called maintenance but nothing seemed to work. Finally, if you are adults looking to
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We appreciate your valued feedback. We would like to address your comments and invite you to contact our Customer Care team customer.care@vacationclub.com, or you can call 800-860-9384. We look forward to hearing from you.

Summary Heading: Escapre from Reality to a Beautiful Place that feels like Home
Summary: This is an amazing place. I love love love it! The 2-bedroom villas are my favorite. Each of the villas are in a cluster along the hillside of Newport Coast Drive. Let me describe the experience.  You drive up to the fountain entrance and the view from there is the ocean. Walking into registration is a big picture window/door that overlooks the pools and ocean. It's breathtaking. Check in process is easy and friendly. Lovely little touch is having salt water taffy at the desk. Then out to your villa. Walking in...You have the kitchen/dining room. living room with a small balcony just for you. The Master Suite has a Jacuzzi tub and 2 person shower, make-up vanity. King Bed and TV. The second bedroom has a Queen Bed, TV, sofa bed, and bathroom door. - The amenities are lovely.
Manager Response: Thank you for your perfect review of Marriott's Newport Coast Villas. We are ecstatic that you found our views breathtaking and found our amenities lovely!

Summary: Free nice resort and clean villas with  ocean view , very nice staff  The kids activity need to be improved by add more kids play ground for the young children also the pools need to bee maintained and clean  The market place is a pet expensive  Thanks
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. While we are happy you enjoyed the resort, we are disappointed that the kids' playing areas, pool facilities and market place prices did not meet standards. We have shared this feedback with the resort's leadership team and we thank you for bringing it to our attention. We hope to welcome you back soon!

Summary: Villas were spacious. Large 2 bedrooms and bathrooms. Grounds are kept clean and parking is always available right by your villa.   For ocean views, request them 2 weeks before arrival. Also request renovated villas. They're a number that are not yet renovated.   Pools and grounds  are kept very clean and organized with activities. You see the grounds keepers spraying everything down 1st thing in the am. Kids have lots to do. Also pools are all 3 1/2 ft to 5 1/4 ft deep. No deep ends. Looks are all salt water.  Crystal cove beach is 15 mins walk. Great area for jogging with lots of hills and pathways.   Location of villas is set close to 73 highway and 5 mins from downtown Newport beach. They are all within distance of a pool as there are 3 pool areas on the grounds.  Gave it a
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are happy to hear you enjoyed our spacious villas and fun activities. We hope to welcome you back soon!

Summary: We are MVC owners and Marriott lifetime platinum elite members who travel extensively and stay exclusively at Marriott properties.  Our stay at the Marriott Newport Coast Villas was awesome in every way - fabulous location, friendly staff, excellent customer service, great amenities and comfortable accommodations.  We enjoyed the complimentary wine and cheese tastings, sunset at the outdoor bar and grill, and stunning ocean views from our high floor villa in the best building on the property.  There was  a bit of a parking shortage in front of our building (it was a challenge to find a space at times, particularly at night) and a few guests were incredibly rude and dumped their filthy pizza boxes and sloppy garbage bags by the elevator instead of the garbage/recycling rooms
Manager Response: Thank you for your five-star review of Marriott's Newport Coast Villas!  While it's great to hear that you enjoyed the location, staff and amenities of the resort, we are disappointed to hear that your Sales experience was not positive.  We invite you to contact us at 800-860-9384 or via email at customer.care@vacationclub.com.  We look forward to hearing from you.

Summary: The villas are are very nicely remodeled and the staff here were wonderful- everything you need is at the resort and they have lots of activities for adults and kids- we stayed on the top floor near the pool - a little noisy but beautiful.  There are three pool areas and lots of fitness activities - Piyo, yoga, paddle boarding, etc
Manager Response: Thank you for your perfect review! We are happy your stay was wonderful and look forward to your next visit to Marriott's Newport Coast Villas.

Summary: We stayed a few days at the Newport Coast Villas with some friends and family members as a last hurrah before the craziness of school began.  We also took time to celebrate my daughter's 12th party there.    The whole stay was very enjoyable and relaxing.  We stayed at the Canyon pool, which was great for a party with many guests because the common area is large with lots of tables and umbrellas, ping pong, a bean bag game, and shuffle board.  It also had a huge fire pit that we made smores with at night.  There's also a grilling area with clean grills and a scraper.  It was weary to use the grills.  The complex has a park named Pacific Park, which is an easy walk from the Canyon's area, and the gorgeous hotel lobby and main pool area is just next door to Pacific Park.  There is
Manager Response: Archer, thank you for your perfect five star review! We are happy we were able to make your daughter’s birthday celebration memorable.

Summary: Stayed here for a week with multiple family members and all of us loved staying here. First of all, this is a beautiful MVC property. We've been to many and this ranks near he top. It helped that we got a renovated villa in the 1700 building. But since this property is on the hill, the views are incredible from many different areas, including the main pool.   Villas were big and spacious. Opening up the patio doors and letting in the ocean breeze was a perfect way to relax! The beds were super comfortable and the blackout curtains did their job. The master shower with the two shower heads is heavenly. The kitchen is adequate. There are three huge TVs in each 2 bedroom villa.  There are also 2 pullout sofa beds as well, so plenty of space.   We went to Crystal Cove one day. Free
Manager Response: We are happy you loved your villa and were able to enjoy the pool. Thank you for your review of your stay at Newport Coast Villas.

Summary: This is a beautiful vacation club property.  The lobby and the entrance grounds are great.  This property is very spread out. It is nice because many rooms give you great views of Southern Cali.  Canyons, large homes on hillsides and of course, the ocean.  The property offers free shuttles around the property, but sometimes you have to wait for it and even ask the front desk.  The marketplace offers pizzas, salads and pre-made deli sandwiches.  It also offers Starbucks and many other goods needed.  The restaurant by the pool is good for lunch or a simple dinner. The view is great!  The main large pool area is busy with lots of families, sometimes live music, ping pong and outdoor chess.  Sometimes hard to find a chair.  There are two other pools on the property that are nice and
Manager Response: Thank you for your review of Newport Coast Villas! We are happy you enjoyed your view and were able to enjoy the amenities and activities offered at the resort. We are excited to host you again for your next family vacation.

Summary: Stayed here for a one week vacation with relatives.  The property is absolutely beautiful, with fantastic views of the coast.   Would have given a 5 rating, but three things keep me from it:  1.  Insufficient gas grills -- they need to at least double the number of grills available.  During dinner time, you basically had to go stand in line to claim a grill 30-60 minutes ahead of time.   2.  Very poor sound insulation between floors.  We were on the ground floor and had to listen to the non-stop thumping from the kids above us running around all the time.  3.  It seemed like there were a lot of very large families/groups (20-40 people in the family/group) staying there the week we were there.  They basically took over the pool and chairs, fire pit, grills, and outdoor dining
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. While we're happy you enjoyed your overall stay, we're disappointed that amenity usage policies and noise detracted from your stay. We appreciate your feedback and have shared it with the resort's leadership team. We hope to welcome you again soon.

Summary: Our villa was fully loaded with kitchen equipment, blender, entertainment center. It was large and comfortable with a great deck outside. Pool and other facilities were clean and not crowded, and staff was very helpful. This is a great place for a family or couple getaway!
Manager Response: Thank you for the perfect review. We are happy to hear you enjoyed the accommodations and pool here at Marriott's Newport Coast Villas.

Summary: Great pools, great activities, incredible location. Huge 2 beds 2 bath suites...great views IF they give you one. Lots of space in the resort, you feel as if you are on YOU OWN vacation, but people are all around! Great place to be. This place is situated close to everything in Newport.
Manager Response: We are so happy to hear you enjoyed your stay at Marriott's Newport Coast Villas. We look forward to welcoming you back again soon.

Summary: This is a great vacation destination. You are not right on the beach, but close enough for beautiful views. The pool area is also quite nice with great snack options. Also in very close proximity to shopping and other dining adventures.
Manager Response: Thank you for your 5 star review Brian. We are happy to hear you enjoyed the views and location of Marriott's Newport Coats Villas.

Summary: We visited Newport beach and stayed at Villas at the end of April. The pools were fantastic and the kids enjoyed the mini-golf, play area, and other facilities. Rooms were spacious and comfortable. We used the grills for dinner and enjoyed the fire pits in the evening.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are so glad you and your family enjoyed the pools and daily activities. We hope to welcome you back to Newport Coast Villas soon!

Summary: I would highly recommend staying at the  Newport Marriott to any family vacationing in the Los Angeles area. Our condo was new with a great view of the Ocean. Beautiful grounds, great pools, and a helpful, friendly staff. In addition, they have many activities to keep the kids entertained. Hope to return sometime in the future.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are so glad to hear you enjoyed yourself while in Newport Coast. We look forward to welcoming you back soon.

Summary: This is my second stay at this location. The resort is pricey, however, we brought kids and need this layout. The staff was able to check us in hours early ---very helpful--there is also a guy names Mario who will do anything to make the stay even better. We loved the convenience of kitchen and coffee maker. Room cleaned daily. We were on the first floor and I would recommend a higher floor if available. There is a shuttle service, however, it is limited 9only three stops) so I would recommend a car as there are many beaches and places to see. Location fabulous. Highly recommend.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are happy to hear you and your family enjoyed your stay at Marriott's Newport Coast Villas. We hope to welcome you back soon.

Summary Heading: Wonderful place to stay for couples, families, friends...
Summary: We chose Newport Beach for its convenience to Anaheim and the Coast.  This home-away-from-home... was gorgeous.. Set on an idyllic hillside overlooking Newport Beach.. sunset views are amazing.  We had a 2 bedroom / 2 bath and just loved the entire stay.  Full kitchen made having snacks on the patio easy and keeping extra bottles of water and leftovers convenient.  The Villas resort has multiple pool areas, a fire pit area, sand volleyball court, and on site restaurants.  Every evening they had different events (tequila tasting, smores by the fire, etc) to keep every member of the family happy.  Reception was very quick and informative - would not hesitate to stay again or recommend to anyone looking for a Coastal Vacation... by the way, about 25 minutes to Disneyland w/CA
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are happy to hear you enjoyed your stay and the daily activities at Marriott's Newport Coast Villas.

Summary: For the past 12 years every July we travel to Marriott Newport Coast Villas for a week of fun in the sun.   Every year seems to get better.  The property is beautiful.  The staff is exceptional.  Nothing better.   Exceptional restaurants are within 10 minutes.  From casual to elegant they are worth visiting.   Take a drive to Laguna and vibist The Deck for lunch.  Special place.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to leave a review. We are happy to hear you enjoyed another stay at Marriott's Newport Coast Villas. We look forward to welcoming you back again soon.

Summary: Agree with almost all comments here.    A few notes to reiterate: 1.  Though there is shuttle service, I'd recommend a car for added convenience.    2.  The resort is proximate to so many activities or just relax poolside & have fun.    3.  We had a family BBQ one night & found the grills in immaculate condition.  I think it speaks to the attention to details the resort staff takes to ensure guests have a quality experience!  Job very well done Marriott!!!
Manager Response: Thank you for your review Casey. We are so happy to hear you and your family enjoyed your stay at Marriott's Newport Coast Villas.

Summary Heading: A perfect spot for a coastal getaway
Summary: We've stayed at this property several times as we are owners at this property. There really is so much to offer.  We are a family of 4 with 2 boys (13 and 8). They love, love, love, the pools, table tennis, chess, and sport court (Pacific Park) areas.  While it's was a busy time at the resort, being July, we never had a difficult time finding seating at the pool.    Some negatives to be aware of..... Not one time, in our week there while we were poolside, did we EVER have someone offer to get us food or drink from the poolside bar/grill.  The area seems very lightly staffed.  Table service would have been greatly appreciated.  Also, this stay, we were in building 4000 on the bottom floor. We love having the patio area to enjoy the cool mornings and comfortable evenings.  There
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to leave a review. We are so glad to hear you and your family enjoyed your stay at Marriott's Newport Coast Villas. However, we are disappointed to learn that you were unhappy with some aspects of your stay. We have shared your feedback and hope to welcome you again soon.

Summary: I want to make it clear that I love the resort. I have stayed here several times. I was disappointed with my last visit in May 2016 due to the room location and reception staff. I had put in my request in advance for my 9 night stay. I did not use my points, or trade to get into this resort but paid the full rate. I requested an ocean view on a high floor well in advance. I receive a view of a cement wall (literally) on the street level. I assume the cement wall was to reduce the road noise. I tried to move, request several times to speak with someone. The reception staff was miserable. We had to wait past the check in time for our room (we arrived at 12 noon as stated in our pre arrival information) of 4pm. We waited in the lobby with my party of friends. I was surprised by the
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are disappointed to learn you were not satisfied with the view or some of the Marriott's Newport Coast Villas staff. As a valued owner, we want to hear from you. Please contact our customer care team at 800 936 6824 or via email at customer.care@vacationclub.com. We look forward to hearing from you soon.

Summary Heading: One of Marriott's most beautiful Vacation Club resorts
Summary: We are finishing up a week here; we drove past here years ago, but this has been our first time vacationing here.  Having been a MVC owner for years and stayed at many locations, this location has to be one of their most beautiful locations.  Situated on the coastal hills of the Newport Beach region, it has spectacular views (even those advertised as "partial view").  The complex has everything we could want - including a main pool with a lot of activity and pool bar, as well as a really nice one up on the top of the complex that was quieter and really nice for us to relax at.  The villas are they typical quality that we've come to expect and enjoy with all of the MVC resorts.  Convenient location for daytripping it to San Diego, LA, or other coastal towns.  Unless you're

We are reasonably loyal Marriott Villa users and were not disappointed with the Newport Coast offering. The complex is large, but once you find your villa you aren't far from anywhere you need to be. Check in is easy and there is no hard sell to buy into the Vacation Club. The main pool area is located below the reception and this is a gorgeous spot to while away the time. There is pool side service for drinks and snacks and the kids really enjoyed playing in the pool. Our villa was clean and tidy and the daily servicing was more than adequate - it isn't a full service, but the beds are made, towels changed and sometimes the kitchen tidied. The villas are fully equipped - right down to a dustpan and brush, so you want for nothing. There is plenty of space with each bedroom

Very cool location with a great view, the pics do not do it justice.  I listened to the sales presentation and got a wonderful rate.  The trolleys are very convenient to take you into town or the beach as well as shopping.   The units are great, you could live there full time and entertain as well!   I would definitely return, however it was very very busy!

We had the best time. There was plenty for everyone to stay busy or relax.our villas was awesome and very comfortable. Location was close to a grocery store and food options. A lovely sunrise and sunset each day. Helpful, friendly staff. Only issues..people sitting in cars smoking...it blows righter Toward you or building. They need to monitor this better. Tv in 2nd bedroom kept messing up.

We enjoy staying with this location when they have an advertised rate as it can be pricey.  Beautiful rooms and a welcomed stay.  The view from some of the rooms are amazing.  It's nice to sit on the balcony in the evening and watch the sun set and relax.  Great spa  :-)

I stayed as a guest of a timeshare owner. The property and rooms were gorgeous. We enjoyed the pools, the bar, and the children's playroom. If you are interested in the timeshare, they offer discounted packages to entice you to buy. Otherwise, the villas are very expensive though you get a lot for the price - 2 luxury bedrooms, 2 baths, a full kitchen and huge living room with pullout sofa bed.

Summary Heading: Consistently one of the best vacation resorts in Newport Coast
Summary: Our family has been visiting Newport Coast Villas for over a decade since our purchase of a week here and we feel that it is among the best of Marriott's time shares (we also have a time share at Maui Ocean Club).  Most all of the villas have now been renovated and they have added daily movies and other family activities on the resort.  The spa continues to be one of the best in terms of service and staff.  Jessica who is the receptionist has been there for years and is great in recommending treatments and specialists for whatever your needs are.  Their check in is more efficient and there appears to be less waiting time to check in.  We have had the pleasure of working with Berit, pre check in adviser for years and her exemplary service in trying to accommodate time share

I was in town visiting family and we decided to do a little 3 night getaway here. Although we initially were concerned about being to far from the beach once we got here and saw the spectacular view and  discovered the transportation options to the beach and other desired areas we were completely satisfied. The kids had a blast at the pool and in the kids camp areas. The food was good at the main pool and we enjoyed sitting by the pool with a fantastic view overlooking the ocean.  We also had a smaller pool right next to the building which had an equally gorgeous view and was very convenient.   The condos were nice and well laid out. With 2 bedrooms and 2 pull out couches we easily were able to accommodate our visiting guests and the kids. There were tons of great restaurants

What a beautiful resort! Our family of 5 recently stayed for a long weekend at this beautiful property. This is a great location to rest after a long day of touring around, centrally located a few minutes from Laguna and just down the road from Newport Beach. You can walk to the beautiful Crystal Cove Beaches.  We loved every bit of the pool, the workout room, the teen movies, game room and the Sunday night magic show. The staff was super friendly and helpful. The grounds were just beautiful - beautiful landscaping and just a breathtaking view of the ocean. Food and drink prices at the pool were reasonable ($8-$10 range).  The pool did get a bit crowded and 'Disney' like later Saturday afternoon, but the crowd dwindled down after a bit and we were able to enjoy a quiet dinner

Marriott NCV Is our favorite place to go. It has a beautiful view of Pacific Ocean  (if you as for a room with ocean view) It is a beautiful 2 bedroom time share.    In the living room there is a sofa sleeper, 2 nice chairs... and balcony with table a chairs . The kitchen is fully equipped with everything you could possibly need. dining table for meals and bar stools as well. The Master room has large spa tub and private bathroom. The room has large screen TV plenty of room.  The second room is really nice as well .  The pool is large & beautiful and a view from almost everywhere on the grounds 2 large spa Jacuzzi. Shopping and Grocery stores close by, The shopping center up the street has several restaurants to choose from.   Marriott has planned activities everyday for youth
Manager Response: Thank you for your great review!  We are happy to hear that you enjoyed your well-appointed large villas and convenient location of Marriott's Newport Coast Villas.  We look forward to hosting you and your family again next year!

Summary: We stayed for a long weekend last June.   Let me start with what's good about it.  The beach is a 15 minute walk.   That said beach have paved trails of about 6 mile round trip from pelican side to the historic village.     The 2-bedroom villa was spacious enough for a family of 4. 1 bedroom with King bed and another with queen, 2 bathrooms, full kitchen and washer/dryer.  The living room also has a sofa bed.  The villa has a veranda too.  The property has 6 pools.   This is definitely a hotel for families.  Younger ones.   Expect kids running around the hall ways or the villa above you.   The street side villa is loud.   Thankfully there is little to no traffic at night.  If you plan on staying in during the day, expect to hear the loud roars of all the v8 sports cars in
Manager Response: Thank you for your Trip Advisor review of your recent getaway. We are sorry to read your overall stay failed to live up to expectations due to the villa décor and furniture, and traffic noise.  Your comments regarding the shower and pools have been shared with the resort’s leadership and we thank you for your input. Hopefully we will have the pleasure of hosting you soon at Marriott Vacation Club.

Summary: We stayed in the 5100 building and had an excellent view of the Pacific Ocean, swimming pool and fire pit. The villa was comfortable with two bedrooms and two full bathrooms and in good condition and very clean. The grounds were also well maintained. We attended a family movie night out on the lawn as well as a magic show. Our granddaughter enjoyed swimming and s'mores night also. I highly recommend it for families.  Btw, there are free shuttles to take you around the property and also off property. We went down to Crystal Cove State Beach one day and checked out the tide pools.

Summary Heading: Beautiful two bedroom apartments to stay
Summary: We stayed in this resort for one week. The apartments are well designed and well maintained. The staff are very well trained. They do handle so many families very professionally. I had stayed in this location seven years ago and I remember only good things.

Summary Heading: Great Property, Great Service, Great Views
Summary: We recently choose Marriott's Newport Coast Villas for our family vacation (7 adults and one infant). We requested a remodeled corner room in building 3900 or 2400 on the top floor. We were assigned room 2420 which was a recently remodeled corner room. Unfortunately, we were located on the 2nd floor. The view was good but was partially blocked by the snack bar roof. One of the other problems was the closeness to the pool which allowed for a lot of late night noise. I choose 2400 based on the recommendations of another tripadvisor member, but if I had to do it over I likely would have picked a room farther from the pool. Other than those minor issues the overall property was awesome. The staff was extremely friendly and accommodating. We went on a Marriott Timeshare presentation

Summary Heading: Relaxing Stay at High-End Marriott Property
Summary: We were in the 5100 building, which we understand to be one of the newest.  Our two-bedroom layout worked well for us and our adult son.  We picked up bread and fruit at the Whole Foods store at Fashion Island.  We ate a nice breakfast in out room and enjoyed the fresh strawberries.  We ate lunch around the pool twice, enjoying Marriott burgers.  We did a time share presentation, but did not buy.

The location is great and the grounds are gorgeous.  The villas are up to date, clean and spacious.  However, you can hear the people above you stomping around like elephants.  The Marriott in Park City has people walking in ski boots and you can't hear a thing.  I don't know why all the Marriotts can't be sound proof like Park City.  Also, they claim to have a restaurant.  It's not a restaurant.  You can order food from the bar (which was closed most of the time due to a little rain) or the Market Place.  The MP has few menu items.  I doubt I'll go back.  On a positive note, MARK, the shuttle driver, IS THE BEST!!!

Summary Heading: Great location and a beautiful property.
Summary: This is a timeshare property.  Each villa has two bedrooms, two baths, a full kitchen, living and dining room and a washer and dryer.  The Marriott offers a free shuttle to Crystal Cove State Park (plus a few other places) for their guests which was quite handy.    The property is well maintained and the employees were all friendly and pleasant.

It is nice location, near the beach and rooms plus campus is well kept.   But a place that I enjoyed most when at the beach.   The hotel scene is media and tech heavy.   Prepare for the "Preview Center" where a time share sales rep will "invite" you to purchase a time share "with no pressure".

Our 2 bedroom villa could sleep up to nine. We had approx 20 guests for a celebration and all fit in comfortably. Lots of seating...also the hotel staff sent up a bottle of wine. Nice! They have 3 pools, tennis and b-ball courts. Lot's of activities, some free, some nominal charge for all types, families, singles, couples. A great place to stay...almost as if you are in another country.

This timeshare property is one of the best. Rooms are all spacious 2 bedroom with a full kitchen. Many rooms have an unbelievable view of the coast and Catalina Island. A shuttle is available to take guests down to Crystal Cove State Beach which is a slice of heaven with a fun café. The pools are nice and also sport the amazing view, with pool bars and snacks available.   Rental prices are high, but a family of 4-6 will be very comfortable sharing the suite. The décor is homey and elegant with a big tub in the master. Laundry in the suite too, so pack light!   Loved having a kitchen so we could come together in the mornings for family breakfast on our time. A Trader Joe's is right down the road with excellent selections of cheese and wine for sunset cocktail hour.
Manager Response: Hi Nancy.  Thank you for your five-star review of Marriott’s Newport Coast Villas.  It is terrific to hear you adored the villa, resort amenities and resort views.  We look forward to welcoming you and your family back on your next vacation.

Summary Heading: Nice 2-3 bedroom Villas for families staying in SoCal
Summary: The property is loaded with 2-3 bedroom villas and very nice grounds.  Recommended for families staying in the Newport coast area who need a full kitchen, family room, dining room, and multiple separate bedrooms.  There aren't very many attractions nearby and everything requires driving.
Manager Response: Hi Christopher.  Thank you for your review of Marriott’s Newport Coast Villas.  It is wonderful to know you found the resort ideal for families visiting the area due to the well-appointed villa.  We look forward to the opportunity to welcome you back to Marriott’s Newport Coast Villas.

Summary: This hotel was amazing. The staff were friendly and helpful. There is a great view of Newport Beach from the hotel. The lobby is very fresh and modern, with a printer center and computers to use. There is also a convenience store next to the front desk which sells fresh donuts, Starbucks coffee, drinks, snacks and toiletries. Outside of the lobby, there is a beautiful fountain and rows of beautiful flowers.  Underneath the lobby there is an activity center, arcade room, iMacs to use, video game area, and even a MOVIE THEATER! And right outside of this area is a huge fitness center, massage center, and beautiful pool. This hotel is just perfect for anybody who wants to have a great time with nice views of Newport Beach.  The room was luxurious and nicely spaced out. There is a

As always, this Marriott resort property is superb in every way.  We are Marriott time share owners in another location and we chose to use our membership  points to stay here for the week while we were in the area for a family wedding. The villa was appointed perfectly and had everything we needed readily available.  The location is great for visiting any and all of Orange County.  Customer service is excellent and the property is beautiful! A can't miss!!

Nice place try to get a upper location for a view of the ocean.  2 bedroom units nicely setup and easy to use.  Modern with free wifi and big screen tv.  Some units do not have elevators to upper floors, if you need as at desk. Checkin was quick , locations are spread out and you must use provided map to get where you want to go.  No real food here, go down to PCH make a left and big shopping center on left with Trader Joes, restaurants and stores. Long strip mall or right on PCH to Newport lots of stuff  Will return again

The grounds are beautiful and very well maintained.  Gorgeous gardens, views, walking paths.  The accomodations are very nice, spacious, everything you need including a full kitchen.   Barbeques are also available.  There are multiple pools spread throughout the resort.  I only stayed for 3 nights and then moved on to another location but next time I will spend the whole week here.   The only downside is because this is a vacation club there is an attempt at a hard sell for you to become an owner but once I said I was not interested I wasn't asked again.

Summary Heading: Not for couples with no children
Summary: Just got back from Marriott’s Newport Coast, and, I must say, being a Vacation Club owner, was a little disappointed.  If you are able to score a room with an ocean view, you are lucky.  We were on the ground floor, no view of the ocean, and, 50 steps to climb up to the pool.  Having bad knees, I asked for another unit that didn't have all the steps.  No such luck.  I guess owning 2 timeshares with Marriott doesn't help. Our view, as the employee put it, was ‘a garden view overlooking a parking lot’.  She was right, sadly. I don’t think the girl checking us in was very knowledgeable.  When we asked to have two names on the account so that our friends could make room charges on their credit card, she said it couldn’t be done.  Luckily, the young gentleman next to her showed her

Was pleasantly surprised by this fractional/owners club property. Not a vacation club owner I rented a condo here for a long weekend  through Marriott with several teenagers whom were touring the area as part of an exchange student tour. Property was a decent location to the sites we wanted to see and offered lots of room for our party of 6. We wished we would have had more time to enjoy the on site amenities and activities.  Property is large and sprawling and guests should know that most units dont have beach views and the beach access is about 1 mile away, shuttle available but this is not a beach property.

Lovely vacation club resort with beautiful views and comfortable accommodations. The staff was friendly and helpful, and the location allowed us to explore the Orange County sights with little effort.We thoroughly enjoyed the visit. We had requested a poolside villa and were delighted to get just that with the addition of a Pacific Ocean view in the background. Be sure to call in advance to let them know exactly what you need as not all buildings have elevators.  Looking forward to returning soon.

Great Vacation Club Resort with three areas to consider. We were in 4000 area with great views, a BBQ area near buy and a large quieter pool. Resort even has some large fire pits to enjoy an evening around during colder nights. Kids tended to swim in the main pool area near reception.  Since the apartments are fully equipped with washer & dryer, no need to bring large luggage of clothing. Use the Pavillion Grocery Store at the Newport Coast Shopping Centre for food & drinks etc. Take the Free Shuttle Bus to Crystal Cove State Beach. You can hire some beach chairs from the Marriott Shack. Pool bar/snack food was fine and service was good. Only shame was that room cleaning was not automatically free.

Summary Heading: Love this property but they made a mistake
Summary: If you're a Marriott Platinum Membership Rewards member (and a Hilton Diamond member), the sales team invites you to buy more points with MVC and they put you in a crappy room - overlooking a parking lot and try to sell it as a Garden View- and I assume the want to "impress you" so you'll purchase during the tour, they have made a mistake. We were planning to buy more and I made a quick decision to decline at this time.   Note to Newport Coast - if you want to make a sale, make a good first impression. Particularly to your Platinum members.  ps, the front desk staff were gracious and were only doing their job. The back office needs to review their approach. The sad part is we brought friends to impress. They LOVE looking at a parking lot too,  as you can imagine.

The check in was a complete mess with long lines.  This should not happen at a Marriott.  Then the elevator that we had to use to get to the room they assigned us would not work, so we had to request another room.  When trying to call the desk, the phone rang and rang, then you were placed on hold for a very long time before finally getting a human.  Much frustration at the beginning of the vacation.  We had a two bedroom condo which was very nice.  Be advised that there are a lot of steps to the pools and to many of the condos.  That is not a good situation for senior citizens.  We were able to see movies in the "cinema" which is a nice amenity.

We booked this room with high expectations and overall it met most of them.  Pros: great location, nice amenities, beautiful view and room met most of our expectations.  Cons: furniture in living area is dated, the staff tries to talk you into time share and the closest beach ( Crystal Cove ) you have to pay to go.

Large resort with nice rooms and amenities. Renovations are ongoing so everything looks new and modern. Multiple pools, gym, tennis, ping pong, movie theater and bicycles. Special events for adults and kids all day long. No restaurant/bar but food/drinks available at the main pool until 8pm. Staff is friendly and courteous. 5 minute drive into Newport Beach where there are tons of restaurants and shops.

Summary Heading: A fun filled resort for families
Summary: This resort accommodations were excellent. All of the villas are 2 bedrooms/2 bath with full kitchen & dining areas. The rift includes multiple outdoor pools, tennis courts, pickleball, basketball, putting green & volleyball. Daily children activities & games. A free shuttle will take you to any & all parts of the resort or there is a schedule for the shuttle to take you to the beach or shopping. The balconies from the villas give a view of the Pacific Ocean, golf course or the pool.  Fantastic facility.

This was our 10th visit to the Marriott Newport Coast Villas and again it was perfect.  When we arrived at the check in desk Ashley was there to assist us and she was just wonderful.  It had been a stressful couple of months and we wanted to add a few days on to our owners week stay without moving to another villa.  Ashley spent a lot of time trying to work it our for us and was unable to add the days. Our Villa was not quite ready so we went to walk around the beautiful property and while on our walk we received a call from Ashley. It seems that she continued to work on our request and along with Andrew together they were able to make it work.  Thank you Andrew and Ashley you made our vacation perfect.  In addition the remainder of our stay was wonderful. The staff is always so

My family and I stayed for week in May. We had a beautiful ocean view villa in the 2300 building. Check-in was fast and convenient and the reception lobby has a beautiful view of the main pool area...complete with live music. I really wanted to love this property but I am huge on customer service and unfortunately this Marriott missed the mark. The first incident occurred when one of the Pool activity staff yelled at my 3 year old for touching the noodles for sale. The second was the bar staff was incredibly rude. For a $9 weak drink you would expect to be treated with some respect. Honestly, I could go on and on, there were additional encounters that left a bad taste. The entire staff needs to go through customer service training. I'm sure they have lost a lot of guests because

Summary Heading: Spacious and Luxurious + Majestic 180 Views of the Pacific Ocean
Summary: We own Marriott time share for over 2 decades and booked a week at Newport Coast Villas through an exchange with Interval International.  Yes - for those familiar - Interval International.  (we lucked out).  Our reservation was handled through Marriott Owner Services in conjunction with the Marriott Desk at Interval. Pre-arrival went very very smoothly. Our requests were granted with minimal exception.  The property consists entirely of 2 bedroom, 2 bath villas with a full kitchen, washer/dryer and an open terrace.  The master bedroom suite has a king bed, casement style windows and a 6-fixture master bath. Yes - 6 fixtures.  The living/dining/kitchen area spills out through a double sliding door (Andersen) to a 8x12 terrace from where you can see majestic 180 views of the

Fabulous complex.. Very family freindly with lorts of childrens activities.  Not right on the beach but shuttles to take you to several local beaches are pretty convenient.  Complex is large and comprehensive with wonderful activities for families (ansd we are in our late 60s, but enjoyed it a great deal).  Can't wait to go back.

Summary Heading: Great location - wonderful views and activities
Summary: We stayed here for three nights while at a convention near by. Wish we could have had time to relax and enjoy this beautiful resort! The pools looked amazing and the view of the ocean was everywhere.  They had lots of activities for adults and children alike.  Our room was a 2 bedroom with 2 huge bathrooms,  full kitchen with table, bar area and living room. The balcony was very big aS well.  Only a short drive from shopping and restaurants.

Summary Heading: A short getaway to see family
Summary: This is our 2nd visit to Marriott's Newport Coast Villas, and I love the property.  It sits on a hill overlooking the Pacific and has some breathtaking views.  There are a variety of activities available including Zumba, yoga, movies, whiskey tasting... This visit I only got to one Zumba class.  Shannon, the instructor, is phenomenal.  Due to gray weather, which is evidently common here this time of year, I took in two fairly recent movies  in their mini theater - Room and Concussion. My only criticism of the property is that they seem to be understaffed.  We had to wait awhile for s bellhop to take our luggage to our room. (We did not rent a car this visit.). And at the poolside restaurant and bar, it was difficult to get a server's attention because their were only two-and one

I am timeshare owner this location, I love nice view, activities and walking around with some beverage at pool area. My family had enjoyed for kids B-day party and small group meeting with swimming as per ownership

We love the Marriott Vacation Clubs and this one met all our needs as well.    We had a 2 Bedroom Villa with a view of the ocean. It's beautifully landscaped & the villas furnishings are lovely. The beds are so comfortable and the rooms were fairly sound proof as well.  Kitchens are fully equipped & outdoor grills are everywhere. Though we didn't use the pools, they looked great. Parking was good for tenants and they do check to see that you have the correct permit on your car... so park where they tell you to. Everything was clean and well maintained.  Conveniently located near the coast highway so you can get to all the beach cities along the way. They do provide shuttle services for shopping, etc. so you don't always need a car.  We do plan to return.  Had a relaxing vacation

We have been coming here for years. Nice to see the villa was updated and clean. Booked a lady minute getaway and managed to stay in a nice suite with a decent view, love the new modern look. Wish that the beds and couches were a but cushier though! They might consider a mattress topper as the bed is very firm. Enjoyed great walks on the beach and tide pooling at a super low tide down at the nearby beach. Always enjoy easy access to grills and markets.

Check-in was easy but I had to wait 3 hours to finally get into my room, this was after asking for an early check-in.  2-bedroom was spacious with full amenities. Had to do the timeshare preview which was fine until we said NO, then we felt like we were treated like gum on the bottom of a shoe.  Great pools, movie theater. Overall great property, just not so good with check-in and timeshare preview.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel with easy access to Disneyland.
Summary: We stayed at this property from 29 March for 5 days. We stayed in room 1124. The property grounds were stunning. The parking was very convenient, right out the front of each building. The pool area was great, the large pool was semi heated when we were there which the kids loved. The only down side to this area was there was only one hot tub which could sit about 12 people. This was the only one for our  whole building complex! They need another hot tub. The hot tub had a strong chemical smell as well. The kids club looked fun. Check in and check out  was quick. The main pool was very crowded when we were there, but the pool in front of our building was not. There was a nice BBQ areas although we did not use them.  We traveled to Disneyland for two days during our stay. It was a

We stayed in a 2 bedroom condo for 5 days. The resort itself is beautiful and has spectacular views.  Our unit was large,  well-equipped and comfortable. The location is between Newport Beach and Laguna Beach. There are very many excellent restaurants nearby (there is nothing within walking distance). Newport and Laguna Beaches are magnificent towns with small shops, art galleries,  scenic views.   One tip about resort: there is no real restau6. There is a bit of pool bar food but they open late and close early.

We were invited to stay in a 2 Bdrm. Villa with friends, a party of 7.  The accommodation was great for our group.  There were two bedrooms on each end of the kitchen living areas, offering privacy and comfort.  The grounds and pools were beautiful.

Great accommodations. My wife, 11 month old and I stayed in a 2 bedroom villa. We were very comfortable and the place had several activities for us to do as a family. Rooms are very comfortable (loved the Pillows and bed). It is up to date with stylish/comfortable furniture. Great grocery store near by with many options for ready to grill food. The hotel has many clean and easy to use grills, some with spectacular views.  Beach is literally across the street. However you do have to walk a ways to get to the beach and go down a steep grade hill. Beach is beautiful but not one you can get in ocean readily(many huge rocks). Great for lounging on beach and kite flying. We actually got to see 2 whales within 75 yards of us. Pretty cool experience. Great place.  One more thing, if you

This was our 4th stay here and as usual it was great. Just the two of us this time so space galore since the units are all 2 bedroom as far as I know. We had a nice view of the lawn and an ocean view too.   We did not use any of the amenities this time as we drove to nearby areas such as San Clemente, Laguna Beach, Huntington Beach and Balboa Island for shopping and dining. This is definitely a location  where having a vehicle is almost a necessity though there is a shuttle  to the Crystal Cove shopping center where there is a Trader Joe's plus several restaurants.  As other reviews have mentioned, some units have been refurbished (getting rid of the glass top dining table!!!). The grounds are lovely and there is lots to keep everyone busy.

The location is breathtaking the hotel has a great view of Newport beach. Checking in was very quick and the staff was extremely helpful and patient explaining how to find our villa in such a huge resort. The room is very nice and perfect for big families. There is a full kitchen which provides everything you need to cook. There's a dinner table that fits four people and a spacious living room. The rooms are clean and still feel new.  The resort has a big pool, bbqs, a basketball court, volleyball and a small golf patio. There is a movie room where they screen different movies throughout the day. Very family friendly resort. Even though the hotel is near the beach it is not walking distance to it. I would return for a relaxing night in Newport.

Starting to show its age, we stayed in the newer section of the property.  Felt a little badgered by the timeshare staff in the main building (we were there with owners).  Pools were clean, views were incredible.  The room comfortably slept 4 adults and two children without ever feeling like we were crawling over each other.  My kids loved all of the activities that were going on throughout our stay.  Definitely would recommend a rental car for trips into Newport Beach or other nearby destinations.  There is a shuttle that goes to various locales BUT from a convenience standpoint and for a quick trip to Pavilions for food/drinks, a car is your best bet.  Playing pool or ping pong at the main pool area while looking out at the beautiful Pacific Ocean is something that everyone

Summary Heading: Beautiful Property - Villas, not a Hotel
Summary: This is a Marriott Vacation Club property, so don't expect a full services as you would from a hotel. It is designed for a week's stay and each room has a kitchen along with nearly everything you need to cook and clean - all you need to supply is your own food and beverages.  There is poolside bar and food service with, well, bar and grill food.  If you want to dine out there are dozens of excellent restaurants within a short drive.  The views from this property are just outstanding!  If you are a Marriott Vacation Club owner you must put this on your list - if you are a casual traveler you might be able to get a decent rate in the off season.

We were invited to this Marriott while staying at a Marriott in Palm Desert. Our initial room assignment was totally unacceptable!.It was at the lowest elevation on the property (property sits upon a hill overlooking ocean). No view except of brush and concrete slab. It's like they give you the worst room and if you accept that room, score for them. We were eventually given a nice room. No ocean view because according to the desk, those rooms are saved for owners. My interpretation is that those rooms are saved for guests who pay full price. I don't understand their business plan. If you want people to buy into the timeshare, wouldn't you entice them by putting them up in one of the better rooms...not the dungeon??  Great place to take kids...lots of activities; wonderful pool

Summary Heading: Beautiful property, not far from the beach
Summary: I had never stayed here before and was very pleased with the property. Everything seemed to be well-maintained. Our room was a two bedroom and overlooked the grounds and ocean. The kitchen was modern and well-equipped. The beds were comfortable and we didn't have any issues with noise. The living area had comfortable couches and TV. We were very comfortable the entire time we were in the room. There was plenty to do in the area. We did several hikes around Crystal Cove and went to Fashion Island Mall. There was plenty of shopping, restaurants and things to do within a short distance, but you definitely need a car. There isn't anything close enough to easily walk to.

My wife and I spent a week in a two bedroom villa (room for overnights with the grandchildren). The view of the ocean was great. The villa was clean and and very well furnished. It was very evident that upgrades had been made since our last visit. The kitchen was very well supplied. The bed was outstandingly comfortable, which is the norm for a Marriott establishment. The entire staff from check-in to check-out is very courteous, friendly and helpful. The amenities for this resort are outstanding for both adults and children. There are numerous activities and outstanding restaurants as you travel along the pacific coastline. If you are searching for an outstanding place to stay on the southern California coast, this is the place. My wife and I would highly recommend the Marriott

Summary Heading: walls are paper thin, you wont hear the ocean, just people
Summary: Wow I can not believe this resort got that many stars! We are vacation club members and this is by far the worst layout design I've ever seen! Back to back master suites, so you can absolutely hear the people next door... lovely. Also do not expect to hear the ocean, only children and workers and people and stomping above you and doors slamming, relaxing.... We had a terrible time getting here from DC and didnt arrive until almost midnight and had to sleep in the guest room, not the master due to the fact that as stated above, we could hear the couple next door. Been here for not even a day yet and more tense then I was before my vacation! If you are looking for a relaxing environment with a spa like atmosphere go somewhere else, this place is by far not up to that standard.

This is our fourth trip to Newport Coast Villas and we have the most beautiful villa which overlooks the grounds and the ocean. Such a comfortable beautiful place I never want to go home.
