We drove from Palm Desert (where we stayed for a week in Marriott's The Enclaves) to Newport Coast Villas and instead of taking the freeway which gets you there but is a tad boring we took the scenic route over the mountains which was beautiful and traffic free. However, climbing the mountains and manoeuvring the hairpin bends down is not for the faint hearted but I would do it again as it's beautiful scenery. Everything about Newport Coast Villas is superb and I can't imagine anyone would dislike it. Our balcony where I am sitting now is lovely as is the whole apartment. Once again I shall be

Summary Heading: Great view , great vacation get away
Summary: We stay here for a family reunion and come back with kids for spring time. The place is clean and nicely done in outdoor setting with fire pits and nice play area for kids with playground , tennis courts , pool and game rooms , spa and free classes outdoor for yoga and work out.   Location is the best , close to the famous beaches and state preserved waterfront such as Crystal Cove and Laguna Beach. I love to come back here, our kids love the fire pits for cooking hot dogs and roosting marshmallows  and see the open ocean and the beach.  Bus from the resort take you to the beach and shopping center.  Great costumer serves.

This is seriously the best location, near Laguna Beach, Newport Beach and Beachcomber and walking trails. The room had recently been remodeled and I'd light, airy, very cool. For a family vacation or a reunion this would be fantastic! Very nice welcoming happy hour once a week and lots of activities. Hope to go again!

Stayed week of 4/24 on a Marriott  Interval exchange.  Stayed at Room 1520 with a golf and partial ocean view.  Villa was refurbished , spacious, and comfortable.  Villa was a close walking distance to the main pool and the Tide pool.  All staff were courteous and handled requests promptly.  Went to Huntington Beach street fair  (every Tuesday) which had vendors, farmers market, and many restaurant options.  Enjoyed walking Balboa island with its quaint beach cottages , shops, and restaurants.  Also enjoyed Corona Del Mar Beach with its easy paid parking ,and family friendly beach with facilities.  Took arranged tour with Fun City Tours thru Marriott  to Beverly Hills/ Hollywood. Would highly recommend!!!!   Newport Coast shopping Center 2 miles , with many shopping and

Beautiful location and villas. Nicely equipped with a full kitchens and grilling areas. Several pools. Walking distance to the beach for wonderful sunsets. Great location on the coast with views of the Ocean everywhere!. Close to Laguna, Disneyland and 1.5 hours from the San Diego Zoo. Temperatures a little cool for me but sunny every day! Great Staff and very clean and well maintained resort. Totally lives up to the Marriott name.
Manager Response: We are happy that you found hours of beautiful sunsets and fabulous coastal views!  Thank you for your Trip Advisor review, and we look forward to seeing you again soon!

Summary: Second time for us to come back to the Marriott Newport villas. Already have our third visit planned. Two bedroom two bath condos with full amenities.  We had a spectacular ocean view villa.  The pools are great and there's lots of activities to do.
Manager Response: Hi Donna.  Thank you for your great review, and for your loyalty to Marriott Newport Coast Villas!  See you again soon!

Summary Heading: Welcome to the Hotel California!! Stunning
Summary: This was an absolutely beautiful resort. It is a timeshare resort with condo style accommodations. This type of resort suits my family so well. While I did not get an oceanview room as I requested. (I understand it is not guaranteed) the view was still beautiful. The grounds of this resort are spectacular. The pools are heated and beautiful. There are basketball and volleyball courts, fire pits and playgrounds. Everything you need in a resort. There is a movie theatre and arcade. The shuttle service to Crystal Cove is prompt and very convenient. I would highly recommend this resort for families or couples visiting Southern California.
Manager Response: We appreciate your top-notch review, Dayna!  We are delighted that you found the Marriott's Newport Coast Villas amenities and accommodations the perfect match for you and your family.  We hope to host you again on another family vacation!

Summary: We spend 4 days in the Ocean View Villas. It was relaxing. The 2 bedrooms Vlilla is very spacious, comforts of home. The shuttle is a convenient offer provided by the resort. It took us to Laguna Beach as well as the the Beachcomber at Crystal Cove, a must restaurant to go for breakfast. Easy access to Newport Beach and Orange County.

Four adults, three children ages three and younger. We arrived on a Friday and checked out the following Monday. The property is clean, well groomed, and landscaped with beautiful colorful flora that seemed appropriate for the arid coastal climate. Walking the grounds was fantastic, with ocean views ever present. The resort employees were the best: friendly, high service orientation.

Very nice accommodation for a girls vacation when a little extra room is required.  The two bedroom villa was perfect and each bedroom spacious.  Location is perfect for getting up and down PCH101.  There are many choices in the area but this is affordable and a great value.

This place is a nice getaway if you live in Ca and want someplace close to go.  We have been here twice this last year and have enjoyed it very much.  The rooms are huge with 2 bedrooms and ocean views.  Very relaxing with easy parking.  Beach is a easy walk across pacific coast highway.  No daily house leaning  Would definitely return again!

Was only there for a few hours to visit some folks.  Beautiful property.  Amazing views.  the ocean is just a stone's throw away.  Loved the place.  Quiet and friendly nice villas, fully equipped apartments with beautiful views of the sunset and the ocean.

Summary Heading: Amazing as always, now even better with the renovated room
Summary: This is my fifth time visiting this place, we love it so much. The room are now renovated, and with the new look, it's so much better. The old one was okay but this new look is more modern/contemporary. They sofa bed in the living room is even better, when the bed is pulled out, there are still two seat left. The common area are amazing, golf putting, sand pit, bbq are everywhere. The room also got a new fridge, dishwasher, washing machine and dryer. They should had redo the cupboard in the kitchen as well.  I would suggest the hotel consider changing the bathroom hardware, it believe they weren't changed and not working that well.   May I also add that the mattress in the second bedroom are not that good, when I sleep on one side I felt like I'm falling off the edge, I believe

Our room/condo was lovely.  Two bedroom, two bath, fully stocked kitchen, w/d. I stayed 4 days and hated to leave. The grounds are impeccable with beauty.  Views are breath-taking.    It is a family friendly resort.  Many many activities for children as well as adults.   Food in pool bar/restaurant was very good.

Please see my earlier review dated June 17, 2015 as it appears that a review cannot be edited and this is a follow up to review the resolution regarding the issue of the tailgate theft on the property of our 2014 F-250 pick up.    Long story short -- the hotel's insurance company refused to cover the cost related to replacing our tailgate which was stolen on the hotel grounds (outside our hotel room) in the middle of the night during our stay there.  The hotel made no attempt to rectify the situation following the insurance company's decision.  Knowing that multiple vehicle thefts occurred on the same evening, I was a bit surprised and disappointed.    Ensure that you CAREFULLY review the parking pass for their disclaimers because, in spite of the vehicle being locked, Marriott

Summary Heading: Family friendly resort with own washer & dryers!
Summary: Our family of 5 loved the Newport Coast Villas. The units were spacious, clean and equipped with a large flat screen tv's, washer/dryer and full kitchen! The grounds were very nice, beautiful views and friendly staff. There was free wifi, no extra resort fees or parking charges. Having kids, we requested to be a short walk to the pool. The pools were large so lots of room to swim and play. The pool temps could have been a bit warmer (82 degrees and 85 degree weather).  Whole Foods and Fashion Island are 7 minutes away so we were able to have breakfast in our room. We will definitely return, pack less (thank you washer/dryer) and stay a week!

Summary Heading: Easily the nicest timeshare property in Southern California!
Summary: Awesome property with ocean views and gorgeous landscaping set high on the hills above Crystal Cove in Newport Coast.  Easy drive from most of Southern California.  Take Jamboree exit off of 405 and skip the toll on the 73.  Drive through quaint Corona Del Mar and up the hill to the resort.  There is more than one entrance to this large resort but there are signs leading you to the check in lobby.  We arrived on Saturday a bit earlier than 4 and quickly checked into our 2 bedroom 2 bath unit in building 2500.  We had a pleasant view of the ocean from our 2nd floor unit but clearly the higher the better for views.  Even on our level there were several trees that I would have liked to have seen replaced with something shorter but we could easily see Catalina Island over 30 miles

Summary Heading: Can't help but feel relaxed and refreshed at this resort
Summary: This is my 3rd time staying at this property.  Unfortunately it has always been for work so I don't get to fully enjoy the amenities such as pool, tennis, etc. and the beautiful resort itself.  Sitting atop a sloping hill, most, if not all the rooms have at least partial ocean views.  You can hear the waves crashing, the birds chirping and feel your stresses melting away.  Full kitchen, including oven, allows me to put my road warrior chef hat on and experience home cooking away from home.    Standard 2 bedroom units are well appointed with contemporary furnishings - i.e. they're not chic or hip but homey.   I thought I would be turned off by the sheer size of the property but I actually enjoy it - once I got my bearings and stopped getting lost!  The larger fitness center by

Summary Heading: Beautiful property, great location, and wonderful grounds
Summary: We stayed for 5 nights in a two bedroom villa.  The kitchens are nicely furnished and have what is needed to cook there.  They have multiple pools for families and a quieter one for adults.  There is a great play area for children complete with a sandbox, basketball court, and putting green.  They do movies with popcorn as an activity. The grounds are beautiful.  We were there with a lot of families with children, so it was noiser than I had anticipated.  It is a 20 minute walk to the beach, or they have a shuttle that will take you to the beach.  It is a great property for families.

I wanted a place to stay halfway between Burbank and San Diego and have a large family. This room fit everyone comfortably and the room itself was very nice. That said, if I were to stay again I would stay for at least three days we just did not have time to enjoy the amenities and the cost outweighed the benefit for us on this stay. Also, I find most of these time share properties to be destination adjacent. eg. I could see Newport Beach from my room but could not walk there. Slight misrepresentation.

This weekend marked the first and last time I'll visit the Marriott Newport Coast Villas. While the property itself is well-maintained and in a beautiful location, there were a number of customer service glitches that served to disappoint.  I booked a one-night stay for a quick weekend getaway with some family. Two adults and three kids.  Through the Marriott website, you are given the option to modify your reservation. One of the modification options is granting another party (whom will be staying with you) the ability to check-in under your reservation. A few weeks prior to my arrival, I completed the necessary online form to allow another family member to check-in in my absence. The day of check-in, I receive a call from said family member saying the front desk did not have

Summary Heading: Great but could use some improvements to make fantastic!
Summary: Here’s what we loved:  Fantastic resort for families with tons to do to stay busy—sandboxes, basketball court, putting green, playground, sand volleyball court, activity center with tons of activities/classes, hourly shuttle to Crystal Cove and other nearby shopping places and of course, lots of pools.  The main pool is a bit overrun with guests/teenagers but the 2 pools on the far ends of the resort are basically empty.  The “Grotto pool” has a 1.5 ft wading pool for little kids/babies which was fantastic.  We spent most of our time at that pool area and there were no more than 10 people at any given time, and this was during Spring Break.  Great fitness facilities with tons of cardio and weight options.    Here are my suggestions for improvement: -	Eliminate added costs like
Manager Response: Thank you for your review!  We are happy that you enjoyed the amenities and location of Newport Coast Villas, and we thank you for your suggestions for improvement.  Your comments will be shared with the resort management.  Hope to see you again soon.

Summary: Such a nice place!  We have a family of 7 including our married son, so we needed two separate rooms for 4 nights.    As I searched, I discovered that this condo was cheaper than two hotel rooms in the same area.  This way we could all be together and enjoy the kitchen and access to the beach.  What a classy place!!!  WOW!!!  It is so nice!!  I have no idea if we were in the "updated" unit.  It was large, spacious, clean and perfect in every way.  No, we didn't get an ocean view and when I checked in and was told we were on the bottom floor, my heart sunk.  But we had a lovely view of the trees and flowers and we were perfectly happy once we walked in.  Besides, you get plenty of the ocean at the main pool.  If you have young children, take advantage of the MANY activities for
Manager Response: We are delighted that you truly enjoyed your vacation with your family at Newport Coast Villas!  Thank you for your stellar review.  We can't wait to see you again!

Summary: Checked in a couple of days ago. Everyone is very friendly.  Room is spotless, typical Mariott time share= gorgeous propery, fully stocked villa, luxurious shower with 2 heads. Close to everything.  Great ocean views as it sits on cliff. Only downside is they are closing pool tomorrow for maintenance for the rest of week.

Despite being 70 and traveling with friends the same age we really enjoyed our stay at this family oriented resort. The two bedroom units were very large, updated and generally quiet. We own and have stayed at numerous timeshares over the years and found this resort very impressive. A fairly good location within easy drives to both Newport Beach and Laguna Beach. The grounds are exceptional and we enjoyed the ocean views from many areas of the resort. There are many play areas for families and children. When I looked on a map I realized the resort is only about 30 minutes from Disneyland and thought this would be a perfect place to stay with the grandkids. Attended a timeshare presentation which was very low key and didn't go over 90 minutes. No, we didn't buy a $30,000 week.

Wow!  Can't believe any negative is written about this place. We found none of it to be true. We were in the 1400 bldg which was newly renovated and a short walk to pool. Our room was so peaceful we never heard a peep. YES the resort is massive but we never found that to be annoying and would drive to main building if we didn't want to walk. The rooms are large!  2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, full kitchen, washer and dryer. Kids club is wonderful!!  Crafts, movies, treats, ping pong, shuffle board, large checker board......they had it all. The pools were a little chilly would have been nice to be heated a touch more. Sometimes hard to find pool chairs. The resort is gorgeous the grounds are immaculate and I hope to be back. Highly recommend.

We own several Marriott timeshare weeks and this is the only one we do not routinely trade.  The facilities are first rate and the location is wonderful - just across Pacific Coast Highway from a state park and beach with great walking paths and fantastic views.  Lots of shopping and restaurant options nearby.  The beautiful Pelican Hill golf course is next door.  Although the resort is large, the benefit is that they have a lot of nice children's activities that are well attended and organized. If you visit in the summer, the best ticket in town is Pageant of the Masters, just south in Laguna Beach.  This show is amazing - impossible to do it justice with mere words.

Great property. Lots to see and do. I loved the golf courses and location. Lots  of activities  for kids.  Close to Laguna Beach and San Diago.  Would go back again. Beautiful villas. Beautiful views.  Love Calfornia.

This is a scam. They tell you one thing and you receive another. You will have another payment over of  1K 2 months after closing. Reservations are difficult!! No one told us that. Wanda our sales person seemed so honest and forthcoming. Not so, she promised and told us things that were deceptive at best and lies at worst. So disappointed with a call from Manager Lisa as well. She basically said they would  take this information  to help her team make it more clear to the customer. So glad we could help with our money.

Summary Heading: Would be perfect if all villas had nice view
Summary: We have spent a week there several times, as we have a timeshare there. The property is beautiful, and so are the villas. Some of the "older" villas would benefit from upgrading kitchen electronics. The pools are great.  Unfortunately only about half of the villas have great view.  Also, last time I was there they still did not have any restaurants on the property, but that was supposed to change. I'll check on it this July.

One of the best things is that the price you pay when you book through Vacation Candy is the total price: ie no taxes, no resort fees, no parking fees.  They do take a small deposit on your credit card upon arrival which allows you to make charges at Starbucks or the Market (that has pizza, sandwiches, and a small selection of basics). We did not use it and it was refunded the same day we checked out. And did I mention how easy check out is? You just go! The final bill, if there is one, will be mailed to your email.  Amenities: unit came with tp, kleenex, paper towels, dish soap, all kitchen dishes and utensils.  Nice big tvs, wifi, dvd., w/d and dishwasher in unit.  You can get maid service but we didn't.  There are three pools, lots of grills, a playground, shuffleboard, pool

We visited this property for the first time over Easter weekend. We had a really great time and are looking forward to returning. We had a renovated room which was gorgeous and roomy for us and two kids. The kitchen was very well equipped and it was close to the main pool. We could hear a little noise from upstairs when they were walking around but it was not a problem. We enjoyed the pools and had a lovely picnic up at the top end events lawn. The view was stunning up there and the grounds beautifully maintained. We are at the pool at once which was great and it had a good atmosphere with live music. The staff should be commended for the Easter egg hunt and carnival which they put on for the kids, they had a great time. It's easy to get the shuttle to Crystal Cove and we

It is great resort style hotel as long as your room is close to main building. It has all the amenities, I do agree the staff are not very interactive except for one boy at activity desk. Location is central, they have frequent shuttles to key places in the area.

All rooms are two bedrooms and very spacious.  Decor is relaxing and kitchen is well equipped. The amenities are great with numerous pools and hot tubs.  There are also tennis courts, playgrounds, and themed activities daily.  What a great location too!

We took our small family here and really enjoyed the facilities.  For what this place costs and where it is located it is a tremendous value, especially if you value having a large 2br/2bth room.  Our room was right next to one of the three pools, the main pool deck was more fun and while the pool bar was expensive it was great to have a good time and has a beautiful view of the ocean.  It is very easy to walk to the state park.  We opted for the time share tour because they gave us $200.  It was pleasant, they aren't too pushy.  90 minutes for $200 we felt like was a good value.  If you have kids and are going to Orange County look no further!

Super room, what we've come to expect from Marriott.  All rooms are 2-bedroom suites with kitchen and laundry.  The POOLS were GREAT!!  Nice views, beautiful grounds, activities, crafts, close to the ocean.  Not a bad drive from SD or Temecula.  Newport beach quite close.  There is a shuttle to nearby shopping and sights.

This property is beautiful. Very spacious and has a ton of activities for families.  The pools were amazing with plenty of chairs. The food at the pool bar was great.  My only complaint is that they need more services. Our food wait was over 45 minutes, due to it being the only restaurant on the property. The Hotel shop did not have a very good selection of groceries and such. The bartenders, who were extremely friendly, were very overwhelmed with the amount of people. Waiting to get a drink could take over 10 minutes. Marriott, this is a huge miss on this property.  Get more services!

We stayed here over Thanksgiving week. The unit we had was nicely updated and spacious. We had a nice ocean view too. The kitchen, as in all Marriott timeshares, was well appointed and allowed us to cook a lot in the room. It was quiet in the unit, even though the outdoor hallway passes right by the entry door and the window to the second bedroom. The bed was comfy and we slept well while we were there. The overall location is central to a lot of what Southern California has to offer. We did Balboa Island, lots of the shopping spots, and a day trip to Catalina Island. Both island spots are recommended.

Summary Heading: Great facility, but there are "need to know" details
Summary: I was lucky to bid on a 7 day trip to Newport Beach with a stay at the Marriott Newport Coast Villas.  Not sure what we expected, but this was my experience.  The facility is huge!  I hear there are plans to expand!  We arrived at our Villa and were pleased to see a 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom, front room, dining area plus a full kitchen and a private porch.  We also discovered a washer & dryer.Pleasantly surprised.  We made a shopping list that could be avoided if traveler knows what to expect.  Coffee, sugar, milk, salt/pepper, basic daily things.  Had we known, we would have come prepared.  We also found out that there is no daily cleaning service like you might find in a hotel. Rather, if you want room to be cleaned you have to make those arrangements ahead of time (24 hours).

Summary Heading: Great spot for families, but oh, that traffic
Summary: Newport Coast Villas is a family oriented condominium resort (timeshare). All units are 2 bedroom, 2 bath, with central common area including small kitchen, eating area and sitting area. There is a stacked washer dryer as well, and a deck off the den area.  The property is not directly on the Pacific, so a car or shuttle is necessary to visit the beach (historic Crystal Cove is nearby). The terrain is steep which means higher units will have a view of the Pacific while the lower ones will not. Landscaping is excellent though not quite to the level of the posher resorts in the area. There is a market and a pool bar, but no real restaurant or other place to relax and have a drink. There is free internet, though you can pay a fee for a faster connection. We were fine with the free

This is the place to stay for family getaway!  Always something to keep the kids busy while soaking up the sun and beautiful views!  From morning walks on the beach in Newport, lunch and gelato in Laguna Beach, to Huntington Beach pier bike riding and sunsets there was always something to keep us interested on and off the resort! I cant say enough about this beautiful resort and staff!

Fantastic. We were here for 6 nights. Top notch.  There were activities, games, tetherball, basketball, volleyball, fire pits, swimming pools, and hot tubs.  There was stuff of plenty or quiet areas for nothing.  The grounds, and rooms were clean and well equipped.  There is local transportation to local beaches, grocery shopping, and shopping malls.  If we were to fly in here for a shorter stay I would not even rent a car. Although you would need a cab from Orange County airport. A 15-20 min drive.  The whole family had a great time.  Kids are 11 and 13 and stuff to keep them happily entertained.

We have been MVC owners for about 5 years. We usually take 2 trips a year, sometimes trading our St. Thomas weeks for points. We have stayed at numerous Marriott Vacation Club properties. This March, we stayed 5 nights at this property. First the positives...  It is a well maintained property and perfect location for day trips to LA or San Diego. Our room was clean and fairly updated, main pool area large, overlooking the Pacific Ocean. Our children, 9 and 11, enjoyed playing chess, ping pong and several activities at the kids club.  Negatives.... this property is TOO large and very spread out. Due to the immense size, customer service was lacking. The employees are spread too thin. First off, our room location was horrible! This was the worst view we have ever had on a MVC
Manager Response: Thank you for visiting Marriott's Newport Coast Villas. We are disappointed to hear your experience did not exceed your expectations due to service issues. This is not typical of the resort and we would like to personally respond to your concerns. Please email us at customer.care@vacationclub.com with your preferred method of contact and include your TripAdvisor Username.

Summary: I want to be clear that we are an older couple traveling without family. We like the space, quietness, and convenience of a villa. Having read the reviews and looked at the website prior to booking our stay (which we did a year in advance), we thought that all villas would have an ocean view. We were disappointed when a week before our trip, we got an email asking if we wanted a poolside or canyon view. When we arrived to check in we inquired about upgrading to an ocean view unit, but were told that they were very full and that only 25 percent of the units had ocean views. Having spent quite a bit of time walking through the grounds, we really question whether only 25 percent of the villas have ocean views as most of the units seemed to be facing the ocean. The Marriott does set

My college age son and I stayed last week at this property and loved it. The staff is friendly and helpful , the grounds are immaculate. We stayed in a lovely 2 bedroom unit and it was quiet and well designed. The location is fabulous with plenty to do and shop rifght nearby.I highly recommend this for a family vacation, girlfriend trip or romantic get away.

This is the most beautiful property and the grounds are perfectly maintained.  We stayed Ina lovely renovated room with beautiful ocean views.  Everything was new in the room and it was so nicely decorated.  I just love this place.  The staff is friendly and very helpful.  Crystal Cove State Park is very close and the Marriott provides free shuttle service,  Great stay!!!!

Summary Heading: Beautiful setting, quiet, close to attractions along the beach
Summary: We stayed in a villa for 10 days, and loved it. This is definitely a family-oriented place. The villas each have a fully-equipped kitchen, dining area and living room, and two bedrooms. A balcony overlooks a marvelous view. The staff are all very friendly. They have great programs for kids and adults as well. There is no restaurant on site, though they do have a poolside bar where you can buy drinks and meals. It doesn't matter though, because you can bring food in to cook in the kitchen, or visit nearby restaurants at Laguna Beach or Newport Beach.

We had 2 villas....I called ahead to request side by side. They were able fulfill my request which was awesome sine we had one 2br villa and my daughter has the other 2br villas with her husband and 4 kids. We were able to go back and forth easily. The villas were well equipped, clean and very comfy. The property is very well maintained and clean. It's a by big place and at first a bit intimidating....but quickly we realized it was easy to navigate and even safe enough for the kids to go to the play area on their own. The play area was a bonus...basketball courts, putting area, sand box area (toys provide) , small playground. Very kid friendly. The pools were awesome even warm enough in Feb. The marketplace was nice...but wish it was a big larger and offered more food

Great place to stay for a business trip - very quiet. Easy parking. Close to shopping and many business districts. Staff was friendly enough.  You have to ask for an ocean view - those that are closer to the ocean will not give you a good view. Request the view you want early.

The apartments are really nice and if you get one where the balcony has a sea view, it's great to watch the sun set. Sadly the pools are way too small when the place is full in July. There are not enough sun chairs and you stand neck by neck in the water. The location is great though. Don't miss having dinner at the Beachcomber down on the beach.

This property is centrally located. Between Newport Beach and Laguna, you are within minutes to shopping, the beach, dining and the arts. All the villas are two-bedroom, two-bath and designed to accommodate 6 people. Each is equipped with a kitchen and all the associated amenities. Most villas have a view - many have ocean view. The main pool area contains several pools - one for kids, one for families, one for adults and 2 hot tubs. It's a large property. There are vans and golf carts that can transport you around the property and to local destinations.  The staff is great and our requests were met almost instantly.   Several suites have been recently updated and more suites are in the process. Request an updated suite.  There is a bar at the main pool that serves lunch. It's

Marriott's Newport Coast Villas is a spectacular property with amenities for families, couples, singles. They have thought of everything for a comfortable , relaxing stay with activity placements dotted throughout the landscape. Prepare & eat IN or venture out to dine in the area (at one local spot we were discounted because They asked if we were staying at the Marriott property- i didn't recall any mention or notes about community di$count$ from the front desk). Pools, fire pits, grilling areas, basketball, tether,biking, walking, hiking,Tennis, golf, and picturesque and ocean views. Room was perfect for 2 couples, yet room enough for an 8+ person stay. Clean- nice space. Friendly, efficient personnel and service. Would easily choose this (Marriott) type property for a family

We've stayed here before as Marriott Vacation club owners in other resorts.  Our stay this time, the best we've had.  Relaxing poolside, updated villa, good food & drinks at the pool bar.    Staff was extremely pleasant & helpful. As loyal Marriott customers, we highly recommend this resort.   We'll be back next winter for a longer stay.

Stayed at Newport Coast Villas for a high school reunion. Two bedroom/2 bath suite at $280/day = $140/couple. Very nice accommodations - clean, "new" smell to room, kitchen well-equipped with refrig, microwave, dishwasher, coffee pot, utensils, etc., comfortable beds, very quiet, beautiful ocean view. Only negative was some confusion with administration... when other couple arrived ahead of us, they were refused registration because they were not listed on room records (although my wife had given their names 3 times). All worked out okay. Two large central pools plus other smaller ones on grounds. Several planned activities each day. We were offered $200 to attend timeshare presentation but declined - no pressure. (This is a timeshare facility. I presume one could get even a

Summary Heading: CLEAN, WELL-LOCATED FACILITY, GREAT VALUE FOR MARRIOTT VACATION OWNERS
Summary: Our friends have Marriott vacation points and invited us to accompany them here.   I think all units are two-bedroom two bath with a pull-out master couch and a small balcony. Very clean, very nice, with kitchen, and daily maid service. The location is great although not on the beach, so you shuttle there.  The only thing missing for us is a nice restaurant/bar.

Great location in Newport Beach just up the hill from Pacific Coast Highway and Crystal Cove Beach.  Convenient to Anaheim, Los Angeles and San Diego. Very nicely appointed villas all with views of the ocean.  Great amenities on site.  Friendly, knowledgeable staff.  Would certainly return.  Also convenient for cruises to Catalina Island and whale/dolphin watching cruises. Free wifi for members

We love staying here...a home away from home but better!  Friendly staff.  Incredible units.  Woke up this morning to the sounds of birds and a little fog over the golf course and ocean.  Just a delightful place to stay.  Tons to do on property (pools, sport courts, fire pits, cafe, bar, grills etc).  Plenty of places within a short drive for a fun afternoon or evening.  Ask for an ocean view unit!

This is a great place to stay.  It is located just east of PCH and Crystal Cove state park which has a nice beach.  On my Mac dining walks I enjoyed walking down to the beach and looking for small sea life in the tide pools.  You are just south of Newport Beach and just north of Laguna Beach, so if you like the beach like we do, you'll love it!  If you want to visit LA, it is about an hour drive.   The accommodations are all two bedroom units which can sleep 8.  The kitchen has all the items you would want if you cook.  We usually make breakfast and lunch in the room and go out for dinner.  One evening we cooked on the grill and ate outdoor on a table overlooking the ocean.  It was spectacular.  We got our produce at the Irvine farmers market that operates on Saturdays.  There

Summary Heading: Beautiful Location on the Newport Coast
Summary: We had fantastic stay at Marriott's Newport Coast Villas.  The condos are nicely decorated, large, clean and fully equipped kitchens.  The location is world renowned with spectacular and beautiful views of the Pacific Ocean.  The resort offers something for everyone in the family.  There are three outdoor pools, three whirlpool spas, tennis facilities, fitness center, activity center and a movie theater.   We would definitely return to the resort with our family.

Beautiful 2 bedroom condo . And 2 sofa beds w great mattresses.  We just picked up house phones and ask for a ride to a pool and a driver w golf cart shows within minutes. There is also a shuttle that drives around the grounds. There are a few different pools. All have gorgeous views of the ocean.  Staff that you encounter anywhere on the property are pleasant and more than accommodating.  The location is perfect! Can't wait to come back . I'm not an owner, purchased the room on Priceline. I am a Starwood owner and will exchange my points to come here. There are amazing amenities for kids . Check it out on web .

Summary Heading: Good for families, but watch out for pressure to buy if you are a guest
Summary: We stayed at the Newport Coast Villas 2 times. The first time was just for 1 night and it was great. So, based on that time, we decided to stay there a 2nd time for a longer period. So, on this last stay, we were given a room that was on the first floor, close to the road. I originally asked for a higher floor room. This room had no views except for the road. Since we were guests and not owners, the concierge staff kept on calling us to come to their preview presentation to buy, and that was irritating. Then, we kept getting calls to buy hotel rooms as guests for the future. Please just let your guests enjoys their vacation!!

This Marriott is always awesome to stay at.  This is my 3rd trip to this resort.  Excellent pool and spa area.  The view is incredible.  It is also close enoughto most of the Southern California theme parks etc.  the rooms are being rennovated and look wonderful.  They have gone from a Mediterranean theme to a California modern vibe.  Very nice.  Plenty of room and good quality cookware in the kitchen.  Another wonderful trip.

This was a great hotel for a quick trip to the beach!  Amazing views from the deck off the room. The room could use a little bit of updating, but it was clean and spacious as all Marriott locations typically are!  The pool area was gorgeous!  Plan to spend more money in this area, not for someone on a budget!

Spacious villas, we'll maintained and kept clean, friendly staff, soooo many activities to keep children happy.  We love driving down to the Corona del Mar beach, and walking up to ruby's shake shack for the view and DELICIOUS sweet potato fries. Will definitely be back.
Manager Response: Jen, thank you for your five star review of Newport Coast Villas.  We are happy that you've enjoyed your stay and look forward to your next visit!

Summary: This is an amazing place to stay. The villa was spotlessly clean, modern and spacious, with an incredible view of the Pacific. The resort is fantastic with a beautiful pool, children's centre and lots of activities for the kids. The staff were really friendly. The only aspect we weren't so keen on was the pressure  to attend the timeshare presentations. Also the resort does need a proper full service restaurant but it's all so beautiful that these were just small niggles. We can't wait to return next year.

I have stayed here many times since it opened.  It's first class and high quality.  The resort continues to improve each time.  Enjoy the property and relax by the fire pit while viewing the beautiful ocean sunset.
Manager Response: Thank you for your recent five-star review and for returning to Newport Coast Villas.  We hope to see you again soon for another special celebration!

Summary: We don't have a Marriott timeshare, but were able to book here through their website. My wife treated me for my birthday to a stay and play in the OC. Had a two bedroom as our son joined us. Room faced the ocean and overlooked some of the Pelican Hill golf course. Gorgeous view especially at sunset. Room was spacious and clean. Great service. Will definitely have to come back.

This was our second stay in about 10 months and our room and location was a bit nicer than our first stay. We were able to participate in a couple of the onsite activities this time but a longer stay would have been preferred. A 4:00 PM check in and a 10:00 AM check out makes a one night stay pass much too quickly.
Manager Response: Thank you for your return visit to Newport Coast Villas.  We are very happy to hear that while your stay was short, you had a great experience!

Summary Heading: Awesome resort, convenient to Southern CA attractions
Summary: Newport Coast Villas is a huge sprawling resort of many buildings set on a hillside overlooking the Pacific and Pacific Coast Highway. Higher floors in most buildings have fantastic views. Check in was fast and the staff is super friendly. There is a small convenience store in the lobby with snack etc.   Higher floors in most buildings have views of the ocean though its quite a long walk to get to the actual beach. We chose to drive and pay the $10 parking fee at Crystal Cove beach rather than take the resorts shuttle. Crystal Cove is terrific with hiking paths down to the beach. Its not really a beach for swimming as its very rocky but great place to hang out and relax or walk.   We were in a two bedroom unit top floor in the 4000 building which is centrally located in the
Manager Response: We are delighted that you had a great experience at Newport Coast Villas and thank you for your five-star review.  We agree, the resort is one of the best centrally located properties to access a variety of activities during your stay.  We look forward to your next stay in California!

Summary: Swapped my timeshare for a week here. Will definitely be looking to do that again. Great accommodations with a 2 bdrm, full kitchen, balcony with water view. The grounds are really pleasant and although large, there is a shuttle running if needed (such as when you are too lazy to walk uphill after a tiring day lounging by the pool). Staff is exceptionally friendly and helpful.  We ate out the first couple of nights here, but after that preferred dinner in as the setting is nice, relaxing, and no need to drive. They have good BBQ's available and the pool area is nice to hang out. Very close to Crystal Cove which is a great place to walk the beach. Close drive to Laguna and Newport beaches. They also have a shuttle running to several spots around town.
Manager Response: Stephen, we would like thank you for visiting Newport Coast Villas on your recent Interval International trade.  We look forward to seeing you upon your return visit to California!

Summary: I stay at many of the Marriot Villa properties and this one needs to be updated.  The property and pools are fantastic but the inside of the villa is worn. The couch was really bad and the patio furniture wasn't very nice. I was very disappointed. I will say the location is fabulous but won't go back till it is posted it was updated. Staff was very nice.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review of Marriott's Newport Coast Villas.  We are sorry to hear the decor in the villa was not up to standards on your recent visit.  The good news is we are currently in the process of renovating all the villas at the resort.  We look forward to hosting you in an updated villa on your next trip to Newport.

Summary: The property was recommended by friends who live in the area and it lived up to their recommendation.  When we checked in we were placed in a unit that did not have full ocean view we had requested.  It was a quick trip back to the registration desk and the matter was resolved with no incident.  We thoroughly enjoyed everything about the resort from the views, to the handy convenience store, to the beautiful pool areas.  The villa was very clean and well kept and the housekeeping was first rate.  We would highly recommend the resort and we will stay there again when we are in the area.  The only thing that could improve one's stay would be a little more parking near the villas and a full service restaurant and/or bar.
Manager Response: Thank you for your TripAdvisor review, David.  We are happy to hear you enjoyed your stay with us this January.  It is also good to hear the front desk was able to assist in getting you the view you wanted.  We hope to see you again soon at Marriott’s Newport Coast Villas.

Summary: This is our second time here. Nice property and well manicured. Location offers great views of ocean and coast.  Villas have a washer/dryer, kitchen and supplies, trader joe's is a 5 min drive away.  La Vista grill at the main pool has great chicken tenders and quesadilla. Firepits at night are a great touch.  Looking forward to coming back after our baby is born

I and my boyfriend stayed at this resort for 2 nights. We rented 2 bedroom apartment with balcony and hills view. The rooms were very clean and spacious although the anendities are outdated. The apartment had washer and dryer in the room, 2 full bathrooms, fully equpped kitchen. The bar by the pool closes at 8pm sharp so there is not much to do at the resort, but quick Uber ride ($8) brings you to many attractions and places to hang out. If I'm back to Newport Beach I would definitely stay there again despite the fact that this is true family oriented resort with kids running around like crazy.

Summary Heading: Not what I was hoping for
Summary: I bought a vacation package from Marriott so I could 'experience' the program.  I made my reservations 7 mos. out, knowing I wanted to come to SoCal for whale watching.  First the positives:  the housekeeping services were excellent and each one that did my room did an excellent job.  Patrick at the front desk was good and a newer employee, John, was quite helpful.  Now my experience.  First it's hard to see the Newport Coast sign in the dark as it's not lit and the road is NOT labeled as Tuscany, but rather Pelican Hill.   We checked in at about 5:30 p.m.  Paige was at the desk and said there were only 2 choices:  one in bldg 2200 on the 1st floor or one in bldg 2100 on 2nd floor.  She suggested the 2200 as it was newly renovated.  We said ok, went to the room and it smelled of

The Newport Coast Villas are an extensive property with activities that cover most any age.  My grandchildren enjoyed feeding the koi, playing at The Sandbox play room, and swimming.  We had a nice evening roasting s'mores at the barbeque pit while being serenaded by a guitarist/singer.  The property is well maintained, though heavily used. A picture fell off the wall and it took maintenance a while to get there to clean it up.  But, a clogged toilet was addressed within minutes of being reported.  The parking is not right in front of your villa, but not too far from it.  It is only a 40 minute drive to Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Great spot for a girls' weekend
Summary: We rented a villa for a girls' weekend and were extremely happy with our choice.  Some of our group was from Southern California and the others (including myself) were flying in from Seattle.  We arrived before our scheduled check-in time but were able to find us a room that was available. We were in the 3700 building and had a partial ocean view.  It was clean, updated and more spacious than we expected.  The next building over from us was the main registration building and pool.  The pool bar had a great happy hour and live music.  There are tons of amenities here was well.  We played tennis but there was also sand volleyball, basketball courts, two fitness centers and daily classes and other activities.  It was too cold/wet for us in the evenings but there were also several

Great place to stay with the family!  Great location and fun place to be.  Many amenities and things to do for everyone.  Free parking, ocean views and all the rooms are 2 bedrooms!  The pools are nice with an outdoor bar

Summary Heading: 2 bedroom 2 bath with full kitchen villas and high end amenities
Summary: If you want a very relaxing, luxury villa experience, then book this! We stayed in an updated villa in building 1200. No ocean view, but so peaceful.  Full, beautiful kitchen with a full sized fridge. Very close to the kids pool, and BBQ (we used both daily). The BBQ was absolutely spotless. The grounds are meticulously maintained and luxe. I would definitely love to come back. Next time we hope to get an ocean view villa.

loved our stay . we had amazing views. our villa was very spacious and clean. serviced everyday with all you need in the kitchen. pools and hot tub were super! theres plenty fun activities for kids . lots to do nearby

Has it all!  Great rooms, fantastic views, incredible service, multiple sections/pools, shuttle service through out hillside complex, world class gold course below (Pelican Hill), quick access via shuttle to Colony Cove Park & restaurant, instant problem solving.  One of the most dependable, delightful, villa-style complexes anywhere.  Stayed numerous times as guest but always worth price when available.  Clubhouse complex has everything for kids and atmosphere is great for families.  Limited food (small snack shop) and parking (1 car; others in parking structure near admin) but shuttle service available. Great Marriott Success!

Loved this place, we had a tremendous view. Enjoyed the pool and hot tub! Very nicely landscaped. Beds were fabulous, even the pullout sofa was super comfortable! Will be back!  Rooms were very spacious staff, especially housekeeping were excellent.

I have been a Marriott time share owner for over thirty years. I have been many Marriott resorts around the world, but you keep coming back to the places you love. The Newport Beach resort is beautiful and well-maintained. The villas are large and luxurious. Well located overlooking the Pacific Ocean and Pelican Hill golf course and midway between Laguna Beach and Newport Beach. This has become my go-to getaway!

Spent a pleasant two days at the resort in early December with my mom. Wish we could have stayed a few more to enjoy the resort. Didn't encounter any problems as mentioned in other reviews. A few weeks prior to our stay, a vacation planner reach out to me to arrange our accommodations. I asked for a top floor unit, view of the ocean and a building with an elevator. All requests were honored.   We had a renovated room, it was modern but comfortable. It was nice having two separate bedrooms and bathrooms for added privacy. The front room had a double bed with a pull out couch. The back bedroom was a king, view of the ocean and very large bathroom.    The resort offered ample activities throughout the day, multiple pools, shuttle to take you around the resort and to the beach.

Marriott's Newport Coast Villas are sensational. How do you beat the weather(70 and sunny during our visit), or the location( high above the beautiful Pacific). The two bedroom villas offer a kitchen, dining and living areas. TV in three rooms and a good WiFi connection. Our villa was very clean with modern appliances. The views on the the property and access to the nice swimming areas was first class.
Manager Response: Thank you for the five-star feedback on your visit to Marriott's Newport Coast Villas. It is terrific to know you enjoyed your overall experience . We look forward to hosting you on future visits to Newport!

Summary: We have now stayed here the week after New Years 4 years in a row and have never been disappointed. Even though the weather this year was a bit rainy the prior years have been fantastic and seems to be a great week to travel. We live about an hour away in Los Angeles but it feels like we are in a great getaway destination. The property is always well kept and the rooms very clean. The staff is outstanding and one person named Jose Lopez went above and beyond as he was out in the pouring rain emptying the trash just getting soaked but he was keeping the resort looking great! I recommend the 4001 or 4000 buildings for great ocean views. Many food options a short drive away and great beach walking distance or free shuttle ride to it. Thank you again see you next time.
Manager Response: Thank you for your five-star TripAdvisor review. We are so happy that we continue to provide your family a great local getaway at Marriott's Newport Coast Villas. I'm pleased to hear that Jose's hard word stood out to you during this stay. We look forward to welcoming you back soon to Newport!

Summary: As many reviewers have indicated the service at this hotel is non existent. Our lovely weekend stay turned into a nightmare after interacting with multiple staff members including the night manager Daniel Miller. Different staff members gave us wrong information about the ability to extend our stay. Regardless of the beauty of Newport Coast and the location of this property it only takes one bad experience such as this to make us never want to return. We should have gone to Pelican Hill resort as we originally planned. I'd rather pay a higher rate and not deal with poor management and service.
Manager Response: Thank you for your TripAdvisor review. We are sorry to hear you did not enjoy your recent visit to Marriott’s Newport Coast Villas. Your feedback on the staff  is appreciated and will be shared with the resort management team. We hope your next stay at a Marriott Resort exceeds your expectations and thank you again for your review.

Summary Heading: Great but walls a little thin
Summary: Requested a villa with an ocean view on a high floor and our room (Rm 4431) had a gorgeous ocean view. However, like the previous time we were here, as Marriott Vacation Club owners and having been to a lot of other Marriott Vacation Club resorts, we found these villas were in need of a little maintenance and looking quite tired. A few of the floor tiles in the kitchen were cracked and needed replacement. Resort grounds were lovely and we really enjoyed our room with the great ocean view. However, the hot tubs were too far to get to and so were the swimming pools. Walls are thin. We were in the main bedroom and could hear someone snoring and talking in the next unit.

We stay here every year as a convenient spot to visit our West Coast relatives.  The property is in a good location to get to beaches, shopping and points all along the coastline.  The staff is cordial and helpful in the usual Marriott way. The villas are standard for Marriott Vacation Club properties and are well maintained.  There's plenty for families with children to do on the resort property.

Summary Heading: Wonderful property - with a few things to note
Summary: We stayed here over the holidays and I was surprised at the size of the property (HUGE), location (wonderful and so accessible) and amenities.   A few downsides -- 1) inconsistent heating throughout the unit, about 10 degrees difference between the two bedrooms, 2) thin walls and floors - could hear our neighbors watching TV from a floor above, walking/running around on the floors above-- I was not impressed with that aspect, 3) parking can be hard to find if you get back to the property at a later hour, 4) there is a lot of driving throughout the property so if you go with friends, make sure your units are nearby each other or in the same building.   The furnishings were wonderful, beds were incredibly comfortable (new mattresses), bathrooms were wonderful, everything was

Lovely two bedroom villas, on a bluff overlooking the Pacific!   Many amenities and activities for entire family. day activities, music, festivities, indoor, outdoor fun!  Three pools,  fitness, beautiful Crystal Cove with  beach shuttle service from resort. Beautiful area, many restaurants, shopping nearby as well.    Great family vacation spot!

This was my first stay at the Marriott NC Villas.  I initially chose this place because I was looking for a 2-bedroom hotel room or condo.  The facility is immaculately kept and very clean. The staff was very friendly. My kids loved the family-friendly game deck and pool. And the unit itself blew me away. It was a very large two bedroom villa with an ocean view. The ocean view included a view of Catalina Island off in the distance. And I loved the fact that the unit included a kitchen. The kitchen came stocked with dishes, cups, silverware, pots, pans, etc. The on-site store carried some basic groceries so I was able to buy ingredients to make breakfast one morning.  I highly recommend this beautiful, family-friendly vacation spot!

This is a timeshare location and has some great views of the ocean and Catalina Island.  It also has some fabulous amenities to enjoy.  The villas are spacious and is within easy reach to major attractions both north and south.  Really enjoyed our stay.

Summary Heading: Bought in 1998 - still heart this resort.
Summary: I happen to be a founder here and purchased a week here in 1998 but instead of utilizing my week from the season of January to mid May, I traded my one bedroom which I split from my Marriott  Desert Springs Villas II into Christmas week here for a two bedroom two bathroom villa. We checked in on a Sunday for seven nights and the resort was completely sold out.   Our villa had an oceanfront view from the first floor and was located in the 4400 building.The week was active entertaining family and friends since we live less than 50 minutes nearby by car and the extra bedroom came in handy for guest over several nights. The fully functionally kitchen came in handy for cooking prime rib meals and even has a blender for making gravy and baking sheets for baking cookies. Marriott had

Love these accommodations!  Each Villa we have stayed in has been a complete pleasure!  We always get the two bedroom Villa and most often have family with us.There is plenty of room!  The resort activities are a hit with the kids.  Location is perfect for us to go to Theme parks, San Diego, Beaches, & surrounded with GREAT restaurants!!

Rooms are great. Spacious and clean. It's just like another home away from home. But staff was not friendly and helpful enough. Location is also good, you need to walk ten or more minutes to the nearest beach though, it is no problem if you have a car.

They rooms are spacious and friendly-warm.  The pools and main area are beautiful and the staff are very friendly.  Just what you expect from Marriott.  Unlike the Grande Vista in Orlando, they do not have a real restaurant on the Newport property so you have to go into Newport for a real waiter and restaurant.  Not a big deal to drive for 10 min into town but sometime I just want to stay home for a leisurely meal.

Summary Heading: Nice as long as you don't spend a lot of time in your room
Summary: This property is really lovely - good location (near the beach and shopping) and a lot to do there. The rooms are disappointing, though - nothing to write home about. But, as long as you spend your time out and about, you can't go wrong with this place.

Summary Heading: Visit was weird, not a good value buyer beware no beach front?
Summary: Nice location but layout horrible , drving to your room, drive back to lobby. Dont get me wrong I love the area.  The folks here are so rude and crass. They need to attend seminar on service in hospitaility. They price of these time share is insane and not worth it   trust me with the fees you could rent a suite every year at 5 star hotel.   But they have supply of time share which is very rare in O.C.  But why bother wast of money no real ammenitie sand no beach . So what are you buying.

beautiful hotel, wonderful stay.  We came from a road trip and spent a couple of days at Marriott.  Everything was perfect and we had a great and relaxing time.  We stayed in a suite on top of the little hill.

If you want to be treated like a customer or even a human being by front desk staff DON'T stay here. Good luck getting an ocean view. Although I've never stayed at a motel, this must be what the service feels like? Requested top floor b/c I'm sensitive to noise. Got 2nd floor with view of the noisy highway. 6am wake up call by the loud child on the floor above jumping and running. Oh and 10am check out haha! I usually love Marriott but don't stay at this one.
Manager Response: Thank you for visiting Marriott's Newport Coast VIllas. We are disappointed to hear your experience did not exceed your expectations. We would like to personally respond to your concerns. Please email us at customer.care@vacationclub.com with your preferred method of contact and include your TripAdvisor Username. As an alternative, you may reach us directly by calling 800-860-9384. We look forward to hearing from you soon.

Summary: This is an upscale place to stay with beautiful manicured grounds and lots of attention to detail.  Our room was in building 4400 and had a fantastic view and a comfortable balcony.  Our villa had 2 bedrooms and a full kitchen, dining/living room.  The sound-proofing could be a lot better in these units.  The couple we were with could hear the guy snoring in the next villa and my wife and I could hear muffled conversation from the villa next to us.  The beach is a 15 minute walk, a 5 minute drive, or Marriott has a shuttle that goes to the beach hourly as well as other places less frequently.  The parking lot here looks like a Mercedes Benz, Lexus, Porsche & Audi dealership.  This is a large, multi-building hotel built on a steep hillside so it was a long walk to the pool,

Summary Heading: Beautiful ocean views, great pools, and gorgeous Villas
Summary: Great location for sight seeing at all Beaches (Laguna, Newport Beach) and shopping at Fashion Island.  We drove into Los Angeles and San Diego which was close by and went to Universal Studios and Sea World!  Overall an excellent location!

Summary Heading: "We continue to come back to this stunner!"
Summary: This facility is the most perfect vacation venue in Orange County. With easy access to SNA airport plus close to all of the best that southern CA has to offer it's the perfect place to both stay or make your day trips from. We have now made it our 2nd home when choosing our westward ho'  destination.
Manager Response: We are happy to be your resort of choice in Orange County!  Thank you for your review and we look forward to your next stay.

Summary: We exchanged into this development in December.  When I booked in I made sure I filled in the pre-arrival information and as a result I was given a end unit in block 4800 ( newest units at the top of the hill) with a great view of the ocean.  December weather is average, but it was nice while we were there.  The top level units have their own pool area which was empty when we went there.  I am sure it is busy during the summer months.  They also have a separate work out area in the top area.  When you are up there you will find you will rarely go to the main pool area.  We did not spend time in the main pool so I cannot comment on the restaurant or anything like that.  I have stayed at many Marriot timeshares and this one it pretty typical.
Manager Response: We are pleased you enjoyed your time at Marriott's Newport Coast Villas!  Thank you for your review and we look forward to your return.

Summary: This property was beautiful!  There seemed to be a lot of activities around the pool area....ping pong, foosball, human-sized chess/checker set, a movie theater, beach chair rentals, etc. unfortunately, my husband and I were only there 2 days in the winter.  We didn't get to enjoy the pool, but we did take advantage of the free shuttle to Crystal Cove National Park and the Beachcomber Restaurant.  The bus driver even hands out towels for the beach!  The Park is right down the street on PCH and has great opportunities to take walks, hike, while having spectacular views of the ocean.  As other reviewers have said already, the "apartments" (which they call "rooms") are spacious with 2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, full kitchen filled with appliances and dish/cookware, and a washer/dryer.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review of Marriott's Newport Coast Villas!  We are happy you enjoyed your visit to the resort and hope you will return on your next visit to California.

Summary: We just spent one week in a two bedroom villa. Very nice villa - everything you need. Three great Flat Screen TV's but TV controllers are slow and confusing - irritating. We requested a villa near the pool and we got it - villa 2312 ----- BUT you must climb a hill with 50 steps or 30 steps. Just be aware. Most buildings are 3 stories - we hoped for ocean view but, be aware, ocean views are only from THIRD story levels. Most 1st and 2nd floor rooms have a nice view of trees and roads.If this is important, try for third level rooms. Three pools are great as is Jacuzzi. You should definitely have a car at this resort. It is definitely a 4 star plus property if you are ok with this info
Manager Response: Thank you for your review of Marriott's Newport Coast Villas.  We are pleased you had a nice stay with your family and hope you will return soon.

Summary: I stayed in Room 4430 which had a fantastic ocean view.  I was on the third floor.  Rooms are very comfortable but do show a little wear and tear.  This does not detract from the million dollar ocean view though.  Balcony has a table and chairs for you to sit an enjoy a glass of wine or a meal.  Full kitchen with pots, pans, dishes and silverware.  There was even a little salt and pepper shaker for you to use.  Property is beautifully landscaped with fountains and statues.  Staff was very friendly and check in was a breeze.  We were even able to get a late check out.  I would recommend this place in a heartbeat.
Manager Response: We are pleased you enjoyed your stay, Kim.  Thank you for your review and we hope to see you again at Marriott's Newport Coast Villas.

Summary: This is not at par with most Mariott resort everything you ask they say this is a time share resort we can't do that this is a horrible resort with worst customer service. The rooms are nice but they have very limited activities and everything always has a line. The manager at front desk can't help you with anything. Won't be coming back
Manager Response: Thank you for visiting Marriott's Newport Coast Villas.  We are disappointed to hear your experience did not exceed your expectations due to service issues. This is not typical of the resort and we would like to personally respond to your concerns. Please email us at customer.care@vacationclub.com with your preferred method of contact and include your TripAdvisor Username. As an alternative, you may reach us directly by calling 800-860-9384. We look forward to hearing from you soon.

Summary Heading: One of the best hotels in MVC...
Summary: Nice place with Italian architecture and amazing views. It not a resort on the beach but dont be afraid, it has enough things to be done like an amazing pool and intesting turistic attractions in the neighborhood. You must have a car to this hotel cause you dont reach so easily the interesting things, turistic attractions in LA.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review! We are happy you enjoyed the resort's design and amenities. We look forward to your next visit!

Summary: We stayed here recently for four nights.  We had a villa that overlooked the canyon on the second floor of bldg 6.  The property is gorgeous and it is tip top shape. The complex is huge - not the most intimate of hotels.  The lobby was far from our room as was the pool area.  Not a big deal.  Our room was really nice: two rooms, two bathrooms, a kitchen, dining and living areas complete with balcony where we had breakfast each morning.  The rooms are quite nice.   Only issue we really had was a wedding going on and we, apparently, were in the middle of all their guests rooms; lots of late night running down the halls and banging doors.  Again, not a huge issue, we wish them well, but still... Crystal Cove Beach was a shuttle ride away and oh so nice.  We got 10% off with our
Manager Response: Thank you for your review! We are pleased that you enjoyed the beautiful property and your spacious villa. We look forward to your next visit!

Summary: Spent a beautiful weekend at the the Newport Coast Villas. The property is gorgeous.  When you first walk in the lobby balcony overlooks the pool with a gorgeous ocean view. You know you are on vacation.  The views are amazing, the property beautiful and you are close to many restauants and Laguna beach which is fun to walk around and spend the day.
Manager Response: Thank you for your positive review! We are delighted you loved the resort location and design. We hope to see you back again soon!

Summary: We thoroughly enjoyed our much too short stay at the Newport Coast Villas.  Arriving after a long drive, we walked into our villa and were blown away!  It was beautiful and so spacious.  We had a villa with 2 bedrooms and 2 bathrooms, a full kitchen, dining area and great living room. Since it was dark when we arrived, we didn't get the best of the villa until morning--an ocean view from our balcony!  There was so much room in the villa to cook and relax.  We didn't use the pools, but the areas looked very inviting.  The pool bar/restaurant has good ocean views, and some darned good food!  Pizza delivery on property took about 20 minutes from ordering to room delivery.  I wish we had more time to enjoy this beautiful property!
Manager Response: Thank you for your five-star review of Marriott's Newport Coast Villas!  It is fantastic to read expectations were exceeded during your recent getaway to Newport Beach as a result of the spacious yet well-appointed villa and the overall food quality.  We look forward to the opportunity to host you both again!

Summary: I had the opportunity to spend a couple days here when my in-laws were in town and using their time share to stay here. This place is like a resort with many amenities and daily activities for kids and families. It situated just minutes from John Wayne airport and located on the hills over looking Newport Coast.  First let's start with the facilities. We stayed in a two bedroom villa that was very nice and spacious. There was a good size, full service kitchen, large living room with a 55 inch flatscreen tv, two large bedrooms both with on suite bathrooms and a couch that converts to a bed for additional guests, and a nice balcony area. There were large 50 inch tv's in each room as well. My only gripe is that the channel selection was somewhat limited, but then again I think the
Manager Response: Hi Oscar!  Thank you for the five-star feedback on your recent getaway to Marriott's Newport Coast Villas.  It is thrilling to learn you found the resort perfect for a stay with family because of the spacious yet well-appointed villa, amenities like the pools and the daily activities offered among other highlights.  We look forward to hosting everyone on future Newport Beach stays!

Summary: We enjoyed our stay at the Newport Coast Villas.  We stayed for 7 nights and enjoyed the pools, hot tubs, landscaping, and friendly service. Great experience for five reasons: 1. Clean and well maintained property 2. Excellent service 3. Easy Parking 4. Large rooms/villas 5. Lovely pools and hot tubs  After we checked out, I realized I had left valuables (including cash) in the safe which were mailed quickly to me fully intact.  The lost and found folks were helpful once I was able to get through to them.  When calling the phone number to the resort, the front end staff screen the calls and I found that frustrating because of the time spent answering a series of initial questions.  We also left a jacket in the room which lost and found confirmed they had and said they were
Manager Response: Thank you for the five-star TripAdvisor feedback on Marriott's Newport Coast Villas!  It is wonderful to realize you had a great experience because of the well-kept facilities, the top-notch service from associates, convenient parking, spacious villa and the amenities such as the pools.  We hope to have the privilege of hosting your family on future getaways to Newport Beach!

Summary Heading: Great hotel for a family vacation
Summary: We stayed for 6 nights in October with our 2 children aged 2 and 5. We stayed in a newly refurbished villa which was a great size and in great condition, we did not have an ocean view but you must accept in advance this is normal for non MVC owners. This was the first time we stayed in Newport Beach as we normally stay in Santa Monica but I have to say it was a great location.  The villas are well equipped for a stay with young children, and have all essentials in the kitchen. We tended to cook for our children in the villa to that was good.  The pools are great, we tended to use the one by blg 1100 as it was much quieter and had a pool for young children. Our kids also loved the children's activity centre.   We found the grounds to be very clean.  The only negative I would have
Manager Response: Hi Karen!  Thank you for the five-star review of Marriott's Newport Coast Villas.  It is terrific to read you found the resort ideal for a family vacation as evidenced by the modern yet well-appointed villa and amenities like the pools among other highlights.  We hope to have the pleasure of hosting everyone on future getaways to Newport Beach, CA!

Summary: This was the third time to stay at this property.  It is always an enjoyable visit.  Was the first time to utilize the free shuttle down to the beach.  My villa in the 4300 building was starting to show some wear but realize all units can't be magically updated at once.  The grounds of the property are impeccable.  Always see people working outside.
Manager Response: Thank you for the five-star TripAdvisor comments on Marriott's Newport Coast Villas!  It is thrilling to discover your visits consistently delight because of the well-manicured grounds.  We look forward to continuing to host you for many more years to come!

Summary Heading: Feelin' a Lot Like Europe in California
Summary: We have stayed at several Marriott Resort properties, but the Newport Coastal Villas with its rolling landscapes, lush plantings and hillside location looking over the Pacific, you will certainly feel like you are in an Italian hill town in Tuscany.  The villa we stayed in was a 2 bedroom with ocean view and we could not have been more pleased ...this unit was also one that had been recently redecorated. The sunsets viewed from the main clubhouse area are fantastic.  Staff could not have been more accommodating and professional.  While not owners at this property, we would  be very likely to re-book and revisit it again.
Manager Response: Thank you for the five-star TripAdvisor feedback on Marriott's Newport Coast Villas!  It is fabulous to read you found your stay on-par  with the Marriott Vacation Club experience mentioning the overall villa and above & beyond service from associates as standout aspects of your vacation.  We hope to have the pleasure of welcoming your family back again!

Summary: Well I can understand about maintenance fees but not everything shutting down on the grounds at 6-7pm. (Ooh. You can get pizza a little later than that.) There are wonderful restaurants nearby which now requires a rental car, taxi or uber; uber definitely being the better choice. Expect a lot of driving.  The grounds are beautiful but there is minimum to do: a few pool tables, a few grills, a few pools. The activity director does her best to bring activities to adults. Tonight I attended a painting class which was fun and they had a pasta making class right after that I chose not to go to. Sea glass necklaces tomorrow morning and one poker slot, one black jack slot, one bingo slot, all at a cost if you like that kind of stuff. Zumba, yoga, water aerobics and things for kids to
Manager Response: Thank you for your review!  We are glad to find your visit met expectations because of the well-manicured grounds and daily activities.  We look forward to hosting everyone again at Marriott's Newport Coast Villas!

Summary: We stayed in a 2 bedroom villa that was recently refinished. Very nice grounds and staff. There are 3 pools on the property, and plenty of chairs. No ocean views were available.  We would stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you for the feedback on your visit!  It is terrific to learn you had a blast during your recent stay at Marriott's Newport Coast Villas as a result of the amenities like the pools, modern villa, well-manicured grounds and accommodating service from associates.  Our team looks forward to hosting you both on future getaways to Newport Beach!

Summary: This place is gorgeous! The lobby is beautiful, staff is friendly and the view of the ocean just from the lobby is fantastic. The resort is huge. We were in unit 4740 and it was a corner unit. We actually had a great canyon and ocean view. It was so quiet--we felt like we had our own wing. We traveled with another couple, so this villa was quite comfortable for all of us. I wish there was a fireplace, because it did get quite chilly at night. Our balcony was big and had enough seating for everyone. It was nice to have coffee out there in the morning. There was plenty of parking and lots of things to do on property. We were out and about most of the time, so we didn't take advantage of everything. We needed more than a week. The location is near everything you want to
Manager Response: Thank you for the five-star review of Marriott's Newport Coast Villas!  it is fantastic to discover you both found your vacation top-notch mentioning the accommodating service from associates and comfortable villa as standout aspects of your getaway among other highlights.  We thank you for sharing the photographs and look forward to your next visit!

Summary: Very large two bedroom two bath condo that sleeps 4 perfectly and 8 reasonably. The grounds are immaculately groomed. The resort amenities are great for couples or families. If you're friends/couples going and want some distance from the families book 3900 building top floor. The sunsets are amazing coming down over the ocean.   So many things to do from the resort: golf, shop, hike, bike, tennis, beach and sail.
Manager Response: Hi Annie!  Thank you for the five-star review.  We are happy to find expectations were exceeded throughout your stay because of the well-appointed villa and well-manicured grounds among other highlights.  We thank you for sharing the photos and look forward to you and your families next stay at Marriott's Newport Coast Villas!

Summary Heading: Secluded, First Class, Minutes from a walk to scenic beach in the state park.
Summary: Great resort. First class villas and grounds. Multiple levels to the facility, different pools and things to do (putting green, basketball court, pools, etc.) all around the resort.  Just down the road from Crystal Cove state park. Amazing views and a walk along the beach.  Restaurant at the top of the bluff is a great place to grab a snack or morning coffee.
Manager Response: Hi Robert!  Thank you for the five-star TripAdvisor feedback.  It is exciting to discover your recent business stay exceeded expectations as a result of the top-notch villa and grounds.  We look forward to your next stay at Marriott's Newport Coast Villas!

Summary: This place is definitely home away from you.  The rooms are very clean and the bed is comfy.  If you love you cook, this place is well equipped in the full kitchen.  I was very impressed with the very spacious usable space.  It has a balcony right outside so if you want to enjoy a quiet hot breakfast in the morning, you can definitely have it here. Love this place!
Manager Response: Hi Soko!  Thank you for the review.  It is terrific to know your stay at Marriott's Newport Coast Villas exceeded expectations because of the overall villa, finding it well-appointed, spacious and comfortable.  We look forward to welcoming you back to your home away from home soon!

Summary: We have stayed here a few times and have always loved it. This time we got a refurbished villa with a gorgeous ocean view, could not get any better! They really did a great job with the remodel.  The front desk staff were great, Valerie was very helpful. We always loved this area with so many wonderful things to do. You have to explore Crystal Cove, walk around Balboa Island, take the Catalina Flyer and visit Catalina Island.  There are so many other things to do in this area you need more than a week. We are ready to book our next vacation here.
Manager Response: Hi Jutta!  Thank you for the five-star TripAdvisor feedback.
