Best golf course in Orange County across the street (Pelican Hill $$$$). Pricey area but short drives to Fashion island gives you plenty of choice for food, shopping, entertainment. Villas are spacious, well maintained, well stocked with COMFY BEDS, 6 chair tables, open patio/balcony and great views of the vast Pacific.  Staff is terrific and check in a snap.  Only

Summary Heading: Outstanding place to soend a week
Summary: Rooms (Villas) are large and well fitted. We were on the 4th floor and had great views. Had we been directly facing the ocean they would have been better but this was our first time there & we will know what to ask for in the future. All villas are 2 bedroom units. The master has a king bed & its own large private bath while the 2nd has 2 queen beds (for the most part) and a bath that is also open to the rest of the villa. As with all Marriott Vacation Club facilities, it has a large very nice kitchen area and 3 TV's. We sat on the balcony every morning & had breakfast & read the news paper. There are a lot of very nice restaurants within about a 10 min drive. Add another 10 min and you get to even more in Laguna beach. We tried 4 during our 7 nights there. Highly recommend and

We went for a week with our friends.  It was a beautiful place to stay with a great view of the ocean.  There were four of us and we had plenty of room and certainly did not feel cramped.  The weather was not too nice; but that is what you get in the winter.  We certainly enjoyed the list of restaurants to try.  Some of them should be updated; but most were good.

I've stayed at this property several times and love it. I love everything about it EXCEPT this time my sister's car got broken into on the property. Actually serval cars were "hit" that same night. They were very good about how they handled it, but it was still a big deductible to pay. They credited us 20, 000 rewards points, but that doesn't pay for a window. I just spoke with my sister and she said she hasn't spoken to either the police or property. Beyond the points, Marriott only issued an apology.

This villa was a great place for our girlfriends weekend. There were six of us and our villa was roomy. Didn't feel cramped at all. The grounds were lovely and well maintained. The pool was area could have been bigger but was a good place to hangout for few hours. Newport has great places to check out and eat so we were out mostly for the 3 days we stayed here. I would stay here with family next time.

we have been here several times and always have a great stay.  This time we shared the unit with my wife's sister & her husband and there was plenty of room for everyone. The front desk was very accommodating even though we had made some mistakes in making our reservation and wound up with exactly what we wanted.

We're a busy adult family and it is difficult to get together on any regular basis to catch up. MVC has been wonderful in that regard. We've been coming here for the past six years and it has become a tradition. The two bedroom unit is home for the days we are here, usually about a week. Both on site and nearby, everyone finds enough to do. An especial favorite activity is walking to Crystal Cove State Park.  When I got here Sunday, checked in, changed and went down to Crystal Cove in time to see the glorious sunset, then enjoyed dinner at the cafe on the beach and walked back invigorated. The following morning bright and early I was back there again with the girls. During the week it was possible to achieve a goal of 15 plus miles mostly walking along the beach, waves lapping

Summary Heading: Hotel and Area, 5 Stars.  Service almost 2 Stars.
Summary: This review is simple.   This is a timeshare so the rooms are nice, the location is nice, the views are nice, and checkout is 10am!    So make sure you realize that this isn't a regular hotel and there are no noon or 1pm checkouts.   I live in Orange County so I don't get all goo goo gah gah over the scenery.   It is what it is, Southern California and all it has to offer.   However, the difference between a great hotel and an average hotel are the amenities and the people/service at the hotel.   Any hotel can look pretty on the inside but suffer with the daily things people expect that aren't delivered.   I check in and only staying here one night before heading to Los Angeles.  Arrive at hotel and get into room (signs to room can be confusing and finding the room can be also).

I have been to this hotel twice, solo.  The reservations department were exceptional in meeting my requests for a stay including my husband and two additional rooms for family members.  We were attending my daughter's college graduation.  I requested the smaller tower for convenience.  Our rooms were very close together and all had great views of the ocean.  The decorations were beautiful for Christmas and very festive.  Friendly staff, exceptionally clean and quiet.  LOVE this place!

We arrived after dark and therefore didn't get a good view out of our window until the next morning.  Other than the Palm trees obscuring some of the view, we had an excellent view of the Pacific Ocean.    Didn't use many of the facilities, since we were only in California for 5 days. The room was excellent, as all Marriott facilities are!  The concierge was very helpful in finding additional activities besides what  we had already planned

Late night check in.  No restaurant service except pool service, but if it's raining... Well forget about it.  Noise from main road.  Had to sleep with the TV on to tune out the racing cars.  Woke up this morning with a delivery truck outside terrace.  Driver didn't turn off his truck for over an hour.  Noise from foot traffic above rooms.  Next day carpet cleaners cleaning rooms across the way.  Vibration noise all afternoon.  Asked to be moved and "Not sure what we can do, but we will try our best".  No fault to the front desk, but seeing other complaints for the same room I'm in should speak loud and clear to staff. (Room 3440)  This is a hard sell to convince me to buy time at this location.  No full service restaurant and really nothing to do on hotel grounds!  Rather spend
Manager Response: Thank you for your TripAdvisor review, Joseph.  We are disappointed to hear your experience did not exceed your expectations due to the noise from the road and delivery trucks.  It is understandable that this would put a damper on your visit with us and we will like to address your concerns personally.  Please email us at customer.care@vacationclub.com with your preferred method of contact and include your TripAdvisor Username. As an alternative, you may reach us directly by calling 800-860-9384.  We look forward to hearing from you soon.

Summary: The family and I decided to get away a few days after Thanksgiving.  Since we are MVC owners we decided to give this location a try.  The room setup was the standard MVC setup.  The staff and the grounds were nice.  My kids enjoyed the area with the basketball court, golf putting greens, etc. Compared to other MVC locations, I thought the pool area was a little small.  The view from our room was wonderful.  Although the location is not the beach, if you're up for a 10 to 15 minute walk, you can get there easily.  We didn't use any of the shuttle services.  The wifi service was very interesting.  All though it was free, it seemed like we had to keep logging into the system with almost every use.  The Marketplace store was nice but expensive.  They sell Pizza Hut pizza at the
Manager Response: Thank you for the TripAdvisor review of Marriott's Newport Coats Villas!  It is fabulous to read you had a blast during your short family getaway, as you singled out our associates, the grounds and facilities such as the basketball court and putting green as highlights.  We thank you for your loyalty to Marriott Vacation Club and hope to have the pleasure of hosting you the next time you are in need of some 'fun in the sun'!

Summary: My wife and I have stayed at a lot of hotels over the years and seldom do I rate them as a 5. The ambience of this property is truly amazing. The villas are large and in this case nearly as large as our home. It had two brs, two baths ( one with a soaking tub and double shower), kitchen, living room, dining area and enclosed patio. Great place to stay and well locate. Also,free Wifi.

We were stunned by the beauty of the grounds, lobby and swimming pools. However,  the size of the property is its own worst enemy. To get to the pools, hot tub (and Lobby) from the building where we stayed, one must either walk or wait for a shuttle ride. Its easily 200 yards down a hill from this building. I don't know... I like a smaller property. We can hear footsteps in the room above us and when the air-conditioning kicks on it sounds like a washing machine during the spin cycle. There are more little problems as well but the bigger problems are what's important here.   The proximity to Laguna Beach, Crystal Cove and Corona Del Mar is nice. Lots of great places to eat!
Manager Response: Thank you for your TripAdvisor review of your recent getaway to Marriott's Newport Coast Villas!  We are glad to read you both found the grounds, lobby and pools gorgeous.  We thank you again for your feedback and look forward to hosting you both on a future stay!

Summary: Very nice property but only one eating place that wasn't opened at night when you check in late the other was a market with pizza hut but it was limited and they were out of everything  The 2 bedroom is nice but would be even better if the other bed was King size too!  Not a full or double bed --- those are too small for two adults.  Not right on the beach like you would think from the photos.... Over all I wouldn't stay there again.

we stayed in the unit # 3834 and within 2 days of staying we got complain every day that we were making noise which is absurd despite the fact that all we did is normal walk in the room. Building must be very poorly built and insulated. You can't  expect  tiptoeing the room all the time

Took the family there over the Thanksgiving holiday.  This is definitely a case of 'you get what you pay for' as there were better hotel deals but none that give you close to what the MVC properties offer.  We had requested a view of the ocean and they were able to fulfill that.  If you have a group of four or more the spaciousness of these villas make for a wonderful vacation.  The resort had all sorts of activities for the entire family (two pools, basketball, tennis, campfires, games, kids night out).  I couldn't have been happier with the stay and everyone was delightful.  You may want to note that it seems to be difficult to get in a villa before the 'official' check in time of 4:00.  That was a comment I heard from more than one guest.  Other than that, it's an amazingly

The entire property is nothing short of beautiful.  The views are fantastic and the villas are fabulous and have everything you could need.  Check in went fairly smoothly and we were able to locate our room easily. Originally we planned to go into Newport Beach to eat dinner but since we were so enamored with the property, we decided to just stay there and enjoy a nice dinner within the spacious resort. One big problem........there is not a dining facility or even a bar located with in the property.  When I called the front desk I was told about the one food service facility they have.  By then it was about 5:30 so we made our way to that location.  What we found was a pool with a outdoor bar area.  About a 15 foot square structure with roll up sides.  We located a table nearby

Booked the week on Expedia and couldn't be happier.  Great property, central location for an extended LA-area visit, and close to the best beaches. Stayed in a newly remodeled Villa (1421), not much of a view but spent most daylight hours visiting using the properties amenities or visiting the local sites. They even delivered Thanksgiving dinner to the Villa while we were away, and walked in to an already set table.

We stayed there during the week of November 17-22 and we had a very pleasant stay. I loved our view of the ocean. Super relaxing. The pool areas were nice and quiet and enjoyable. Very beautiful place all together and again, I cannot talk more of the view. Comfy beds, loved the villa style. Parking was insane though. We always had to park far away from our room. Other than that, beautiful place to stay, many things to do, with Laguna Beach just down the street, Huntington Beach a few miles out and Disney about 45 minutes away, we had a great time. Loved the shower in the masters! Oh and having a family of 5, it was super nice to have a washer and dryer in the villa! =)

We went down for three nights with another couple and were disappointed with the hotel. Our room overlooked a parking lot, the toilet ran and took five trips from maintenance to repair and there was a lot of noise from the nearby busy street. The grounds are beautiful, the area is gorgeous, the staff were friendly and helpful, but the room was really just just OK.
Manager Response: Thank you for your TripAdvisor review, Marty.  We are sorry to hear about the maintenance issue you had with your villa and appreciate your feedback.  This is not typical of the resort and we would like to personally respond to your concerns.  Please email us at customer.care@vacationclub.com with your preferred method of contact and include your TripAdvisor Username. As an alternative, you may reach us directly by calling 800-860-9384.  We look forward to hearing from you soon.

Summary: I would give this Hotel a higher rating but I was a bit disappointed by a couple things. We only stayed one night, which I would have liked to stay longer. We arrived as the sun was almost down, but we did get to see the end of the beautiful sunset as we were waiting to check in, which the lobby and the view were beautiful! As we went to find our villa it was very dark and got a bit confused on how to get to our room but we finally found it. Completely dark at that point so I could not see the view from the porch yet the room was beautiful and nicely equipped. Hoping to see the ocean when we woke up, but that didn't happen. some trees and a street below :(  For the price we paid for the night I was hoping to see the ocean. We were too late to sign our 11 yr old up for the
Manager Response: Thank you for your TripAdvisor review, Debbie.  We are sorry to hear you encountered a few issues during your one-night stay at Marriott's Newport Coast Villas.  The check-out time for Marriott Vacation Club resorts is 10AM, which allows for the housekeeping team to clean the larger accommodations.  This can be inconvenient if it is not explained at the time of check-in.  Before your next visit, please contact Customer Care at 800-860-9384 or customer.care@vacationclub.com so we may assist you with your stay.  Thank you again for your review and we look forward to welcoming your family back again.

Summary Heading: Absolutely beautiful location - Stunning ocean view
Summary: This is our third visit to the Marriott Newport Coast Villas.  As before, we love the location, the temperate weather and the beautiful landscaping of this resort make it a relaxing environment.  Love the fully appointed 2 bedroom villa, nice to grocery shop locally and make this a home away from home for a week.  The granite countertops, stainless steel appliance for in with the upscale look and feel of the resort.  Plenty of walking trails nearby, beach walks and other activities that we enjoy. The gym and spa are fully equipped.  The pool side bar/restaurant make a nice mid afternoon stop to enjoy the view.

Very nice place to stay. Close to the Beach and some Ocean views. Very spacious and clean rooms. Nice pools and BBQ areas. Very beautiful well maintained resort.  Looking forward to staying here again. Great for families with kids as there are a lot of activities to do right at the resort.
Manager Response: Thank you for your five-star TripAdvisor review, Bonnie!  It is wonderful to read you had a blast on your recent getaway with friends because of the spacious villa as well as the resort amenities including both the pool and BBQ areas.  We are thrilled to learn that you plan on returning to the resort and we look forward to welcoming you when that day comes!

Summary Heading: All I can say is Wow!
Summary: We were fortunate to get a fourth floor corner villa overlooking the ocean and were sad that we only had two nights to spend at this property.  It is beautiful and well taken care of.  Our view was superb, the villa was quiet and peaceful, the facilities such as the pool and exercise rooms were excellent and the staff were wonderful.  The only downside might be the lack of food service, but you are in a condo with a full kitchen and there are many restaurants in nearby Laguna or Newport Beach.  State park beach across the road and easy access.

My wife and I stayed for our 18th anniversary and had a unit looking towards the ocean. Amazing sun set right from our porch. Top notch resort and all the quality you expect from Marriott. Our unit was clean open and tons of space for two. Made our trip to Newport Beach fantastic!!
Manager Response: Thank you for the TripAdvisor feedback on Marriott's Newport Coast Villas!  We are thrilled to know you both chose to celebrate your 18th Anniversary at our resort and that your stay exceeded expectations because of the spacious villa and relaxing views.  We hope to have the opportunity to greet you again!

Summary: My wife and I (MVC owners) stayed here with her parents for one night after flying in from Boston and before going out to Palm Desert for the week. The property is beautiful, and the view of the ocean from our unit was spectacular. The staff is very friendly, and the units met our high standards and expectations. We will definitely go back and spend a week. Newport Beach and nearby Laguna Beach have many great looking restaurants, beaches, and plenty of things to do. Though the Newport Beach property is not directly on the beach, it reminded us of Marriott's Marbella Beach Resort, which we loved.

We had such a delightful stay.  There are many great views of the ocean from this property and beautiful grounds.  Lots of entertainment for families, couples and kids!  No need to leave since there is a full kitchen.
Manager Response: Thank you for your five-star TripAdvisor review of  Marriott's Newport Coast Villas!  We are thrilled to learn that your family enjoyed their vacation for both the views and well-maintained grounds.  We look forward to seeing you again real soon!

Summary Heading: Beautiful hotel next to the beach
Summary: Stayed here for my birthday.  This property is awesome for families and especially for kids.  Movies for kids and activities all over the grounds for all ages.  Most of all very relaxing and beautiful views of the ocean

Summary Heading: Huge resort but small common areas
Summary: Marriott’s Newport Coast villas are perfectly located for a great southern California vacation.  It is situated near the coast in tony Orange County next to other upscale resorts, luxury homes, and posh shopping malls.  A short drive takes you to the small town of Corona del Mar with convenient restaurants.  An even shorter drive takes you the Crystal Cove State Park right on the beach.  For more intellectual pursuits, the University of California Irvine is nearby.  High end shopping is also a short jaunt to Fashion Island – surely to be enjoyed by the ladies but way too upscale for me.  Disneyland is only ½ hour north if you can avoid the stupefying traffic snarls.  Be sure to check your Google Maps to find the freeway blockages.    The resort is absolutely humongous.  It
Manager Response: Hi Frank and thank you for your TripAdvisor review!  It is fantastic to know that your family enjoyed their recent stay as a result of the spacious villa and convenient location.  We are sorry to hear about your experience with the Wi-Fi and apologize for the inconvenience.  We thank you for your comments and will share your valuable feedback with the leadership of the resort.  We look forward to hosting you again at Marriott!

Summary Heading: Outstanding Resort with beautiful views of the Pacific
Summary: We stayed at the Marriott Newport Coast Villas for a Three night stay that included a 2 hour sales pitch.. We are MVC owners and were looking for a place in SoCal. We have visited many of the Marriott Villas in other locations, but were impressed with the location, grounds and units (all 2- bedroom). We originally were given a unit near Newport Coast Drive, it was a noisy location, traffic most of the day, (Bldg3400).. I requested a quiet room and was promptly given another location (bldg 1900).. Very quiet and enjoyable. The pool area is lovely with many flowers and a park atmosphere close by.. I would recommend this location for either families or couples.. Ask for a Ocean view bldg if available. PLEASE be aware tolls from Orange County Airport..I was not notified before and

The location couldn't be better and you are forced to chose between multiple swimming pools or the Pacific Ocean just 2 minutes away. The two bedroom suites with a fully supplied kitchen make this location perfect for either a family or two couples. No restaurant, but with the town of Laguna beach-south  and Newport Beach- north, a restaurant is never more than 15 minutes away. Friendly staff and a beautiful atmosphere make this a dream location.

Summary Heading: Beautiful Resort in beautiful southern California
Summary: Three night stay as part of MVC sales pitch package.  Property is really quite lovely, well maintained and very welcoming.  All 2-bedroom units, full kitchens, 2 baths.  Minor maintenance details noticed in the unit - sliding door wouldn't lock, broken window opener can be overlooked.  Grounds, pools (at least 3), fish pond, outdoor grills were wonderful.  Mini-store was pretty mini so do plan on leaving the grounds to get just about anything but the bare bones snacks.  The resort offers a shuttle bus, that we didn't use, and the onsite concierge was very knowledgeable.    1/2 mile away is Crystal Cove beach (down a steep hill), keep in mind the return trip up the steep hill (which is much steeper on the return trip).  Reasonable 15 minute ride to Newport Beach proper, Laguna
Manager Response: Thank you for your review of Marriott's Newport Coast Villas!  We are pleased you enjoyed the preview package during your stay in October.  While the resort does have an obligation to prioritize owner requests, we hope the villa view your received exceeded your expectations.  Thank you again for your review and for visiting us in California.

Summary Heading: Gorgeous views of the ocean on a well kept beautiful property.
Summary: As Marriott vacation club owners we have been to several of the club properties. The views and the SUNSET are comparative to the Hawaiian properties without the long,expensive  flight. Seeing the sunset over Catalina Island nightly was breathtaking!  They are in the process of updating all of the 700 villas. The next time we come we will make sure we request an updated one as our couch was worn down and a few other items needed attention. The kitchen was fully stocked and had everything we needed as we do prepare several of our meals at our villa. There were conveniently located gas grills that were cleaned nightly.  The staff was very friendly and attentive. There were a lot of activities for families with small children. For us adults  there was so much to explore  close by.

Summary Heading: If you don't mind be threatened its a great place to stay.
Summary: I am a marriot owner and have stayed here several times before but was very disappointed with my experience during this visit. We stayed in the 2 bedroom villa which was recently updated. The furniture was modern and the bed was comfortable.  The room itself was not the problem. The first issue was we drove an rv because a member of our party is disabled and not able to fly, we informed the hotel of this in advance and that we were traveling with service dogs. The morning after we spent our first night at the hotel we were told by the front desk we were not allowed to park the rv on the property and they would tow it if we did not move it. We had to park it at an rv park and rent a car because of this rule they never informed us of. The parking lots were empty and we had parked
Manager Response: Thank you for visiting Marriott's Newport Coast Villas.  We are disappointed to hear your experience did not exceed your expectations due to parking and the sales presentation.  This is not typical of the resort and we would like to personally respond to your concerns.  Please email us at customer.care@vacationclub.com with your preferred method of contact and include your TripAdvisor Username. As an alternative, you may reach us directly by calling 800-860-9384.  We look forward to hearing from you soon.

Summary: I spent a week at this place. It is run better than most upscale hotels that I have stayed at. The amenities are fabulous with pool, bar, etc. The staff is very friendly and service oriented. Its a .pleasure to go to the grill and have it work without fuss . The shuttle bus to the beach is reliable and on time and makes the whole event a pleasure.  The Condo is well equipped with up to date appliances and has everything needed to do as much or as little cooking as you want.

Summary Heading: Beautiful property on the Pacific bluffs - BUT!
Summary: We loved the grounds and the view from our villa across the golf course to the Crystal Cove State Park and the Pacific.  However, the amenities at this MVCI property were not as we expected.  Unfortunately, there is no restaurant on site beyond the pool bar, and the Marketplace offerings are lacking.  There is no affiliation with the nearby Pelican Hill golf resort, so expect to pay $200+ for a round with club rental.  We were very excited at the prospect of the spa on-site, but it is sadly diminished from its original capabilities to 2 small treatment rooms without in-room showers and limited privacy or ambience, despite the skills of the therapists.  Maybe this is a good location for families that are content with the pool and/or relying on the shuttle to get to the beach.  I

Summary Heading: Wonderful place to stay in Newport Beach area
Summary: This is the fifth Marriott vacation villa-type place we've stayed in. Please note that this is NOT on the beach (we knew that going in)--it's located uphill from a narrow part of the PCH. But the view is lovely, and one is not far from shopping, etc., and the resort has shuttles to take its guests to places nearby (for those without a car). One thing to note: it is a fairly large resort and is spread out on a hill, so take that into account if you want to be near a pool, or the tennis courts, or the marketplace, etc. We had a lovely view from our fourth floor that overlooked a bit of the ocean, with a beautiful pine tree just next to the balcony railing! The "main" pool area lovely (there are two other pools on the grounds--this is the biggest one, with two smaller pools and the

Nice location, though not on the beach.  Depending on the location of your villa and any mobility limitations, you might have to drive to get around.  For example, there are a lot of stairs - i met a young mother with a stroller walking up a hill, then really struggling to get up stairs to get to the main building.  Quality of villas vary; some upkeep/maintenance issues (e.g., sliding glass doors off their tracks, deadbolts that need WD40, dirty grout in the showers, etc.) but each villa has a tag for you to write down any problems and Engineering is quick to fix the mechanical things.  You can definitely hear noise and footsteps from the unit above you.  Front Desk staff is very friendly and helpful.  Lots of activities for kids.  Wish there were more eating options onsite.

My wife and I stayed here for three days. It is a large  2 bedroom and 2 full bathrooms. Clean, comfortable and we wish we could have stayed a bit longer. Full kitchen, community grills and several pools with hot tubs around the grounds. Shuttle buses run to the local beach and other areas. We will stay again.

We went for a 4 day trip. Had a great time, very nice and relaxing. Beautiful pool and beautiful beach around the corner. We had a 2 bedroom condo and was great for the 4 of us I really can not think of any problem. Oh Yeah, my only complaint was the live music at the pool did not play long enough. Now, when that is your only complaint, you are spoiled.

We absolutely loved our stay here.   As Vacation Club owners, we were given a villa with an ocean and golf course view.  The view was spectacular.  The villa was spacious and well appointed, although the appliances were a bit dated.  The location is fantastic with a short drive to Laguna Beach, Corona Del Mar and Newport Beach.   Pelican Hill Is across the street.  The Grill there is fabulous.  The two golf courses are bucket list courses.  Definitely a place to stay.

Summary Heading: Fun, simple hotel in great location
Summary: This is a very simple Marriott. The villas are spacious, in relatively good shape, and clean. The location is perfect as the beach is around the corner. Pools are all well maintained. It is a family hotel, so as long as you are prepared to be with the kids it is fine. A good affordable vacation spot for the family. They have tons of activities, so if you are hanging out on property there is plenty to do.  The beds themselves are pretty hard, which was a sore spot(literally). The housekeeping "service" offered is very basic and left more to be desired.  This is really a 3 rating hotel, however its location and the property maintenance bumps it up to a 4.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review of Marriott's Newport Coast Villas.  We are pleased to hear your family had a great visit and enjoyed their time with us.  Your feedback regarding the bed is appreciated and will be shared with our facilities team.  We hope to see you again on your next vacation in Newport!

Summary: Very clean and comfortable stay. The staff was accommodating and polite and the pool was excellent! It was also very quiet and we couldn't hear any neighbors around us. The grounds are beautiful and expansive, perfect if you enjoy a beautiful morning walk.

This hotel is also a vacation club spot, but before we became owners we stayed here several times. This property is immaculate and perfect for family fun. If you are able to get a room with a view, the ocean makes it that much better. There are several pools on the property. At the main pool, there's a bar & grill, Starbucks is on the property and there are amenities like gyms, teen hang out rooms, life size chess and checkers, aerobic classes, putting green, basketball court and playground. The rooms are amazing. Stay! You'll love it!

As Interval International owners, we have stayed at several Marriott Vacation Club properties.  This property was, by far, one of the most beautiful places we have stayed.  The views were amazing, the pools were wonderful, the front desk area was posh, and the grounds were beautifully landscaped.  There was a fairly helpful concierge (although we didn't like to use them much as they kept trying to get us to take a tour).  The Starbucks was a nice touch.  The room itself wasn't too updated or exciting (the view was great) and that was a little surprising given how nice the grounds were.  My largest complaint is with the activities desk.    As I stated earlier, we have stayed at several Marriott Vacation Club properties (Orlando twice, Branson, Breckenridge, Boston, among a few
Manager Response: -Hi and thank you for your TripAdvisor review of our resort! While we are happy that you and your family enjoyed the pools and beautiful atmosphere, we are sorry to hear about the service failures you experienced with the activities center. We have shared your comments with the resort leadership and thank you again for your valuable feedback. We invite you to return in the future so that we may truly exceed your expectations.

Summary: This Marriott Vacation Club property is in a fabulous location. Not very well signposted however so very easy to miss the turning on the first visit.  We encountered a problem in terms of customer service (a crucially important message left for us was never passed on) and the duty manager failed to get back to us as he said he would. However this was eventually resolved thanks to another manager, Heather, who was very helpful.  There were limited parking spaces immediately next to the apartments but we were always able to find somewhere to park in another area.  There are plenty of deck chairs available and although residents are signposted not to reserve deck chairs (which they don't) they do sloppily leave their used towels on chairs instead of to the returns unit. It would be

My wife and I just returned from here at end of September. We stayed 10 days. The location is great it's a short drive to Disneyland, laguna beach and pretty much anywhere in southern California. The rooms are very large and the view of sunsets was beautiful. Pools, fire pit, basketball court and grounds well maintained. Employees are there to help and friendly. They went out of there wa for us.

Just came back from a week at this resort and had a great time. Clean and beautiful . There a a lot of restaurants and shopping very close by. All beaches are nice. Crystal cove is a must see just make sure you bring water with you. Trader Joes is in the crystal cove shopping center as well as some good restaurants .

Summary Heading: Best Marriott Property with Amazing Views
Summary: We are Marriott Vacation Club owners and have stayed at a number of properties. This tops them all, including Hawaii and Aruba.  The property is well maintained with all of the expected amenities (tennis courts, basketball courts, grills, cool fire pit, beautiful gardens and grounds)  The pools are very nice.  We love the salt water. The views of the ocean, mountains and golf course are awesome.  We stayed in building 4500 on the fourth floor.  Great location. Also nice is the shuttle service to several area attractions including the beach at Crystal Cove.  We are already planning our next visit.

What more can I say than "OUTSTANDING." From checking to checking out, the stay was awesome. Our condo gave us a glorious view of the pacific ocean. What better way to start the day than sitting on the balcony overlooking the ocean for your morning coffee. The condo was beautifully furnished. The kitchen was well supplied and the bed was fantastic. The staff was friendly, courteous and do there very best to accommodate your every need. The grounds are beautifully kept and the amenities are plentiful. I would recommend this resort for a relaxing week in an outstanding setting.

We just returned from our third trip to the Newport Coast Villas.  We love it down there, even though we have an 8-hour drive to get there.  All the villas are 2-bedroom that actually sleep 8.  We took friends this time, and another foursome joined us next door.  Having a kitchen is wonderful.  The grounds here are lovely.  We like building 4000 or 4100 to have views of the golf course and the ocean.  There are several pools as well as a spa, and lots of activities on site (many for children).  There are so many activities nearby that we filled a full week with golf, shopping, bicycle riding, exploring, and lots of eating!

Summary Heading: Nice vacation club property in a beautiful area
Summary: My family vacationed in California and stayed at this Vacation Club. As an owner with MVC (not this property), I am very familiar with their resort model and this one was in line with other places. The drive in from LAX was very simple and finding the resort was easy. It is on the mountain side of US1, just outside of town, directly across from Pelican Bay.  We arrived in the late afternoon and our room was immediately available, so the check in process was very quick and simple. We had requested a higher floor and an ocean view, both of which we got without a problem.  The property itself is very big. I actually have not stayed at another MVC that was this large, and since it is built into the hillside, it can be difficult to move around the property if you are not in shape. Be

Marriott NCV is our go-to spot whenever we visit our college-kids, who love to come stay with us there. Plenty of room in the beautiful, comfortable villas. Pool is fabulous...especially when they've got the live music going. The property is expansive...we've stayed in the north, south, and west areas. Some are closer to the main pool, which is our favorite, since it has more action. The north & south pools are much tamer/quiet. They keep expanding the activities...added a cinema & more movies in-room - but we tend to be more active while we are here, not so much screen-time. The walk to the beach involved crossing a huge intersection at Pacific Coast Highway (PCH), but it is well-marked & signaled. You need a car to get to restaurants, Laguna, Newport, Corona del Mar, to/from

We went there on a $299 package tied to a 90 minute pitch on Marriott Vacation Club membership.   The facility is beautiful and nicely maintained, as you would expect from Marriott.  Staff was very friendly, helpful and respectful.   The room they gave us was a two bedroom suite - much too big for the two of us - but we enjoyed the space.  As an older couple, two things were minor negatives for us - activities were overwhelmingly geared to children and families, very little on site for couples and aside from the pool bar & grill and a quick market off the lobby, there was no real restaurant.   Having said that, the resort has three pools and we discovered the two at the ends of the resort were less of a haven for kids.  Also, there are nice restaurants in the area (and they gave

For a business conference this place is amazing the staff super friendly and all of the facilities spotless. Was here and had great time.  The food is great and they do a good job of making sure you are comfortable. Parking might be a hassle but it's worth the price.

My wife had been eager to spend two weeks at this resort and had even booked three weeks for next summer.  But having experienced the resort ourselves, despite the fact that it has a good reputation and is in high demand, we've cancelled for next year and won't be returning.  The resort is a bit hard to find with Mapquest and even on the road.  There are plenty of signs for Pelican Bay, but none for the resort as you drive west toward the resort.  Registration is nightmarish and highly inefficient and they like to force you out into a patio area with little shade to actually get the keys to your villa.    Parking near the registration area is horrific and essentially non-existent.  While you're waiting for your keys you'll probably be sent to an underground parking garage at

Upon checking in after a seven-hour flight from New York, we were warmly greeted by Lindsay, at the Front Desk.  We experienced the same customer service we've come to expect from Marriott Vacation Club.   CarolSue, the Concierge made several nice suggestions for our short stay. All were spot on.    The villa suite was also something we've come to expect, immaculate in every detail.   Although we were assigned a "Canyon View," we still had breathtaking views of the Pacific from our balcony.   Would definitely recommend to family and friends!

Summary Heading: Underwhelming Stay At Marriott's Newport Coast Villas
Summary: My family and I recently completed a week stay at Marriott's Newport Coast Villas and I can sum the entire stay up in one word – underwhelmed.  To elaborate, almost nothing stood out as great about our stay, but many things were subpar.   I do not think this hotel should be a Category 7, it does not compare with other Category 7 Marriott properties we have stayed at. This was our first “real” family vacation since our daughter was born a year ago, so we spent a considerable amount of time looking for a family friendly resort in the Newport Beach area.   My husband travels extensively for work and has previously given all his loyalty to the Marriott brand, which is why he has platinum status with them and we were also very interested in becoming Marriott Vacation Club members.

Summary Heading: Fabulous property with the Pacific Ocean view
Summary: We went to the Newport Coast Villas in January 2014 and we are still raving about our stay.  The place is stunning and well kept.  The pools were great and the actual villas, although quite old (we got a 2-bedroom but not a lock-off type which is the standard in most new developments), we still enjoyed the space and was great for 4 adults on a vacation.  We hope to come back really soon to this property!

Our first visit to the area. Stayed for five days prior to attending Catalina Island wedding. The property was very nice. We stayed in the main building which is great for close proximity to main pool. Definitely need a car if you plan on leaving the resort for anything.

This property is well maintained. Lots of quiet areas, BBQ and picnic areas. Loved the Adirondack chairs scattered around the property, The actual suites could use a little TLC. Maybe some cabinet hardware and updated appliances. The OTR in our suite looked ready to fall off the wall. It was scary to use. Pool areas are nice. One issue was asking for coffee at the pool at noon. I was told by the server that the coffee machine wasn't working and I would have to go to Starbuck's. That was a huge put off for me.  The staff, for the most part, was very friendly and helpful.

I am there right now - it has only been 3 days and true to form Marriott has been fabulous.  The room I am in has been partially renovated and is beautiful. They have hit it out of the park and when they are finished it will be amazing. I love, love, love this property - always top of the line AND they fixed their internet  it now covers the whole resort not just your room. Couldn't be happier........

My family & I just returned from a one-week stay at the Newport Coast villas. It was very relaxing and enjoyable. We found the villas provided just about everything one would need for a vacation including the BEST thing of all---space. All villas have two bedrooms, two bathrooms, a kitchen, dining area, living room & balcony. Marriott provides shuttles to Fashion Island, Crystal Cove State Park, Laguna Beach & the Crystal Cove Shopping Center. Still, one really would be better off renting a car as there is not much within walking distance. The villa complex itself is huge and sits on a bluff overlooking the Pacific Ocean. The views are spectacular. We did not have an oceanview villa but were happy nonetheless with our view of the Pelican Hill Resort across the street. There are

I stayed for just a few nights in June, 2014, to visit friends staying there from PA and WA.  I have stayed there numerous times and always appreciate the friends front desk staff accommodating me with a great room with a view of Catalina Island on a clear day, the sail boats racing around, and just relaxing on the balcony with a glass of wine.  It has become my home away from home about four times a year for two or three/four nights at a time, and love it every time.   With a full kitchen I can stay in and relax, or treat myself to one of the many fabulous resturants close by.

Parling is abyssmal  Be prepared to hike and climb many stairs with a significant incline. This place would daunt an everest climber. You don't want to forget anything in your room. No restaurant on property - Poll snack bar food was terrible

Summary Heading: Third Stay - Check In Always A Cluster!
Summary: This was our third stay at the Newport Coast Villas. Every single time the check in process has been a huge cluster! There is NEVER enough parking around the lobby. Cars are stacked in line, some without drivers, blocking other cars. 10 minute parking signs everywhere that nobody pays any attention too! If you check in on a weekend, guaranteed your room will NOT be ready until the 4:00 check in, even if the front desk clerk tells you differently! They seem to have a militant policy about not allowing even a 10 minute early check in! When 4:00 rolls around and they haven't sent you that text to tell you your room is ready, go back to the front desk, it will miraculously be ready! They do have an employee outside by the key pick up area handing out free mixed nuts and cocktails of

Summary Heading: Probably could be much better than the score
Summary: First and foremost, the resort is beautiful with a wonderful scenic view of hills and ocean and golf course.  The room are large and well equipped.  The negatives are caused by lack of staff.  We were told to leave our trash out by 10 AM and most days the trash was not collected until late afternoon even though the birds had pecked though the bags and scattered trash over the walkway.  The property covers about 72 acres and there is no parking around the central club so you have to rely on the shuttle service which had 2 shuttles on service during peak times for around 700 units.  They also did not have enough people working reception or service calls, sometimes waiting as long as 10 minutes on hold to call for a shuttle.  The resort is well located, within walking distance of

Summary Heading: Great location, nice garden with pools
Summary: This is a very nice Marriott, but the one in Cairo, Egypt, easily tops it. The location of the hotel is great. It is close to Disney land (should you want to go there), close to the beach (you still need a car to get there), close to one of the biggest shopping malls of the West Coast (South Coast Plaza), and across the street there is Fashion Island, a really magnificently styled open-air shopping mall, very different from most other malls in the US. The hotel has three different pools in a nice garden with wonderful plants. The service is as one can expect in a Marriott: very good.

Summary Heading: Holy smokes this place is great!
Summary: We stayed here with our family (a group of almost 20) with people varying  in age from 2-65. There was something for everyone. The activities for kids were great and I loved the kids club. The rooms were nice and spacious. A beautiful area and I was very impressed!

We love the location. Close to shopping, beach, great restaurants. Also not too far from Disneyland, legoland, etc.   Pros:  location, your own kitchen and laundry, multiple pools, good gym, Newport is beautiful. It's nice to have condo space with hotel services (fresh towells, daily cleaning and beds made. Yes please!)  Cons: you "pay" for many of the resort amenities/activities and we don't take part in a lot of those so that is not a big perk for us. Since it is a large condo complex it can take a while if you call for extra towels or a clothes iron (we waited 30 minutes). Our condo wasn't sparkling clean - but when we called about it they cleaned it right up. We also did not have hot water one morning and had to wait an hour for it to be fixed and hear back up - we ended up

Family of 5.  As the kids get older I have found I needed to rent 2 adjoining hotel rooms; but this 2 BDR villa was even better.  The rooms were big, great kitchen, And dining area .  Easy access to nearby sites, great staff, better than average grounds.  Stayed here because of a sales pitch.  We will likely return.

Lovely hotel. Although I am Marriott rewards , they did not give us a nice view room. We had  a two bedroom suite. One room was big and the other very small. The suite was well equipped with everything we needed.

The villas are beautiful.  Nicely appointed especially skin deep, but... We lost most of our refrigerated items due to freezing, kept changing the temp on fridge, but it just shifted the freezing to another area inside.  We didn't complain because we thought we had found a solution. Oh well. Lots of food thrown away.  The villas are NOT handicap friendly. Of you never left your unit it would be fine, but the hills with twists and turns are not conducive to maneuvering a wheelchair.  In fact, we had an incident where the chair went off a curb and fell over.  There is not even close to enough handicap parking spaces. For two full buildings there were two.  I wonder is that is even ADA compliant.    The pools were overrun with children running around. Not surprising for summer, but

Summary Heading: A great experience and good value in Newport Beach
Summary: I really like the newport coast villas and stay once or twice a year. It is close to the crystal cove beach area and shopping so you get nature and nightlife. The villas are very big and well kept. Most pools have a nice view. The staff is very polite. I recommend this highly for families or couples who need more than 1 room at a hotel.

Summary Heading: Very Average. Smiley service is only skin deep.
Summary: We stayed at this property at the end of a long US trip.  On checkin they made a big deal of "doing anything we can to make your stay nice"  Well, it wasn't quite so.  The rooms are fine, think typical Marriott, but a request for a quiet room was blatantly ignored with our room facing the Pacific Coast highway. The build quality of the structure is such that we could hear traffic pass by all night, and we certainly couldn't sleep with the window open for noise. When I pointed this out, they were "Sorry"  There are 5 pools, three in the main area, but it is blatantly too small for the number of villas. All chairs were taken so we had to wait for one, and the pool was crowded with kids.   The catering around the pool is understaffed and we had to wait for over an hour at one of

Summary Heading: Lots of room, great amenities, good location
Summary: Marriott's Newport Coast Villas is a lovely resort with lots of ways to relax without leaving the grounds:  three pools, a poolside bar which also serves light meals, LOTS of outdoor grills, walking trails, kids' activities, movie night, bocce court, tetherball grounds, etc.  You could easily stay there with your family for days, just hanging out.  Of course, with the beach just down the street (the resort offers free transportation to the beach multiple times daily), lots of shopping centers (free transportation to those, too), loads of good restaurants, etc., there's just too much to do in the area for a one week visit.  It's also only half an hour to Disneyland, closer than that to Laguna and all its wonderful offerings, etc. As for the condo...  I stayed in a

Summary Heading: Newport Beach Family Spring Break Vacation
Summary: This was an excellent place to stay for the family.  We had a suite with a full kitchen and 2 bedrooms with bathrooms.  In addition, there was a nice size living room and laundry in the suite.  There was a full size exercise area, huge swimming pool facing the ocean, ping pong, foos ball tables and a small child activities program.  A very nice destination hotel for the family.  The beach was down the hill and had to be accessed by car, but it is a clean state beach.

Summary Heading: Perfect vacation at the Marriott's Newport Coast Villas
Summary: Marriott's Newport Coast Villas is the perfect place to get away from everything but still have everything just a short drive away. Just up from PCH, you have plenty of restaurant, grocery and beaches to choose from. The rooms are large and comfortable and the property is beautiful. We spent a lot of time at the pool and playing ping pong. This is a fabulous property that you should visit soon.

Our family of four (kids 13 and 16) stayed here for a week in August and it could possibly be one of our best vacations.  We love visiting California and was our first trip as a family to southern California.  The location is perfect!  Disney 30 minutes and LA was about 50 minutes.  San Diego about 90 minutes. Beaches are an easy drive.  Crystal cove was nostalgic but there are far better beaches.  Loved one of Lagunas beaches (not main beach).  Wish we had more time to explore other beaches in the area.  The hotel rents chairs for 5$ per day but no boogie boards, and get there early in the morning because they go quick.  Plenty of restaurants in either direction.  We ate at the Hotel  Laguna (perfect for sunset) and Bandera in Corona Del Mar (great town with some gorgeous

A couple of years ago we past this resort and thought it was great overlooking the Cove and if we went back to SoCal we would look to stay there. We found a unit from a great guy this summer. We were guaranteed an Ocean view and let me tell you - having breakfast overlooking the ocean every morning is something I truly miss - it was great. Equally great were the views of the sunset. The hotel is well located and has shuttles to the beach - probably could run a little more frequently though. Our 2 bedroom villa was awesome and we were even in a secluded wing so there was nobody around our room at all. The property has grills, 5 pools, firepits and an assortment of activities. Staff was great. Having the beach right there with Crystal Coves was a treat and many famous beaches were

I stayed for a week with my wife and three daughters.   The villas are really confortable.  All that you can expect form a Marriott Vacation resort.  The view are very nice.  The location is very nice very close too many charming beach villas.  We spend most of the time away from the hotel but it was a beautiful place to come back to rest at the end of the day.

Although I only live 10 minutes away, my long-time girlfriends and I sometimes rent a two bedroom and have a girl's weekend.  I've never stayed here in the summer, but it truly is a great place to stay, especially for families wanting a beach vacation in a beautiful location.   The rooms are huge, have a full kitchen and a couch that makes into a very comfortable bed.  The pool area and all the outdoor activities a family could participate in are endless!  Plus, there is a shuttle down to Crystal Cove State Beach, which is a gorgeous beach! Any family could easily spend a week here and still want to stay longer.    Another added bonus of the location is that you're very close to great shopping, restaurants, biking and walking trails, and other charming beach cities like

Stayed in a 2 bedroom villa on the timeshare sales pitch promotion. Great deal! Convenient to the freeways, Albertsons grocery store, and about 45 minute drive to Disneyland. Perfect for our family of 4. Saved money by cooking a few meals in our kitchen, and did a load of laundry in our villa the last night.

The villa's are all two bedroom two bathroom with balcony.  The balcony is perfect for eating breakfast and lunch.  If you are coming here, pack a "spring float" flotation raft for the pool.  If you don't own one, go online and do a google search.  Plenty of online sellers.  They cost about 30 dollars each.  Buy one or two if coming with someone else.  Your pool experience will be 100% improved by having them.  If flying here, they will fit in the bottom of suitcase. They fold up and can easily be packed.  The rooms all have magnificent views of the Pacific Ocean. Perfect location between Newport Beach and Laguna beach.

We stayed for the first time at the Newport Coast Marriott Vacation Club.  The pools and activities for children were amazing for Bella (9) and Evan (8).  The access to small, quaint CA coast towns nearby was wonderful.  You need to rent a car when you come here.  The ocean access was disappointing but it was not easy but the stunning views almost compensated for it.  Our bottom floor room had ants in it but the staff addressed it right away and impressively.

We stayed at the Marriott Newport Coast Villas as guests of owners. We stayed for a week this past week. The owner is my sister-in-law who has been an owner for over a decade. We stayed in the Cambria building, 2nd floor villa. The property is very nice. All amenities were provided, which made things so much easier.  I would add that providing hand soap for the kitchen would be a nice touch. There were just a few things that I noticed in the room.  One, there were food crumbs in the kitchen drawers.  Two, the top rack of the dishwasher was hard to roll in an rout.  Three, the large pyrex measuring cup shattered while in use, which was a total surprise. Upon inspection of the smaller Pyrex measuring cup, I noticed that it was warped at the bottom, rendering it unsafe to use. I

The first impression of this place is fantastic. The main building and the views are breathtaking. Overall, this resort is first class all the way around. The pools and workout room are both very nice. The food at the pool bar was good but it typically took a while to get it. The prices at the marketplace were reasonable but there also is a grocery store just a few miles away. The park area at the resort was really nice with a playground for toddlers, putting greens, basketball hoops, fire pits, etc. The kids activity area was the nicest I've seen at any MVC's and had good games for the kids, movie theatre, etc. The only drawback of this resort is that it's not right on the beach. We ventured over to Crystal Cove Beach which is about a 10-15 minute walk and I was not impressed.

Summary Heading: Perfect  for feeling at home in Newport Beach
Summary: These 2 bedroom villas are located in Newport Beach on beautifully landscaped grounds over the coast and a close walk or ride to the beach.  The rooms are simple but have full kitchen, sitting area, tvs, 2 bathrooms, patio and everything you need to feel like you live in the OC.  Perfect for staying with family and enjoying sunny california.  Lots of activities avaible on site as well from outdoor pool tables to swimming.  I did a little trip report if you need more info on chiliandtart.tumblr.com hope that helps

I have stayed at Marriott's Newport Coast Villas on a couple of occasions with my parents who had a time share with Marriott.  We have always enjoyed our stay as it is so clean, the grounds well maintained, great customer service, beautiful location with ocean views and it is a perfect place for couples and families.  We always hate to leave when the time comes for our vacation to come to an end.

Summary Heading: Just a beautiful place to visit
Summary: There are many great things about the Marriott Newport Coast Villas. Did have a slight problem that was resolved very quickly by Heather who  was the front desk manager. She was caring and totally understanding. This is a wonderful property that is kept well. The friendliness of the workers and staff is a credit to the employees themselves as well as Marriott's training program. The pool was clean and clear. The food served by the pool was quite good and the drinks were excellent.the staff around the pool were efficient and courteous. The parking can be a little tough as some guests take up more than their allocated spots. They have different parking for outside guest. They have a quiet pool and a quiet spa. Most people do observe that but you always have  the loudmouths that

Summary Heading: One of my favorite places to stay...anywhere
Summary: I always enjoy our visits to the wonderful resort.  The resort is beautifully designed, with comfortable, fresh, two bedroom villas many (but not all) of which have great views of the hills or Pacific Ocean.  The landscaping is beautiful and there are several large pools in the complex for you to enjoy.    But by far the greatest attraction is its proximity to the Newport Coast.  Situated on the lower part of a large hill rising from the Pacific, the resort is about a five minute walk from Crystal Cove State park, one of the largest stretches of natural beach in California.  The beach stretches for miles and there's tide pools you can explore and great sand beaches for the kids to play in.    Newport has lots of great dining and the Balboa peninsula and its piers are a short

Great stay. Really good location, easy walking distance to the ocean. Newport is a super location for a vacation. Lots of things to do, an hour away from LA.  Wonderful resort, like a  dream. Close to the fashion mall. Easy driving distance to Dana Point, where you can go on a boat  and see whales and dolphins. Do this on Tuesday, when it is half price. We saw mother and baby humpback whales and over 100 close.dolphins

Eight years ago we spent a glorious August weekend at the Marriot's Newport Coast Villas and were enticed to buy a week of timeshare.  Since then, we have either booked a week in the fall or have traded out to other resorts.  This July was the first time we actually went back during the summer.  Now that the resort and my kids are a little older, I discovered a few changes which were either new or that I had overlooked before.  Here's what I noticed during my summer vacation stay:  1.  Unlike in the fall, the resort is very crowded during the summer months.  There's a lot of traffic in general.  Parking in front of your building can be a challenge.  The pools are full, and it can be noisy.  However, if you have children and are subject to a school schedule, a summertime visit

Summary Heading: Worth Doing the Time Share Presentation
Summary: Marriott offered us (Marriott Reward Members) a great deal to come check out this property as a potential time share purchase.  The deal was too good to pass up, so while we had little interest in purchasing we chose to visit in July.  We had friends from Texas fly in to meet us and the 4 of us shared the two bedroom/two bath room.    Really appreciated how the villa was set up so that each couple had as much privacy as possible, with the bedrooms located on the opposite sides of the villa. Everything was fabulously clean.  The kitchen was well equipped, the balcony large, lots of space to spread out.    The resort itself was well landscaped, the pools were well attended, but not too crowded to find a seat.  There is a "quiet" pool which was a nice escape from the main pool used

This is great place to have a relaxing break but also you can get to LA and San Diego in just over an hour. Whale watching is 30 mins away. Only disappointment was  no   bathrobes or anywhere to dry stuff that can't be tumbled eggs swimsuits.

In Sum: > Ample room for family of 3-5. > Great ocean views > Fun pools > Spa, Weight Room, Kid Activities > Good value for area  We've stayed in the Newport area so many times over the past 25 years and have found these villas to be a really good solution to meet multiple family needs. Originally we planned to rent a home in Corona Del Mar, wanting to be as close to the beach as possible. As attractive as that is, our daughters loved the pools that the Villas provided. Add to that the weight room, spa, kid activities, price, and we opted for the latter.   We love the less well know beaches of North Laguna, so getting in the car would be necessary regardless where in Newport we stayed. There is so much to do in the general area and we found this to be a good central location

Summary Heading: Best Marriott Vacation Club so far...
Summary: Best Marriott Vacation Club so far! We have used some of the Orlando one's over the last few years, so had a good idea what to expect from these Villas. Our two bed Villa/condo was up to scratch. Had all the facilities you would expect. The complex is large and apartment blocks can be spread around, but ours was near the basketball court which was only a short uphill stroll to the pool and reception area. The complex could do with a few more staircases to get people up to this area, as it can be a long walk uphill from some of the apartment blocks! Pool area is large with lots of good areas to sit and catch some rays. As a European visitor I do wish American pools where a bit deeper, they never seem to be more than 1-1.6m. Makes swimming more difficult, but this is merely a

My family and I have been to this resort 3 years in a row during spring break.  I think that alone should say how we feel about this place ... it's Fantastic!    Since I have a large family (4 kids), I am often looking for 2 bedroom units to accommodate my family's needs.  And I am a big fan of Marriott Vacation Club properties ... because they have it all!  Plenty of space in the unit, full kitchen, living area, 2 BR, 2 BA.  You get the idea.  This particular property is one of the best!  Beautifully manicured grounds, incredible views of the ocean, amenities for all ages, and close proximity to a variety of activities ... which is great for a family that has very different tastes.    About the location ... this Marriott is situated between LA and San Diego, which makes

I read on some other reviews that you can't get in prior to checking of 4 pm and thought everyplace says this and  I have never had an issue at any other Marriott.  Well, there was NO chance of us getting in a minute prior to 4pm.   The place was totally sold out (such a nice place) and I think this is likely the case often, so plan accordingly.  The property is very beautiful and so nice. Parking is one spot per unit then additional cars in the garage--they reinforce the warning/towing, so beware.  The pools are a bit crowded early, but you can take the shuttle to a handful of gorgeous West coast beaches that the Marriott offers.  It is very convenient.  Also....the (only) bar/grille at the pool on the property outside closes at 7 pm most nights and 8 Sat and Sun nite.

Stayed there for a week with wife and two boys , great place, lots to do for kids. I also enjoyed nearby places to visit, Laguna Beach, Newport Beach. Pool was little crowded but not too bad. Condos are roomy and clean, nice to have kitchen to have a family meal or two even though we didn't cook.

We had a great time with our kids a Coast Villas for a 4 day stay.  We had a very limited ocean views but the grounds were nice. Next time I hope to book with better ocean views.  I loved the size of the rooms, kitchens, laundry, etc.  Very enjoyable!

Even though it's a time share you can book rooms trough Marriot reservations. We liked the room size and the super views. Plenty of cafes and restaurants nearby for a good choice of eating. Friendly folk working there too.

Summary Heading: Marriott Newport coast villas,(great for families)
Summary: Did a promotional stay at Coast villas this week. Tried to get a view room , no chance without being a owner. Room given was updated and nice room but at the lowest spot on property so no view. Service was very good and 2bd rooms were spacious and clean. Lots of families with lots of kids in July. Not much room at pools. Would return off season if could get a view room.

Summary Heading: Nice location in between Newport and Laguna
Summary: My family stayed here a few years back. It was ok. The room needed updated. The pool was ok, but it wasn't hot outside really to be swimming. Check in was easy and very accommodating too. Prices are ok. I would stay here again because of the location!

Summary Heading: still a good place for a S Cal vacation
Summary: Stayed for a few days with friends at the Marriott Newport Coast Villas just this past week.  We had stayed here four years ago and had enjoyed the experience.  A few things have changed, namely that there are additional buildings that have added units, some with great ocean views.  We stayed in the 4600 building on the third floor, and these units really have wonderful views, of the golf course and of the ocean.  The setting of this place is the star of the show.  All of the units are basically double master suite condo's with full kitchens and include sofabeds in the living room, so this is a great place for a family vacation or for friends to join up for a vacation and still have some privacy in the unit.  The kitchens make it possible to do breakfasts & lunches (& dinners if

We were here for a week in mid-July. We had a two bedroom, two bath unit on the fourth floor of the 3800 building. The property is beautiful and well maintained, with fabulous views out to the ocean and overlooking Crystal Cove.  As expected the staff at Marriott was great. The rooms are attractive and nicely decorated, with a TV in the living room and both bedrooms.  The pool area is nice, but can get busy so if you want a good location with shade and sun get out to the pool by 10 AM. Casual dining at the pool, and pizza delivery to the room, but not much else on property for dining options.  They have shuttles to a number of locations such as beaches shopping etc. if you do not want to drive.  Overall a great family vacation at a beautiful resort.

Summary Heading: Hopefully the location change will help
Summary: I checked in late on Saturday night so didn't get any of the choice rooms and got a room in the building 1900. It is a great location for peace and quiet if you don't have any kids, but I have 4 little kids under 7 and walking up and down the staircase to go anywhere was so hard that I moved my family out of the property into a friend's house until Marriott can find me another room, at least, with an elevator access. I am getting a new room tomorrow so hopefully the new location will help.

Awesome resort!  Location to the main building with the pool, food and shuttle is key for people who want the resort feel.  We booked last minute during high season and took the best deal we could find, which was $500-1000 less than many of the deals out on the web.  This is a 700 unit property and is bigger than many of the Marriott vacation properties I've stayed at.  We were in the 4600 and a big hill back from the pool....not popular with small kids or an ex runner like me who had foot surgery this year.  Just look at the property Map and go for a unit near the main registration building.    We have come to So Cal many times and to book a property on the beach that is nice is very expensive and usually small.  This Newport villa is not on the beach, but is spacious, clean

Husband & I went kid free week after the 4th of July. Stunning views of ocean & property from main bldg. We were in bldg 2000 & on bottom level so had no view but we were never in room during day so no problem. We stayed for $499 on timeshare invite, presentation was just over 2 hrs & was pretty low pressure. It is a great deal for a family traveling every yr. Close to beaches & shopping/restaurants. Wish there was more breakfast/healthy food options on site. We will definitely be back!

We stayed at one of the busiest times of the year- over the July 4th holiday. The place was packed, yet we never felt uncomfortably crowded and the staff was able to remain friendly & helpful the entire stay! Not sure how they did that. We stayed in the 3500 bldg. so that we could be close to the pool & still have some ocean view. We loved the location of the villas( away from all the town activity) & we loved the location of our room.  Our room seemed a little dated & tired, but was clean & had everything we needed. It was also quiet even though it was across from the registration area.  The only disappointment was the pool bar. It was advertised in the elevator as a romantic setting overlooking the ocean. It was far from romantic. It was a loud busy pool bar, filled with

The resort is amazing.  There is plenty to do for all ages. The two bedroom suite that we were in was spacious and clean.  We were in the 1900 building and we had a view of the ocean and the golf course (Pelican Hill). The grounds of the property were all well manicured, staff were all very friendly and very eager to help. Overall the facilities were great. Pools were perfect temp and not over crowded, grills were clean, and the kids park and tennis courts were perfect. Definitely recommend.

Summary Heading: We stay 1-2 times a year.  Stay on the preview price for 249$ for 3 nights
Summary: We are Marriott timeshare owners and come here 1-2 times a year from the Sacramento area.  For location and ameneties on resort this is one of our favorites.  Great for familys, reunions and romantic getaways.  I would avoid the areas near the main pool if you want peace and quiet, those are better if you have lots of kids.  The units closest to the ocean are garden view, but much quieter.  Peak months it can be crowded, the offpeak times are the best.  We usually go in late November and early March.  This place never gets old.  Marriott will do some preview specials at 249$ for non owners for 3 nights, which is the best way to go if you've never been.  You have to sit through the 90 min presentation, but well worth it for the money you save.  If your intereseted in the preview

We were here Spring Break meeting up with our son in AZ and had a fantastic memorable vacation once again. We haven't been here for a few years and really missed the NewPort Coast Villas. It has been our home away from home bringing so many great memories while our young sons have grown into young men. We met up with our son that is attending college in AZ and it was the perfect meeting place. We hung out at the pool and met some fantastic people. I really hope we meet up with them again another year. The villa itself has everything we could possibly need for the week. We eat out every night but appreciate everything in the kitchen. There are so many fantastic restaurants locally while in NewPort. The pools on site are incredible and we sat out there daily. The Marriott Company

Another exceptional resort from Marriott's vacation club. This resort is nestled in the mountainside, along the coast of Southern California near Newport Beach. A great location with lots of attractions minutes away. The resort itself has several beautiful pools. The grounds are reminiscent of the Italian countryside of Tuscany. Each villa is beautifully decorated and comfortable for a family. The kitchen is well equipped. Most units have a wonderful view of the ocean. You wouldn't even need to leave the resort with loads of activities, but don't miss Balboa Island, Laguna and other coastal towns full of great restaurants and shops. I look forward to our next visit to Marriott's Newport Coast Villas!

Summary Heading: An oasis in the Rat Race of SoCal
Summary: We enjoyed staying at this Marriott Vacation Resort.  While our 2-Bedroom Guest Suite was a little outdated, it was very clean and properly appointed.  We were on the 3rd Floor and had a partial ocean view from our balcony.  All of the staff was very friendly, hard-working, and helpful, which was not easy to do with the large amount of people who were present at the time of our stay.  Driving through the LA Freeway System to get to our destination was akin to driving in a Nascar Race...Speed Limit is 65, but EVERYONE is doing 85....so it was very nice to be able to park our car for a few days and utilize the extensive Shuttle Service that this Resort provides.  There are also panoramic views of the Pacific Ocean from here, so one need not wander from the premises very far to
Manager Response: Thank you for your review Ted!  We are happy to be your oasis and appreciate your wonderful comments.  We are excited to report full villa renovations will begin this year.  We hope to truly exceed your expectations on your next visit to Marriott's Newport Coast Villas!

Summary: Beautiful and spacious rooms with a laid back beachy vibe :-).  I have been to this property twice now and both times I have had very good experiences. The rooms are well kept and spacious. The main pool area is usually bustling in the late spring and summer months. The pool bar offers a delicious array of alcoholic beverages (my favorite: skinny pina colada). I do wish that they had an onsite store that sold more then personal pizzas and junky food. There are several grocery stores nearby, so it wasn't a problem, but it would have been nice on that first day to have a few more options.  The views of the ocean driving into the property from the 73 were stunning ...makes you appreciate the true beauty of Sunny Southern California. I just wish this property were closer to the
Manager Response: Thank you for your review, Jenna!  We are thrilled your family had a great visit in June and really appreciate your feedback.  Your comments about food and beverage offerings will be shared with the appropriate managers as we continue to improve our resort amenities.  Our team looks forward to your next visit with us at Marriott's Newport Coast Villas!

Summary Heading: A great property with an equally great staff!
Summary: This is a timeshare - but on a scale of timeshare resorts, this one ranks an 4 out of 5.  The staff is accountable and responsive to your needs.  All calls for service get a confirmation quality assurance check from another member at the hotel.  Most, if not all the views at the resort look out  to the pacific ocean.  There premises are clean and well maintained.  The rooms - all very spacious and clean.  The appliances are basic and do the job.  The only negative is the parking!  It's such a prime real estate location that the design maximizes views and lodging at a sacrifice to parking.  But the weather is so nice, it's not really a bother to take the extra walk if you arrive late to your unit and find no parking spots.  This place is probably Marriott's most successful

We did a one week road trip to Newport Beach with friends in March 2014. We stayed at the Coast Villas as it was a great home base for our planned trips north and south. The view from our villa was 180 degrees and stunning. The accommodations, lobby and associated shops were typical upscale for this area. All staff members we had contact with were pleasant and very helpful. There are several large common area patios in this resort with multiple gas BBQ's. A great place to throw a steak or half a salmon on the grill, have a brew and enjoy the ocean views.  We visited Crystal Cove Beach several times looking at the 20's & 30's beach bungalow's that can also be rented through the state park. Very nice beach that is great for long walks with many tidal pools.
Manager Response: Thank you for joining us on your California excursion!  We appreciate your five-star review and hope to welcome you back soon to Marriott's Newport Coast Villas!

Summary Heading: Awesome Place for Good Family Fun!!
Summary: We were there for a short weekend and we fell in love with this property. We aren't part of the Marriott Vacation Club so we got the daily service of having our room cleaned each day (I think you have to pay if you want your place to be cleaned if you're there as part of the timeshare.)The suites are villas with everything you need for an extended stay (full kitchen, washer/dryer, dishwasher) and we stayed in a spacious 2 bedroom villa which was perfect for us. The kids slept on the pullout couch and I laid on it and it was pretty comfortable. It's super close to the beach (although we didn't take advantage of going there since we had so much fun on the property) and close enough to shops and restaurants (not walking distance, of course).  I have two young boys (3 year old and

Located on a bluff you are a little further from the beach (shuttles are provided), but you get some seriously amazing views in return!  Completely geared towards families, this is a great place to get together with a large group and spend a relaxing weekend.
