It's a vacation for the entire family. "And that's the way it is" Mega Bob

We stayed in the 2300 building and had a wonderful view of the ocean. We used the pre-request form and got a perfect location that was close to the pool, activity center and easy walk down to the beach.  Everyone was friendly and helpful. I was asked once to take a tour of the facility for a timeshare presentation and was not asked again. The units are newly remodeled. The kitchens are well stocked so you can adequately prepare meals in including storage containers for left overs. The activity center staff was actively involved in everything they did.   We had a great time going to the extra activities and meeting people from different areas. The beach area is wonderful. Crystal Cove is fascinating and the walk along the coast is exceptional.

Summary Heading: Our Favorite Marriott Vacation Club Resort in the US Mainland
Summary: Bordered by Newport Beach and just north of Laguna Beach is this great resort up on the hills above Crystal Cove Park. Many of the views are fabulous with the ocean, golf course and beach below. Spanish style is attractive. The units are roomy, clean and well equipped as we always expect from Marriott Vacation Club. There are several nice pools, grills near each building, and a variety of resort activities.  The resort also provides free shuttle to the most popular nearby attractions. Shopping centers, restaurants, grocery (including our favorite Trader Joe's), churches and a variety of beaches are all nearby. The surprise is that this resort feels like it is far from the huge urban areas not far away.  Short drives will bring you to Balboa Island, Dana Point, downtown Laguna

There's nothing to be critical of here.  The service from all employees was excellent, the attitudes gracious.  The villa was spotless, and the grounds no less perfect.  The environment is beautifully landscaped.  We had coolish weather but everyone and everything on premises was top notch Marriott Vacation Club.  Management here runs a tight ship, but in a way that everything felt relaxed.  We were fortunate enough to have a villa with a view to the ocean.  Buildings 4000, 4100, 4200 are the ones to request.  Looking forward to our next visit!

Best thing about this resort is the close proximity to Crystal Cove state park.  I will stay here again for that reason alone.  Rooms are all 2 bedrooms with really nice large kitchens.  The master bathroom was odd.  No door blocking the sink from the bedroom and the door to the toilet/shower was crammed in.  It was difficult to get out of the shower with the bathroom door closed.  It could be done, but you need to be limber and not overweight.  Some of the villas looked like they had enough parking.  Ours did not.  We parked a few buildings away whenever we returned from an outing.  We were next to a quieter pool.  The pool water was too cool for me for January.  The larger main pool area was filled with families.  No exaggeration when I say FILLED.    The sheets are bad.  I am
Manager Response: We appreciate your positive review of Marriott’s Newport Coast Villas!  We are happy to hear your vacation exceeded your expectations and that you thoroughly enjoyed your stay with us.  We also appreciate your feedback on areas of improvement as we continue to enhance our guest experience.  Thank you again for your review and we hope you visit us again soon!

Summary: This is our destination of choice. We visit at least 1 time a year. We come in various months and the S. Cal weather is usually great all year long. The rooms are very generous and very well decorated. There are 3 TVs and a fully equipped kitchen . The beds are are so  comfortable. The resorts pools and grounds are beautiful . You won't be disappointed
Manager Response: Our team appreciates your positive review of Marriott’s Newport Coast Villas!  We are thrilled you enjoyed your spacious villa and many amenities on property.  We look forward to your next visit with us!

Summary: We recently stayed at the Newport Coast Villas.  We were in a beautiful 2-BR suite that was very comfortable, clean and well laid out.  The furnishings and the decor were excellent and while we didn't do any cooking in the condo, it appeared that there were adequate cookware and tableware to prepare most meals.    Our over all impression was very good with two exceptions -  The resort is located high on a bluff with many of the units overlooking the Pacific Ocean.  Being somewhat physically impaired, the size of the resort and the way it is spread out across the hillside makes getting around the resort somewhat difficult at times.  They do operate a shuttle that circles the resort, but depending on which building you are staying in, even the walk to the shuttle stop can be quite
Manager Response: We appreciate your positive review of Marriott’s Newport Coast Villas!  We are happy to hear your family had a great vacation and enjoyed their luxury villa.  Our team also appreciates your feedback regarding areas of improvement as we continue to enhance our guest experience.  Thank you again for your review and we hope you visit us again soon!

Summary: We recently stayed at Marriott's Newport Coast Villas.  We stayed in the 5000 building on the fourth (top) floor.  This is exactly what we requested from Marriott.  One of the nice services that Marriott has implemented is a pre- stay request form where you can put in preferences for rooms, extra items etc...    We have used this a few times and it's nice to arrive and get what you expected.  We really like this service. Check in was easy and the front desk staff was exceptionally friendly.  They obviously hire the best people.  Everyone, and I mean everyone we saw who was a Marriott employee said Hi and asked us if we needed anything as we passed them in the lobby.  Quite a tribute to the staff and management at this resort.  the views and décor is breathtaking.  The front desk
Manager Response: Thank you for your positive review of Marriott’s Newport Coast Villas!  Our team appreciates your detailed feedback and are happy you enjoyed your time with us.  We look forward to your next visit with us in beautiful Newport Beach!

Summary Heading: Beautiful resort, fabulous people, plenty to do, or not!
Summary: I'm enjoying a few days here by myself while hubby works.  He will join me for the second half of the week.  The staff is excellent, the resort is beautiful and well-kept.  There are plenty of activities to do, or not to do! The location is great for dining, walking, or relaxing.  I walked into town everyday to eat, shopped at Fashion Island, walked the beach.... the possibilities are endless!

This resort was absolutely wonderful. The staff went out of there way to be helpful. I requested an ocean view prior to check in and Manny delivered on our request. Amazing views in blg 4400. 3rd floor. The front desk sent up a bottle of wine for my husbands birthday. The grounds are meticulous. A great starting off point to see the local area. We visited with my sister and her husband and saw many sights. Crystal cove is very quaint, Laguna beach area, Dana point, Huntington Beach, Catalina all within close proximity to this beautiful resort, I would highly recommend. There are also many great restaurants in the area. The front desk gives a Marriott card with recommendations of places to eat in area with a discount! Great touch. I will definitely go back!

The ocean views were awesome. The beds sooooo comfy. But.. Forget long deep sleeps or after naps. We were woken up 4 out of 7 days but wood chirppers...maint workers. ..leaf blowers etc.  Today  it started at 8 but most days 9. No coffee on the beautiful patio for us. Coming from the east coast it was already a hassle to acclimate our sleep but the noise sure didnt help.
Manager Response: Thank you for your positive review of Marriott’s Newport Coast Villas!  We are thrilled you loved your luxury villa with the comfy beds.  Our team also appreciates your feedback regarding morning maintenance as we continually look to improve our guest’s experience.  Please visit us again on your next trip to California!

Summary: We loved our stay in our 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom villa.  The view was awesome.  The pools and hottubs relaxing.  The staff were above and beyond helpful and friendly.  The entire grounds were beautiful and very well maintained.  They have a shuttle service that runs all day dropping you off and picking you up at Cystal beach, and 3 shopping areas.  We are already making plans to return next year.

The Marriott Newport Coast Resort  is a clearly superior facility with an attentive staff. The rooms are all two bedroom, two bath, apartment-like accomodations.  The kitchens are fully equipped and fairly spacious. Although rated for a maximum of eight guests, each unit probably is more suited to four-six.   The location is on the side of a hill above the Pacific Ocean with views of the coast and the golf course sited below.  There are continuing daily cultural and fitness activities and the location is near many varied restaurants, shopping opportunities, tourist attractions, etc. We've been guests several times and fine the resort suits us ideally. Guests should be aware that check-in is 4 pm or later and check-out, 10 am. This is a well maintained resort and offers first

We have returned to Marriott Newport Coast Vills for about the last six years for a short break from the Canadian winter, especially welcome this winter (2013/2014). The weather in California was exceptional for visitors, although rain and cooler temperatures would be very welcome for the locals as the heat and drought resulted in many difficulties. We have found the weather in past years to be pleasant, with highs normally up to about 70, cool nights, and probably one to two days of cloud and rain per week.  The property is very well maintained and clean, with an overall air of elegant and relaxed luxury. The staff are friendly and responsive to any reasonable request. We have come to know several of the staff, so it's like returning home on our visits.  The villas are one of

Summary Heading: A week of spectacular sunsets and beautiful, warm January weather
Summary: We just completed a beautiful week at Marriott's NCV.  We are Marriott owners, but this time exchanged through II using Shell points. Our  2 bedroom villa in Building 4400 had a beautiful ocean view, and though at first it seemed a bit far from the 3 pools, it was only a 5 minute walk from there to the main pool or the Canyon pool.  Everything was up to Marriott Vacation Club standards, and the landscaping, grounds, pools and views were gorgeous.  One night we enjoyed steaks grilled at the terrace next to our building, and another night had a lovely sunset dinner at the Beachcomber Cafe at Crystal Cove. We drove that night, and the $15 parking charge is waived by showing your receipt. We did use the NCV shuttle one day for Crystal Cove, which was convenient and the driver
Manager Response: We appreciate your positive review of Marriott’s Newport Coast Villas!  As Marriott Vacation Club owner, we take great pride in providing you with an exceptional vacation experience.  We hope to welcome you back soon and thank you for your review!

Summary: We were lucky enough to exchange a time share week for a stay at this property.  It was a beautiful 2 bed and bath villa with a view of the golf course and ocean.   Sunrise and sunset on our balcony was wonderful.   The property is beautifully maintained with multiple options of pools, hot tubs, exercise rooms, spa, activities or just a place to relax and do nothing.  There is also a basketball court, tennis courts, putting green, ping pong, pool tables and lifesize chess/checkers out by the pool.  Exercise classes (zumba and yoga) are held several times weekly out by the pool as well.  The only negative I can think of is that there is only one small place to order food by the pool and the menu is quite limited.  There is a small convenience store and many restaurants within a

Summary Heading: Beautiful Resort in Prime Oceanfront Locatoin
Summary: As timeshare owners, we always look forward to exchanging into a Marriott-owned location and once again, we have not been disappointed with the high standard of amenities.  Newport Coast Villas is a massive complex in the Spanish style (tiled roofs and pastel stucco) which is centrally located to the Pacific Coast Highway and endless sightseeing, shopping, golf, surfing, fishing, hiking trails, local farmers' markets and tour opportunities.  That said, for those who want to simply stay on the resort and relax, there are 3 magnificent pool areas, complete with shuffle boards, pool tables, hot tubs, swimming pools and firepit/barbeques.  An on-site tuck shop offers basic grocery items and wine/beer/liquor and newspapers, etc. for those last-minute or forgotten items.  The local

Summary Heading: Incredible Time at Newport Marriott Coast Villas
Summary: Our stay was from Sunday 01/05-01/12/14.There were many fans there from Auburn or Florida St. for the BCS game about an hour drive to Pasadena. We own a Marriott timeshare at Shadow Ridge in Palm Dessert and this is our second stay here at the Marriott in Newport. Prior to arriving, my son and I met Mike( a rep. of the resort) at a golf tournament and he recommended that we call ahead and request the 4000, 4100 or 4200 buildings. I placed the request and instantly was impressed how kind the front desk staff was. We got our request fulfilled and were located on the ground floor of building 4000-unit 4012, and had an incredible ocean view unit that overlooked the 3rd fairway and green of the Pelican Hill golf course. We even saw whales a few times in the distance with our

This is perhaps one of the finest resorts in a beautiful location.  Being timeshare owners in Florida we have traded numerous times and are going back in April.   You sit atop the cliff and th  overlooking the ocean and a championship golf course.  The views are breathtaking.  We must say the only and I say only drawback is the hike to the higher buildings.  If you are not used to walking request the lower building but you will not have the view.  I love this place!!! note June is fog month and the winter months can get quite cold for California!!

Summary Heading: One of the best vacations ever
Summary: We just completed a 10 day stay and if I would have known how great it was we would have planned for a longer trip. All the villas are 2BR and roughly laid out the same, the only differences would be the view. They're probably about 1100 sqft. with 3 42" flat screens, wifi, full kitchens with tons of pots, pans, etc. It's easily a 4-1/2 star property.   But the best part is the pools. There are 3 big pools heated to the mid 80s. Very comfortable. Plus 2 hot tubs. They have outdoor pool tables, ping pong tables, a basketball court, putting greens, barbecue pits, kids playground, you name it, they have it. They have daily activities for adults and kids, my kids did scavenger hunts, pirate days, movies, arts and crafts, but their favorite was smores by the campfire.  They appear to
Manager Response: We are happy to read your five-star review of Marriott’s Newport Coast Villas!  It certainly means a lot to us that  you had one of the best vacations ever at our resort.  Thank you for your positive feedback and we look forward to your next say with us!

Summary: Have stayed at several Marriott Vacation Club properties before but this is THE BEST.  We were in the 4100 building.  The master bedroom & L/R overlooked the #3 hole of the Pelican Hill Golf Course, Pacific Coast Highway & the ocean.  Stunning sunsets every evening from the comfort of the balcony.  A short 5-minute walk & we were in Crystal Cove State Park walking on the beach.  There is a Pavilions & Trader Joe's grocery stores nearby if you want to eat any of your meals in the fully equipped kitchen.  A mere 10-minutes from the Orange County airport made transportation quick & convenient.  Fashion Island mall (WOW) only 10 minutes away.  Huntington Beach, Balboa Island, Dana Point, Laguna Beach, all within minutes.  Can't wait to come back & spend another glorious week here.

Wow! What a beautiful scenic location. Being from Alabama we have the world's best beaches. That being said, this was a beautiful area. Very quiet, peaceful, panoramic, beyond expectations.    The 2 bedroom Villa was very comfortable. Amazing views. Wonderful for our extended weekend. All that being said we were happy.  The kitchen which we only used to chill drinks, and heat food in microwave , could use an update.   The good far outweighed a few items that could be updated. Yes, I would return to this location, and suggest it to a friend.   The State park across the PCH was beyond delightful, and went there 2 mornings and had breakfast on the beach. A must do if you stay in this area!
Manager Response: We are thrilled you enjoyed your vacation at Marriott’s Newport Coast Villas!  We appreciate your positive review and are glad to be your second favorite beach location.  Please visit us again on your next trip to Newport Beach!

Summary: Went to the property as a family and stayed in a 2BR condo close to the pools.  Stayed there for three nights, and headed to Pasadena for the BCS Championship on one day.  So in all, we spent on full day at and around the property.    Rooms were comfortable, the kitchen was adequate, and the washer/dryer was nice to have.  It's reminiscent of most nice Marriott resorts, which I would say is a good thing.  The pullout beds from the couches actually have nice mattresses, something you rarely see.  It makes a difference.    The property itself is sprawling, but the pool area is clean and family friendly.  In the coldest part of the winter for the US, we were swimming during the day in the heated pool.  There is so much to do though, with the massive chess board, the ping pong, pool

Summary Heading: Ideal getaway from the Central Valley
Summary: We came to unwind from the hustle and bustle and cold weather.  Could not have asked for a better time. Our two bedroom, partial ocean view, was everything we needed and more.  Although it is a little tricky getting,our room and location made up for that.  All the comforts of home with a wonderful view.  We enjoyed watching the sun come up and set from our balcony.  We will visit again.

I came here with my mother and two children to unwind after the holiday.  We are having the best time.  This was a perfect getaway. The staff has been friendly and the service good.  There are plenty of activities for the kids to take part in.  The property location is really great and I have walked the entire property and I don't think there would be a bad room location.  Every day they have had music or ice cream or smores.  There are pool tables and ping pong tables. My kids are ready to move in.  Our room(s) very nicely appointed and well cared for.  I would highly recommend this place.  You can stay on property and do plenty or leave and have fairly easy access to many places nearby.  Great vacation. Thank you Marriott!

The hotel locates on the Coast Dr off high way 73. It locates on the side of the valley with an amazing ocean view. I have stayed in a two bedroom apartment which offers two bedrooms, a living room, a kitchen, two bathrooms, and a washer and dryer.  The hotel offer verity of services such as barbecue station to enjoy your day.  The property was quiet and clean. I believe this is the best Marriott I have ever stayed in.

Summary Heading: Ideal for a family vacation, not for those who like a quality hotel experience.
Summary: I stayed in a 2 bedroom Villa which I must say was a very nice villa. The kitchen was fully equipped, the bedrooms large and an ample living room/ dining area. Aside from the invasion of Ant's , which caused us to leave for a few hours while they fumigated, not a bad place. In fairness they compensated me 200 dollars for enduring the lingering fumes. It has plenty of activities for the kids and the pool is the center of all the fun. As a parent of grown children, not such a great place for fun and or convenience. There is no room service so if you want to eat it's buy food at a near by store and cook or dine at the pool bar for typical bar menu. If you do not get a Villa close to the pool, you will regret it....To walk all the way to the pool from the far side of the resort is
Manager Response: Thank you for visiting Marriott’s Newport Coast Villas.  Our team is disappointed that we were unable to meet your expectations on your recent stay with us.   While ants are never a welcomed sight, we are happy the front desk worked with you to resolve the problem.  We also appreciate your feedback about the Marriott Vacation Club preview tour and apologize you did not fully enjoy the experience.  Marriott Vacation Club is a great option for many families looking for vacation ownership with the service only Marriott can provide.  We hope you decide to join us again and thank you for your review.

Summary: Loved the spacious 2 bedroom villas as a good alternative for families to 2 interconnecting hotel rooms. Our one night stay was too short to explore the resort amenities. Ground floor villas had great ocean views but the noise from villa above was a negative
Manager Response: We are happy you chose Marriott’s Newport Coast Villas on your quick family getaway!  As a loyal Tripadvisor contributor, we appreciate your positive feedback about your recent visit with us.  We look forward to hosting your family again in the future!

Summary Heading: Good resort in a beautiful area
Summary: We are owners at Marriott Vacation Club in Marbella, and exchanged our week for a week in Newport Coast Villas in Southern California in September 2013. Which was nice :-)  Prior to our visit we requested a room on a high floor with an ocean view - and managed to get both in building 4300 (I think..) which was great. This resort is bigger than the European MVCI resorts - there are pools and hot tub areas at each "end" of the resort as well as a larger pool area at the centre of the resort. I think this was the first time I have ever driven to a pool area in the same resort! (It is walkable, but when in Rome….)  The room was up to the normal high standards we have seen in other Marriott Vacation Club properties. Compared to the European resorts the pools and hot tubs were

Summary Heading: Is it correct to service the bins at 0530 hours I don't think so customer service
Summary: This was the first week of a two week california stay week 1 in coast villas and week2 in palm desert. Having never been to the resort we asked for a quiet room out of the way of any noise. We were given a ground floor room with great views in the 4500's. The decor was good and had everything we requested except for quiet. We had the village idiot who decided to clean the bins at 0520 so as to wake us up nice and early. complained to reception was given apology and 25$ credit and told it wouldn't happen again. It did was dealt with by chris one of managers who gave me nothing except a promise that we would be all treated at palm springs as he knew one of managers . well Chris they haven't heard from you didn't get your email if it was ever sent and there service is a lot better
Manager Response: Thank you for visiting Marriott’s Newport Coast Villas.   We apologize your concerns were not resolved in a timely manner and can understand your frustration with the early morning disturbance.    We would be happy to speak with you about your stay and invite you to contact our Customer Care team at customer.care@vacationclub.com or by calling 800-860-9384.  Thank you again for visiting and we hope to welcome you back soon.

Summary: I was here in October with a friend and now here for a week before Christmas.  I requested a room in the 1700 building, third floor (they have elevators and luggage carts) and both times was given the requested room.  The view is incredible and just a short stroll to the beach.  The staff are friendly and accommodating.  The activities range from sports to crafts to free wine and cheese socials.  Rooms are large, well appointed and beds are comfortable. They offer free wi-fi and free parking, but also have a free shuttle to area beach towns and malls.  Couldn't ask for more!!!!

Drove over to LA from St George without a reservation. As Internval International members we headed here first as availability was showing on internet agents. Reception were very helpful and found us an apartment for the week. As usual, it was the required Marriott standard - the same as every other Marriott which is great - you know what to expect and you will not be disppointed.  The apartment was spacious, clean and the bed was really comfy. The only things we could have done with were egg cups & some bubble bath. Pool area lovely, staff fantastic. thank you
Manager Response: Thank you for visiting Marriott’s Newport Coast Villas!  We are thrilled to receive a five-star rating from a well-traveled guest such as yourself.  Please come visit us again soon!

Summary: My wife and I stayed here in December 2013.  The property is beautiful and the service is excellent.  We really enjoyed the friendliness of all of the employees!  The location of the resort is perfect, close to the beach, restaurants and shopping.  We plan on coming back sometime in the next year and this time we will bring more family members with us!  Thanks for a wonderful time!
Manager Response: Thank you for your five-star review of Marriott’s Newport Coast Villas!  Your kind words are appreciated and we hope you get a chance to visit us again in the future.

Summary: Beautiful property.   Located on the coast of Southern California.  Very close to Laguna beach, Newport Beach and Huntington Beach.  We had a 2 bedroom villa with a view of the ocean.  Everything was very nice in the villa.  Very spacious.  Furniture was comfortable.  The grounds were spectacular.  The views are outrageous.  Now for the bad...which isn't really bad.  The pool bar closes at 6pm and is not open when it rains.  There is a lack of on property places to eat.  The BBQ's were very clean and easy to get to.  Timeshare sales pitch was a little annoying.  Very much enjoyed our stay.

Seriously one of the best hotels so far...checked in and our room was close to pool. We have a service dog who was so welcomed. Music at sunset and honestly  just a great property! Parking e  Was a little difficult but not awful. We were allowed to park and unload when we thought we couldn't. The front desk actually showed us to our route to our room.

The location is close to the ocean. some rooms have a view. There is very limited parking and you need to go along distance to get around. The units are set up very nicely. The kitchen living room was situated to accommodate 6 people. The bedrooms had good storage and room sizes. It was quite comfortable for 4 people.

We traded our Cabo timeshare for this in Newport Beach to celebrate my husband's birthday in OC.  After reading all of the reviews and tips, we were situated in a two bedroom suite right on the golf course and ocean view!  Wow!  Sunrise and sunsets every day where we spent every day of our 7 day stay.  After a day of fun, we made sure we were back on our balcony with drinks in head for the show each evening.  The staff was excellent!  I felt like I was at a high end resort.  My only complaint with Marriott properties, is that although they have a million pools and atleast three hot tubs on site, they will NOT designate one as "adults" only.  This really is a problem for me because I do not want to get into a hot tub with a baby in swim diapers!  Yuk!   I thought there might be

Summary Heading: Mice in room, no view, dirty walls
Summary: My family and I left today. We have both been Marriott elite members for years. We called ahead to ask for a rooms with a view and were assigned basement units. One has a dirty wall where the prior occupants must have splashed coffee or something which was never cleaned. On our second day we found mice in the couch hideaway bed. Nice grounds and should have been a nice stay but was not.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us at Marriott’s Newport Coast Villas.  We sincerely apologize for the room conditions you encountered on your most recent stay.  This is not typical for our resort and does not meet the Marriott standards you are accustomed to receiving.  We would like the chance to speak with you further regarding your visit.  At your earliest convenience, please contact our Customer Care team by email at customer.care@vacationclub.com or by calling 800-860-9384.  Thank you again for staying with us and taking the time to provide your feedback.

Summary: We stayed here for two nights as our base in the OC. Initially I was concerned that maybe I hadn't made the right choice in regards to the location as we didn't have a car, but I was wrong - it was perfect!  We were in Villa 3140 which had the best view straight out to the water, full kitchen facilities and washing machine/dryer. There was a mini mart on site which served Starbucks and the complimentary shuttle was frequent to Laguna Beach, Fashion Island and other local locations.   I could easily have spent a week here and would love to return!

Came to town to visit friends and hit up the SoCal surf before it got too cold. Drove down from LAX (~an hour without traffic) and had no problems with check-in even though I arrived late at night. If you get a friendly front desk rep. ask and see if they can get you into the building of your choice. Some want the golf course view, some want close proximity to the pool for their kids, some want the beach view, so to each their own. I asked for a beach view villa and got one on the 3rd floor in building 2500. The  sunrise and sunset views were breathtaking!  Newport Beach/ Balboa Peninsula is conveniently located 20 minutes north of the resort. If you're looking to go surfing, stand-up paddle boarding, fishing or bicycling on the pier this is the place to be. Also, lots of great

We were lucky enough to stay in a two bedroom unit at the Marriott's NewPort Coast Villa's.  The location and the villa's are outstanding -  rooms very spacious and well appointed. Lovely gardens and views - free shuttle service to certain destinations which is really good if you don't have a vehicle.

Beautiful property for easy access to all tourist attractions. My family rented one of the two bedroom units. Full kitchen, three tv's, great patio. Easy trip to Disneyland and the beach communities. We love these units, for cooking our meals if we want or having food delivered with plenty of room to eat. Pools were very nice and the view of the coast was gorgeous!

This property is located just accross the street from the pacific ocean and the views from our room (4012) were outstanding......all employees were friendly and eager to please....the amenities are very nice and the villas are large and nicely appointed....I had no complaints.

Summary Heading: Nothing to bring us back here...
Summary: Our stay was not necessarily unpleasant...except for the apathetic staff... We just did not get a "resort" or "hotel" feel.  Here is nothing to fondly recall or to bring me back there when there are so many other options.

Lovely vacation location, the theme is Tuscan with Villas in the cliffs overlooking the ocean. Extremely well maintained.  Beautiful topiary, reminiscant of a Tuscan village with cobble stone streets.  Lovely fountains, and pools...drivers with golf carts to take you wherever you want to go on the resort grounds...shuttle to take you to shopping and local sites.  The condos are in excellent condition, very clean, with updated furniture, two bedrooms, two bathrooms, Master with jacuzzi tub and large walk in shower.  Full living room and dining room. Granite kitchen with full stove, refrigerator, microwave, and everything you would need to prepare a meal.  Dishes, silverware,glasses, pots, pans, blender....etc...  The front desk/housekeeping services were "on point".  When you

These condos were great.  Even though they weren't on the beach it was a ten minute walk to the beach.  The complex was wonderful.  You felt like you were in an Italian villa.  We were on the ground floor and from the living room and the master bedroom you had a view of the ocean.  The bedrooms were nice but the front one look onto the parking lot and was a little noisy, it also had a sleeper sofa but couldn't image using it.  It seemed like a strange arrangement in a small bedroom. The common pool areas had pools, hot tubs, BBQ grills, pool tables and other outdoor games.  It was perfect for couples or families.  There are beach restaurants a 20 minutes walk away. There is also Newport Beach a quick car drive away. Disneyland was a 20-30 minute drive.We will be back.

We stayed at this location in order to attend the wedding of our daughter's best friend at the Resort at Pelican Hill- directly across the street.  Our daughter & son-in-law experienced some confusion when they first checked-in, but we were able to resolve it by the time we arrived a few hours later.  We stayed in a two-bedroom suite #1422- which I pre-selected, thinking it would have a good view.   I was definitely wrong- it looked out on a back alley & fir trees.  However, the suite itself was immaculate, and had everything we needed to be comfortable.  Unfortunately, we didn't plan ahead to bring snacks, water, etc.  So, we had to go to the small convenience market on site, in order to find last minute things.  But, all in all, everything worked out fine.  Marriott even

Summary Heading: One of my very favorite places
Summary: I try to visit this resort 1-2 times a year. The accommodations are absolutely wonderful. All of the units are 2 bedroom , 2 baths. They also have a full kitchen and a washer and dryer. Many have an ocean view.

Summary Heading: Now this is what I am talking about!! Excellent!
Summary: This is the second time we have stayed at Marriott's Newport Coast Villas. As always, Marriott exceeds expectations. Let's first start with the staff. Friendly, professional and always willing to help. The entire property is manicured, clean and well kept. The villas are amazing! We were in a two bedroom villas with a full kitchen with a lanai.(Actually, I think all of the villas are 2 bedrooms) The villas are spacious, clean and have all the comforts of home. All of the appliances, TV's, and pots and pans are state of the art and are quality items. The maid staff were timely and did an excellent job. The pools were amazing. They were huge with lots of lounge chairs and lots of room to spread out. The poolside bar had excellent food with flat screen TV's. You can't beat the

We stayed at this "hotel" to take care of some business in the LA and Laguna Beach areas, this location worked well for us.   The layout of the 2 bedroom condo was great and it was very well appointed. My only complaints were fairly minor - we were on the second floor so we had small ocean views, I would have liked it if they could have provided some spices in the kitchen (they offered salt and pepper packets only), and my adult daughter's room was right above the playground. This got VERY noisy for her. It would have been nice to know about the playground location when we checked in.  The weather was terrible while here (sorry, but it really does rain in southern California!) so we didn't get to try out the pool but it was beautiful. The whole facility was great and the staff

Very nice timeshare property.  All room are 2 bed, 2 bath, full kitchen and 2 sofa bed's so while it advertises sleeps 6, it can really sleep up to 8 assuming 2 are children.  I was extremely pleased with the cleanliness.  I got a below average location in building 1000, with no view.  Otherwise, would be a 5 star.

Newport Coast Villas are at the high standards Marriott Vacation Clubs have worldwide.  The property is large and there are several pools to chose from.  You will want to try and reserve a room with a view.  I would suggest having a rental car.

We visited this timeshare for the first time earlier this month.  Our room was on the top floor of the 4300 building giving us a great ocean view.  The only thing I didn't like about the room was the balcony.  It was small and crowded with the table and four chairs.  As we walked around the hilly property, I did notice that there was a lot of differences between balconies as far as size and railing types.  Other than that, the unit was similar to most Marriott timeshares, which means it has everything you need for your week.  There was lots to do on site for four adults.  We practiced our putting, used the fire pit, played corn hole, took the shuttle to Crystal Cove, and attended classes in Zumba, yoga, and jewelry making.  There was a nice cocktail welcome with live music.

Just returned home to AZ after 5 nights at Newport Coast Villas.  This is my first review ever on Trip Advisor and I felt compelled to let others know how much we LOVED this resort.  Full disclosure- We are Marriott owners so we do love Marriott but this place was exceptional.  We have been to Hawaii and all through the US with our ownership but Newport Coast takes the cake! My husband and 2 kids didn't want to leave. From the pools to the villas, this was just an awesome place.  On this vacation we felt like we stepped into a Mediterranean paradise.  Villas are all 2 bedrooms and huge.  The woman at the front desk said they were going to refresh the rooms I believe next year.  Perfect place for kids and adults alike.  I took one star off my rating because there is no restaurant

Summary Heading: Marriott Newport Coast Villas is great family vacation
Summary: Our family of 5 (3 boys - 2, 3 1/2 and 8) really enjoyed the location and the on site amenities. We did not realize the weather would be so wonderful in mid October. This hotel is perfect for young families. We used the grills to cook chicken, hot dogs and hamburgers. We used the fire pit to roast marshmallows. The basketball court with 2 hoops was a wonderful surprise. The playground was perfect for kids 1-6. We spent a 1/2 day at Crystal Cove state park and enjoyed the quiet beach with tidal pools (small fish, hermit crabs,etc.). Water was almost 70 so warm enough to wade and swim although waves are a little rough for non swimmers and young kids. Disneyland was about 25 minute drive and then our last day we drove about 80 minutes to the San Diego Zoo. Our room was perfect for

Marriott does it right!  We had our family reunion at NCV and it was an amazing experience.  We had 5 villas for over 30 people.  The villas are very spacious and well laid out with high end touches (3 flat panel TV's, DVD player, granite countertops, jetted tub, washer/dryer). It sits on the hill with spectacular views of the ocean.  There are many onsite activities for families: swimming pools, hot tubs, patios with furniture, shuffle board, tennis/basket courts, fitness areas, gas fire-pits, gas grills, grass areas. You can even rent beach chairs, umbrellas, tennis racquets, etc.  They provide a free shuttle to take you around the large property or off the property to shopping areas, restaurants, and the beach.  My only complaint would be that there is a lack of lighting in

This is a time-share, standard hotel hybrid. There are time-share owners and there are seminars they hold to get you to purchase a time-share. The time-share owners get priority in the rooms with views, so if you are booking a room here like you would a standard hotel, don't expect the view of the pacific.   I did not have a problem with checking in earlier than 4, and the front desk staff seemed like they enjoyed doing their jobs. The rooms are spacious and large.  the large tub in the King room is a plus. I did not utilize the shuttles to the beach, but did see them run quite frequently. The grounds are well kept and make sure to utilize the BBQs on site.  If you need to purchase groceries there is a grocery store down the street.  If you do not want to sign up for the

We were in town for a last minute family event and stayed here for 4 nights.  The room is very spacious, and the location is really spectacular.  We had a view of the Pacific from our balcony.  We have stayed at many timeshare locations, and I would call this sort of timeshare+.  Its certainly not a luxury resort with daily turn down service, etc, but the service is much better than other timeshare properties we've experienced.  There is a daily "tidy" service, which included making the beds, refreshing the towels, unloading/loading the dishwasher, etc, but not heavy cleaning.  This was a very nice bonus.  The pool area was very nice, but we found the food at the poolside restaurant overpriced and mediocre (which is pretty much what we expected)  The rooms sleep 8 people...not 6

Newport Coast Villas are a top-of-the line Marriott timeshare property offering spectacular view of the Pacific Ocean and surrounding canyons.  The property is huge, but each building is small enough to keep it from feeling too crowded.  The units are all large two-bedroom apartments with all conveniences provided and with Marriott quality all the way.

We are Marriott owners.  Ever since we became owners, we always wanted to visit this resort.  We were very disappointed.  Our trip fell during the fourth of July, but the resort was not prepared for the crowds! The pools were too full, the saunas were full of children with lack of Marriott employees.  I would not recommend this resort.

Summary Heading: Enjoying our stay & already talking about returning
Summary: We're in the middle of a 10-night stay here at Marriott's Newport Coast Villas, and I already want to share my great experience. First off, we know the difference between a luxury timeshare property and a luxury resort, unlike some reviewers who have shared their experiences.  We know that we're not going to have daily turndown service or room service options or a fine restaurant on property.  So please do your homework; this is a timeshare property, and so it may be lacking in some amenities, and there will be offers of sales presentations (which you do not have to attend, by the way), and owners in the Marriott Vacation Club may be given priority in choice of rooms.  That out of the way -   This is a beautiful property!  The location cannot be beat; every building seems to

We have been owners at Newport Coast Villas since there were just a handful of units. A very family friendly place. Getting a room with a great view seems increasingly difficult. It is a shame as they added units they didn't care about guests ability to park a car after 7:00 pm. The Property is lovely and a nice walk to Crystal cove State park. I thought the "New Lobby decor" is laughable and doesn't go at all with the Mediterranean architecture of the property.  It looked like something I've seen in a  modern Shanghai high rise hotel!  My daughter and I had a good laugh over it. Despite poor taste in lobby decor the rooms are great for a family.  We always have a wonderful time and have made great memories over the years.

This place has a great location to the beach and town while being very self contained.  Enjoyed my 4 day vacation grilling on the grounds as well as the swimming pool, activities and close location to the beach.

This is such a beautiful property located on a cliff overlooking the Pelican Hill Golf Course and the Pacific Ocean.  The condo was so beautifully appointed and had a great floor plan - two separate bedrooms, each with their own bathroom.  Lovely kitchen with everything you need for cooking meals.  Lovely dining area & living room.  The view from our unit was breathtaking, overlooking the 5th hole at Pelican Hill.  The beds were comfortable & it was very quiet.  We can only say good things about our stay -- staff was great & accommodating in every way.  This is a first-class property & you won't find anything nicer in Newport Beach for the price.

A very pretty resort, just too large with an impersonal feel. Villas are well equipped and all areas are kept immaculate. La vista pool side bar serves salads and fast foods, bartender Roger was very friendly and attentive, made great drinks. The market place did not have enough staff to deal with demand, cold coffee, poorly managed. Pools, all beautifully situated throughout the resort but wake up Marriott and give us adults visiting without kids an Adult Only pool. You do it in Aruba and Spain so why not here. When we travel with our grand kids more than happy to sit poolside and listen to Marco Polo! While we were staying it appeared as if the pool near the building 5100 had been rented for a private party, a large number of people seemed to take over the area with loud

Stayed for 3 nights at this gorgeous property in a extremely clean, modern deluxe 2 bedroom villa. We were made to feel very welcome by the lovely Joanie at the front desk who went out of her way to get us checked in early and fill us in on all the great local eateries. The property it self is huge, very well maintained and it was just lovely to be able to either relax by the pool or get involved with the many family orientated things that happen most days. We just loved our stay.

We recently spent a week at the Marriott Newport Coast.  This was our second time there and we had an enjoyable stay.  We were in building 4400 on the second floor.  We had requested a higher floor but with the second floor, we could still see a decent view of the ocean.  Being on the 2nd floor, we could hear to people above us walking (or clomping) around and could hear their somewhat muffled voices.  They were usually speaking in the “outdoor” voices (that is, fairly loudly).   Of the 6 different Marriott locations that I’ve stayed at, this one seems to have the least amount of sound deadening.  Unfortunate….  BTW, the units on the upper floors have the best views.  The units from 3800 on up to 5000 are a bit newer, are higher on the property and probably have the better

We own a week timeshare with Marriott, so we exchange to different locations. This location is great! There is so many things to do in the vicinity of the place. Restaurants choices are many...all different prices and varieties. The ocean is across the street. They have a ton of shopping nearby. I liked that we could drive an hour to be in San Diego or an hour the other way to L.A....more options for fun. The rooms are all two bedroom and very spacious. The weather is usually 70-80 range which is nice. Fly into LAX instead of John Wayne...more flights and much cheaper.

Summary Heading: One of the most Beautiful Resorts we have ever stayed in!
Summary: My family and I stayed at the Marriott Newport Coast Villas the week of Sept 1-6 and were very impressed with the BEAUTIFUL grounds and fantastic Villas that are offered.  No room would be a bad location in this place!! The housekeeping is impeccable and the appliances were top of the line.  I want to personally thank Ms. Berit Stingley, for accommodating my request!  We loved the room!  Can't wait to come back!!

Summary Heading: beautiful resort, beautiful location, excellent facilities
Summary: Stayed September 7th for one week in a top floor 2 bedroom villa (suite/apartment) in the 4700 building. Arrived at 6.00pm and check in was very quick and smoothly handled by Adam. Had requested a top floor villa/room with ocean view, and was offered top floor, canyon view prior to my arrival. There were no ocean views available. This was perfect. There are a lot of negative comments on TripAdvisor about NOT getting an ocean view. I think there are so few of the rooms built high enough to actually get an ocean view, it really isn't worth fretting over whether you get one or not. The gardens and landscaping are amazing, and absolutely beautiful. The lush trees are tall enough to 'block' ocean views from lower rooms. The resort is built on a hillside NEAR the ocean, and is not

Summary Heading: Amazing Resort.  Great for Kids.  A Walker's Paradise.  May Just be the Best deal in SoCal
Summary: First of all this is a very large and expansive resort.  The Villas feel like a community more than a hotel.  If you are very heavy-set or physically unable to walk you will want to ensure your rooms are near the area of the resort you want to stay.  We enjoyed everything about this resort.  They have daily activities for kiddos—fish feeding, root beer floats at the pool, s'mores at one of the many fire pits, ect.  There are daily welcome drinks for the adults and they have a free shuttle that takes you to Crystal Cove and Laguna beach on the hour.  Service was top notch and were treated very well.  We requested a room on the first floor near the Tide pool.  The Tide pool has the kids pool. No problems at check-in and our room was ready when we got there.   Great rooms—top of

Summary Heading: Best Family Resort I have stayed in
Summary: This is the best family resort I have ever stayed in. The location is nice in Newport area, which is a nice and upscale area in southern Los Angeles, although it is quite far from the tourist attractions, but if you have a car, this will not be a real issue. The villas (apartments) are nice and spacious, all the apartments are the same, it have 2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, full kitchen with washing machine, and a living room. There are a lot of activities, like some sports (mini golf, basketball, table tennis, tennis, and much more). The kids will really like it, specially with the kids playground, the arcade room, and the swimming pools. The only disadvantage is the all the rooms have a king size bed, no twin beds.

Really great resort. Very convenient, with all the facilities. Huge condos, fully equipped. Very clean, handled by an efficient and courteous staff. Perfect location, minutes from beach cities. Easily reachable with the PCH. Without any hesitations we will come back here.

Loved the room and the resort.  We wish they would be more descriptive about shuttle service.  We drove to Crystal Cove but once we parked and paid for shuttle service we found out Marriott Provided complimentary service.  Otherwise the stay was excellent.

The location of this Marriott Resort Apartments is amazing and a beautiful setting.  Being a Marriott Vacation Club owner in Spain, I can't but compare it with the one in Spain.  The location of the newport Beach Villas is great, The resort lacked the feeling of a gate Community as the ones in Spain, which is a bit less secure when you have kids.  The main pool was way too crowded upper pool was a bit dirty with stuff floating around! the lower pool was awesome!  A lack of on resort Market (one available was way to limited in what it offered), so you will have to depend on local newport store to get your things!  Service of staff was below what I expected form a Marriott resort, too busy to care about giving the top level service one would expect.  Was surprised the cleaning
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. Your experience is not typical of the guest experience at our resort and we would appreciate an opportunity to personally address your concerns.  Please contact us at customer.care@vacationclub.com or at 800 860 9384. .

Summary: We own a Marriott Time Share and spend several days each year at this Marriott situated on the Pacific Ocean at Newport Coast.    You do not have to own a time share to rent a unit at this Marriott.    Each unit is 2 bedroom/2bath fully furnished including a washer and dryer.  The units we have used all have a balcony overlooking the Pacific.  There are several pools, shuffle board and other areas including a workout center and a golf course.    Nearby is Laguna Beach, down the road is San Juan Capistrano and so many other places to visit too numerous to mention.  About 2 hours South is San Diego.      If we win the lotto we are moving to Newport Coast - it is to die for!  Moderate Weather Year Round.

We went to the marriot after attending a seminar in Palm Springs. We are marriot timeshare owners so we knew we were going to get "the speech" had no intention on buying a second timeshare but were talked into because we really like the new point system. The resort is beautiful but you do have a difficult time getting one of the villas with a view. If you're  lucky enough to get one you have magnificent view of the pacific. The villas are clean and well kept. It certainly isn't Pelican Hill (across the road, which we stayed previously ) but it's about half the price.

Stayed here for the weekend, finishing up a California week vacation. We had no idea it was a timeshare but upon checking in I figured it out in 3.4 seconds.  A few polite No thank you and I brushed thru the door like the cool Ocean wind.  They called my room a few times but I never answered. The rooms are quite nice and plenty of room.  We were on the bottom floor (not the greatest) but we were close to the pool and BBQ where I was dieing to cook my own meal so I didn't care. The unit had very nice and large tv's however the cable was down and they never worked for anyone in this section. The pool was very comfortable and it was full of kids which was fine because we were a family as well.  The one thing you need to know ismitmis a very large property so if you plan to walk to

I'm an owner at this property and have stayed here a number of times before.  We are here on a weekend package price (we had a family event in the area to attend) on the condition we attend an owners' presentation.  Being on the weekend package, we knew we weren't getting an ocean view.  (We actually have a nice garden view and a patio, so that part's OK.)  We didn't know that they've changed the parking rules such that the second car in our party had to park so far from our villa that we have to drive people too and from it.  The villas sleep eight (we have six here), and they provide two parking permits.  Our second car arrived at midnight, and it was a real burden that they couldn't be anywhere close to us.  We also got a villa that was downstairs from the street level with
Manager Response: We are sorry to hear that you did not have a positive experience at Marriott's Newport Coast Villas.  During periods of peak occupancy, it is necessary to restrict the number of parking spaces per villa.  The resort does offer a shuttle from the parking area to your villa.  Our resort is ADA compliant and all of out ADA villas have elevator and ramp access. The ice maker is emptied and cleaned after every guest to ensure it is sanitized for the next guest.  Your experience with the security staff is not  typical of the guest experience at our resort and we would appreciate an opportunity to personally address your concerns.  Please contact us at customer.care@vacationclub.com or at 800 860 9384.

Summary: We were impressed by this excellent well run resort. It was a great place for a holiday - we enjoyed the spacious 2 bedroom apartment and amenities. The 3 swimming pools are great, super warm and the grand-kids just loved them. There are 3 nice tennis courts, well maintained and easy to book. Everywhere at the resort, there was efficient and friendly service. The resort is very well located with a shuttle service to beautiful Crystal Cove beach which is close by. It is also close to Fashion Island, great for Newport Beach, Balboa Island and the peninsula.

Summary Heading: Nice way to end our road trip
Summary: We stayed here for 5 nights at the end of a month long road trip.  We wanted somewhere to put our feet up and relax.  This was just about perfect.  We had a two bedroom apartment and it was massive by European standards.  The main bedroom was huge, massive bath and a double shower.  It was also so good to have a proper kitchen, dining area and washer + tumble dryer.  The pools were great.  We based ourselves around the main three but there were others.  Facilities on site were good with the exception that we would have preferred to have had a restaurant where we can sit down and eat in the evening as there is nothing after the pool bar closes at 7.  It was explained to us by the timeshare sales rep ($250 free if you can stand the 2 hour pitch but not a hard sell) that as the

This is our second trip to Marriott's Newport Coast Villas.  This is just like many of the Marriott Timeshare properties with most units being 2 bedroom and living room spaces that sleep 6.  We like the NCV because it is in Newport, close to many beaches, shopping and restaurants.  We are owners at another Marriott property and were invited to attend a presentation in exchange for a special rate.  The property is large, and on a steep hillside, so it's a little work out walking from one place to another, there are shuttles though.  The Crystal Cove beach is at the bottom of the hill, and quite a hike if you want to walk.  The exercise facilities are well equipped.  The pool area is very popular, and filled with families and kids.  Lounge chairs by the pool were in high demand

We've stayed at the Marriott Newport Coast multiple times, enjoying the amenities at the resort and also those nearby.  The units are beautifully appointed and have everything a family and/or friends getaway.  The kitchens are set-up if the spirit moves you to cook or a multitude of restaurants are close if all you want to make for dinner is reservations!

Summary Heading: Better off Staying in Either Newport Beach or Laguna
Summary: Vast property with multiple pool but this is a time share and if you want to stay you have to listen to the pitch. Secondly, the buidlings are arranged in such ways that unless you're upgraded or lucky to get a west facing room, you will be living in a cave ( even worse if you find yourself on the first floor). The rooms are standard and offer all the comforts of home (esp. the kitchens). There are BBQ's throughout the property and a beach shuttle. However it the place has a compound feel and is made up to the quintessestial suburbia clientele. All in all average but after spending time in Newport Beach proper, i.e. the Balboa Yatch Club, and the Montage at Laguna Beach, you are better off spending the money at a nice resort than at the Marriott villas.

The villas are all beautifully laid out in well tended grounds. I was on holiday with my American cousins and we found all the staff friendly and helpful. Do ask for leaflets on local attractions. We found them in the computer room and not in the reception area!

Summary Heading: Be Careful What You Wish For
Summary: We have been Marriott users for the past several years, and have experienced some fantastic timeshare properties in Florida (we are not owners, but we enjoy renting the timeshare properties because of the romm configurations, full kitchen, washing machine etc). I was very much looking forward to staying at the Newport Coast property, but my experience did not come close to that of prior Marriott stays. Firstly, to reiterate what others have already pointed out, it is a huge property, so big in fact that to walk from the rooms at one end to the rooms at the other side would take a good 30 minutes. It is therefore quite impersonal, and the other issue this creates is parking. There are both indoor and outdoor lots - one day I drove around for 25 minutes looking for a empty space

Summary Heading: Concierge or CON-cierge, that is the question.
Summary: When I made a reservation for my husband and adult daughter and son to stay at the Newport Coast Villas in Newport Beach CA, I was excited.  The online photos of the rooms, so bright and well appointed, the full kitchens, the spacious balconies, the inviting pools, the luxurious lobby and most significantly, the panoramic ocean views of Catalina Island were just what I was hoping for.  In the box on Marriott's website which allowed me to express any requests or special needs for our stay, I wrote that I wanted a "room on a high up floor, non-smoking, with a view of Catalina Island".  I figured that was specific enough that I would receive a response if it was not possible to fulfill my requests.  And I made my reservation more than a month in advance, using my husband's Marriott

Summary Heading: Nice but if you aren't a member....
Summary: Our 2-bedroom villa was wonderful. Very clean and well equipped. We were here on a deal to become a Marriot Vacation owner. Because we weren't owner there were times, especially around the pool, when you felt like a 2nd rate citizen. The 1.5 hour Marriot "sales pitch" lasted over 3 hours and they were pretty pushy. The place is beautiful. They offer a shuttle to beach which is nice.

You need to realize what you are getting here.  It is a spectacular piece of property.  And the units are spacious and well done.  However, it is a BIG resort.  700 units spread over 50 buildings.  Lots of programming if you are into that.  The disappointment is in where they put you.  30% of the rooms we are told have ocean views.  I requested both a room with a view and a unit on a high floor (to help ensure a good view), but got neither.  Instead, first floor by the resort entrance.  It seems obvious to me they allocate the more desirable rooms for those in the Marriott time-share program.  We rented thru Expedia.    We won't go again.  $600 is too much to spend a night to not have any control or feel any confidence you'll get what you're looking for in terms of placement.

I just completed a week long stay at the villas and was as impressed as ever.  The villas come complete with all the items you need for cooking and enjoying life in southern California.  The locaiton of this resort is unmatched.  IT is right across Pacifc Coast Highway from Crystal Cove State Park so you can walk to the beach in the early morning and look for sea creatures int he tide pools.  IF you enjoy shopping, Laguna Beach and Fashoin Island in Newport are only 10 mintues away.  OF course there are other beaches within 20 minutes - Lguna, Newport , Huntington.  All offer surfing, boogie boarding, skimming or just sunning and swimming.  IF you want to stay on the resort, you can lounge by one of the many pools or enjoy some of the activities they have for the family.  In the

We took our two little kids (ages 3 and 5) there for a long weekend. We usually stay at Pelican Hill across the street but the rates at Pelican for that weekend were outrageous so we decided to try Marriott instead. The accommodations are very convenient if you are traveling with kids as it has 2 separate bedrooms and a kitchen so the kids shared a room and we had our privacy for the weekend. Kitchen comes very handy for snacks, milk etc. That is what you do not get at Pelican unless you get a villa there for $1,500-1,700/night.   Having said the above, we still LOVE Pelican way better. Marriott is a huge resort, very spread out and crowded. The service staff is OK, nothing to brag about. We were surprised to see that housekeeping does not really clean the rooms; they sort of

We loved this place so much last summer that we decided to make it happen again this summer even though a flight for 6 from Indiana can be financially steep. It was well worth it once again. This place is clean, super family friendly/family oriented, and provides a variety of outdoor activities for kids. We spent even more time this year by the pool, walking around the grounds,... and just continue to think of how we can make it happen again another summer.   The units are more spacious than you would expect making it more of a condo feel. The only thing that was a challenge this year was the parking lot seemed much more full than last year making it hard to find a spot at times. Other than that, I can't say enough good about this place!!!

Stayed here with family for the Pageant of the Masters in Laguna. The 2 bedroom suite was great and very comfortable. The resort is an excellent location to explore both Laguna and Newport beaches. Went by the pool for a little while and were not impressed with poolside service. Way too crowded and way too noisy. More pools are needed .

We came to Marriott's Newport Coast Villas for the second time. I really like Newport Coast Villas because of its size. This is a huge resort to stay in and met every expectation I had for Marriott Vacation Club. We were lucky enough to get an amazing view and a nice spot close to the grills. The main area is also huge and the pool there is also huge and spacious. The employees are, like always, friendly and happy to help and the activities are fun and great. There is even a complementary bus to take you around to the beach. The patio is nice and its great that the weather makes it great to sit outside for dinner. I defiantly recommend a stay here for it is spacious and well placed!

We stayed for a week in a 2-bedroom appartment. It has everything, very spacious, all the details were thought over, the kitchen is fully equipped by all the utensils, they even supply you for everyday cleaning: tabs for washing mashine, tide for laundry (which was in the appartment itself). The territory is big, many activities, there is a pool, but we didn't go there. We went to Laguna Beach. There is a shuttle to Crystal Cove, but if you like more deserted beach may be you better go to another one. We liked this hotel very much.

Summary Heading: Quality has gone down and forget getting a room with a view!
Summary: This was our second stay here. The first time was as at a preview cost and sat through the timeshare presentation. We almost bought one and now am so very glad we didn't. Our first visit was in November several years ago. Very different ambiance compared to July! The pools were packed with too many people in the hot tubs -- including young kids. The place is very family friendly with all kinds of events that one can join into if you like. Some are free and some costs a bit. We did not partake in any. This place isn't conveniently located to LA tourist attractions. It's up the hill from a beach are that is full of rocks. Interesting place to check out but not for swimming.   We booked our apartment (so called villa) through VacationsHomesOnly.com. Preston Green was very helpful

I had written a review on this before, but haven't seen it posted, so I will try again...We stayed at this resort July 4-9, 2013 and we did NOT get what we paid for.  When we booked this 2 bedroom unit, we thought we would get a room with a view which was why we paid $550 a night.  We are from the Midwest, so that is quite a chunk of change for us to splurge a night, and we ended up paying way less for TWO rooms at The Disneyland Resort with a great view!  When we first went to our room that was basically in a basement and the only view we had were some bushes, I called the desk to see if we could be moved.  They of course, came back with a rehearsed answer that their complex was at 100% capacity and being July 4th, I thought this maybe true.  We stayed in our unit that evening,
Manager Response: We're sorry to hear you did not enjoy your stay at Marriott's Newport Coast Villas.  Our resort was sold-out during your stay and first room priority is always given to owners of the resort.  However, we do not have villas in the "basement" and all of our rooms are luxury 2-bedroom villas with a full kitchen.  The nightly rate was a discounted offer and a good value for the summer in Newport Beach considering the cost of an average hotel room.  We appreciate you taking the time to share your feedback.

Summary: I have never been to such a lovely hotel, the place is like a honeycomb, a maze of a place. Once settled we took in the view and took lots of pictures of the room to the pool to the reception area.  We loved the poolside service, and enjoyed the atmosphere, it was very laid back. The prices are typical of staying inside the community.  We did make out way to the Newport Beach Fashion Island for lunch at Whole Foods, and it is very pricey to shop as most of the stores are posh and Rodeo Drive type stores.   All in all, it was lovely. The hotel is located 1/2 mile from the actual coast, but the view is wonderful from the hotel, and you can lounge at the pool and view the ocean.  Loved it!! Great place to take the family!

We took advantage of their 3 night promotion for about $500.00(rents out for about $600/night ) and had to listen to their promotion. The ladies were very nice and very informative.  The site is stunning, ocean views, several large pools, a playground for kids, teen hangout place, free shuttle to the beach, reasonably priced beach chair rentals etc. The grille/bar is expensive but they all are-mediocre food. We took our 6 yr. old granddaughter and she loved it. This is a great place for families of all ages. We highly recommend it.

We stayed here in May 2013 with our extended family, including kids from 2-5.  It was the perfect location and a great property with many conveniences for those with families.  Our room, which was 2 bedroom, 1 with a king and 1 with a queen, plus two sleeper sofas was great.  It was nice to have a full kitchen plus laundry in our room with the kids.   The pools are the perfect spot to play plus there's an outdoor grill with full service pool side if you want to lounge.  The location is also beautiful, with great views of the Pacific Ocean and is only about 5 minutes from downtown where there's plenty of great shops and restaurants.   And to top it off, you can't beat the price!  At $289 a night, I was thoroughly impressed with the property, maintenance, and level of service.

Stayed at Marriott Newport Coast Villas in June.  Quality was top notch. Views and setting were amazing. We saved money and bought at Redweek.com.  Paid $2000 for a week in June. We hope to return again.

First time visiting Newport Coast Villas and now having found this vacation gem we will definitely return year after year. The resort is very family friendly. The rooms are spacious offering 2BD, 2BA with a full kitchen and laundry. When you checkin you are given a weekly itinerary of things to do around the resort such as Wii competition, snow ones, crafts, caricature drawings, live music, wine tasting, dance lessons, tennis, basketball, playground, mini golf, onsite arcade, and a whole lot more. The views are amazing. The resort is large with over 700 units so they have shuttle service running throughout the property. My family and others roasted s'mores by the fire pit every night. There are two fitness centers on property so we never had issue with getting in our workouts.

Summary Heading: Service has gone down; Too many people
Summary: Like the reviewer below, we are Marriott Premier Owners. We have come here every summer since I can remember.  Positives: -Good/Avg Wifi -Soaps provided smells amazing -Suites are an excellent size -Activites -Good location  Negatives: Before there weren't as many people. I think they're letting anybody come, as before only certain people could. There are more crowds than ever. Customer service has gone down; probably because they think that us owners don't really matter anymore because we're already members and will probably stay loyal. They're probably just doing they're best for their new guests. We asked for a new room because we were supposed to have an ocean view, but our view was mostly covered by trees. They said "the entire place was booked". That's not possible; there

My family and I stayed here for ten (10) days in July.  We are Marriott Premier Owners, but this was our first trip to California.  The resort is beautiful, located on the hills across the PCH from the beach - with multiple Spanish or Italian style villas built onto many acres on the hillside.  The view from the lobby, and any villas in the building where the lobby is located, is spectacular - overlooking the three main pools, which are beautiful, and the Pacific, as well the landscaped property.  The problem is that if you aren't in this building, or one near it and on a high floor, you lose the sense that you are at a resort on the Pacific coast.  Our villa was on the first floor of building 1700.  The villa was well appointed and clean.  However, we had a view of trees off

Came here as a trial to see if we were interested in buying a timeshare.  Although purchasing isn't in the cards for us at this time, we loved the resort and had a fabulous time.  You can't beat the location, beauty of the resort itself, villa accommodations & activities offered.  Having a washer/dryer in the villa, having 2 separate bedrooms, a full kitchen and gas grills a few steps from our door were all welcome amenities!!  Great family vacation!

We stayed for a few days in April with two boys (16 & 12).  Our suite was perfect size. 2bdrm/2ba.  One had king, other queen with pullout sofa in room.  Additional pullout in living room.  Had full kitchen.  Main Pool area was nice with 2 good sized pools in one area. Boys played ping pong and jumbo chess in pool play area.  Lots of families were enjoying it.  Was full, but didn't feel too crowded as there are other pools on property.  We were a bit of a hike away, and up some steep steps, so ask about that if it's important to you. We used the gas bbq grills one night that are located at each building.  Close to Pelican Hill golf-hubby said was great.  Easy to get to spots in Newport Beach, both to sightsee and shop including grocery stores.  Made day trip to Disneyland (open

This was our third stay at this resort and by far the best.  Based on our experience, villa location is key to fully enjoying your stay (villas we occupied previously  had no views and small patios).  The grounds are beautiful and the views are breathtaking.  There are on-site activities for adults and children and without exception, each member of our family rated this a 5 star vacation.  There are several pools, a fitness center, kids' activity center, great shopping nearby and of course, the ocean.  We have already booked this resort for next June.

This is my favorite place to be. If you are an owner here you know what I mean. If you are looking to use this as a hotel-it's wonderful! Each and every unit has 2 bedrooms. Both rooms are beautiful. One sleeps 2, the other sleeps 4. The kitchen is stocked with all the plates,cups and utensils you need. I suggest bringing your own paper plates, ziplock baggies, aluminum foil and spices. We also like to bring a lantern for the patio at night. The best part of using this as a hotel is not having to pay exorbitant and ridiculous parking and resort fees, that nearby hotels charge.  It's all included. The Crystal Cove Beach across the street makes this the perfect OC destination.

the resort located in a good place which have a lot of activities and things you can do with your family, unfortunately the rooms has a different views  and the all of them have the same rate. if you were lucky you will stay at one have the ocean view. we enjoyed staying at the resort it was an excellent experience. the only negative thing is that there is no resturant in the hotel, the only thing they have is pizza hut

Summary Heading: Newport Coast, Terrible Service and Room
Summary: Just arrived at the Newport Coast Marriott. Was looking forward to our 3 night stay, but the day started by checking in at 1pm, getting a property sales pitch at the front desk and at the Concierge...twice in 10 minutes. Actually felt that I could not leave the Concierge until I gave my name...."No" was not good enough. We finally received a call that our room was ready after 4:30pm...kinda late!  Overall rates are +$600 per night, our Room is 1814, first floor, patio covered with bugs, very very dark and kind of wet! We are currently owners in at Park City Mountain, so we thought trying another villa was a good idea - Wrong! This one is bad!  We did call to try to exchange for a better room. Was told that we could check out tomorrow, wait until after 4pm to see if another room
Manager Response: We are sorry to hear that you did not have a positive experience at Marriott's Newport Coast Villas.  This is not typical of the guest experience at our resort and we would appreciate an opportunity to personally address your concerns.  Please contact us at customer.care@vacationclub.com or at 800 860 9384.  We look forward to hearing from you.

Summary: All units are two bedrooms with full kitchen and two baths. Most have ocean views. Although they are timeshares rentals are readily available through sites like red week.com. Disneyland is about 25 minutes away.

Summary Heading: Gorgeous property - get rid of the mildew, Marriott....
Summary: This resort is probably one of the most aesthetically appealing properties that I have visited. The villas are built into the rising terrain and most have ocean views. A lot of activities for families. Very very nice lobby. Shuttle service to public beaches and mega mall.  But c'mon,Marriott -recurring problem in units in warmer climate: mold and mildew in the shower. Not good, not good.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback on Marriott's Newport Coast Villas.  I was disappointed to hear about the issues you encountered with mildew in the bathroom.  Your comments have been shared with the appropriate manager so that corrective action can be taken to address this issue immediately.

Summary: This was a family vacation and we had three villas for the 15 of us.  We are in our 70s and did not believe the resort was that great.  However, our children (in their 40s) and grandchildren (4-22 years old) loved everything about the place.  While we spent two days at Disneyland and Knott's Berry farm, we mainly hung out at the resort, and overall we had a great vacation.  Negatives: On a hillside, and you will do a lot of walking and climbing steps.  No elevator in our building (but was one in adjacent building, so that you don't have to haul your luggage up and down stairs). Living area is somewhat dark because it is long and narrow with only the patio glass doors letting sunlight in.  While their photos show fantastic ocean views, a significant number of units have very

...but I could not shake the feeling that I was on a cruise ship.  Perhaps the feeling was due to the way the buildings hug the sides of the hills, and that everything seemed squished in together (yes I realize real estate there is REALLY expensive).  It may have been the crowded pools steps beneath the main building.  Or it may have been the various activities advertised.  I guess that is what a resort is all about.    However, when we arrived the place was a mob scene.  They seriously were in need of some traffic control in the loop in front of the check in area.  I guess that experience colored my feelings about our entire stay.  Having said all that, there are a number of good things to note.  The villas are very nice, with comfortable beds, serviceable kitchens and plenty

After spending a 30-Days wonderful family vacation in USA between Hawaii, Las-Vegas & LA in various lovely hotels, we have concluded our stay here!   Actually, I was saying to myself & my wife, accidents do happen, and, this is one of them...  Here is why?   1) Check-in at 4:00 PM and check-Out 10:00 AM ( not hotels standards.
