You feel trapped if you ever want to checkout earlier day and have to wake-up early with whole family). 2) Huge property with no warm entries, warm greeting gate, and,  also far away reception, pool, main lobby etc. 3) Plenty of Lovely Green-Grass Hoppers entering your room:) 4) All direction signs at night are not lighted-up or have lights on them! 5) Bed sheets are never changed during your stay unless you pay $16 per change! or ask for an early swap of
Manager Response: We are disappointed to read that you did not enjoy your stay at Marriott's Newport Coast Villas.  The resort is not a typical hotel experience and provides guests with many additional amenities, services, activities and luxury villa accommodations.  While a typical hotel check-in is at 4 pm and check-out at noon, cleaning a 2-bedroom/2 bathroom villa with a full kitchen requires additional time to ensure each unit is cleaned to the highest Marriott standards.  Your satisfaction is very important to us and if we did not provide the Marriott level of service that you expect and deserve, we would like an opportunity to appropriately address your experience.  Please contact our Customer Care office via email at Customer.Care@vacationclub.com or at 800-860-9384 so that we can personally address your concerns.

Summary: Marriott Newport coast villas knows how to throw a party!! 5 pools , face painting , tye dye, bingo, name that tune, kids club, bike rides, nearby beach, complimentary transportation, art festivals, tennis, firepit, outdoor bar, fireworks, gorgeous views... What's not to like??? We love it ! The best choice for a great beach week over the 4 th of July!

Stayed here in May 2013 for nephew's birthday. The property is huge and expansive. There are several clusters of buildings and it is easy to get lost but there are clear signs. The central building with the courtyard is fabulous. The beautiful Italian fountains are spectacular and the vintage car is adorable. Check in was easy and staff is friendly and will provide you with info and answer all your questions. The lobby has a great view of the pool! We got the key and drive to our villa-the unit is huge-2 bedrooms master and secondary but both complete with amenities and jacuzzi tub. They have a full kitchen, living and dining, perfect for families. The property is not beachfront, but you do have the beach view, lots of pools and activities for kids and adults. Close to Fashion

We stayed at the Marriott Villas from June 28th through July 5, which was a very busy week.  We were guests of close friends that are Marriott owners at their St. Thomas location.  For two nights we were housed on the second floor of the 2200 building.  It was a nice two bedroom unit, however, the view was tunnel like (we could see the Pacific) and somewhat distant from pools, common areas and fitness centers.  The deck was also very small.  On the third day we were relocated to the 5100 building which was higher on the hill and much closer to the upper pool and fitness center.  The view was far superior and much more panoramic.  We enjoyed that location.  Going in we had high expectations given Marriott's reputation for quality and service.  Overall the facilities were
Manager Response: We are disappointed to hear about your experience with one of our sales managers.   This is not typical of the guest experience at our resort and we would appreciate an opportunity to personally address your concerns.  Please contact us at customer.care@vacationclub.com or at 800 860 9384.  We look forward to hearing from you.

Summary: We stayed here from June 30 through July 4 so as others have mentioned it was super crowded.   It may be because it was a holiday but my impression was that the pools and bar are way too small for the number of villas at this location.  Each pool was jammed with young children and you couldn't even get near the hot tubs.  The most annoying part was that we were told that only 30% of the villas actually have views of the ocean and our view was of a bush.  We were renters, not owners, so that may explain our lousy location.  But while we were checking in, a long long process, I heard everyone complaining that their villas were not located where they expected.  We booked 6 months ago so I don't know what the trick would be to actually get a room with a good view.
Manager Response: We are sorry to hear that you did not have a positive experience at Marriott's Newport Coast Villas.  The resort was sold out during the July 4th holiday.  However, we offer several pools throughout the resort. to accommodate our guests.  We make every effort to accommodate requests for a specific villas or view type.  However, first preference is given to Marriott Vacation Club owners and during peak times of the year, it is not possible to honor every request.

Summary Heading: Good for families, but too crowded over July 4th
Summary: We stayed here for July 4th festivities.  We liked the property and the grounds, but the crowds were too much.  It was at 98% capacity and use of the facilities was impossible.  Pros:  Gorgeous property Lots of beautiful views Spacious 2 bedroom units We enjoyed walking the grounds Bunnies were spotted Free hotel shuttle to Crystal Cove beach, Laguna and Newport Great location. Great beds to sleep on.  Our unit had a king, a queen, and two pull out sofa beds  Cons: There was a wait to play tennis and basketball the entire two days we were here.  Impossible to get on the court at decent hours. The gym was small for a property this large.  It was toocrowded during out stay. Watch out for the "discounts at local restaurants" pitch from the timeshare people.  They're not aggressive,

Summary Heading: 1st time to stay at Marriott Newport Villas
Summary: This was my first time here.  We are Marriott owners and used points to go over 4th of July.  I say the Resort is good, not quite as great as some of the others, but still recommend it.  Bar area is a bit too small around the main pool.  We did have a good room location and we could see fireworks from where we were staying which was great.  I would rate the rooms as very good.  2 bed/2bath is nice when you have young kids.  The beaches though were really fun.  Waves are larger than in Gulf of Mexico and the kids just thought that was a blast.  You can rent beach stuff (buckets / shovel / chairs) for pretty minimum amount of money from the Marriott and I also like that you can take Marriott towels to the beach and they don't "freak out" about it.     We highly recommend going to

Summary Heading: Best view of all the Marriotts we've been to
Summary: This place is stunning, with many villas that are on the hills overlooking Crystal Cove State Park and Beach. The Villas are very modern, exactly what you expect and get with every Marriott timeshare (except maybe that converted one in Breckenridge Colorado!  This is a great location with 5 minutes to Crystal Cove Beach, 10 minutes to Laguna Beach, and about 90 minutes to San Diego. Also balboa Island is within 5 minutes ... so plenty to see, do, and EAT. Also 15 minutes from Disneyland!  The grounds arte spectacular at the main entrance with fountains and koi fish ponds and large pools. And of course a nice Pool Bar just in case you like that!  If you get a chance to choose, the 4000 villas have the best view, highest on the hills, and a pool very close. The only strange thing

Summary Heading: Still a great condo but not on a holiday
Summary: This is our 2nd time to stay here and we have enjoyed it again.  Maybe not as much as the first time but it's still a really good place to stay.  The Newport Beach area is a great trip.  If you're a Marriott owner then this needs to be on the top of your list.  I rate this place excellent because it scores high in my opinion for what it is.  It is not a true luxury hotel.  Don't book here if that's what you're looking for.  It is a condo family style vacation.  One big NEGATIVE was that the place suddenly got way overcrowded for July 4th.  Pools were packed.  I think a lot of locals showed up.  I saw a LOT of people without wristbands.  We couldn't even get two chairs at two of the pools.  Didn't try the third pool.  Parking completely disappeared.  People parking anywhere and

This was my first time here. We had my father's 80th family reunion here. The resort is the most extensive I have seen in the vacation club chain. The grounds are sweeping. The views amazing! Lobby and staff are A rate and the villas are perfect. A great spot sandwiched between corona del mar and Laguna beach. Highly reccomended!!

We stayed at Marriott Newport Coast for 3 nights on June 29th in room 2620.  We had stayed there before about 5 years ago and loved it.  I little disappointed this time.  First of all, 3 night really isn't enough time to enjoy the area.   Pros: Big units with 2 bedrooms/2 bathrooms and a full kitchen Nice appliances and washer and dryer Nice balcony almost with a few of the ocean (in between the buildings) Great staff Great pools, on Sunday there was live music in the afternoon Beautiful grounds and activities for young kids Cons: Too far to walk to the ocean (you can but not much fun) It is not on the ocean Nothing really within walking distance so you need to get in your car to go to the ocean, restaurants, shopping, etc. The unit we were in seem a bit outdated and not as nice

Started our 10 day trip thru California at this great hotel. It is beautiful. Stayed in a 2 bedroom villa type room with full kitchen. It also had a washer and dryer. Pool area with lots of activities if you like that sort of thing. Nice park like area with basketball and tetherball courts. Nice open pit fire every night put on by the hotel.Close to Laguna Beach. Able to walk to beach (not with litle ones) or to park across street to run or walk. Wish we would have spent more days there. Will def go back.

Summary Heading: A great choice if you are coming to Newport Beach, CA
Summary: This property is on the coast of Newport Beach.  If you are considering a vacation or a stay in Newport Beach, this is the best Marriott by far, and it is one of the top places to stay in Newport Beach due to its fantastic location (on the cliff across the street from the beach), and its central location to world class shopping and dining.  This is a great location for families with children as well.  We stayed here with our 4 children ages 7- 14, and they had a blast.  The pools are fun, they have a putting green, smores at night by a fire pit, an arcade room, ping pong, shuffle board and all sorts of resort activities.   There is a shuttle that will take you to numerous off site locations for dining and shopping.  The rooms are spacious with great kitchens that certainly come

Just coming back a week ago, in a few words I can said it was worthed, it was beautiful, it has things for all ages.I travel with my family, I had a teen, my sister and her 6 and 7 years old daughters, my daughters friends, and husband.Everybody has a blast.The Villa was spacious, clean and very confi, we didn't get the best  view, just a garden view, but it was ok, we spend the days at the pool in the afternoons, and at the beach in the mornings.The Villas, has a shuttle, free of charge, who works in daily basis, and take you back and for, to Laguna Beach, Crystal Cove and even the Mall, just perfect. Also for the little ones, friendly activities daily, and for the older kids a Teen Shack, my daughters favorite place.Will definetly plan to come back, maybe next year, but next

Summary Heading: Second Visit - Beautiful location! Nice & clean!
Summary: Our family of four visited this resort June 1-3, while on our way to LA. for the second time.  Resort is beautiful and the grounds are very well kept. The 2 bedroom suite was perfect for my spouse and our 2 boys, ages 18 & 21. We love the stocked full kitchen, 2 baths, 3 televisions & the washer/dryer. Timeshare units are the way to travel! Unfortunately, to our surprise, we arrived during "June Gloom" this time and it was too cold to enjoy the pools or beaches.So keep that in mind when booking your dates but there are plenty of places to check out even during colder weather.  We went down to San Juan Capistrano, which we highly recommend!. Laguna Beach is my favorite filled with wonderful shops & restaurants like Watermarc. We did take the timeshare tour and our consultant did

Summary Heading: First time at Marriott Vacation Club
Summary: I am pleasantly surprised by my first experience at this Marriott Vacation Club property, no pushy sales pitch at all!  Check in process was quick and effortless, we were assigned to the room directly above the lobby, the pool view is just outside our balcony door.   The rooms are sparkling clean, and the kitchen has everything that a family needs for vacation.  What I love the most about this place is the gorgeous view, and the location can't be beat as well.   Parking space can be tight especially coming back from late dinner, but hey I don't mind the walking in this serene and beautiful property.

Summary Heading: Better than the pictures - rave reviews are all true
Summary: In the middle of all the glitz and glamour of the Newport Coast area, Newport Coast villas is an opportunity for average people to live like a "king" for a week.  Within 15 minutes you can be in Laguna Beach (to the south) or Balboa Island (to the north).  The area is truly unique with wonderful views from most of the property.  Unfortunately, we were stuck in the 1800 building on the 1st floor and the rooms were very dark - avoid this building.  The property is built on a steep incline so request a building on the higher parts of the property to ensure good lighting and perhaps a nice view.  The playground, putting green, and basketball were all nice touches to the property for our two kids.  We also found the pool to be very useful as it was heated and can be enjoyed with

We just came back from one of the best Family vacations. The units were very spacious and the kitchen was great for meals with two small children (5 and 19 months). The grounds and the pools are beautiful. This is a great location to enjoy the beach, pools and Disneyland - only a 25 minute drive. I loved having the BBQ grills close by and they were exceptionally clean as well.  We would come back in a heart beat. Can't say enough good things about this place!

We recently spent 7 nights at this property, and it was fantastic.  The 2 bedroom condo that we had was on the top floor of one of the buildings and we had a great view from our balcony.  The staff at the front desk were very enthusiastic and helpful.  The had a lot of activities for the kids as well.  I would stay here again!

We love coming to Newport Coast! We have visited several times over the past 10 years. This facility is well maintained, attractive and located beautifully. The two-bedroom units are roomy and sleep 6 to 8 comfortably. The kitchen saves a lot of money and the washer/dryer are very handy. The staff is willing to please. Ask for a unit with a view of the ocean. It is a mile-long walk/run to the water, but the pathways are great and it is such a lovely vantage point. It's fun to walk a bit further and explore the quaint and retro Crystal Cove Beach houses. When in the area we enjoy going to some of the local beaches, museums, farmers' markets,  Balboa Island, hiking, boating, eating out and shopping. The Crystal Cove Promenade just a mile down the road has a Trader Joe's which is

Spent several days here with my daughter and her family who live about an hour away.  This was a great spot for a family vacation when I visited CA.  The pools and landscaping where great and the small kitchens were convenient with two young children.  Location with views of the Pacific were beautiful.

My husband and I are child-free, but can see that this has many features that families with children will appreciate: tetherball, basketball and tennis courts; putting green and multiple pools.  The state park is across the highway--not an easy walk, but easily accessed by car.  The villas are well-equipped and maintained.

As a Marriott resort owner, I have taken for granted the caliber hotels that Marriott provides. Using Interval, I recently exchanged outside Marriott and was very disappointed. On the other hand. This resort was top notch.   I initially wanted to be closer to the main pool area and hoped for a view of the ocean, upon arrival, I was provided a lower floor room, closest to the coast with a separate pool area right outside the door. This proved to be be excellent since the hot tub and pool area was much less busy.   The location was perfect for local beaches in Laguna and Huntington. It also allowed day trips to LA and San Diego with no traffic concerns.   I hope to return to this resort in the future. It is a must for any Marriott owner!

I have stayed at many timeshare resorts but have to say this is on top!  From the time we pulled up to the resort, it just kept getting better.  It's a great place the a family reunion or family vacation.  The only down fall was it could use a restaurant on the property.  I personally enjoyed walking to the beach daily.

Summary Heading: Great value, great location for a family trip!
Summary: We stayed in a two bedroom villa and enjoyed it. We had requested a crib (aka pack n play) and high chair to be in our room before we arrived because we were coming in late 10:30pm. They Weren't in the room when we arrived but after a phone call and 15 minutes wait they were brought to our door!  We brought a cooler full of drinks, kid food and fruit! I wish we would have brought some more stuff like breakfast (eggs, bacon etc).There is not a full service Resturant beside the pool bar and grill. All in all beautiful facility! Loved Newport! Very family friendly and clean!

In many ways better then Maui in my book. The front desk did have some computer problems getting keys. However, very relaxing and beautiful. The air helps heal the skin and brain. You will come away so relaxed from the location and beauty. Excellent place and views. Better the Hawaii in my book.

Amazing property.  Friendly Staff.  Clean and Large rooms.  Wish it was closer to the beach but they have fantastic pools and shuttle service to the beach, which is not far, every day all day.  The Villas are very spacious and me my wife and four kids fit in there with plenty of room.

Great place, nice 2 bedroom unit with fabulous views!! Doesn't get much better than Marriott Newport Coast Villas! Would definitely stay here again! Washer dryer, etc. everything you need!  Very pretty grounds with lots of pools!

We stayed here for a weekend with our 1 yr old and enjoyed having lots of room in the clean 2br suite. The check in process went pretty smooth being as busy as it was and the staff was very friendly and helpful.  They sent an email prior to arrival asking if we had any special requirements which was a nice touch.   My biggest complaint was the 10am checkout which is earlier than most hotels and was tough to meet with a little one who naps at that time.  We would stay here again.

Our family stayed here for the 2nd time, and it was great, its a 2 bedrooms villa, and the living room & master bedrroom & balcony all ocean view, it comes with kitchen so you can cook.  The price is fantastic for the 2 bedrooms, it costs the same price as if you would get an ocean view room (small room not 2 bedrooms, go to marriott.com) anywhere.  There are shopping malls & supermarket near by, also cute little restaurants & shops on E coast highway.  Crystal Cove state beach park is across the street.  We are planning to come back in the fall.

We stayed six nights after a long drive from Northern Calif. Check in was easy and the condo was terrific. Cool ocean breezes beat blistering heat of downtown Anaheim any day.  We requested a preference for a high floor, ocean view in the newer 5000 or 5100 units near BBQ's and pool (...of which this resort has 5). I didn't want to be near the 3 big party pools in the middle of the resort. I was hoping that being the farthest out would be the best bet.  We were assigned unit 5040 which is the top floor, end unit condo with a veranda view of the ocean, directly above the BBQ area and only a short walk to the uncrowded pool and two Jacuzzi.(jacuzzies?, jacuzzs?) Both are pleasantly heated and clean unlike some other hotel pools we've seen (...and didn't dare use).  It was a

I stayed here for a wedding in Newport Beach and I enjoyed this hotel very much. The rooms were spacious and very clean. The hotel was conveniently located. Very nice pool area. I would definitely recommend and stay again in the future.

Stayed here over Memorial Day weekend with my parents, husband, and our baby. We didn't do much at the resort as we only stayed one night, but the villa was gorgeous, and we had a view of the ocean. Everyone was quite friendly. Definitely will stay here again to experience a lot of what the resort has to offer.

Stayed with 6 other family members for a week in early May 2013 (we are Marriott owners).  Was a little disappointed that once again we did not get a requested top floor, but the view was beautiful from our second floor unit in Building 4100.  Fortunately our upstairs neighbors weren't too noisy because, as others have noted, the sound-proofing isn't great.  Our grandsons enjoyed the basketball/tetherball/mini-golf/sandbox area and pool, and participated in one of the kids' activities.  We spent an afternoon at Crystal Cove State Park--beautiful beach.  Kitchen was well-equipped, and DD and SIL said the foldout couch seemed more comfortable than during our stay here three years ago.  Didn't do many other activities onsite, since we mostly stay here for its proximity to

We have been Marriott Vacation Club owners for about nine years. We just came back from Newport Coast Villas. It is a beautiful location but we were disappointed. It did not measure up to our experiences at other Marriott vacation club villas. There is no concierge available on the weekends and the vacation club staff are not as knowledgeable and don't seem to care. You have to pay for housekeeping services. At every other villa we've stayed at owners have mid week housekeeping with no cost. There is no welcome breakfast so no opportunity to meet with venders to see what local activities are available. They have a number of brochures available but it's not as helpful as meeting with the venders. The setting is beautiful however when you walk into the lobby the stark, cold decor
Manager Response: We are sorry to hear that you did not have a positive experience at Marriott'sNewport Coast Villas. This is not typical of the guest experience at our resort so we would appreciate an opportunity to hear about your concerns and appropriately address them.  Please contact us at customer.care@vacationclub.com or at 800 860 9384.  We look forward to hearing from you.

Summary: Our family stayed here for about a week in February and it was just wonderful.  The villas are normally time-share I think, and whatever extras they have they rent out.  Pricing is pretty steep, but we came at a lull and so snuck in for a reasonable cost for a 2-bedroom, 2-bath villa.  The property is set so that it is overlooking the ocean from afar (not immediate access to the beach, but rather well across a highway, etc.)--but the way its setup makes you feel like you are right there.  The view from our balcony was amazing, and you could see the sunset every night on the Pacific.  The staff were pleasant and overall the stay was very relaxing. Though it's super far away from access to LA, it's a great location to get away from it all, but not a great location if you want to

Close to the most charming spot I've seen in the area, and this is my fifth trip in the last 5 years. Awesome beach access with a short healthy walk, beautiful breeze off ocean reaches villas. 2br Villas are perfect with kids and kitchen was very well equipped.

I thought I wouldn't like this so much because it's so far from the beach. Loved it! Beautiful grounds! There is a shuttle to Crystal Cove and Laguna Beach every hour, so pretty convenient. The pool is gorgeous and we spent most of our time there. I think for kids, the pools don't have a whole lot of offer for being there all day-no pool features, but there are lots of kids club things going on. (we went without kids). so I think they are ok.   Unit was typical Marriott time share-nicely laid out. We unfortunately were on the busy street so it was super noisy! We had to move to the smaller bedroom. You DO NOT want one of these units. This place is huge! we were glad we were not way at the end, but they do have smaller pools at each end of the property for convenience, but no

I came with my family for trip to south Califa and decided for Newport Beach as our base.  Hotel complex is excellent. Pool, jacuzzi, mini golf, playground, green everywhere.  Apartment was pretty comfortable also. We had a two bedroom, with jacuzzi, great and well equipped kitchen, balcony and main room with sofa. 6 persons could fit easily.  Hotel has a mini market where you can buy whatever you need during your stay. It serves light meals as well as Pizza Hut and Starbucks. There is a restaurant by the pool also.  I got an apartment that I could step in and out without passing by main building. I felt like having my own apartment in Newport. Exactly what I was looking for.  Staff great but not exceptional. The floor of main bathroom needed some minor maintenance. These are

I stayed here last weekend for a wedding. It is enormous, and beautifully taken care of. There are 2 bedrooms, a living room, full kitchen with granite and stainless appliances, a dining area, and balcony in every suite. Plus 2 bathrooms, one for each bedroom. Being a fitness buff, I was impressed with the gym, with many cardio machines with personal TVs, fresh ice water, towel service, and free headsets you keep. This place is gigantic, so if you are looking for quaint, this ain't it. There were not really any restaurants on the property, and to get to one required a drive. Nothing is in walking distance, except the beach, which is across the street (Pacific Coast Highway).  The pools were all very clean and beautiful, and there is ping pong, air hockey, an arcade, and teen

We wer just there when the weather was unseasonably Beautiful.  The villas are done nicely, not great, but surely functional.  We thought the floor plan was excellent.  Two bedrooms, separated by the living room dining room so that no one was close to you.  Each had its own bathroom.  It actually could sleep 6 to eight because of the pullouts.  We booked it through their guest reservation, but someone told me you can also book it through VRBO.com and that would save you money.  if you planned to eat in the villa, it was fully stocked with everything you need to make a meal.  What we didn't like is they did not have a restaurant, just a place that opened at 11 at the pool.  We also thought the furniture was dated and the towels were downright cheap and flimsy.  But the location

Summary Heading: Great place to spend a week
Summary: I've been an owner since 2006. The service has improved greatly since my last visit here a few years ago. Ocean views, walks on the beach, fantastic gyms , clean pools. We've BBQ'd every date on the grill outside our villa. Close proximity to shopping, restaurants, movie theaters and more. Love this place!  And the showers are clean!

We enjoyed our week at this hotel.  It's a great place for bigger families.  It's close to the beach, shopping and not too far from Disneyland.  The swimming pools are nice with beautiful views of the ocean.

I have written more than one review of this property but it is consistently lovely.  The one thing I have not commented on in the past is the staff.  Because this is more of a "Vacation Villa" and I come for work, I have little interaction with the staff other than checking in and out but this last trip, my colleagues and I arrived slightly after they had closed the gift shop and my assistant was in need of amenities.  Solomon was extremely sweet and helped us out even though they had already locked the doors.  For play or for work this is an amazing property.  I have only stayed in two bedroom suites which is basically like a 2 BR apartment including a king room with both a HUGE bathtub and separate shower, a queen bedroom with a pull out sofa in both that room and in the

MVC Newport Coast Villas is a great place for a weekend get away.  The Villas can sleep up to 8 people.  The full kitchen is nice and roomy.    This was our first time staying in Newport. I was excited to explore the town a bit.  Unfortunately I was very disappointed with all the traffic.  We drove to the beach and fun zone.  It took us about 35 minutes to get to.  The beach was nice however it was fairly steep and narrow.  I would rather hang out on Huntington Beach.  The fun zone was a bit of let down as well.    Check out Crystal Cove.  My kids loved the tide pools.  We would definitely go explore that area again.    The resort is pretty amazing.  Tons of things for the kids to do.  We even rented movies in the marketplace.  We were also pleasantly surprised to find a

The moment you walk into the lobby, the views take your breathe away.  Everyone is very friendly and willing to assist here. Chris a manager at the reservation desk was very nice!  Our villa was considered a partial ocean view but we have a very panoramic view of the ocean.  We are in the 3000 building but since we have never stayed here before we really don't have anything to compare it to.  The villa unit is so spacious!  Everything you might need in a kitchen is there included leftover containers!  Our balcony is very nice and have a round table to 4 cushioned chairs.  We ate breakfast out here each morning.  Also the location of this property is perfect.....just a few minutes from either Laguna or Huntington beach.  I would highly recommend this property.

The villas are spaced upon beautifully manicured gardens and the pool area is beautiful. They are gorgeous buildings and overlook the coast. Poolside you can play large chess, bag toss, ping pong, pool, and eat at the cafe. Each unit is well furnished and clean. Try to get a room with an ocean view close to the pool.

Summary Heading: Awesome location, facilities and roomy living room area w full kitchen
Summary: I wish there were saran-wrap and extra plastic bags and some small essentials in the kitchen.  Love the bathtub/ showers in our suite.  Spacious living/dining room. Overall great experience.  Cool pools and BBQ

When reviewing pelican hill's ratings, I noticed that this Marriott Time Share popped up as "compare a similar resort," in my opinion and after having stayed at both within a one month period, there is nothing similar about them.  Pelican Hill was a world-class resort, favorably comparing to highly rated Asia-Pacific hotels.  Marriott behaved, looked and was cared for as befitting the time-share that it is: superficially lovely but based on low cost construction material, few services and those that are provided are provided grudgingly, and in general only providing the minimum necessary to check off a list of what must be provided to call itself "a resort."

First time here and I'm very impressed. Our villa was clean and very spacious consisting of full size and fully equipped kitchen (pots, pans, plates - the works!), washer/dryer, 2 bedrooms/2 baths - master bedroom have separate large tub with dual shower heads.  With all the pullout beds, this villa can sleep 8 people easily. Since there are only 3 adults and 2 toddlers in our party, we enjoyed our villa rather well, lots of space for everyone.  I read on insiders and reviews on tripadvisor/yelp that they are strict on check-in/check-out times.  And Marriott status doesn't apply much on here (or any resorts) so I didn't expect much when we arrived.  We planned on just using their pool while waiting for our villa to be ready by 4pm.  However, Jill, in registration was very nice

Stayed here recently with the wife. The villas are roomy and well appointed and the compound and grounds are beautiful and immaculately kept. The villas have full kitchens and ideal for individuals, couples and families. We loved ours and made use of the kitchen and grounds. There are gas BBQ pits conveniently located to each villa. They are very comfortable with TVs in each bedroom. Our only disappointment was not having an ocean view.   We recommend it and you will not be disappointed.

This was our second time back to this gorgeous property and as before, it was amazing!  This time we stayed for a week and really got to enjoy the area more.  The villas are beautiful, the beds are so comfortable and I can't say enough about the HUGE doubled headed shower in the master bathroom.  If we had our choice, we would take that shower home with us!    The pools are warm and beautifully maintained.  We always had a great time at the main pool with live music and a bar to order food and drinks.  Our six year old loved the kids activities.    The staff was helpful, friendly and made our stay even more enjoyable.  We were on an "Encore Package" which was a 2nd time around for a timeshare presentation.  We didn't purchase but our experience with our sales guy was fine.  It

The hotel is a mix between a resort and a hotel, you get a bit of each.  You would expect a beautiful view but it always seems to be obstructed by the trees which are all over - I guess it is not a problem if you love trees but I was hoping to see more of the ocean.  The rooms are very confortable, large and roomy, no problem there!  The entire complex is large so you need a car to move a round.  It does have a perfect location - very close to anything you desire.

Summary Heading: Don't use lobby snack shop if you are in a hurry.
Summary: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights in April.  We listened to the 90 minute Vacation Owners Time Share sell.  The saleswoman was fantastic.  We did feel pressure to buy.  It took about 3 hours.  I don't know if we just asked too many questions, but, it took way too long.  There is a bus shuttle to take you from your villa to anywhere on the property.  The villa's are on a hill so that was nice at times.  The villa we had was wonderful.  Furniture was fairly comfortable, but, I did begin to notice that it looked as if this particular unit was a conglomerate of all leftover pieces from other units.  All very well made, but, absolutely none of the fabrics went together.  Draperies, bedskirts, chair coverings on kitchen chairs, LR chairs, upholstered pillows, carpeting.....all

We recently stayed here and enjoyed a beautiful ocean view villa. There are 700 units available and the property is kept in pristine condition. It is conveniently located between Newport Beach and Laguna Beach, so there's plenty of things to see and do nearby (within 10-15 minutes by car either north or south on Pacific Coast Highway). It was so nice, however, that we were perfectly fine staying at the property and making use of their pools, hot tubs, and sauna's in the spa area while enjoying a cocktail or snacks by the pool. We enjoyed it so much that we extended our stay a couple of extra nights and now looking to plan a return trip.

This was our third visit and we continue to love coming here.  The view of the ocean was panoramic from our unit.  We requested a quiet unit overlooking the ocean away from the pool area as resting, relaxing and reading were our goals.  All were accomplished.  We had friends celebrating their 50th Anniversary with us and they also loved their spacious room with private bath and ablilty to prepare breakfast and appetizers.  The staff are excellent.  Very helpful, professional and pleased to be assisting us.  Every kind of store including Tech stores/resources were within a 15 minute drive.  Many boutique's, bakeries, cafes etc nearby.  Cyrstal Cove, across the highway is fabulous for walking on the beach and then having a meal or cocktail at the Beachcomber's Inn right on the

I stayed here with my family in April.  We were able to get a unit that allowed us to see the ocean from our room.  The property was just beautiful.  We had fun by going to Disneyland, Magic Mountain, and doing the Hollywood tour.  The area that this is in was great you have Crystal Cove, Newport Beach, Laguna Beach all nearby.  There are very nice cars on the roads in this area.  (I saw a Tesla at the grocery store) Maserati's a lotus.. many folks drive nice cars in this area.  The resort has some shuttle services to Fashion Island and Crystal Cove.  Crystal Cove was only good for a short visit.  They do have a lovely set of pools on site (one of them is salt water?)  We had a great stay.

Summary Heading: Great for a short family reunion
Summary: We met my sister there for one night to celebrate my mom's birthday.  We had a great corner room in one of the units in building 51 with plenty of room.  Only thing I didn't care for was the smell which could have been because of frequent use of the unit, but other than that it was a perfect place to stay and enjoy each other's company.

Tis was a great hotel for the family. They had fun pools, fun park for the kids to play basketball, mini golf, or roast marshmallows, and great rooms. We loved having the kids in their own bedroom and having a kitchen to do a little cooking. The view from the hotel was fantastic. The only downside is that you have to drive to everything: food, beach, shopping. There is a shuttle service, but we never used it so I can't say how well it worked. The beach we went to most was balboa island. But the beach across the greet from the marriot is pretty nice too.

Summary Heading: Marriott is known for their beds -- not here!!
Summary: Ok - I am a Marriott snob -- I am part of their point system and destination club -- every experience I have had at Marriott I comment to my wife -- the bed was awesome -- that applies to courtyard and Farfield as well. Sorry, not here!! Everything else was very good -- service etc..  But the bed was not comfortable and the pillows were not like other Marriott's.  (Marriott -- wake up call -- no pun intended)

I scheduled this getaway with multiple things in mind...me relaxing at the pool, getting together with a great friend and getting my guys and their girlfriends for a family get-together as well.  The Newport Villas allow you this type of gathering, with the two bedroom villa and resort grounds.  I couldn't have been happier--it was the perfect long weekend!  I am a timeshare owner there and enjoy my timeshare week but also recommend using the facility if you are not--and prices during off season are amazing,  considering the amenities you get!  The full kitchen alone saves on eating out and there are multiple areas for outdoor grilling as well... I know the grounds and ask for the best ocean views...if that is important to you familiarize yourself with the building locations and

Summary Heading: Very nice getaway, but our stay has just begun . . .
Summary: Checked in Wednesday 10th for 7 nights.  Unit was ready early, even though we were well ahead of normal "check-in" time of 3, I think.  A pretty, Spanish-inspired architectural look that is easy on the eyes, the development is large and easy to find your way - once you've had some time to get used to it.  If they were trying to sell me a time share, you would think they would have placed us in a higher location with a view of the ocean, especially since we came during the middle of the week and not many customers seem to be around.  They didn't, but then I'm not here to buy.  Would've still liked a better view than trees and golf course.  Unit is very nice and spacious, well equipped, and easy to find.  Can't think of a thing negative and probably won't for the next 5 nights.

First understand this is a Marriott Vacations property, so they are set up for families with full kitchen and dining room amenities.  The suites are well-appointed and luxurious enough for most tastes.  The living room and both bedrooms include high quality flat screen televisions, but the real views are from the balcony and master bedroom windows.  The ocean and surrounding hillsides make for amazing views of the California coastline and Catalina Island.  I actually booked online via a special promotion for Elite Marriott Rewards members.  Although this was a business trip, the rate was lower than surrounding Marriott hotels and the amazing location and "at home" kitchen amenities were a welcome change from the standard hotel experience.  My favorite amenities were being able

Summary Heading: Beautiful property in a beautiful location
Summary: We did a timeshare exchange and stayed for Spring Break 2013.  Location is really nice although you need to drive just about anywhere you may want to go because it is secluded from any restaurants and other activities.  Crystal Cove beach is walkable and a fun place to visit (eat at the Beachcomber).  Two bed villas are very nice, clean and equipped for a week with the family.  I was surprised there was no mid week tidy service as in most Marriott Vacation Club Locations but there is a  washer/dryer to do your own.  Kids had fun doing the easter egg hunt and making tie dye t-shirts.   We had a first floor unit (as requested) and were very near one of the two smaller pools.  Our view was pathetic (looked out onto the maintenance road) but not a huge deal. Never had a problem

This 75 acre complex sits on the hillside of the canyons of Newport Beach. A wonderful Mediterranean inspired resort - it boasts great views of the Pacific and PCH!   Although not right on the beach, you are literally a 10 minute walk down the road to the beach which, when coupled with the views from their many pools - was more than we needed to be relaxed and enjoy the property.   The rooms were spacious - with large patios. Accessibility was creatively designed with hidden garages and access ways for getting to your villa without disturbing the charm and beauty of the location.   Because of the large layout, the property has 2 work out facilities with many pools for accommodating guests. Also, walking the grounds and the surrounding areas are a must - for views no matter where

Summary Heading: Gorgeous Views and Grounds with So-So Interiors
Summary: The odd thing about Marriott Newport Coast Villas is that even though the villas have their share of flaws, there is something about the resort's location, grounds, architecture, and the Southern California coastal climate that seems to wipe away all of the negatives and leave a person wanting to come back.   In my past 4 visits to the villas, I have noted the following:  -- There is very little sound-proofing between units.  For example, during my last visit we were able to hear footsteps from the unit above, shouting from the unit below, and conversations and the television in the next door unit. -- I woke up with a stiff back every morning because of the beds. -- Occasionally parking near one's unit can be difficult -- especially at night when everybody's returned to their

We stayed for our spring break week, & this is our 4th week over the past about 6 years.  We checked in 3/31/13 for 7 nights.  We traded our Marriott week from Grand Chateau Las Vegas for Newport Coast Villas.    The weather was wonderful, not too hot, so we could play tennis.  The resort has tennis courts & you can play for free, just bring your own balls & rackets.  They also have basketball, etc.    We used the gas BBQ they provide twice during the trip to cook dinner.  There are not enough BBQ's as many families like to cook this way & I saw people even doing their lunch on the grill a couple times.  We had to walk to an adjacent building one night because our two buildings only had 2 grills that were always busy.    When you stay at a Marriott timeshare resort, keep in mind

I stayed at one of the condos in bldg 3600 - lovely view and huge resort!  OUr patio had a view of the beach, but one need to drive to the beach.  It is a large resort.  Our room is on the 2nd floor and the floor is extremely thin - I had to endure listening to the people from the above room's loud and annoying footsteps throughout the day and night.  And the master bedroom shower was damaged - the engineer that to replace the whole shower head.  It is a nice property.

Summary Heading: One of the best among an already great group of hotels - actually much more than hotels!
Summary: Located with easy access to all that Southern California offers, helpful concierge, exceptional accommodation - unusually great for both families and couples looking for a more quiet vacation. Recommend this very highly.

Nice room, it's a bit dated but in beautiful condition and clean. Marriott luxury bedding. The jetted soaker tub is a joke, it's so weirdly short, that you can't actually lie in it. ( well, we couldn't  - one of us just over and one just under 6' tall) We stayed on weeknights in February, it was quiet but not deadly quiet. We enjoyed the adult pools and whirlpool very much. The pool felt somewhat salty, I did not react to the chlorine. All in all, a very good experience. We enjoyed the well stocked kitchen, and were able to cook some great meals.  This was also a good opportunity to do laundry, with a good little w/ d set that had a quick wash setting.

Summary Heading: I take it back, worth every penny!
Summary: Yes, this resort is worth all the hype! I was hesitant at first not being accommodate with ocean view room when i called 2wks before arriving and paying prime rates at $429/night (not timeshare) but I take it all back. We stayed 3 nights during Easter weekend, our villa was in bldg 3400 and very close to reception area (literally across the street) - this beats ocean view. The entire resort is HUGE and we were traveling with small kids. Our main concern was being as close as possible to the main pool (heated) and all the activities such as mini golf, basketball courts, playground, life size chess/checkers, and everything the main lobby has to offer (indoor game area, Starbucks).   The resort had daily activities all planned out. Saturday March 30th started out at 10am sharp with

We stayed here for 3 nights in late March--wish we would have stayed here all week!  It was in such a great location, villas were very nice-spacious, clean and quiet!  We stayed in building 4100 on thefirst floor--we asked for building 4200-and for a 4th floor-did not get either-but they did get us in am ocean view room so we were fine with the room. It was a great resort for children-our 8 and 10 year olds did not want to leave! They had so many activities for them-basketball courts, putting green, s'mores, many pools, pool tables, ping pong, etc.  There is a great Grocery store on the top of the hill from the hotel-make right out of resort and shopping plaza is on your left about a mile up the hill.  We will definetely be back for another vacation stay here!

We spent our spring break here. Got an exchange thru Interval and as a multiweek MVCI owner my expectations are high. This resort sure met and exceeded all my expectations. Like my son said "we will for sure come here every spring break for the next 10 yrs". Can't argue with him! Can't wait to go back.  Our unit was in building 2600 with a wonderful ocean view. A very short walk to the main building and swimming pool. They have a teenager lounge in the main building for teens and my son and his friend spent most evenings there.   The staff is very friendly and helpful. We didn't check in until 3am because flight delay. had to ring the doorbell to get into the main lobby but am employee showed up shortly to let us in. One morning the coffee pot cracked and they delivered a new

Enjoyed our stay. Wonderful resort with comfortable suites, short walk to Beach, nice pools and amenities. Only drawback is noisy buildings with little or no noise dampening between floors. Staff was helpful at check in. Facilities very clean.

The location is right across the street from the Ocean!  Beautiful views!  We had a 2 bedroom condo and it was fabulous!  The rooms were large and the condo easily would accommodate two couples plus  a few kids!  There was a large kitchen, well equipped and a large table that would seat 8.  Each room had a flat screen TV.  The bathrooms were gorgeous and the master bath had a full double shower that was VERY nice!   For those of you readers who are fussy sleepers, their pillows ROCKED!  I actually ordered a pillow from their supplier to take of future trips!  We stayed at a few places prior to this hotel and the pillows were so hard with no "give" I had a hard time sleeping.  Not here!   We were in a garden condo.  There was a cozy patio outside the living room area.  Right

I took my family for a getaway and we had a terrific time. Although the weather was not favorable due to overcasts and rains, we still had a wonderful time because the property was so beautiful. The lobby was under renovation and it look like it will be even more beautiful.   We stayed in a two bedroom villa and it was clean and furnished with furniture that were still in good quality. During our stay, the grounds were so nice that my family enjoyed walking around the property a lot. We even used the grill and made steaks for dinner one night. We visited Crystal Cove which was a 5 minute drive down the road to see the tide pool and watch the sunset. We also went to Balboa Island and Newport Beach but we spent a lot of time at the activity center at Newport Coast Villa.

There is no better location than this beautiful property.  My wife and I have been here numerous times for a quick weekend getaway from our house about 2 hours north and always leave wanting more.  The 2 bedroom units are perfect for either a family or 2 couples.    You can either cook your meals in the unit or go to the nearby Crystal Cove area where there are amazing restaurants. (Maestro's Ocean Club is my favorite)  Love, Love, Love this place and so will you!

Summary Heading: Beautiful Condo's in the middle of nowhere
Summary: We booked a two bedroom unit (they are all two bedroom units in this complex) for half a week to decompress after 4 nights at Disneyland.  These are beautiful units that all look brand new in spite of being about 10 years old.  While we were there the complex was having several technical difficulties with Staff unable to produce a checkout receipt and the wireless internet was down for several days.  They never could log on to determine how many Marriott member points we had. Really odd (and a little scary) at check-in they gave us keys to an occupied room.   That has never happened to me in over 30 years of business and personal traveling.  The staff member at the reception desk was stunned (as we were).    The on site bar/grill and the convenience store are handy and they both

We stayed a week for spring break March 17-24. We were in unit 1722 second floor. It is closest to the ocean and West. The view was medium. We could see the ocean but there were trees in the way due to a golf course in front. But, it was still nice. This was our third spring break there and the weather was pleasant, cloudy in the morning but burned off about noon. The property grounds are truly beautiful. Lots of trees and the plants and flowers are gorgeous. The Marriott has re-done their check-in lobby. I like the older one better; seems to modern for my taste. There are 5 pools, 3 in the central location and 1 each at two ends of the property.They are all well-kept and nice. Just below the property on PCH is Crystal Cove State Beach. There is lots of room to walk the beach

Stayed in building #3900 on the 3rd floor, ocean view.  Great unit with a super view.  We were there the week of January 25th, 2013.  The weather was warmer than usual for that time of year, in the high 70's.  It is a great central location, convenient to many other attractions.  We walked to the beach at Crystal Cove Park every day.   We were able to see the passing grey whales, dolphins, seals and many shore birds.  Lots of starfish and urchins to observe when the tide is low.  Unit was very clean and quiet, another great Marriott property.   Staff were very pleasant and helpful.  Great restaurants nearby.  Fashion Island is nearby with a Great Whole Foods and lots of restaurants.  Traders Joe's is 5 minutes South of property but Pavillions Grocery Store in the Newport Coast

Summary Heading: These Villas are always a good time
Summary: So we went to Marriott Newport Villas with a 19 yo, 12 yo and a 2 1/2 yo.....we had MORE than plenty of space for all of us.  It's so convenient with the toddler because there is a washer and dryer in the villa, so I can wash clothes....I could also help myself to towels and linens in a closet outside, or the concierge was happy to bring stuff over. We did a lot of visiting outside of the Villas, so when we got back we were all tired and ready to sleep, but one night we did visit the pool.  It wasn't pool weather, in my opinion, but the pool was heated, so my husband and the kids got it.  He did say it was not super warm....but kids apparently feel nothing because they had a great time anyway. There were many families there doing the same as us, so it was nice to see. The

Summary Heading: Beautiful, comfortable & convenient base of operations
Summary: For 2 folks from North Idaho who live in a rural mountain setting, this was truly the perfect place to base our visit to the crowded, noisy L.A. area! Convenient to so many places with many opportunities for fun there at the villa compound itself. We invited our Corona relatives to stay with us there, and we all loved the margarita golf game and the life sized chess game, and the family friendly picnic area & playgrounds for the kids.  Our suite was beautiful, comfortable and provided all the necessities for our 10 day stay! Across the  PCH from the beach and good restaurants.  Highly recommended for either a romantic getaway or a family vacation.

This property was beautiful.  I don't know what else to say.  Everything was amazing, except for the old popcorn found in the pull-out sofa and someone's chapstick found under the bed - just showed me that they didn't do as thorough of a cleaning as I would have expected from a property such as this.   It was close to a highway and we could hear vehicles/motorcycles all night (not just driving, but revving to make it sound louder).  It's also not very close to anything.  I don't mind being secluded, but it was a pain to have to travel 15-20 minutes just to eat.

Summary Heading: Glad Newport is our Home Base Facility
Summary: We've been Marriott time share owners for 10+ years.  We've stayed in the original Newport buildings to the newest.  They are consistent - they do a good job managing the property/facilities.  This time we stayed in the newest building in room 5131.  We had an ocean view.  My only complaint is that even though wi-fi was available, we could not get on the wi-fi.  We called the front desk - they put us in touch with ATT.  ATT was no help.  Problem was not resolved.

Summary Heading: Great Family Stay for Newport Beach & Laguna Beach Area
Summary: A top notch family resort.  Four adults and three children in our family party and had plenty of room, home-like, comfortable feeling.  30 Minutes from Disney.  Minutes from great beaches, state parks, shopping and restaurants.  Can be a long walk to pools, recreation depending on which building you are staying.  Marine inversion-fog and cool during our visit so did not get to max out the recreational value of the stay, so felt it was expensive.

Summary Heading: Would definately stay here again and again.
Summary: This hotel is absolutely beautiful. Our 2 bedroom villa had plenty of room for our family of four, plus we even had room for our friends to stay a couple of nights with their son. We stayed in the 4500 building. Our room had a wonderful view of ocean (Crystal Cove) and the golf course. I would recommend participating in the fun activities offered at the resort. Our 2 year old loved to make her own build a bear and we even took our children to bingo night. We have a 2 and a 1 year old, so were not sure how they would do at this activity, but they loved it! The host was super accommodating and patient with all our questions and our very interested children. We even ate at the marketplace in the lobby. The food was wonderful. I had the chef salad while my daughters shared some

Our room was full of rodents. They damaged a lot of our clothes. After we reported about it we just got an offer to move to another room. The reaction of stuff was so normal that we really afraid. We understood that that they knew about it and than I found a lot of rodent catchers in our room. This means that they everywhere there. I sent some photos of it on Tripadvisor. Feel free to see it.  When we asked for a refund for damaged clothes our claim was resend to their Insurance Company. I got 1 call from Insurance Company while we were there, but after I leaved hotel - no calls, no any information about our case, no any refund.   So, think first before coming to this hotel!

I'm sorry to report after visiting the Newport Coast for several years in a row we won't be returning to this property.  As owners at the Marriott's Newport Coast Villas we have come to expect a high quality vacation.  Our room # 4711 is in a dark and dreary location with no view at all and it is next to the elevator so it is very loud. Remodeling in this area of the resort has left little to no parking and the front desk has refused to move us to another room.  Upon arrival our toilet was not working, ice maker was not plugged in, T.V. remote was broken, etc. etc.  We phoned the front desk and the maintenance personal responded quickly, but they could do nothing for the noise and parking spaces and dark hole of a room.  The one saving grace to this is MARK STOMP the

While it's true that this Marriott has a spectacular location, it also has a few shortcomings. The unit we stayed in experienced engineering difficulties that are uncommon for Marriott properties. Each time we used the dishwasher, the kitchen sinks backed up with brown water. The heat didn't work on the first night. We were traveling with our young son, so each evening when I called for engineering staff to do repairs (once for the heat and twice for the plugged sinks), I gave specific instructions to enter quietly because our son was sleeping. Each night, however, the engineering staff couldn't have been much noisier - each time apologizing that they were uninformed that I had requested they arrive quietly.  Other than the engineering difficulties, an excessively loud

We were invited by some of our firends to stay few day. The rooms were big, modern, clean awe had a wonderful view of the beach . it is great for family if you have children, they have pools, monkey bar with slide, gym room, miniture putting green, large chess game, tic tac toe, great place to walk. close to allot of good resturants. we had fun!!!!!!

We have stayed at Newport Coast Villas about 4 times and keep going back.  The main attraction is the beach which is within walking distance (or shuttle distance) of the property.  A shuttle will take you to Crystal Cove State Park, a charming little enclave of old cottages and secluded beach, sheltered by cliffs and connected to a trail system.  The property, itself, overlooks the ocean with many of the rooms having a balcony with ocean view.  Each villa has 2 spacious bedrooms and 2 bathrooms.  It can sleep up to 8 people, using the two beds and 2 hide-a-beds. There is a small washer and dryer in each unit. Onsite amenities include pools, jacuzzis, game room, playground, basketball court, kid's program, bike rentals, discount passes to state parks, convenience store, barbeque

We have stayed at the villas numerous times while in California visiting our daughter. The property sits on a ridge overlooking the Pacific. The pool area is huge, with a poolside bar for drinks and food.  Pool area can get a little busy with young families, but if you need a quieter spot there are two other pools. The condo has a full kitchen and two well appointed bedrooms. The only negative is that the living room furniture is not very comfortable. Great location for all Orange County has to offer!

The rooms are kept in very good condition.  Lots of room for 4-6 people.  Fairly well-stocked kitchen with plates, pans, etc. Nice exercise room, pools, children's play areas, ping-pong table and more.  Lots to do!  Walk to the beach--but not the best beach around.

Summary Heading: I have NEVER been treated so well in such gorgeous surroundings
Summary: We booking into this property on a last minute exchange from Marriott Summit Watch, which was a skiing destination, because I broke my foot and couldn't ski.  Not only were they able to accommodate us on short notice, but when we arrived, we discovered we had been placed in a unit that required minimal walking and was right next to the pool and the handicapped parking.  I was blown away about how considerate they were of my needs.  It's such a large property that I could easily have been assigned a unit in a distant building that would have made my stay extremely difficult.  They even had a handicapped shower seat in my unit, without my even having to ask.  I felt like (crippled) Royalty.  Now THAT's service.    There is little need to add my praises to the beauty of the project

This property has a really spectacular location, between corona del mar and laguna beach.  It is maybe half a mile walk from entrance to crystal cove state park. No golf or full service restaurant on property.  Our unit was lovely, spacious and nicely decorated. Not every apartment has ocean views.  Grounds are lovely with many birds of paradise and various other plants.  Only issue I had was that the layout and design of registration area was cold and not welcoming.

Summary Heading: Just a remarkable place to spend a week by the beach.
Summary: This property is simply spectacular. The rooms are spacious and comfortable with a full kitchen. Live music wafts through the air often. The views are extraordinary . The manager, learning it was our anniversary, sent us a bottle of wine and a nice card. Proximate to Crystal Cove and Laguna Beach, we really were able to relax. We did the Vacation Club presentation. The presentation was very well done and no pressure. We did not elect to join at this time but we appreciated the information. We will absolutely come back. The property is family friendly and has tons of things for kids to do. Pools were wonderful. Near some good markets and you get a hotel discount card. The manager and staff were welcoming and wonderful

My family and I have visited this resort twice for our timeshare visit. The grounds and the suites are awesome! It's close to beaches, restaurants and many touristy spots. It's a quick drive to all the amusement parks also. Can't wait to go back.

This resort is in an OPTIMAL location!  It's away from the hustle and bustle, 1/2 mile from a beautfiul state park (along the ocean). It's not too far from Fashion Island, Laguna, Corona del Mar, and Balboa. You can't go wrong with a Marriott property---and this one is excellent!

All rooms are 2 bedroom villas, great living space and full kitchen.  Ask for ocean view rooms.  Newport Coast is one of the most elite areas in the country, so enjoy the price you get here.  Points are welcomed as well.

Summary Heading: newport coast villas are top notch all the way.
Summary: the staff makes an excellent 'first impression' each time we enter the lobby or are tendwaited on by the pool.  the suites are lovely and  comfortable.  the setting is perfect.  the resort is just minutes to many great restaurants, beaches and shopping.  we always look forward to our next visit.

Summary Heading: Relaxing and lovely property offering lovely condos and resort options for the price of a hotel.
Summary: I'm not a Marriott timeshare owner but chose this property over the many hotels I considered.  Great location, beautiful setting, clean, comfortable.  Everything you'd expect from Marriott. I had no interest in a pitch for buying into their timeshare so I was a bit annoyed by the couple of times I was contacted to do so.  Aside from that it was a great, relaxing few days!

Summary Heading: Beautiful Scenery, Beautiful Resort, and the Marriott Experience (except at the Concierge Desk)
Summary: We can't say enough about the Marriott Vacation Club properties.  We like to stay at them when we have the opportunity.  This Winter, we had the chance to stay at the Marriott Newport Coast Villas.  We had a villa in the 1600 building.  While we had a higher unit, it overlooked the golf course, barely able to see the ocean, however, we cannot complain at all.  We didn't want to stay locked into the villa the whole time anyway.   We enjoyed their heated swimming pools late into the chilly winter evenings, and thoroughly enjoyed the beautiful views and architecture from and on this property.    Check-in was seamless.  The individuals working the front desk were prompt, and ready to help with any question we had.  The concierge desk staff, totally different story.  I've had a

Summary Heading: Perfect Base to Explore Southern California Coast!
Summary: Marriott's Newport Coast Villas is a beautiful Spanish style resort property that is a great starting point to explore the Southern California Coast. The Resort is located near the Pacific Ocean, with Newport Beach/Costa Mesa and Laguna Beach just a few minutes away in opposite directions. The Villas offer awesome views of the ocean or the valley. They contacted us before our arrival and we requested an ocean view and were delighted that is what we got. Our roomy corner two bedroom, two full bath villa included a well stocked, nice size kitchen, a large dining area and living room that opened onto the spacious balcony. The master bedroom had a king bed, double vanity, shower, and a separate roman tub. The second bedroom had a queen bed, a sofabed, and a shower/tub combination.

Just came home from a week at Marriott's Newport Coast Villas.  I have to say from check in to check out it was an awesome experience.  The staff was courteous and check in was a breeze.  We stayed in building 4600 and the view from our villa on the 4th floor was breath taking.  The resort is conveniently located about 1/2 mile from Trader Joe's and about the same from Whole Foods. There are restaurants nearby in Newport and Laguna Beach.  The villa was very comfortable and had every convenience of home.  One day we went to the Getty Museum, about 1 hour away.  It was well worth the drive.

Our family of 8 has stayed at the Newport Coast Villas several times.  The service is always excellent, and I appreciate that all of the staff from the top down are courteous.  Tip:  We always go to Disneyland for the 3 day hopper.  It takes 30 minutes from front door to tram and we use the 73 toll road.  Bring a lot of quarters with you.  The toll road fees will cost $2.50 to $5.00 each way.    We like to eat at Souplantion at Main and Jamboree in Irvine because we are vegans and it's hard to find the food we are used to.  We also shop at Pavillions.  Just take the main road out of the resort to the right and follow it until you see the strip mall on the left, a couple miles away.  You can also strike a deal with ABS Surfshop to rent boogie boards and wet suits to body surf at

Summary Heading: We left our hearts in Newport Coast, CA
Summary: We felt like we were staying in a modern villa, located in Umbria, Italy.  The view from our bedroom window was rolling hills, with lovely villas and an ocean in the distance.  The walks were stunning.  Marriott was at their normal best putting together these lovely villas.  Clean, decorated nicely and very well kept.  A little town nearby stole our hearts.  We hiked down to the coast and took a walk on the beach and ran into the little Crystal Cove.  The refurbished homes were quaint and had a little history.  Their food was delicious and generous.

Summary Heading: It was alright but lots of room for improvement
Summary: I stayed here last December for just under a week to visit a few nearby customers.  Although it is a very picturesque location the hotel is not really geared toward business travelers.  There are no real options for eating onsite and I was really surprised one morning when I learned that their convenience store did not open until 7AM.  If you were traveling with your family and looking for a spacious room to use as a base for traveling to sites nearby this would be a great choice.  For me the space was underutilized and a few of the amenities that business travelers count on were missing.  I scored "Service" a bit low because when I was foolish enough to lock myself out of my room, it took 40 minutes and 2 walks to the main lobby to address my problem!

Summary Heading: Nice 2BR Villas - Great Views, Close to Good Golf
Summary: If you want ocean views in the south LA area, this is very good.  Clean, modern 2BR villas are great for couples or families.  Wonderful location close to Newport Beach, across the Pacific Coast Highway from a public park and beach, and next door to two good (though expensive) Fazio golf courses at Pelican Hill.  Good kids' activities and great pool!  The complex is pretty large though, if that makes a difference to you.

We stayed at the Newport Coast for a few days last week. We were in Villa 4221 with fantastic Ocean views. The Property is nice but unlike most Marriott Vacation Club Properties, it is gigantic and not one in which you can easily get around on foot. Just know that if you are considering this location. The staff is great and the villas are up to Marriott standards. There is a great deal to do in the area and I would certainly take advantage of the discount card for local restaurants.

Newport villas are beautiful. We have a great view of the ocean, well equipped unit, and spacious. It is a large property but easy to manage. Everyone at the front desk is  helpful and friendly. Workout centers have new equipment and plenty of space. There is a tennis program here that is wonderful! Mark, the tennis pro is great and gives a lot of instruction during the drill. So much fun that I signed up for the whole week. It is a huge advantage to have a tennis program at this resort! Loved our week here.

Stayed here the first week of December 2012, as a timeshare exchange.  The grounds are impeccable but the units are spread out. This was not to deter from the beautiful views of the ocean as the resort is situated somewhat on a hill.  Unfortunately, I cant comment on the activities there because we were busy doing activities that one does in Southern California.  As far as the rooms, they keep up with the Marriott Standard.  We had a two bedroom suite that was comparable to staying in our own home. Comfort to the max. Do not think anyone would be displeased to staying here. Lots of resaurants within a 5 nimute drive and upscale shopping within 10 to 15 minutes. Beautiful town.  Looking forward to coming back.

Summary Heading: The weather did not cooperate, but grounds and villas were awesome.
Summary: We visited the Newport Coast Villas in January 2013.  The views of the Newport Coast were awesome and the Villas were quite comfortable.  Sadly, the weather did not cooperateand we had not rented a car, thinking that we could get around on foot.  It is a HUGE complex and therefore not all that walkable for two seniors.   We attended the "vacation club" presentation and were quite impressed.  We will be going back next April or May for another chance to consider buying into the vacation club.  We have done a great deal of investigation into how this vacation club works and are undecided at this time as to whether we would actually purchase.  However, we are looking forward very much to considering this property again when the weather lends itself to the beautiful grounds, walking

Room was mostly awesome, but the price is a bit high. Limited Parking. There was also an animal rummaging the trash can outside our door and leaving greasy tracks off the balcony. There was also a trash room that smelled on the only walk to our room/car.

the jury is still out if I really like this place or not! it is a HUGE complex and sprawled out for what appears to be miles! one get a secluded feeling as there are few neighbors, good and bad. one has to drive around the complex, nothing is easily walkable, so bad.

I would stay here anytime. Beautiful grounds, amazing view, well maintained and just plain fun. Food at the pool bar was shockingly good! Life size checkers, fussball and pool tables outside, video games for teens.  The only small negative was spotty housekeeping. most days were perfect, but two were pretty bad. No replacement of tissue, detergent, things like that. But we really didn't care. The rooms were awesome and we felt right at home!

Summary Heading: Great base for visiting Southern California Coast
Summary: Like most Southern California Coast timeshare resorts, they are not on the beach but they provide a shuttle bus to the beach, nearby shopping malls, and downtown Laguna Beach which is a plus considering that All parking even most public lots is $2 per hour with a 1 to 3 hour max.  We had a large 2 bedroom corner unit on the second floor for 7 nights.  It did have a view of the ocean but the trees below us partially obstructed the view.  There was a free wine and cheese party where the friendly resort department heads introduced themselves and mingled during the party. From this base we were able to visit the old town areas of Seal Beach (highly recommend this and free parking), Newport Beach's Balboa Island (a short $4 ferry ride from there to the old town area with ferris

Summary Heading: Great location, nice unit, kids club needs some renos
Summary: We were so happy to have lucked out in reserving a 2 bdrm unit at the Marriott Newport Coast Villas last month.  It is a timeshare we have been considering buying into.  We really enjoyed our stay, but I'm still not sure we would buy.    Pros: - Check-in was quick and friendly.  We were sent to the concierge to pick up a discount card which I was wary of doing as I was afraid of being pulled into a timeshare pitch, but I think they saw that we were with young children and just gave us the discount card and we were on our way.  We received no timeshare pressure at all during our stay. - We stayed in the 4800 building and the 2bdrm unit was large and clean.  Loved the bathrooms.  Beds were super comfy.  Lots of lighting.  Huge soaker tub in master bdrm.  They said it had an ocean

We stayed here for a week and while the weather could have been better, the Newport Coast villas  are great! We had a great view of the ocean and one hole of Pelican Hill's golf course from our windows. The villas are nicely furnished and have all the necessities needed. We shopped at a nearby Trader Joe's and Albertsons for groceries. The bedrooms are comfortable, spacious and bathrooms very nice. Remember this is not a hotel and in most cases room cleaning is extra, but the units have washers and dryers and we really didn't want the hassle of maid service.

Summary Heading: Second Stay Here- some recommedations- 5 stars intitially
Summary: So this was our second stay at the NCV's. Our stay was a mixture of good's and not so great's but nothing terrible.  Pro's  1. Check in was a breeze. We actually showed up a half hour before check in time and were told that our room was ready, this was nice as others on here have commented that they have had to wait at least until 4pm or later to get their room keys. Lisa checked us in and she was very nice and pleasant.   2. A week before we arrived we were sent an email asking us our room preferences, they gave us three room options from most to least desirable. Of course we first picked a top floor corner room with ocean views. To our delite we were given room 2330, top floor, corner room, with ocean views.   3. As was the case with our previous stay to the villa is nicely

The location of this hotel is phenomenal with views of the ocean from nearly anywhere.  Great pool and recreation area with life size chess and ping pong tables.  The shuttle to Crystal Cove State Park was nice. Also a very easy walk to the beach.

This is a great location for a Southern California family vacation. The units are large and very well kept. The development is across the street from Crystal Cove State Park which has a nice beach and tide pools. Marriott provides a shuttle that will take you there. We made it to Disneyland in 20 minutes each morning,however, if you want to stay around and just enjoy the resort, Marriott has plenty of activities to keep you busy!

Summary Heading: Gorgeous. Could not ask for more!
Summary: We booked this room directly through their hotel website. We stayed in a 2-bedroom suite that was absolutely perfect for our group. There was a large master suite with a private en suite bathroom (complete with a very large and luxurious separate bath). The second bedroom had an en suite bathroom as well, but also served as a guest bath. Full kitchen with amenities, great little patio with a partial view of the ocean, and a comfortable living room / TV area. The grounds are gorgeous, the views are spectacular, and the room was very clean and comfortable. If you're traveling with another couple or with parents, this is the perfect alternative to two staying in two separate hotel rooms. We would definitely stay here again if the situation called for a 2-bedroom suite. This is an

Had a wonderful few days here with friends, would definitely go again. Beautiful grounds, though would have preferred more compact size to facilitate walking, kids loved the pool, and I loved the views from the generously sized balcony.

Summary Heading: Perfect!  Can We Go Back Now?
Summary: My brother belongs to this time share location and was able to book us a room at the owner's rate which is cheaper than if you book it as a non-owner.  This is my second stay here, and I would go back in a minute.  The property is well maintained.  The front desk staff is friendly and helpful.  The bed linens are the kind of linens that make you want to stay in bed!  Ditto the bed!  The kitchen, dining area, and sitting area are open and inviting.  The property itself is luscious if only we had had more time to explore it.  We did sit by the pool on Sunday morning and it made me want to stay longer, or to come back when we weren't so busy with other activities.  There's a lot to explore here and we'll need to come back to explore it.  The housekeeping staff was attentive and

The buildings, condos, grounds and amenities are very nice. Our unit was cleaned daily at no charge.  I found the staff friendly and accommodating particularly the conceirge. From certain spots the views are great but from many condo units there is no view at all. To access the beach you have either a long walk or short drive but they charge $5 / hr up to $15/day for cars to park. Pelican Hill is across the street - a very high end resort with great golf. If you play strongly suggest the North course. Call one week in advance with your Marriott confirmation number and request the first twilight tee time.
