This saves $100/person and the sunset is spectacular. Another course worth playing is the less costly sister course Oak Creek.  All are Fazio designs, excellent shape and great

I got this through a time share opportunity to stay three nights for $199 if I sit through a presentation. I was interested in hearing about Marriott's new program so I did it. The resort is beautiful with a view of the ocean. Ask for a top floor and a view. We had a two bedroom condo that was very nice. They are probably 1200 sq ft and decorated nicely. We went to Disneyland (about a 30 minute commute) so was not in the room much. However, with a full kitchen it served our needs well. It is not right on the water but they do offer a shuttle to the beach.

This is a very large timeshare resort with many buildings spread over a beautiful property.  The ocean view setting is gorgeous and the grounds of the resort are well maintained including the pools.  But it's a timeshare and while we knew that, we weren't quite prepared for the lack of hospitality and guest services.  Housekeeping was expensive, difficult to find out what was included or scheduled and what wasn't,  and some services (like sheet changes) were non-existent unless you paid a $16 fee and scheduled through the front desk. Confusing overall.     The staff behaves more like property managers than guest services in a hotel.   Very different from a hotel setting if you're not familiar with timeshare environments, which we weren't.  Even our reservation got off to a

Great location. Easy to locate. Arrived in John Wayne Airport, villas are only 30 minutes away.  There are plenty of trails and local shops, beaches etc..we had a great time even with So Cal having frost advisories. I would swim in heated pools with it being 40 degrees out. The villas are well maintained, our unit was cleaned everyday.  The resort is huge, so required walking to main building for bigger fitness and pool, but was worth it.  We had a two bedroom unit located in 4900 building which is located higher on the hill.  There was a pool and fitness center located up on the hill as well. We obviously went out of season and so had complete usage of hot tub and pools. We did not participate in activities, but the list had things to try.  Laguna beach right next door.  Easy

Summary Heading: By far one of my favorite places. This report had everything.
Summary: Within a mile of the beach and trails. Great area for running. Also had several pools, hot tubs, outdoor grill, outdoor pool tables, basketball and tennis courts, putting green, sand area for kids, playground, arcade, internet cafe....etc. We loved it.Will go again.

Stayed 3 nights and 4 days on a timeshare promotions. So far this has been the best timeshare resort that I have stayed at. 2 bedroom villa with view if the Pacific Ocean. Clean room, staff was friendly and helpful. Free shuttle on the hour to nearby Crystal Cove State Beach, restaurants and shopping venues. Loved this place-planning my next vacation already.

We stayed in a 2 BR which was spacious and clean.  The hotel staff is friendly but I get a little tired of the pitches for the tour/purchase of the timeshare.  They didn't pressure us at all, but we were asked about it a few times.  The rooms themselves are very nice.  The master bedroom is spacious with a large dressing area, nice bathroom/shower area and in room tub.  The second bedroom is also nice, with a couch and bath.  The kitchen/dining area was equipped with the items we needed for our stay (glassware, cookware, etc.)  The balcony is small but sufficient for relaxing outdoors and our room/balcony offered a nice ocean view.  We had some problems with the freezer during our stay, it didn't close properly, but it was repaired quickly.  The hotel grounds are beautifully

We spent a week here.  All the rooms are two bedroom. Most of the buildings have 4 to 5 stories. All buildings have easy access to stairs and an elevator. There are lots of activities offered by Marriott on site and there are lots of things to do in the area.   Check-in was not timely but there is plenty to do:  swim, work out, play ping pong or chess, etc.  Don't let a delayed check-in make you grumpy.  If you want a quiet room and you don't want to be close to the kids activities, ask for a room in building 4900, 5000, 4400, 4500, 4600.  If you want a great sunset view ask for a room in building 1200, 1400, 1500, 1600, 2600, 2500, 2300.  If you want your kids to be close to entertainment, ask for building 2400, 2300, 2200, 2100.  The beds are comfortable.  The second bedroom

Choose this resort after depositing our Starwood/Westin timeshare in Kauai into Interval International. Marriott's Newport Coast Villas are comparable to Westin Villas 2bdrm/2 bathroom Villa overall with the exception of the villa's finishes and kitchen appliances. Some of the common areas needed sprucing up some, but the general appearance of the resort was nice. The decor in the villa was pretty dated, but everything was clean and the villa contained everything it was supposed to - kitchen was stocked with dishes, flatware, pots and pan. We are a family of 6, so we made multiple trips to the nearby Pavillion's , Albertson's & Bristol Farms. We also spotted a Trader Joe's nearby and a Whole Foods at Fashion Island Mall.   Check-in was quick and easy. You get one parking stall

It starts with arrival. Turn off the coast highway and in a quarter mile turn left for Pelican Hill Resort ,or right for Coast Villas. Same views at one third the price. Of course quality is less and Pelican has a golf course, but for families it would be hard to beat Coast Villas. All two bedroom accommodations. Almost all have ocean views and the resort has much  to offer in terms of amenities and activities. Resort staff are very friendly and helpful. Public areas are outstanding and well maintained. The units themselves are all "good" quality depending on when they have been refurbished. It would seem Marriott Vacation owners get priority on refurbished units. Only fair, they are paying the bills, but on space available you get spectacular value for a two bedroom, two bath

First time at the Marriott Villas in Newport.  Nice enough resort. We had the large, 2 bedroom suite which was great. We used one room just to throw all our luggage and travel junk in. That room was nicer than most master suites we've been in at other resorts. Had a couch, large TV, and a nice size bed. The master suite was huge; with a large tub, separate shower room, etc... Gorgeous renovations taking place.  They seem to be re-carpeting the place, repainting, and adding new base and headboards.  Room we received had an ocean view... which we enjoyed tremendously in the chilly, December mornings.  The furniture is what's dated. Looks like they purchased furniture en-mass from some Florida retirement home. But the fixtures balance it out. Nice granite counter-tops, nice table

I'm actually torn about what to write.  We'd never been to Newport Beach before and were very much looking forward to it.  The problem is the resort could have been anywhere as it's somewhat removed.  We had a 2 bedroom suite and that was simply great.  The value was also a plus as it wasn't that expensive.  From there though it was not a place we said we'd go back to.  I'd like to give Newport another shot, just not here.   First, it's removed from the beach so to go anywhere, you have to drive, period.  That takes some of the joy out of it for me.  The beach is maybe a mile or so but not a great walk.  I would normally think a resort would compensate for this by having a great facility with all services but it was just the opposite.  This was more of the eat in, cook in, drive

Summary Heading: Mickey was a little too close
Summary: Love this resort but I was not thrilled that a rodent had free roam in the villa.  While the housekeeping staff was quick to lay traps,  I would have thought management would have been a bit more interested in guest's comfort.  It seemed to be the norm that mice ran around in the rooms.  No one was surprised.

My family has been staying at this property for at least two weeks a year, every year, for the last 10+ years. I can say, unequivocally, we have never had a bad time. We have never had a less than clean suite, always have dealt with a helpful and cheerful staff, have always seen well-maintained grounds, and will keep coming here probably until the cows come home. I now live in Newport Beach, and I still stay here when my parents come to town because it feels that comfortable on the property and the suite size can accommodate a crowd. My mom has gotten her room preferences down to a science, she puts in a request for two specific units, and they are usually available... pretty good service for such an expansive property. For on-site amenities, we love and take full advantage of

My husband and I just returned after a week here.  We have been here numerous times and at all times of the year.  We always enjoy our stays.  Several reviews have stated that the staff is unfriendly and unhelpful.  We have NEVER experienced that.  I always take walks throughout the resort and whenever I pass a staff member, I am greeted in return with at least a smile and more than likely a verbal greeting.  However, I didn't find that to always be a fact when passing other clientale.  I found it interesting that many of the other visitors looked away when greeted or just nodded with a "grunt".  That makes me wonder if the persons who complain about the staff may need to look at their attitudes also.   Just saying!!  :-)

Summary Heading: One of the better Marriott family/timeshare properties
Summary: I have stayed at various Marriott properties over the years, mostly through my parent's timeshare with Marriott.   The quality of Marriott properites definitely varies by location.  But we have been very pleased each time we stayed at the Marriott Newport Coast Viilas.  Positives: large rooms, fantastic location near the ocean, full working kitchen and washer & dryer, good gym, various pools, helpful staff, close to Disneyland (about 30 min drive), lots of activites each day for kids and adults, family friendly.   Negative: average / slightly dated furniture.  But I should add that this is a very slight negative and did not imapct in any way our enjoyment of the property.  Overall I would definitely recommend staying here if visiting the Newport Coast area.

Our family stays here on many vacations, as my sister lives nearby. It is located just minutes from the beach and is a wonderful spot for vacationing. The furniture in the rooms is a bit dated, but the rooms are clean. The grounds are lovely and very well maintained. There are many activites for adults and families. The beds are okay, but the pillows are far too flat. Perhaps because it is a Marriott property, there was a bit of an issue extending one of our rooms for a night- we were quoted three different prices for the same night. Overall, this is a great place for our family to gather and perhaps there will be an update of the rooms soon!

My family has stayed here twice and we love it! The rooms are spacious and nicely furnished. The views are also great, as some of the views looks out over the ocean and Catalina. The service is great and everything is very nice. Additionally it is supremely family-friendly! Overall it is a really great place

Our second visit to this gorgeous property, and definitely not my last.  We're not Marriott Vacation Club Owners.  It's not obvious, but based on availability you can rent a villa, just like any other room at any Marriott.   Just make sure to make a reservation well in advance.   Do  walk the grounds a few times, even with the big hills.  It's like being at some beautiful complex on Lake Como.  Except on a very clear day, you can easily see Catalina Island.   We stayed in the 5100 building this trip and just down the hill at 4700 last time (March '10).  Both afforded beautiful ocean views from the balcony.   Although the 5100 is as far from the clubhouse as you can get, it is right next to one of the pool/hot tub/fitness center complexes in a quieter part of the property.   As

Used our Marriott points to stay for 6 nights at the Villas.  The points charge was excessive & Marriott's corporate offices fail in treating Gold members properly.  Now that that's out of the way, we had a spacious, terrific 2 bedroom suite in a quiet, peaceful area of the resort next to the canyon & golf course with a limited ocean view.  Breakfast & coffee on the balcony were some of my favorite moments.  At night, all we heard were the owls - it was very private.  "Nancy the Red head" went out of her way for us & is a real gem.  We had little contact with others but they didn't seem to be overly friendly or helpful.  The property is about 60 miles from the Hollywood action with plenty of traffic.  Newport is a beautiful, upscale area, great shops & plenty of good

Summary Heading: 3900-4400 is almost a GAURANTEED ocean view!
Summary: We stayed at the 3900 villa, which was AMAZINGLY located! The view was phenominal. I wish I had been able to make my owners request sooner, however, they did not have my correct email address, so I was never contacted. I did get most of my request when I did call them 3 weeks ahead. One of the 4 buildings I requested, 3rd out of 4 floors, and a great view. Parking, it appears, is almost always a problem here.  I agree with one thing that one of my fellow owners complained about for apparently the sam week. I have seen people smoking on balconies and too many people cramming into some rooms. I do feel security should step up more and call out some guests or "owners" and enforce the policies for the good of the people. If people are violating rules, they signed a contract they

Traded our timeshare week through Interval. Used the resort as a base for Disneyland as we had 4 day park hoppers.  Check in-We arrived after the check in rush, so we walked right up and were taken care of. The young man who checked us in was pleasant but as others have said, pretty much expect to be stuck where ever they put you. They are doing a renovation of the lobby so it was messy in there.  Room-Our room was in the 1600 building. It is only a 2 story building and we were on the top floor and the end of the building so our room was pretty quite. The bed in the master bedroom was not very comfortable. We only had a peek of the ocean since we were not up very high but we were across the street from the activity center and a short flight of stairs to the main pool area, so

Traded out timeshare at the Crescent in South Beach for a stay at the New Port Coast Villas in November. The resort is immaculate. It is spread out and has some hills and amazing views of the Pacific. There is a main pool with great views and 4 other pools strategically placed through the resort. There is a main fitness room which is well kept with ample equipment and another smaller facility by one of the pools. There are multiple hot tubs as well. Check in was late and they also allowed us a late check out. The Villas are amazing. We stayed in the 2700 building with Ocean and Valley view. It was beautiful, nice balcony. Request a top floor if possible. There are elevators and if the people above you have kids you can hear them running around, not a deal breaker though. The

We stayed at Marriott Coastal Villas as the last stop on our 2 week honeymoon in the USA. We really were looking forward to our stay here, so we were a little disappointed when we were placed in the building that was as far away as possible from the main resort area. The resort facilities are great and ideal for families, as was our 2 bedroom apartment and we enjoyed the pools, but the service was just not as good as we received at the other places we stayed at during our trip. Maybe we just picked the wrong place for a Honeymoon stay :)
Manager Response: We are sorry to hear that you did not have a positive experience at Marriott's Newport Coast Villas.  This is not typical of the guest experience at our resort and we would appreciate an opportunity to personally address your concerns.  Please contact us at customer.care@vacationclub.com or at 800 860 9384.  We look forward to hearing from you.

Summary: As Marriott time share owner we've traded our Vegas unit for other locations numerous times thru Marriott and Interval Intl.  Last couple times at Williamsburg (poor accommodations, great location) and Phuket (decent accommodation, poor location) we had some disappointments so were very pleasantly surprised by this fantastic property.    The location right on the Pacific Coast Hwy couldn't have been better.  Close to all the southern Cal beach side towns and sights with an elevated view of the ocean from our rooms.  The two bedroom suite with separate baths, kitchen, dining area, covered patio was as comfortable (and more elegant) as home except for the REALLY uncomfortable sofa in the living area.  Probably because it was a pull out sofa bed but as the only large sitting pc in

We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Newport Coast villas (October 2012)  We traded our Myrtle Beach timeshare and stayed in bldg 2700, 3rd floor, corner view - it was amazing, day and night were just beautiful and peaceful.  Other posts are correct, you don't get early check-in at all, but enjoy the surroundings til your villa is ready - they have it down pat.  Grounds are clean, friendly staff and lush landscaping.  Out of the 10 Marriott timeshares we've stayed in, this is the nicest - views top it. They have 5 pools (spread out but not too crowded) and pool bar with views that will just chill you out as you stare.  Like others stated, it's a hilly resort, lots of walking and parking can be difficult, but nothing of great concern.  The surrounding areas are easy to get to

It was beautiful! We checked in early and got a text about 2:30pm on 11-30-12. I asked if we could get a high floor and yes we got changed to bldg 4600. Agree with everything my hubby said chibearfann99. We were in 7th heaven. Next time would like to stay closer to a pool. Walking is nice though for exercise. The staff was really nice. I highly suggest staying here. I just want to Thank everyone here for the great service we had during our stay last week.

I believe all the units are two bedroom suites with a full kitchen.  The units are spacious, clean, and comfortable.  We only stayed a couple of nights and spent most of the time eating out; otherwise, the kitchen would have been great for preparing some meals.  The property is spread out over a hilly area, so access to the main area with pool and activities could require a bit of a walk up stairs and uphill walkways (especially if you are in one of the remote units).    One negative point is that parking could be challenging in you return later at night.  You may find a parking space, but it could be a considerable distance from your unit.,,,(this is almost as bad as in the city).

Great place to stay with shuttle service even for the kids, roomy and clean. If you can bypass or deal with the one hour presentation for time shares its worth it. Lots of fun, pool side service and full kitchen.

I stayed one week in the 4600 Building with my family.  Walking around the resort a  bit, I believe the views of the Pacific Ocean can be seen from many different buildings.  If you are fortunate enough to get a unit on the upper floors, the best views are from those units.  The first floor rooms in Building 4000, 4100 or 4200 are ok as well because there is no trees or bushes blocking the views.  I stayed the first week of December.  Overall, it was very quiet the whole week.  If you like crowds, noise & people, I suggest you stay here around the holidays or summer.  If you like peace & serenity, pick an off season time to visit.  The rooms are equipped with all the essentials.  If you don't have it, the staff is more than accomodating.  The pools were warm even when it didn't

We rented a week here on Redweek.com and could not have been happier.  Was a bit of a risk to pay a third party, but it turned out great.  Property was beautiful, pools were great and we loved the location south of the newport beach area.  We've stayed on the Balboa Peninsula before and were pleasantly surprised how nice it was to explore a new part of town down by Corona del Mar.  Would not recommend the timeshare presentation, but would definately return to this amazing resort.  We did not experience any of the customer service issues seen in recent reviews, but it should be noted that our visit was in early August 2012.

Summary Heading: Beautiful Property But Customer Service Lacking
Summary: I don't know if it's the size of the property and maybe that they were short staffed due to being the off season but I was almost disappointed. The first day when we went to check in, around 5 pm, everything went smoothly and we were given our room key.  When we saw that our room was on the bottom floor with only the view or a couple of bushes, I asked to move.  They said they were almost 90% sold out.  I said okay and nevermind since we had gotten a cheaper rate.  The next morning however, there were only about 35% of the parking lots full.  We felt like we had been lied too. I then checked again the next night, again no sell out like I had thought.  The beds were a little on the firm side with a foam mattress but not bad.  In November, it's cool but not cold so we hung out at
Manager Response: We are sorry to hear that your experience at Marriott's Newport Coast Villas fell short of your expectations.  Please contact our customer care team at 800 936 6824 or via email at customer.care@vacationclub.com so that we can personally address your concerns.

Summary Heading: Stockton moved into the Newport Villas
Summary: As a vacation club member for over 10 years, I am sad to say I can no longer recommend this property to anyone. Over the last year guest quality and management have sharply declined. Drug use filled the air as we strolled the property and management (night) especially on Thanksgiving, was unbelievably bad. Not only did they not have any solutions to minor problems all week- they just didn't care. It was incompetence week. As for security, worthless. If you want to bring a dog- go ahead! Just call it a service animal, let it yap all week and annoy your neighbors. It's ok. The walls are paper thin and don't expect to be moved- even if you are a member. The problem is that if you are a vacation club member your preferential treatment is being deferred to the transient off the
Manager Response: We are very disappointed to read your review.  This is not the typical experience at Marriott's Newport Coast Villas.  We do not allow pets on property, drug use is absolutely not tolerated by any guest and we do not permit anyone to host a party in their villa with outside guests not staying at the resort. It is also important to note that owners of Marriott's Newport Coast Villas always receive room assignment priority over non-owners.  We're sorry to hear that your experience was less than what you expect and deserve from Marriott.  Please contact our customer care team at 800 936 6824 so that we may personally address your concerns.

Summary: We stayed for a week in a 2 bedroom villa with my in-laws who obtained the week through their timeshare exchange.  The villa was beautiful and very clean upon our arrival.  The grounds are also beautiful.  I was particularly impressed with the gym - much nicer than most gyms to be found at a hotel or resort.  There are plenty of activities going on throughout the day which makes it a nice option for families.  Although I did not participate in any of the formal activities my in-laws did and they seemed to enjoy them.  I did, however, take advantage of the bike rentals on site.  The resort is a 15 - 20 minute walk from the beach.  Personally I enjoyed taking this walk everyday, but others may find this too far.  This was my first trip to Newport Beach and I found the whole area

Summary Heading: Very Good is the rating and it is...
Summary: We've stayed here twice now by trading in our other timeshare to this location.  I would love to give this place an excellent but a couple of small issues bumped it down a notch.  Every review that gives the high points are correct.  This place is nicely located.  You get ocean views from the top floors, They are quiet and clean.  There is free shuttle service to surrounding attactions...all excellent stuff.  What's not so great is how they have cheapened up the offerings since the last time we stayed here.  Before you would get a mid week cleaning.  Now you have to pay for it and it's rediculously expensive..  Before they had a member party...not any more.  There were a couple other smaller examples not worth mentioning since most wouldn't miss them.  But my biggest frustration

We were excited to finally come to this property, but disappointed of the set-up of the buildings, there are so many and limited parking at certain buildings. No restaurants on property, and a very small market place, which is crazy given the size of the property. Great restaurants off property and beautiful ocean scenery every where! I will say Our unit needs major renovating.  There are several pools through out the property which is nice. Lots for kids and adults to do. Great place for some people who enjoy being outdoors.   We might consider returning here one day if they upgrade the units.

Summary Heading: Felt like we were it a Tuscan villa.
Summary: Such a beautiful resort.  The grounds, the architecture and the pool transformed us into thinking we were in Italy.  The staff and the accommodations were absolutely top notch.  The two bedroom two bath villas are spacious enough for 4 so bring another couple and share the cost.  I had my parents come with us and they had a blast too.

We visited for the first time to Marriott's Newport Coast Villas this summer. The resort grounds are gorgeous, the rooms are nice, and the hospitality is good.  Marriott cuts no corners in creating a great looking resort. I felt like I was in some small ocean side villa in Europe somewhere.   The rooms were spacious and comfortable. I like the full spacious kitchen that comes with each villa stocked with cooking ware and everything you would need to serve meals. Having a washer/dryer in our villa makes it very convenient to keep up with clothes,  especially with kids and a reason to not have to pack so much clothes!  They had plenty of onsight activites for our family if we chose to do them. The pool was nice. I would visit Marriott Newport Coast Villas again.

I arrived at 1am and Daniel at front desk made us feel welcome setting us up for a great weekend. Room with full kitchen was essential for us. We had breakfast every morning. I slept on the sleeper sofa and was the best experience on a pullout sofa I have had. Great Job Marriott Vacation Club

We got a great deal on expedia with this hotel so we didnt end up paying the full rate which was quite expensive. We stayed 7 nights here and it was amazing. The apartment was fully equipped... i was so excited to see a washing machine & dryer. The grounds are well kept and very pretty. The property is very large so you would definitely need to hire a car when in Newport. The apartment was very spacious and is close by Fashion Island & local restaurants. If offered the special rate again by expedia, i would definitely stay here again. The only thing is, on our second last day, the hotel offered a special to us which was stay an additional 3 nights for only $199.00 + tax (not per night but for the whole 3 nights) which was great but we couldnt do because we had a flight back to

For the price that you pay this place is amazing. We had a 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom villa that was huge and had very modern facilities at the top of the resort by the tennis courts. We were told that ours was a new villa and it was quite something. The resort has everything from 2 gyms, tennis courts, can't even count how many pools but a lot of them, b/ball court and putting green, bbq areas plus fire pits. Beautifully landscaped gardens with the most stunning views to the coast. Wanted to move in straight away. Couldn't fault any staff as they were highly professional and always smiling. We did have a car so that made traveling around to Luguna, San Diego and Disneyland easy. Great place for families or anyone wanting to go and relax and enjoy the amazing facilities and beautiful

The resort is very nice, the grounds are nice, the rooms are very comfortable.  Not as clean as i would expect for this kind of resort. The carpet should be replaced.   I love the salt water pool.  We had to call to schedule for the room to be cleaned, it's not just on a scheduled day.   No restaurant, so we had to use their pricey market to buy our food if we wanted to stay on site for breakfast.

Summary Heading: + great location close to Crystal Cove, Laguna Beach and Newport Beach, + spacious apartments, - noisy & reckless crowd
Summary: This was my first stay in a Marriott Vacation Club and maybe my last. Although the facilities and grounds are great the crowd staying with you in the Newport Beach club is awful.   + Apartments: The apartments or as they call it ‘villas’ are spacious, clean and fit 8 people easily. They are equipped with decent appliances and cozy beds. From most patios you have nice views over the shore. Just try to stay away from the ground floors since I had the impression that these apartments are much darker than the ones on the upper floors.   +/- Grounds: The Marriott has several large pools with small tide pools. Some of them are stunning and very inviting but since they are packed with families and their kids you won’t find a quiet area to relax. Those looking for a relaxed day at the

nice villas about a 10 minute walk to newport beach very child friendly big pool but there are no eat here at the resort but you have a kitchen in your room make sure you see the sunset down at the beach

We were staying at the villas for a funeral we were going to be attending.  When we cked into the front desk area I cked with the desk clerk regarding the things I had requested:  end unit, top floor, view, basically somewhere quiet because we were here for a funeral.  The man at the desk told us we were in a villa on the bottom floor by the road.  This translated to me as NOISE.  I was so frustrated.  I told him what I had requested and of course yes they had made note of this.  But still they had reserved this villa for us.  The front desk lead then told us that this was a time share and they were not like a hotel.  It wasn't as easy to give us our requests.  I told him 'then you should be telling us this when we make our reservations'!  He understood my frustration and spent

Had a great girls trip to the Newport Villas!  Was in the 4200 building.  It's two story with no elevator but great views!  Very quiet.   Walked to crystal cove for breakfast.  Shopped until we dropped.   Mastro's is a great place for cocktails at 4 PM before the crowds.  WILDFISH restaurant is amazing good!  Pelican Grill for football and appetizers!

Summary Heading: Great for families but limited amenities
Summary: This is part of the Marriott Timeshare system.   The rooms are large with full kitchens and living/dining areas.  The units theoretically can sleep up to 8 people (king bed, queen bed, and two pullouts).   Great for families.   This is a sprawling hilly resort so bring comfortable shoes if you like to walk.   Depending on where you wind up you could be taking a long flight of stairs to get to a pool.   There is no full service restaurant on site.   If you arrive late in the afternoon you will need to go off site to get something to eat – but hey you are in SO CAL so don’t waste your time hanging around the hotel.   They do offer free shuttle service to Crystal Cove, Laguna Beach and Fashion Island – hours are limited however.    Quality golf, beach, and hiking are all nearby.

This was our third time visiting this property. We love the location across the street from beauitful Crystal Cove Beach. We love the lovely large rooms. They are the perfect size for a family of 4. And we LOVE the views from the rooms we've had their. The property is very well kept. Its definitely a family friendly place with great pools, ping pong, shuffle board, life sized chess & checkers, basketball, putting green, bonfire, etc. We are Marriott owners elsewhere, and we felt very welcome and treated very well by everyone. We bought our disneyland tickets from the events counter and she was extremely helpful. We had dinner at the poolside grill which was much better than we expected it to be. I thought it was a little pricey, but the fish tacos were amazing! And everyone else

my wife and stayed here and had a great time -loved the security of the place and closeness to shopping and restaurants outside of the resort --staff were extremely helpful and our oceanview villa was clean spacious and terrific view

We spend 4 nights here in October. We were so pleased when we pulled up and even more pleased when we unlocked our villa door, and found more like an upscale apartment. It was beautiful, more than we could have asked for. We were close to the front entrance with parking  very close. We had such a nice ocean view! Everything was clean and in working order, lots of dishes and daily service. We hope to return again some day. The grounds were gorgeous and stunning. Thank you Marriott, It's why I'm a silver rewards member and card holder.

Summary Heading: Very good value and HUGE rooms for families!
Summary: I have never stayed at a Marriott Vacation resort before, and since I needed a hotel for the weekend in the Newport Beach area, I thought I would give them a try. These Villas are basically timeshares that Marriott offers to them public when they are not being used by their owners. The property is very large and they offer shuttle service on golf carts. We were greeted upon check in and when I asked for a villa in a quiet area, I was accommodated. We stayed in building 1000. This villa was HUGE! Easily sleeps 6 people. 2 bedrooms. 2 bathrooms; full kitchen and 3 flat screen TVs!  Rooms very very clean and they come with olates, utensils, even a pizza cutter! We were overlooking the pool which was great and not too noisy. We also made reservations at the tennis courts. They also

If you are not an owner, the front desk people will make sure you know your place, which is apparently far below the status level of everyone else. From my very first interaction with the property on this visit (the pre-arrival email) to checking out, every single interaction with the staff at this hotel was absolutely appalling for a Marriott property (the manager, Kathleen, was the only exception, but unfortunately, when you have to have multiple conversations with a manger, you have already lost me). Asking if our rooms were available before check-in, is apparently out of line. Asking to park two cars near our villa to unload items and small children was against policy (or so we were told, later to be corrected by the manager). One night of one of our villas was somehow

We stayed here 3 nights.  There are all different prices floating around for this place.  If you get a low price you are getting incredible value for your money. We lucked out and, though we had a first floor room, we were on the southern edge of the property and from the master suite and patio had fabulous ocean views.  These "rooms" are luxuriously appointed 2 BR, 2 BA condos with a full kitchen, 3 flat screen tvs and a patio with a table and 4 chairs. It's quite a property with huge gorgeous pools, spas, tennis courts, and a super fitness center. This place is SWEET! The location is also very convenient to all of Orange County

Summary Heading: As close to heaven as it gets!
Summary: An exceptional property.  Location is stellar overlooking one of the more majestic stretches of the Pacific Ocean over a state park and nature preserve with tons of hollywood history.  The rooms are beautifully appointed, the amenities over the top--numerous gorgeous pools, great work out room, steam and sauna, small spa onsite with wonderful therapists, fab pool bar & grill--poolside service, a shuttle to and from the beach, malls and art areas--that goes until evening--great for dining out! A staff that is warm and friendly and makes you feel you are staying at a private club--also great activities for kids, teens and even adults every day all day!  Close to Disneyland, Laguna Beach etc--this a a treasure!!

Summary Heading: Great weekend getaway away from the hustle of LA
Summary: We flew in for long weekend and stayed at the Marriott Villas for 3 nights.The 2 bedroom units are really really nice. Very large, would be perfect for 2 couple or a small family. Full kitchen with all the needed utensils ( wine glasses & openers, strainers, lots of plate and dishes, the lot!) The master bath had a great double shower with a large tub as well. I would love to try and get the top floor next time as we could here the little people running around upstairs in the morning , but it wasnt a huge deal to us. The 3 pools were well maintained and very busy with kids but what do you expect, kids love pools. The "quiet pool" was not so quiet as the hotel seemed to not really monitor it and the parents staying in that area didnt seem to really understand this is not a kids

We stayed here last weekend of Oct during a visit to OC for a wedding.  The 2br suite worked really well for us; a family of four (kids are 5 and 2 yrs old respectively).  Rooms are clean and we had a beautiful partial but "large" view of the ocean.  Down side is there is no room service (you can order from restaurants for delivery), the on-site store sells Starbucks coffee and some supplies, the poolside Grill has a decent but basic menu.  However, there are great restaurants at the nearby Crystal Cove shopping ctr that features high end stores and a Trader Joes.  Also, nearby cities of Laguna Beach and Huntington Beach also additional dining and entertainment.

The wording "villa" is misleading. These are very nice 2 bedroom apartments with 2 bathrooms and full kitchen, with a washer/dryer. Very handy and everything. Except there are 700+ of these villas stacked on top of each other. To get an ocean view, on a high floor, the vacation owners get preference, and we were left to feel that we were in a upscale motel next to the highway. The room was dark, and opening the balcony doors meant a heck of motor noise. When we asked to move - there were a herd of elephants upstairs, running incessantly above our heads, no matter which room we were in, soundproofing non-existent- we were wait listed. No one got back to us. So the customer service was just lip service in this case. There was no restaurant at all. A snack grill served drinks etc

Beautiful room!  We had a two bedroom with two baths.  The room even had a full washer and dryer and kitchen.  I was in LOVE.  We only stayed one night but I could have stayed a week! The outside was well kept.  Ample parking.  The pool was beautiful and had LOTS of children activities.  We didn't bring our children this time, we had gone with couple friends.  My husband and I decided next time we are definatly bringing the kids.  Beautiful hotel!!!!

We had a great time.  We all loved the pool the most.  We spent hours swimming and playing in the pool. The suites are spacious and comfortable with a touch of class.  This was probably our best vacation yet.   Thank you Marrott!

We are Marriott Resort owners, but not at this resort. This was our first stay here and we enjoyed everything about it.  The staff were very friendly, including during check-in, check-out, and sales.  The landscaping is in outstanding condition and the architecture of the building had a feel of Tuscany. The resort is built on the side of the mountain, so there are many views of the ocean.  The resort has 5 pools and they are heated. The weather was very nice given it was late October, so many people were using the pools.   Our room had a wonderful view of the ocean and on most days we could even see Catalina Island.  All units are dedicated 2 bedroom units, with two bathrooms, a fully stocked kitchen, a washer and dryer, and living space.  Each bedroom and the living room had a

We just returned home yesterday from our stay here and none of us can stop talking about how beautiful this hotel and experience was. I had a feeling it was going to be top notch because even a week before we arrived, I received an email from the "pre-arrival team" asking for any special requests I might have. We were coming for a 2 day trip to Disneyland and wanted something close to the amusement park. The drive was about 20 minutes or less from Disney, super easy. Upon arrival, I asked if I happened to get an ocean view room and the front desk clerk just smiled and said "Oh yes, you sure did!" and boy, did we! We were on the top floor of the 3900 building and it was ALL ocean view. Such an amazing, gorgeous view and we could even see Catalina Island in the distance. We live

Summary Heading: Excellent stay - good marks in spite of a few negatives
Summary: We had a great stay at the Marriott NP Coast Villa Timeshare.  It was the first time that we were there.  We traded in to this property from another Marriott timeshare.  Of the five Marriott timeshares that I have stayed in, all have been very nice and this one is perhaps the nicest.  THE GOOD:  We found our unit (3844) to be very nicely appointed, clean, and everything worked.  It was a full 2 BR with a full kitchen, dining room with 6 chairs, a living room with a pull out couch.  The smaller BR had a king or queen bed AND a pullout couch.  The balcony had a table and four chairs.  There was A/C, but we had windows (with screens) open and enjoyed the fresh air.  With the single exception noted below (under "the bad") the unit was quiet.  The internet was free and worked well.

Summary Heading: Beautiful Property in a Great Location
Summary: We traded our Florida Grand Vista for the Villas thru II...put your request in early, we did and were confirmed 11 months out. The Newport Villas are set on a beautiful property.  We stayed in bldg 3500 on the top floor, Great Views!  We arrived around 1pm our room was not ready until 4:30pm which is the norm it seems with this property, especially if you request a top floor in a good location.  We just ventured down to the pool bar for some lunch / drinks until they notified us. The room itself is nice, comfy beds and a nice balcony to enjoy sitting out for breakfast and an evening drink or two ;).....I'm not a fan of the open bathroom with those tubs they place in the master bed/bath.  I'd rather a large updated bathroom with its own door and a nice updated shower.  The

This was our third time to this hotel and we are still in love with it and the Newport Coast area. The villas are very comfortable for our young family, the pools are great, and the kids room (king Triton's)  is a favourite spot for our kids. We spent time at Laguna Beach, Crystal Cove, and Huntington Beach, which were all great. Such a relaxing vacation before hitting Disneyland!   We do wish they had a bar open late, as we had a babysitter and wanted to go out for a drink around 8pm. However, we were told to go to the Pelican Hill Resort to their bar, which was a short walk away and was a bit of a fun adventure. It would be nice if they had a real restaurant at this hotel. As well, there were a bunch of elephants living above us. If you can, snag a top floor villa. However,

Summary Heading: Not a place for a one night stay.
Summary: Although the resort is very nice, and the two room apartments were great, we could not check in until 4:00 and had to check out by 10 a.m. the following day.  So, we were unable to utilize the lovely resort facilities.  Sadly, we spent very little time there.  I would recommend staying for at least two nights, and preferably more.  We were in town for a party, so not really on a vacation, but Marriott is first class.

As one of Marriott's luxury timeshare resorts, this property is of high quality and full of comforts and amenities for families or just adults. The apartments are fully functional with a full kitchen, living room, dining room and bed and baths all with quality furniture and well constructed. The property has at least 4 pools, activity and game rooms for kids, poolside bar and lots to do. They provide a shuttle to take you to nearby activities, located less than a mile to the beach, the shuttle is still very handy.

Well, Marriott hotels of this caliber are seldom disappointing and this one is up there on my book.  The location in Newport, the quality of the room deccor, landscape, spotless clean, great shower, awesome appliances at the kitchen.  The only footnotes here are that the staff is somewhat trained...   We saw glasses not washed and old dishes not picked but the worst is, and you have to be a foreigner to understand this, my niece called the reception and they did not understand her pretty fluent english and just hung up on her (!).  Marriott, Marriott...    Also, kids everywhere at around the pool.  Not big on that but that is my fault for not checking...  Biggest plus:  sunset view and proximity to Crystal Cove beach (great run).

Summary Heading: Wonderfully relaxing with bonus yoga lessons -thanks Jess
Summary: Just the most relaxing destination!  Facilities and grounds superbly kept! Staff very helpful and friendly!  The only exception, a cheeky bar attendant who tried to charge premium prices for requested well drinks and momentarily marred  an orherwise brillant week in a beautiful location!  We will be back!  One recommendation....an adults only pool!  Amazing how two loud and undisciplined children can upset a beautiful and peaceful afternoon. No need for children jumping on strangers or trying to splash and irritate small groups talking poolside ignoring respectfully quiet requests for silence and/or distance.  It was a very large pool, no need for this harrassment, yet many guests gave uo and left the poolside while parental control was absent or ineffective.  Special thanks to

We stayed in a two bedroom villa-very nice and spacious with a nice kitchen. This is located just 5 minutes from Crystal Cove beach, and not far from other beaches. They offer beach chairs, umbrellas to rent very reasonably. The resort has 3 pools. The beds were very comfortable and everyone is anxious to help you with anything. Great place for an extended stay!

My family (husband & 3 girls ages 7,5,& 3) stayed the week beginning 9/29/12 utilizing a timeshare trade.   We were on the 3rd floor of the 2200 bldg.  We checked in ~8pm Saturday--rooms were ready.  Accommodation was spacious in our 2 BR, 2 Bath condo.  All 3 girls slept comfortably in the 2nd BR, which had a Queen bed as well as a pull out sofa.  We were near the pool & in the same bldg as the kids' activity center.  Also to note--the water temp of the pool was great (not too cool).    A family beach is not within walking distance (not walking distance for little ones), but both Laguna Beach and Balboa Island (with its nice beach) are short drives.  Disneyland was only 25 mins.  Although there was only a pool bar restaurant and a small cafe on site, there are plenty of

Summary Heading: In September the kids are home
Summary: This was a mid September week we took to chill out and relax. With the summer gone and kids back at School our week from 9/28 to 10/5 the resort was perfect. We were in the 3600 building which was a spacious 2 BD apt so our family from Portland could join us.  The grounds are majestic; the pool area and water temperature was perfect. While Newport Beach is a few minutes north , we found Laquna Beach the place to go

First-class resort with roomy villas and beautiful facilities.  It is a big complex, so it takes a few days to get your bearings, but it didn't take that long to find our way to the pool!  It even has an adult only hot tub that was great.  Didn't have much interaction with staff during our week long visit.  Members of family visited Disneyland while we were there and said it was only about a 25 minute drive.  Kitchen area was well stocked and roomy.  Master suite was huge with big jetted spa tub, but other bedroom was small.  Living area was a little tight with 6 people, but has huge private deck attached.  We did order pizza one time from on site market, but it was delivered late, so they gave us two pizzas.  Overall, we can't wait to go back someday!

Summary Heading: Great, when not crowded AND if you get the right villa
Summary: We have been coming here for years.  It continues to get more and more crowded.  It used to be you didn't have to fight for a pool chair and the hot tub was open.  Now it is usually mayhem and kids dominate the hotub with 20 kids in a 10 person tub.  I'm not complaining about kids, I like kids, this place is just getting too popular.  They also used to be higher priced units and now they are bargain basementing this place at $200/night.  Marriott desire to maximize profits is destroying the benefit of spending tens of thousands on a timeshare.  This used to be a great place, especially in the off season.  Now, it is turning into one step above a holiday inn.  The rooms are fine, but the place is getting somewhat dated at this point.  If you are looking for a calm and relaxing

Great place to stay. Big rooms,  great location but the personnel at this property are severely lacking. I've stayed here many times. We own weeks here and we are Marriott Gold members. It makes NO difference. You ate treated like trash when you check in. It's so frustrating. Even at 4pm check-in time you still have to wait. They just smugly say, "sorry, your room will be ready at 4:30." They just don't care. Kids in the car, groceries melting, it doesn't matter.

I will start with the fact that I own in another Marriott location and have vacationed in quite a few Marriott Vacation Villa locations.  The rooms and views were lovely and what I would expect from a Marriott Vacation Villa.  The resort is very pretty; however, if you are not up to walking long walks or "41" steps up to the main resort level to the pool or a similar climb down steps to another pool area be forewarned... and make sure your villa is not in 2500.    We were called weeks in advance about any requests we might have and I told them that my husband was having a knee replacement in the near future and we needed to be close to at least elevator.  They did put us near an elevator, but when you were on the ground level it was a far walk to our car and literally 41 steps

We are Marriott owners at a different location, but used the new point system to come in for a 3 day weekend.  Nice, large property with updated & spacious rooms.  All the comforts of home- full kitchen, 6 person dining table, nice master bdrm, washer/dryer, etc...  Located in between Newport & Laguna - just a short ride from John Wayne airport.  Penty of restaurants to choose from at every price level or make a trip to Trader Joes or Whole Foods to cook up something in the kitchen or gas grills located by almost every villa.  Spent most of our time off property, so cannot speak much of use of on site amenities.  Did spend a couple hours one afternoon at the main pool - only disappointment was literally no supervision (by staff or parents) of children in the pool area.  2

Like all Marriott vacation share properties the facility was clean,nice and lots of outside play areas including 3 pools. We happened to be staying with a couple who couldnt walk long or hard and the hills made it hard for them to get around with out a car. One car can park at the villa but the other is in a garage structure. The little store on property had GREAT donuts in the morning but for my schedule I wish it had opened at 6am.

We appreciate the dedication of all the employees at this Marriott Vacation Club. The villa we stayed in #2736 was very clean and had everything we needed. All we had to do was buy food or dine out. The unit is handicap accessibility and made it safe to maneuver around and the balcony had a great view. I used the spa services and was pleased with the services offered. I grounds were kept immaculate and manicured. I will most certainly return for future vacationing. I was true pleasure to stay in such a wonderful place with a great staff, amenities and a beautiful view.

This is one of the nicest timeshare units we've stayed in and we've been in quite a few Marriott properties over the years. This complex is huge! Some 700 units. It's built on a hillside so there are many (if not most) units that have a clear but somewhat distant view of the ocean. The grounds are immaculate, our unit and everywhere we went on the grounds were in top shape. Most buildings have three or four floors so not everyone is going to be able to get a top floor and yes, sometimes you might hear people above you. We really haven't here but you might. It's not that different than living in any apartment complex from that perspective.  This isn't a hotel. Some people seem to confuse it for one but it is not. It's a vacation villa that is part of a very large time share

Summary Heading: Do a week, not a weekend
Summary: Nice resort, lovely rooms, full kitchen, great for two couples.   But, be aware, two nights, three days actually gives one full day and one evening ONLY.   We arrived at 2pm and sat in lobby until 4pm.  Check in. STARTS at 4pm, so if busy it will be awhile till you get to your room.  One day wasted.  Late checkout is 11am, not 1pm as on most nicer places.  That day is gone. There were laundry carts on the hall as we got to our room.  Really!!  No restaurant on site but they did have a bar and grille at the pool.  Great staff there.   Front desk just knows how to say, "sorry, your room is not ready".  So, go for a week and enjoy a 4 or 5 full days.  Don't waste your money or points on a long weekend.  Also, pretty spread, so be ready to walk.  If you have one, the views are

My wife and I stayed at the resort on a promotional deal and were pleased with the accommodations and the service. The sales presentation was not high pressure as many timeshare deals can be.  Our room was on the second floor in the middle of the resort. We didn't spend much time in the resort itself, though it seemed nice and not too crowded. We used it as a base for daily activities in the nearby area. We walked down to the beach each day (about a mile each way.) There were very few people at the beach (mid Sept). We spent time in Laguna, Newport and LA. It was a great location and overall was nice and comfortable.

Stayed in July 2012, for a week. Liked the grounds of this resort, We did not use all the facilities in the resort, as we were busy discovering the beaches and state parks around with many beautiful trails. The conceirge was so helpful, we used to check with her every morining before we head to the beach or state park, she gave us tips about best way to park around places we want to go to, and was very freindly. The spa was so good, the massage is tailored to your needs. Big kitchen with all what we needed. The location is very good for Laguana Beach or Huntington beach and everything in between.

We had a 2 bedroom / 2 bath unit.  It was well decorated and spacious.  Our family of four never felt cramped.  When grandparents arrived for a few days, the pull out bed/couch in the living room served the children well.    The kitchen was completely stocked with everything that we needed to prepare meals for the entire week.   The pool was always clean & uncrowded.  The kids had a blast swimming & playing ping-pong and pool.  The facility is located to many attractions.  We took day trips to the Getty-Malibu, Getty@I-405, The Reagan Library, Nixon Library, Bass Pro Shops, the beach and fishing.  Close to Disneyland if you are so inclined!  It was a great relaxing week in So. Cal. in the warmth of Newport Beach.

Just spent a week at this location. Perfect. Location is ideal. The units are perfect. Resort very nice but also laid back. You don't need to have money ready to tip but everyone is always there to help if you need. The resort is very clean and managed very well.we bought 5 years ago and our family loves moving back. We have 14 and 12 year old. They hung out in The Shack and had fun when not in main pool. Highly recommend for families.

Marriott did an outstanding job developing this property.  The Italian style villas are on a hillside overlooking the Pacific, with most rooms having at least some view of the ocean.  The two bedroom villas are first class all the way...comfortable beds, very stylish, beautifully furnished...everything you could ask for.  One of the nicest Marriott properties we have stayed at.

We stayed for 3 nights on points and liked the villas - they are on a beautiful property in above the beach - crystal cove is a great beach destination - the villas have stainless appliances and were well laid out-nicer that other vacation clubs weve stayed at. pools were crowded but nice - the grounds are beautiful with trails to walk -get a top floor for a killer view.

We are Marriott owners and while it took some time to exchange into this property it was well worth the wait.  We are traveling with our 5 and 7 year old kids and grandma.  We used the resort as a "homebase" and would day trip to San Diego.  We were lucky not to catch any traffic - we were able to fit in Coranado, the USS Midway and also Legoland.    The resort itself is one of the larger Marriott properties we have been too.  It has a Tuscan feel and is located on top of a hill overlooking the ocean.  It is not ocean front, but about a mile walk down the hill and through the State Park at the bottom of the hill then to the beach.  We requested a unit near the pool and kid's club.  It was the usual unit 2b/2b with kitchen.  There was a Trader Joe's down the PCH that was

This is about the 5th or 6th time we have stayed at the Newport Coast Villas. It is a great place for a family vacation and we love the villas and the location. A lot of people review this property as if it were a hotel. This is not a regular hotel property - it is a timeshare property. So, there are a lot of people at check-in time and you need to be a little patient because everyone wants their room at 4:00. We waited only a few minutes to check in and our villa was not quite ready, but it didn't take too long. The person who helped us check in was wonderful and helpful.  One thing that we have found out, after all of our stays, is that the room location makes a BIG difference in your attitude. About a quarter or more of the resort has villas that we don't consider to be in an

Summary Heading: Great Place to Stay With Friends and Family
Summary: A family friendly hotel with full kitchens to keep all those friends and family well fed.  And, lots of privacy away from others who may be a little noisy for your taste.. Only a short distance by auto from John Wayne Airport, restaurants, and beachs.  If you dont want to get in the car, swimming pools, game rooms, and a 75 acre compound that calls for walking or running.

Summary Heading: Great Views- Pretty property, but not my Favorite Marriott Villa
Summary: I own at another Marriott and traded into Newport Coast.  Like others indicated,  The views of the ocean are wonderful and the location is great.  The property is very large and very hilly.  It is definitely a small workout getting around the property.  We did a lot of touristy things and did not spend too much time on site.     I am glad we did not spend time on site, because I did not find the staff to be helpful or particularly nice.  First, we showed up at 4:30 on our check in day and we had to wait over 30 minutes in line to check in (at least our room was ready based on other reviews).  The next day, I did the morning walk to the state park and beach (great views), but it was a little upsetting when the staff member stayed behind with a group that was not fit and did not

Summary Heading: Beautiful property, wasn't thrilled with room
Summary: I just recently came back from a 5 night stay at the Marriott Newport Coast Villas. The property is absolutely stunning. From the landscaping to the view if you had one. The employees at the La Vista pool were wonderful, and I enjoyed the DJ. I do have a few complaints. I saw a post that the only way you get a upper floor is if you are a Marriott time share owner or are in the destination points program. Well, I am in the destination points program, and I not only was offered a first floor room with a view of trees and shrubs( even though I specified high floor,)  but when I complained, I got a second floor room that had to be exterminated twice for ants. In addition, my room was by the Pelican golf course, and at 6:30 AM they start mowing the lawn and transporting sand back and

We purchased a week at Newport when Marriott was selling weeks. This year after our stay we called for our year in advance booking for next year only to be told that they we're fully booked? I explained that we were owner but was simply told to just keep trying to call in and see if something came up and also if we wanted a room the best thing for use would be to buy more points. Are you kidding me we have already spent a small fortune on the purchase and that don't even include the crazy property taxs that are out of hand. We bought because this was we're we wanted to have our vacation and was why we were willing to pay the crazy prices. then through a little research come to find out that they are holding rooms for the nightly guest that don't own so they can run them through

As others have said, the resort is beautiful, very close (but not within walking distance) to the Crystal Cove state park and beach area.   Our room was spotless and recently remodeled. The appliances were high end, and furniture was in very good shape. Housekeeping was fine.  This resort is HUGE, and really I dislike having to drive everywhere. I think it would be more fun to be able to walk to the beach or to shops.   We used the smaller pool near our room (in building 2700) rather than the main large pool near the center of the resort. We were always able to get chairs at the quieter pool. When we visited the large pool, most of the chairs were taken. The downside is all the activities for kids are centered around the main pool, and if you are put on the edge of the resort,

Summary Heading: Lovely rooms shame about the soundproofing
Summary: Firstly let me say how lovely the accommodation was and very clean also. However, as other reviewers had said there is no chance of a very early check in. We had requested a high floor room which I stressed again when trying to check in at 3 pm. At 350pm they told us our room was ready and guess what it was on the ground floor. They said there was nothing else available so off we went at least thinking it would be easy with the luggage ( 6 cases - 3 week holiday for 4 people). Wrong! We were on the ground floor down a long flight of steps which gave it a subterrainian feel and made the room very dark. Anyway we were only there for two days and planned to spend most of the time out. The main irritation ( and why I always request top floor ) was the ridiculous noise from above.

This is an amazing property!  The location, amenities, the grounds, the service, kids programs and the size of the villas are just amazing.    We stayed here for several nights.  The villas are huge!  They are clean and the kitchen is fully stocked with everything that you will need to cook a meal.  The location and the grounds are well maintained.  There is shuttle service to Laguna Beach or Crystal Cove.  I will definitely stay here again!!

Summary Heading: Wish we could have stayed longer
Summary: We had some problems with the rooms and checking in, but the management was great.   The area is beautiful and the tide pools at the beach were amazing.  The rooms were large and very clean.  We enjoyed eating breakfast out on the patio overlooking the canyon.  The pools and workout facilities were very nice.  We spent five days at a disneyland area hotel before our three days here.  We wish we would have stayed here the whole time.

This timeshare development built in 2009 consists of 700 units in 31 buildings, so the scale and cost may be over the top for many.  It can't be called a hotel or condo, it's a resort village & may have it's own zip code.  The size of the property takes some getting used to, but it's right next to Crystal Cove State Park and the ocean.  Getting around is a good excuse to get some excercise, but drive around the area to get a sense of how far things are. The Beachcomber restaurant is part of Crystal Cove and is right on the ocean, but it's too far to walk. Most drive to a parking lot across the street for beach and restaurant access,  How much you enjoy the property depends on when you go and where the room is located among other things. If you go slightly off-season and put in

Our family of four stayed for 3 nights as part of a promotion. The 2-bedroom top floor villa was huge but didn't have a view and traffic noise was annoying in the morning.  We were willing to overlook these shortcomings given the rate we paid.   Perfect pool and activity set up for kids. Easy walk or shuttle ride to Crystal Cove Beach.

Summary Heading: Outstanding. Not cheap. Worth every penny if you want excellence and comfort.
Summary: My son and I were in Newport for a family visit/mini-vacation before he goes off to college. We needed two nights at a hotel in the area. I looked several times at various venues in the area. Some looked expensive but not great; others inexpensive and not great. We opted for great, though expensive. We got a two bedroom villa at Marriott Villas. My sister and niece/her husband joined us one night. Everything was exceptional. Clean and beautiful villa. Quiet. I requested Vila near one of the several pools; and an ocean view. Was given both. Staff completely accommodating. The main pools were busy - high season; lots of families. The Tide Pool was closer to us and less crowded. Very nice pool and hot tub. This resort is just down the road from Crystal Cove state park- a true gem

We stayed here for a week in July.  The hotel property is actually a time share property, and the rooms are huge.  We loved the space in the 2 bedroom villa that we were assigned to.  There is a full kitchen with fridge, stove, dishwasher, microwave, and also a washer and dryer to do laundry right in the villa.  Bring extra laundry detergent if you plan on doing more than one load of laundry as they only provide enough soap for one load, and charge for extras.  The master bedroom has a king size bed, with a large, deep soaker tub and a shower with dual shower heads.  This was nice after visiting the pools or the nearby beaches for cleaning up.  The rooms are quiet, you can hear the odd footstep above you if you're not on the top floor but other than that, they are peaceful and

Summary Heading: Upper scale Marriott Vacation Club Resort
Summary: We have been to many of the Marriott VCR's throughout the world and are extremely demanding of Marriott as you pay a lot for their commitment to excellence. Newport Coast Villas offer amenities and location as good as they come. However if you are unlucky enough to reserve other than top floor ocean view rooms you might be a bit disappointed. I have reviewed a number of the Trip Advisor comments, some good, some not so good on this resort.  My personal experience are the units, staff, service, location, etc were exceptional. The staff was always willing to assist in anyway they could. A bug a boo negative was the lack of parking and their marketing approach.  During high season parking in almost all of the unit locations is at a premium. In addtion, although not requiring you to
Manager Response: We appreciate you taking the time to share your experience with us.  Please know that whether you are an owner of a week at Marriott's Newport Coast, or have purchased Destination Points, you continue to receive reservation priority and priority in room assignments.  During the busy summer months, the only way to receive an ocean-front/high floor is as a Newport Coast owner or Destinations Points owner.

Summary: I just came back from visiting this Marriott. I stayed here from July 15th-20th. Now, not this entire place is bad so I will write about the bad and good here. Keep in mind I was traveling with a family of four and I am in my mid twenties.   Bad: 1. The check-in time of this place and other Marriott's is really ridiculous. 4:00pm is just too late! As a traveler you basically waste a whole day waiting to get checked into your room. Do not ever expect to be checked in early it would be an absolute miracle. Actually, I would most likely plan on waiting to check in after 4:00. Not only was my family annoyed at the fact of waiting so long but you could over hear everyone else getting angry about the check-in. This does become very frustrating as a traveler.   2. When we finally got
Manager Response: We are sorry to hear that you did not have a positive experience at Marriott's Newport Coast Villas.  This is not typical of the guest experience at our resort so we would appreciate an opportunity to appropriately address your concenrs.  Please contact us at customer.care@vacationclub.com or at 800 860 9384.  We look forward to hearing from you.

Summary Heading: Nice place but very hectic and forget about requesting a room in advance
Summary: Nice hotel but requested a month prior for a top floor oceanview room. It's not about making your request early.    I am Highup in the Marriott chain for designation but it's about for you upgrading your timeshare membership.    Do not buy a timeshare it's a rip off. I would highly recommend just renting its a much better value from another timeshare owner.  You can find rentals on the Internet for about $1900 a week during the summer

We stayed here on vacation in a two bedroom villa. It was absolutely beautiful. The resort is phenomenal - didn't even use the exercise room, the property was so pretty to walk! It was too cold to swim, but the pool was gorgeous. The rooms were wonderful. The staff was great. There is a shuttle to a near by mall/restaurant area. My only complaint is that I wish the property had its own restaurant.

Summary Heading: Good place to stay for families
Summary: A friend with a timeshare invited us to stay at the Newport Coast Villas in August 2011. The ground level two bedroom we stayed in was spacious and well maintained. The suite had a standard kitchen which allowed us to cook a few meals. Note that there are limited dining choices on site which close early which forces you to drive off property for meals or do delivery. A few surrounding area restaurants offer delivery service.   The complex is very large which can be a drawback when accessing common amenities such as the pool. The closest pool to our suite required crossing a road and down a flight of stairs. Beach access also required a lengthy walk across the Pacific Coast Highway and down a steep path. There is a shuttle bus that takes you to a different section of the beach a

We went on a family vacation to California and one of our stays was at Newport Coast Villas.  What a beautiful resort! The villas were spacious and a hit with my son.  The pools and activities for everyone were plentiful.  We met a lot of fun people and it is the first resort that my husband and I would go back to.  Great location with a beach across the way.  The views are Spectacular!! We will definately consider becoming Marriott Vacation Owners.  This is a must stay!

Summary Heading: One of the best hotels we have ever stayed in!
Summary: Great family atmosphere,the staff were friendly and professional at all times. Lovely grounds and we really liked the BBQ stations around the property,like home away from home!
Excellent location to relax. Great view and location for a family. A lot of things for the kids to do.

Okay, so this is the 2nd summer that we have stayed here.  Last year we stayed in the 1200 bldg.  No view except for the Eucalyptus trees from the golf course.  But even though there was no view of any ocean, the villa and the resort itself and the surrounding area was beautiful.  Lots to do!  Can't really comment on the staff who work there that time because we really didn't have any issues.  So now that brings us to this summer.  We just finished a Friday to Friday stay in the 1400 bldg.  LOVED this villa!  Loved the views.  Conor and Cassandra at the front desk were AWESOME!  Very kind, respectable and accommodating in every way.  Any staff on the grounds that we came in contact with for some reason or another were very nice.  The reason why I am touching on this subject is

Summary Heading: Better then renting that beach house
Summary: I spent a week (July 8-15, 2012) at the Newport Coast Villas with the family, which included my husband and 4 sons, and we loved it. We are not owners but wish we were (it’s a timeshare), but rented one of the most comfortable suites (which is what all the rooms are) I've ever stayed in. The suites are large and slept our family of 6 very easily. The king bed in the master bedroom is one of the most comfortable beds I've slept in while at a hotel, and I'm very picky because my pillow topped Temperpedic at home is very hard to beat! The living room had a pull out sofa, which my 17 year old slept on very comfortably. The 2nd bedroom also had a pull out sofa and queen size bed. The kitchen was a good size, with full size appliances, and well stocked with pots and pans, utensils,

Summary Heading: Possibly best Marriott Vacation Villa yet!
Summary: This may be the best Marriott Vacation Villa we have ever stayed in! We are owners in St. Thomas and we also love our resort but this place is really amazing. Set in such a great location with beautiful beaches and many other attractions so close by like Laguna, Corona Del Mar, Huntington Beach etc. Grounds and villas are immaculate and there are many amenities for families. We thoroughly enjoyed our vacation here and we will definitely return in the future.

Summary Heading: Worst Vacation Stay Ever, Terrible Service starts with GM and filters throughout staff!
Summary: I stayed here 4/17 thru fri 4/20,  When we checked in I asked the time share presentation clerk about presentation times and she smiled and turned her head, I asked again and she did the same thing, I guess because I am young looking and using my parents time share warranted me not being able to afford it to her. So I went to my room with zero words.on Wednesday I called the front desk to ask for a late check out due to giving my wife a massage on our our check out date, the front desk clerk told me to schedule a 8am massage, when I told her my wife would not get up that early for a massage  her words were "well that's not my problem is it", when I said excuse me that rude she said well call and book the massage and call back and maybe I can let you have a late check out. I
Manager Response: It's disappointing to read your comments and I regret that we did not deliver the Marriott service you expect and deserve.  Due to the size of the villa and a 4 pm promised check-in for our arriving guests, the resort must maintain the 10 am check-out.   As you can imagine, cleaning a 2-bedroom/2 bathroom villa with a full kitchen to Marriott's standards of cleanliness takes time to complete.  However, it's disappointing to hear that you received conflcting information.  Regarding your bed-bug claim, please know that your villa was immediately inspected when the resort received your call and it was determined there was not a case of bed-bugs.  Should bed-bugs have been found in the villa, it would have been immediately shut down and treated.  The delay you experience was in receiving the report from Ecolab. While there is no excuse for the service you received from George, he is not the resort General Manager.  George is the front office manager.  During your stay our General Manager was not aware of your concerns.  If you would like to discuss your concerns further, please contact us  via email at Customer.Care@vacationclub.com or at 800-860-9384.

Summary: i arrived late expected room service, had to ask to be shown to room, rooms are dark and dreary, carpet was musty, almost had asthma attack. ps  i was not.. asked to go on tour, probably because you must have a spouse to go. women alone, go elsewhere! make sure you pick up a car at airport.

Summary Heading: Nice Resort. Not Great. Near a lot of wonderful places.
Summary: As a Marriott Vacation Club owner I know what to expect when staying at one of the locations.  Remember it is a timeshare not a full service resort.  Once you are up to speed with that reality you can enjoy what is provided.  That being said Marriott does a great job of making their timeshares as close to a resort as you get while still staying in a villa.  As is often the case you are at the mercy of chance in getting your villa assignment.  As owners, we have been very lucky when staying at other MVCI locations (Hawaii/Tahoe/Myrtle Beach), but that was not the case here.  The villa was the same type found at most (nice & comfortable for a family of four) , however the location of the villa was one of the worst I had ever stayed.  We had a first floor villa with a "spectacular"

I thought from the pictures this place would feel like a large hotel suite but it felt more like a private condominium. We loved this place and the pictures didn't do it justice. Hope to go back! The only thing complaint we had was that the staff in registration were not helpful when asked advice about the area.

Summary Heading: Nice 2 BR Villa property, wouldn't pay full price
Summary: Stayed at this property for three nights with my family (kids 9 and 6) on a Marriott Travel Club promotional deal. Stay for next to nothing in return attend their timeshare presentation.  The Regular room rate is close 500-600 a night, no way I would pay this much to stay here, but was well worth the price (half of one night) for our three night stay and hour of time given up to hear their pitch. Property is HUGE, 70+ acres and a hike to them main pool area from just about anyplace on site.  Villas are nicely furnished with very comfortable beds. You can read the other reviews as they are accurate in regards to room lay out and function. Like others have said did not like the 4pm check in and 10 am check out....basically lose an entire day at the property with that policy. Staff

Terrible experience.  The Marriott website lists this resort as “luxurious”.  If staying at a hotel where the only dinner option after 7 PM is Pizza Hut delivery than that description fits perfectly.  Of course, deceptive and false advertising on their website seems to be common practice.  It also states they have a restaurant that serves dinner.  They fail to mention the “restaurant”, a pool hut, closes at 7 on Saturdays in the middle of the summer.  That is also the last opportunity to order a cocktail on the premises.
