Sadly, Marriott only makes up for their shortcomings with terrible service.  At almost every turn you’re waiting in line from checking in to check out.  Need to order food?  There is a long wait for that also.  A luxurious resort typically has a staff that
Manager Response: We are disappointed to read that you did not enjoy your stay at Marriott's Newport Coast Villas.  The resort is not a typical hotel experience and provides guests with many additional amenities, services, activities and luxury villa accommodations.  While a typical hotel check-in is at 4 pm and check-out at noon, cleaning a 2-bedroom/2 bathroom villa with a full kitchen requires additional time to ensure each unit is cleaned to the highest Marriott standards.  While it is not uncommon for us to contact our guests once during their stay to invite them to learn more about the Marriott vacation ownership opportunity, we do not have sales staff throughout the resort or disturbing guests while on vacation.  Your satisfaction is very important to us and if we did not provide the Marriott level of service that you expect and deserve, we would like an opportunity to appropriately address your experience.  Please contact our Customer Care office via email at Customer.Care@vacationclub.com or at 800-860-9384 so that we can personally address your concerns.

Summary: We have stayed there three times, each time for a week, and have made reservations to be there again in January. Our stays have been great and have not experienced any of the staff problems mentioned in other reviews - in fact it has been just the opposite, they have been helpful, courteous and give a sense of caring that your needs are met. The critique of the expansive hilly property is what it is - if you have mobility problems this may present a challenge. The property is well maintained, has a definite Tuscan ambiance, the two bedroom units are very well maintained and the views over the Pelican Hills golf course to the ocean from the balcony are fantastic - sunsets are not to be missed and no better way to enjoy them than from the balcony with a nice bottle of wine. If you

I was here for business, so the room was a little much for me, and there was no pool to actually swim in as an adult, and meals were not to be found after dark, but I would come back in a heartbeat with kids. the bedrooms were large and well spaced, the living room and full dining room table are hard to find, as well as the fully functional kitchen. Trader Joes was very close by.

Summary Heading: Restful Getaway...but main attraction is Crystal Cove State Park! NICE.
Summary: We spent 3 days at the Villas and found the property to be expansive...a little too much so for my taste since it is hilly and walking between areas can be taxing on the knees if you are a senior (and I am).  The main attraction was the beautiful beach at Crystal Cove State Park.  Swimming was very good in the cove and there is a nice restaurant right on the sandy beach (The Beachcomer Cafe).  PLEASE NOTE:  No restroom in the restaurant and you will walk perhaps 100 yards beyond the restaurant to use the park restroom.  Food at the Cafe is typical bar food! Nothing too exciting...the tuna melt was not so hot, but the wait staff were all very cordial and nice.  I think it is a better bar than anything else.  The martini flag goes up with a bugle at happy hour and there is a great

Summary Heading: If you ever wanted to know what it's like to date a good-looking yet boorish,person
Summary: This whole experience reminds me of the time I dated a really good looking guy but who was a total jerk...  The look and location of the property is EXCELLENT! They have done an impressive job with the "Tuscan-by-the-Sea" environment with the Italian styled villas and beautiful grounds. The rooms are nicely appointed (we had a two bedroom villa with a ocean view), full kitchen, double headed shower in the Master bathroom with a deep soaking tub. Having breakfast or a sunset dinner out on the balcony and seeing Catalina on a clear day was amazing. It would be really hard to take a bad picture.  It is regrettable that the whole five days we were there was overshadowed by a rude, uncaring front desk staff that must of had something more important to do then serving their guests.

Summary Heading: Billion dollar views, luxury and easy villas
Summary: What an incredible resort.  From the moment you check in at the front desk with the affable and capable receptionists, to housekeepers, groundskeepers and other guests.  From the terrific 2-bedroom/2-bath villa layouts, to the terraces with ocean views, our stay couldn't have been more comfortable or accommodating. The King bedroom master suite has an open floorplan with a deep soaking bathtub and a huge shower with 2 shower nozzle controls and shower heads on either end of the shower.  Second bedroom has a comfortable double-queen size bed, with a very comfortable pull out sofabed.  The mattress wasn't the usual kind with the springs you can feel with every move, rather an upgraded mattress that is terrific.  There is also a pull out sofabed in the living room.  A great use of

Summary Heading: Great for families, as long as everyone likes hiking
Summary: I'll keep it simple and short.  If you have babies, little kids or strollers, this resort is NOT for you unless you happen to be situated in the perfect location.  The resort is HUGE, with multiple buildings.  Its also a very mountainous area, meaning there are lots of hills.  If you are not located right next to the main pool, you will either be hiking with the kids or you will be waiting for a shuttle to pick you up, fold your strollers, and wake up your now-crying baby.  Remember, this is just to go to the POOL.  There was a pool closer to us.  Of course, that required going up NINE flights of stairs (impossible with a stroller) or walk all the way up the block (uphill) and making a u-turn.  The main pool, which is best for the kids, had activities for children around it,

Summary Heading: Nice place, but too big and garbage lying around
Summary: A friend and I stayed at the Newport Coast Villas for 4 nights. We got a deal for $349 for three nights and were able to add an extra night for $200. This required attending a timeshare presentation.  We arrived on a Friday afternoon and we able to get into our unit at 3:15. That was a plus since check in is at 4:00. Our unit was on the second level with a slight ocean view. It was far away from the pools and other activities. Since the resort is on a very steep incline, it required taking the car to the pool to get up the incline. That was inconvenient and it was sometimes difficult to find a parking spot near the pool area. This was a minus.   We were given an activity schedule for the previous days. Two days after we arrived a message was left apologizing for the wrong
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to provide a review on Trip Advisor regarding your recent stay at Marriott's Newport Coast Villas.   We apologize the layout of the facility and activities offered did not meet your expectations.  Your satisfaction is important to us. In order for us to appropriately address your concerns, please contact our Customer Care office at Marriott Vacations Worldwide via email at Customer.Care@vacationclub.com or at 800-860-9384.  Marriott Vacations Worldwide Customer Care

Summary Heading: Get a good deal or dont go
Summary: We got a great deal so we stayed at the Villas...bottom floor,partial ocean view. The rooms are basic but spacious.Housekeeping is below average. Overall I rate it a B-.

Check in was terrible!  Everything else was the best.  Ther is plenty for kids to do the whole day long. The villas are very nice  everyone has been so helpful.  When maintenance was called, they came immediately and then the front desk called to find out if the problem was resolved. Property is located near Von's and lots of restaurants. Marriott has a winner with this time share!

The location is fantastic.  Close to Newport Beach and Laguna Beach.  Two great places to hang around.  I love Marriott Vacation Club properties and this location makes the stay great.  For vacation club properties this one is starting to show a little age.  By no means near average, just a little older feeling than say Grand Chateu in Vegas, or the Orlando properties and the Grand Dunes in Myrtle Beach, SC.  A really nice stay all the same.

I write this review while I am staying on the property..so when I leave, I may post additional comments.All I can say is Wow! Everyone has been so kind and accommodating! Bryan, the front desk attendant was so wonderful. We arrived after a long day of travel between a delay at the airport and grumpy kids, we wanted to check in early, and they accommodated us at 230 pm. Bryan has remembered us every time we have gone to the front desk, even on the phone! The housekeeping staff (Sara) was great too! My 7 y.o. daughter had an accident in the bed and even though she Sara was Spanish speaking, she called the front desk to have me speak to someone to fix the problem...a few things to recommend when you are booking your stay: ask for ocean view or a top level room facing the ocean, I

We've gone to at least 6 timeshare properties and this one takes the cake.  It was gorgeous! The place was very clean.  They contact you in advance to see if you want to have them get groceries for you upon arrival (Weekends, they don't do). There were three pool areas.  We asked to be close to the pool with an ocean view.  Right outside our room was a grassy play area for kids to play.  They had teatherball, basketball, putting greens, pool games, s'mores at the firepits, etc.  Guest room in condo was very spaceous with a huge dresser, TV, sofa and coffee table.  No need to clean up when you depart either.  There are great restaurants like Cheesecake Factory and Joe's Crabshack very close by.  They have shuttles to the beach. We visited end of May beginning of June.  End of May

Summary Heading: I wish there was ZERO stars
Summary: From the front desk Rebertha Powles, Tina reyes, To customer service manager Kathleen Benoit, to Gen manager Jim Marks.  The people at this hotel are the least friendly and accomodating I have ever came in contact with in the hospitatlity industry.  After a horrible experience with check in, the room service, food,  pretty much every thing my wife needed to switch cards for chech out.  They would not allow me to give the a Credit card number over the phone?  I had to find a place and way to get and mail, print it, and then fax it back...ALL SO THEY COULD CALL ME AND GET THE CREDIT CARD INFO OVER THE PHONE!!!!  REALLY this may be general policy but that why you are in the customer service industry.  there really needs to be some changes at this hotel.  just look at a few recent
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to provide a review on Trip Advisor regarding your recent stay at Marriott's Newport Coast Villas. We apologize the (level of service) did not meet your expectations.  Your statisfaction is important to us. In order for us to appropriately address your concerns, please contact our Customer Care office at Marriott Vacations Worldwide via email at Customer.Care@vacationclub.com or at 800-860-9384.  Marriott Vacations Worldwide Customer Care

Summary Heading: Unprofessional evening desk staff hang up on me
Summary: This is our first time staying at the property, time share management as you must say, we are a paying guest and we paid $533.50/night. We  arrived at the property to check in at around 2pm, trying to see if we can get in to our unit early, as expected 4pm is the check -in and our unit is not ready, the front desk who took care of us was absolutely accommodating and helpful, I was promised that they would call us if the room is ready, in the meantime we hang out at the pool and have dinner, about 7:30 pm we still didn't get a call until we called and finding out it is ready, by the time we got our key and luggage, we just barely getting settled in by 10pm.  Now, when I requested for late check out, the evening front desk got very rude and unprofessional that she hang up on
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to provide a review on Trip Advisor regarding your recent stay at Marriott's Newport Coast Villas.   We apologize the (level of service) did not meet your expectations.  Your satisfaction is important to us. In order for us to appropriately address your concerns, please contact our Customer Care office at Marriott Vacations Worldwide via email at Customer.Care@vacationclub.com or at 800-860-9384.  Marriott Vacations Worldwide Customer Care

Summary: We have just spent 3 weeks at this hotel and it was wonderful. First of the property is massive, we arrived late at night and had to drive around for 5 minutes before we found the reception. Check in was a breeze and the staff were very nice and helpful. We had requested an ocean view but due to the fact it was a holiday weekend they could not accommodate us at that time and told us we could upgrade in a few days. We stayed in a 2 bedroom and it was really big and comfortable. It had 2 beds and 2 pull out couches, lots of room for the family. The kitchen was stocked with plates, pots and pans and everything you would need to cook a full meal. Large size fridge and washer and dryer too. It wads like a fully furnished apartment! The bed was one of the most comfortable beds I have

We drove down to spend a relaxing weekend here and ended up checking out early because the facility had nothing to offer.   We arrived Friday night and when we drove up we were pretty exhausted after spending several hours in LA traffic. The valet had his head buried in a ledger and didn't even acknowledge us until he heard my wife ask "why is he ignoring us?" The front desk person got us checked in quickly but it took 90 minutes to deliver the crib to our room so we were stuck with a crying, tired baby until they got around to bringing it up.  There is nothing to do at the facility and essentially no food service. For $500 a night I expect at least one restaurant and hopefully a lounge or common area to relax. They have only a poolside bar (a 10 by 10 area and literally that's

We took advantage of a special offer to stay for four days and three nights here in early June, and it was a wonderful vacation.  We have owned timeshare resorts and have exchanged into Marriott resorts over the years and have always found them to be top-notch.  This resort was definitely in that category.  It is a huge sprawling resort set on the hillside overlooking the ocean, across the Pacific Coast Highway.  The architecture and landscaping evokes a feeling of being in Tuscany.  Probably the only disadvantage is that the sheer size of the resort requires a car to drive around, or else rely on the shuttle that makes continous runs around the area.  We had a car and so enjoyed the freedom of coming and going at our leisure.  The unit we had was on the top floor of a building

Summary Heading: Property was awesome but the desk staff not so accomodating
Summary: The property is beautiful and wonderfully located between Newport and Laguna. It sits across the Coast Hwy from Crystal Cove too. The 2 bedroom suite was huge enough for 6 people comfortably and no additional fee for 6 people. A lovely view of the Pacific Ocean could be seen from the rooms patio as well as the Jacuzzi at the upper pool.  The downside is parking, they only allow you 3 spaces though their site shows free parking but doesn't list any limits.   Also check in is at 4pm and check out is 10am. Late check out is available but is LIMITED!?!? Only a select few can stay for an additional hour, you have to be out no later than 11am.  For the amount of money we paid, that was unacceptable.   When we asked for a parking pass for a friend who was visiting for a few hours we

Great villas. Lots and lots to do on and off the property. The parking, the pools, the activities were more than adequate. Every staff member we ran into was kind and helpful. We have stayed at a few Marriott vacation properties but this one was by far the best. We will return for sure.

Beautifully kept grounds.Building number designations a little confusing but not bad when you get used to it. Staff very helpful and friendly. No pressure to buy a timeshare. Lots of pools and beach chairs available. Rooms were spacious and very well appointed. Full size kitchen and balcony. DVD players in main room. Nice flat screen TVs. Poolside restaurant good (limited menu - burgers, hot dogs, chicken sandwich) but pricey. Onsite Pizza Hut Express can prepare limited menu items (pizza of course and pasta) and deliver to your room if you want. Shuttles available to Crystal Cove beach area and Laguna Beach but we did not take advantage of those. Villas on hillside so there is walking involved - or they do provide a shuttle onsite. Only drawback was proximity to the beach (1

Truly an amazing property.  The villas are spacious, clean, and well stocked.  The views of the canyons, ocean, and golf course made our villa even more incredible.  The location was close to Laguna Beach as well as Huntington Beach where there are some great restaurants. That is one downside, no restaurant at all at the resort. You absolutely need a car to get around, lots of shopping and conveniences close.  Golf courses are reasonably close, however not really reasonably priced..shop around for tee times.

This was a very nice stay. I felt a little guilty because I was by myself and not with my family. Now I just have to come back again and bring them along to enjoy what I just experienced. Most Marriott properties have moderate issues with spotty internet service ...NOT here. For the first time I found a property with real good service! This was just a beautiful and outstanding property all the way around! Hands down a " 9.5".

This was our fourth visit at this resort, and it's still a wonderful place to stay, whether for a few nights or a few weeks.  We especially enjoy the pool areas, as there are plenty of loungers and chairs, enough umbrellas to find some shade, if needed.  The 2 bedroom units are spacious, well laid out and come equipped with full sized kitchen with plenty of utensils and cooking equipment.  There are plenty of barbque areas located throughout the property, they are clean and not crowded.  There is no restaurant on site, but you can get a Pizza Hut pizza made for you in the little expensive onsite market.  There is a poolside grill where you can order chicken strips, hot dogs, burgers etc., but it's not all that great, and kind of spendy.  The resort itself is on a hillside

Hey all, just want to share about the Newport Coast Villas. 1)  Of other Marriott Resorts I've been to this one is the must decadent in decor and atmosphere...and I've been to 3 in Fl, 1 in Phoenix and 1 in Aruba.  It was beautiful grounds with all kinds of botanical garden folliage to take pictures of, Well kept rooms and landscaping, the fountains and pools were great! 2)  Pools:  Note...they were warm enough even on a foggy day to get in and vacillate between the jacuzzi.  They were clean as well.  I would only say that there were ton's of people when it was sunny who would just leave towels to save their spots and leave for hours...so you'd just have to take a spot and if they came back you would give it back, but it was rare.  Try to bring your own blow up toys for the

This was our third vacation at Newport Coast Villas and each time we find it more difficult to leave we love it so much. It is built Tuscan style which is very attractive. The reception staff are very courteous as are the rest of the staff. We were given a great ocean view room which was ready on time, wow the room was simply lovely - so large and beautifully clean with a lovely balcony. We sat by the pool most mornings and took a drive to various places in the afternoon I.e. Fashion Island (which we love), Costa Mesa (simply beautiful shops), Corona Del Mar, Labuna and Dana Point to name but a few. We then drove back and went to dinner at one of Newport's lovely restaurants which I have already written about, do try the Rusty Pelican it's great and not too pricey. You will have

This is an amazing resort! It is a great place to stay! They have awesome pools! I recommend staying here!  Breakdown:  Cleanliness: 5, clean! Location: 5, Newport is beautiful! Rooms: 5, big! Service: 4 Value: 5  Overall: 5

We stayed at Marriott's Newport Coast Villas for one week.  We have stayed at MANY Marriott properties and various other resorts.  The Good:  Beautiful rooms and location.  We were lucky enough to get an ocean view despite being on a ground floor villa.  We were in building 2700.  Very quiet.  We were close to the Tide pool.  (There are 3 pools on the grounds).  It was a nice pool.  The villa was well equipped.  Everything from a wine bottle opener to rubbermaid storage tubs.  The washer/dryer was a new GE frontload that worked well.  The bathrooms were spacious and well appointed.  Having stayed at other resort properties we didn't feel like the walk to the main pool, basketball courts, etc. was awful.  And the walk was beautiful.  Lots of daily activities of which many were

We have had this timeshare for several years now and feel like it is a second home. The unspoiled beach it overlooks (Crystal Cove State Beach) would be reason enough to stay there, but the amenities of this property are many. Villas are comfortable and luxurious. We love having this spot where we can entertain our family and share the beautiful scenery.

We have been coming to the Marriott Newport Coast Villas annually since we bought into the timeshare program 6-7 years ago.  The property has been excellently maintained since the beginning.  The grounds are beautifully maintained, as are the individual units. All the units are fully furnished 2 bedroom units with washer and dryer and a lovely balcony.  Not all units have a view, but we were fortunate to get a 3rd floor corner unit in building 4300 which had a full view of the ocean, golf course and main pool.  There is an hourly shuttle to Crystal Cove Beach, but we enjoyed the walk down from our villa (it is a fairly long walk, so be prepared to travel lightly).  The Beachcomber and Ruby's Shake Shake were convenient places for lunch at the beach.    There is a Trader Joe's a

This was the third trip where I've stayed at the Marriott's Newport Coast Villas and it does not disappoint. This is probably the nicest timeshare resort I've ever stayed and I will come back when I can.  The units I've always stayed in are all 2 bedroom units. First thing is they are huge with great balconies over looking the Pacific Ocean. Some units don't have direct ocean view, but I've always been able to sit on the balcony and see the ocean in one direction or another.  Very high end appliances, bedding, and furniture. Just great units. The grounds of this resort are beautiful with great pools. Staff is always very generous with their time when I've had request and treat me well as a Plat member with Marriott.

Beautiful resort with great views. Fantastic restaurants right down the hill in less than 5 minutes. You can't beat the seaside village of Corona Del Mar just a few minutes up the coast. Laguna Beach is 10 minutes south. This is one of the best spots on the whole Ca. coast.

The Marriott's Newport Coast Villas is a fantastic family vacation resort.  The two bedroom, two bath villas with fully equipped kitchens made for a very comfortable stay.  The main swimming pools and hot tubs were a big hit with my family.  All that was needed was a little more sunshine.  There are plenty of activities such as ping pong tables, basketball and tennis courts, video arcade, enough for all to enjoy.  I highly recommend visiting the Crystal Cove State Park directly across PCH from the Marriott Villas.  I would definitely stay here again if the opportunity arises.

We really enjoyed our stay here, we purchased a week from an owner who couldn't travel this year... lucky for us because the resort was sold out! We had a lovely room, with a fantastic view of the state park. We even saw a mountain lion one evening at twilight on the opposite hill! Lots of activities for the kids, and the staff was amazing!   My only complaint was about the parking!!! I think because it's a timeshare a lot of people feel entitled, because there were a LOT of cars parking where they shouldn't! They give you 2 passes for your vehicles, one for the garage and one by the building. But a lot of cars with the garage pass were parked by buildings where they shouldn't. There were tow trucks around the property all the time, I assume moving the cars that weren't where

We stayed here in 2004 and our second visit did not disappoint. The 2 bedroom apartment was five star and flawless with good kitchen and lots of space for our group of six. We made good use of the balcony with a view of the hills and also took advantage of the complimentary wi-fi and shuttle to Fashion Island. The Easter celebrations were fun which included a giant Easter egg hunt; games; and making balloon animals. The lady that served us at the concierge went above and beyond the call of duty by giving us directions to receive free child entry in the Lego land. We also loved Disney which was only 30 minutes away.

Summary Heading: Proud owners enjoying their first stay!
Summary: Where do I start? We've owned here for almost 4 years, but have never stayed here... go figure! Now, we have a child, which is why I decided to own a timeshare in the first place, and our traveling adventures have DIED quickly. He is two months old, so the slow pace of a timeshare resort, is finally catching up to us! It's been foggy for the first 2 days, but today, Wednesday, is finally burning the fog off at 11am, so now we can really enjoy the area.  I have to admit, the unit we're staying in, 1224 is NOT brand new, nor is it in perfect condition, which kind of sucks seeing how we're OWNERS here and not visiting (we've been on a priority room change list for 2 days now)! The unit does NOT have an ocean view, the trees obscure it, and the unit HAS been remodeled, but there are

We stayed here on a promotional offer related to becoming timeshare owners, so I have to preface this review by saying that this resort found us, we didn't search for it. I'm really glad they found us!  The property is an easy 15 minute drive from John Wayne Airport in Orange County and is located just up the hill from Pacific Coast Highway. The grounds are lovely and well maintained.  Our villa was gorgeous, spacious and ultra comfortable. While not all the villas have views, ours had a partial view, but we could get our fill of ocean view from the pool area. Everything was clean, functional and felt very luxurious. A big bonus was a full kitchen--many timeshare villas only have partial kitchens--refrigerator and microwave, but no oven. This kitchen was well stocked and had a

Summary Heading: A pleasure to visit and stay
Summary: We have stayed at Newport Coast Villas several times. We are never disappointed. The location is fabulous and the villas are really comfortable and well maintained. The staff are really nice and helpful. That said no one is " in your face" - they are there when you need them. It is a great place for families, however, it is not exclusively a "family" place. We don't have kids but we do not feel as though we are in the wrong place. As mentioned previously the location is sensational: Crystal Cove is beyond beautiful and is only 5 to 10 minutes away. Really good restaurants are a short drive away. Overall, a top vacation location.

We just returned from a four day stay at this property and it was nothing short of spectacular!  We absolutely LOVED our two bedroom/two bath villa that overlooked the ocean.  Our villa had top of the line appliances as well as a beautiful decor to enhance our stay.  The beds were really comfortable with soft cozy sheets and the master bathroom shower was HUGE!  Gorgeous tile with two shower heads that had great water pressure.  We wished we could haven't taken the shower home with us!  The villa had everything we needed for our stay.    The resort is five star all the way!  From the concierge service prior to our arrival, to the staff at the resort, they made sure we had everything we needed.  The pools are absolutely gorgeous as well as the grounds are immaculate.  This is a

The positives:  Beautiful property, large apartments, very clean and well appointed. Master bedroom with king size bed, huge bathtub, double sinks and double showers. Second bedroom has queen size bed and a sleeper, plus there is another sleeper in the living room and another bathroom with bathtub. Kitchen has everything for family use and washer/dryer make long stays comfortable. Property is huge. There are pools, tennis courts and gym with spa, playground and bbqs by most buildings. Spa has steam room and sauna, open until 9pm and had no people after 8pm when we were there. Although, there was nobody cleaning up - dirty towels everywhere, some trash, not so 5star feeling. Gym is large, with enough equipment and nice  view outside from every door/window. Views are amazing,

Beautiful resort, great view, made me feel like we were back in our beloved Italy.  Close to everything especially the beach.  Laguna beach is about 2 miles from the resort.  We relaxed from the balcony, participated in some of the activities.  Generally had a great time. Very clean!

Summary Heading: Great location and facilities but unfriendly staff attitude
Summary: We have stayed at this Marriott Vacation Club property several times before during its development. The resort is fully completed and boasts excellent facilities. Units are spacious, comfortable and have all modern amenities. We stayed in one of new buildings and towards the top of the mountain and enjoy good views over the ocean, Newport and Catalina Island. However, we found staff attitude rather unfriendly and sometime unhelpful. We were wishing to stay near a swimming pool but front desk staff didn't make any effort to accommodate our request. The unit was meant to be cleaned up during mid-week stay and nobody from housekeeping showed up. Also, noted that garbage collection was not conducted during the morning hours as advised.

We just spent 3 nights here.  The place is huge.  If you like staying in enormous resorts with loads of planned activities, then this place is good for you.  If you like to be immersed in the local atmosphere or you like quaint accommodations or you want to be right next to the beach, then this is not the place.  This would be a great place to come if you have children and want plenty to do with them.  If you are looking for a romantic getaway, choose a B&B or Inn in the area.    It is located just south of Corona Del Mar within driving distance from everything you would want to do in the area.  Nothing is in walking distance.  We had a 2 bedroom suite and it was very clean and spacious.  The kitchen was stocked with everything you need for your stay.  There is a Trader Joes

We have stayed at the Newport Coast Villas several times and it is one of the best Marriott Timeshare Resorts, only to be compared with the Marriott in Marbella, Spain and the Doral Villas in Miami, Florida. We always asked for a high floor with a view of the ocean,. Mona and Heather were extremely helpful trying to accommodate us. The property is very well taken care of and the pools are always at the right temperature. Crystal Beach is nearby and daily parking passes can be had for only $ 5.00. The units are large and very pleasantly decorated. Great vacation spot and easy to get to from LAX or SanDiego.

I was gifted with a 2 bedroom from my daughter.  The bathtub, bathroom sinks and counter shared the smallish bedroom.  The shower and toliet in such a small area was a real turnoff.  Cobwebs in light fixtures.  Workmanship lacking when doors are secured with wrong sized screws.  No golf course on property but Pelican Hill across the street.  I would NOT stay here again even if given a free room.

I stayed here with my family for five nights in mid April this year.  I have no prior experience with Marriott's Vacation Club concept, but, we were planning a trip to So. Cal.  and found that this property was available as a "rental" for non owners.  The accommodations are terrific for a family with plenty of space for all.  The unit even includes a washer/dryer, a very nice to have amenity.  The views are fabulous.  This place is not really a hotel so there are very limited dining options and no room service.  Check out is 10:00AM, a little too early.  The employees were all very friendly and accommodating.   We had no issue with noise from other guests.  It was very peaceful at all times.  There are attractive deals for folks willing to sit through the sales presentation

Summary Heading: Gorgeous, Spacious, and Something for Everyone!
Summary: At Marriott's Newport Coast Villas the views, villas, and staff never disappoint us. We were there this time 4/7 - 4/14. This beautiful spanish style property is near the Pacific Ocean, with Corona del Mar and Laguna Beach just a few minutes away in opposite directions. Awesome views of the ocean or the valley. Request an ocean view.  WiFi and parking are included. Each gorgeous villa has two bedrms and two complete bathrms, a nice size kitchen, dining area with a large round table, living room with a sofabed that opens by french glass doors to the small balcony. The master bedrm has a king bed, double vanity, double shower, and a separate roman tub. The second bedrm has a queen bed, a sofabed, and a shower/tub combination. The bedrm closets are spacious, and there are even

Came here on April 21, 2012.  It is only a short drive from the Orange County Airport.  We asked for a high room with handicapped access.  We were on the third floor near the highway.  The noise from the highway was loud, but the large spacious room made up for it.  The beds were very comfortable  and it was very clean.  We had only a partial ocean view due to a large white pine outside near our balcony.  Only problem was that we could only stay three nights.  And with the late check-in and early check-out we could have used more time to do both.  It is not close to the beach, but I prefer to be in less congested areas and that we found on it's 75 acres.  I would recommend this place!

This was an exchange through Interval International and we were certainly not disappointed. We had two units next to each other in building 5000, the highest block, with fabulous views and right by the pool. The standard of the units was excellent, we had our own washing machines and free internet access.  There was so much to do on site with activities to suit all ages including two gyms and lovely heated pools and jacuzzis. On Easter Sunday they organised a 5k run and pancake breakfast which was great fun.   Although not adjacent to the beach, it was walkable and the surrounding area was really amazing. The weather was fabulous the whole week and warmer than we expected.  A really upmarket resort, can't fault it.

We accepted a time share deal at this property just to see what the place was like. The rate was great, for the area, but if we could have checked out the first night,without being charged the "regular rate" we would have! First- check in was long, got there at 3 couldn't check in till 4 then waited for keys until 5 along with (as we were told) 200 others that day. We had been told that only owners could get top floor units & views. We finally got to our 2rd floor unit and the first thing we hear is the kids upstairs running and jumping, this lasted for the entire 3 day stay! Next we try to cool the place and the air doesn't work, we called the front desk someone would be up in 20 minuets, the maintence guy finally shows the next day after repeated calls. The unit had several

Great Time!  We vacationed at the Villas the week before Easter, which was spring break for all of the families there.  The place was sold out but pool still wasn't too crowded.  The location was very nice, it was between Laguna and Balboa Island.  If you are looking to be on the beach this isn't your place.  The resort sits up on the bluffs about 1/2 mile from a state park but no beach within walking distance.  The resort does offer a parking pass for the state park and a free shuttle to the beach, which is nice.  But if you want the true feeling of socal go about 20 minutes north to Huntington beach and watch the surfers!  Being on the bluffs the resort is hilly but offers a shuttle around the property.  Rooms were nice and beds were great!  We traded our timeshare week within

Summary Heading: Very new and clean, but not my favorite vacation rental
Summary: This is our second time here, and it is beautiful, but still not on the top of my list.  The grounds are really nice with all the pools, hot tubs, BBQ grills and games, but the weather has not cooperated.  Both times we were here it has been foggy and cold. We have friends who live 5 miles in at Back Bay and it is sunny there.   The 4 o'clock check in is firm, without exception.  If you get there earlier, you can hang out at the pool or pool bar until 4.  We bought groceries at Albertson's in Corona Del Mar, which is a little pricier than other grocery stores.  We had a chilled bottle of wine we enjoyed while waiting. Try very hard to get a top floor, the floors are thin and the stomping family above us sounded like a herd of elephants.  It was too chilly to hang out on the

Arrived at the Newport Coast Villas on Friday the 13th during a torrential downpour..... That was the only negative thing at the beginning which no one but mother nature can change.  Which indeed the next day the sun, blue skies and beautiful views were abundant and pretty much stayed like that for the rest of our week.  This was our second visit to these villas and hope there will be many more.  Our room was on the second floor and overlooked the ocean.  Very spacious, clean and efficient unit.  The grounds are amazing and all the amenities are superb.

Summary Heading: Dream Location, Great Units and Great Environs!
Summary: Maybe I was a misfit at this property because it is simply not a business traveler's place. You cannot expect somebody to come at a place like this with work on mind. But that's exactly what I did LOL... This place is so picturesque and beautiful that you gotta be here on a vacation with family, sipping juice in the balcony overlooking the Pacific ocean and just do nothing.  Stay here is so costly that unless you're a Timeshare member, you just have to be super rich to book your stay here. And you don't get a world of amenities when you stay here. Its just basic, or maybe, even less than basic (like towels dont get replaced unless you ask). But this property is so popular just because of its location and setup.  Service is a little slow because of the sheer yardage over which

Summary Heading: Outstanding location, but a few improvements needed
Summary: Probably hard to beat the location for this property, as it sits on a cliff over looking the Pacific ocean!  I had tried to reserve an ocean view room over the Easter weekend, but only got a first floor location that had a partial view.  Unfortunately, if you are on any floor with someone above you, the noise of footsteps, running, and bouncing balls can get quite annoying.  Not sure why they didn't insulate these rooms better.  The rooms were very large (family of 5 had plenty of room).  However, the appliances were not updated, seemed a bit strange as everything else seemed to be in good working order.  We stayed in the 4800 building which is a little farther from the main reception area.  When booking, take a quick look at the map of the property to see where you will be

This place is amazing.  The location is superb, facility is huge, has much to offer for families. Definitely a 5-star resort with all the amenities.  Day camps for kids, teenagers, 3 pools, basketball court, park, putting range, arcade, excellent fitness center, food.  The rooms are amazing. We had ocean view balcony, 2 bedrooms, very roomy with full kitchen and washer and dryer.  Nothing bad to say about the facility itself or amenities.  The only negatives is that is is busy with lots of people, pool gets crowded and parking can be challenging at times.  Staff was great and helpful.  Locally there is a Vons (Safeway) up the road and close by a Trader Joes to stock your in room kitchen.

I have now stayed at the Marriot the past six Springs and just realized that I have never reviewed this fine resort. My parents own a time share here and so it has been a gathering place for my family over the years. I have never had a bad experience at this place.  The units themselves are very comfortable and accommodate a large number of people. There are two full bedrooms and two bathrooms, kitchen and living room. There is a pull out couch in the living room that can sleep two more. Over the years the Marriot has worked to keep the rooms up to date and looking new. They are all now equipped with large LCD TVs in both bedrooms and the living room. They bedding is top notch and the master bedroom has a jacuzzi tub and large shower with double shower fixtures. The most

Very well maintained property and very family friendly. Visiited during Spring Break, most villas were occupied but property is set-up with multiple pools (conventional pools, nothing fancy) that offer a lot of space without feeling crowded. Facility put on special Easter events for kids and families. Easy access to local attractions, most withing 15-20 miles. Great staff and services. Not all villas provide ocean views, seek top level villas to avoid noise from rooms above, I think we had an "inside jogger" living overhead

We are Marriott Vacation Club and Destination Club owners as well as Marriott Rewards members.  We put in requests for our rooms as we always do before vacation but didn't get anywhere near the location that we wanted.  In fact, we requested a room away from the tot lot and got it right at the tot lot.  No real view of the ocean since it was blocked by another building trees and bushes.  Seemed like all other Marriott owners received their requests.  If not for this, I would have given the place 5 stars. Other than that though the grounds were gorgeous and staff was relatively very pleasant.  We bought more points into the Destination Program, they gave us our contract and a marriott bag etc but we left it in our room.  We called the resort when we got home but they couldn't

Summary Heading: Beautiful location and high quality. Pricey, but it's Newport!
Summary: Our family rented a two bedroom villa, which was very well appointed and comfortable. Granite and marble throughout, with nice furnishings as well. We had a private balcony and views of the ocean below. 30 seconds to the beach, and very close to Newport and Laguna. There are tons of events for kids, although they aren't free. The pools are very nice and easily accessible. Overall it was a very good experience!

Summary Heading: Outstanding views, good to drive around SoCal
Summary: We stayed here during Spring Break, the views are magnificent. Hotel styled as Italian villas, lots of activities for kids including "teens only" club, basketball courts, pools, several grills, fire pit, easy access to major highways. We visited San Diego, Hollywood, LA, Legoland and Disneyworld, all within 90 minutes drive. My only complaint was the mattress quality compared to other Marriott properties.     Service was really good, whenever we called to ask for more toiletries or towel change they would show up right away.

If you are visiting Newport Beach with a family this is the place to stay. Our family owns a time share and we have visited them numerous times, but have never had the chance to stay!  For my husbands 40th birthday we stayed here. The staff was excellent and the room we had in the 4800 building on the third floor had an absolutely breathtaking view. I did not have a chance to visit the pool but it  looked great. The only disappointment was having to leave!

Summary Heading: Comfortable VIlla, Lovely Setting and Views, Happy Happy Place
Summary: Our villa is top notch, lovely, quiet, views of the ocean, and exceptional landscaping.  Spacious, clean, multiple pools that are relaxing and vibrant at the same time.  Parking is easy, and I love the deck that overlooks the beautiful grounds and ocean.  No problems at all with: hot water, cleanliness, friendliness, non-functional appliances.  This place is a delight and I recommend to all, families, singles, elderly, couples.

Summary Heading: Outstanding value, especially if you are with family
Summary: Admittedly, it isn't directly on the ocean (not that you typically swim in the Pacific here, though) and not next door to a family attraction so you need a vehicle.  Having said that this is an outstanding spot for families. I happen to be staying for a business meeting but had a chance to poke around should I want to go there with my family. First, outstanding pool area overlooking the ocean.  Had lunch poolside and it was fine.  Nothing to put on the food channel but decent burger. The hotel are 2 room suites.  Outstanding for families.  Everything is conveniently located and in great shape.  Kitchen areas certainly can help you keep prices down if you want to eat in.  They have a small store near check in with coffee, danish, a few odds and ends, beer/soda and so forth. Small

This is the most beautiful Marriott property that we have ever stayed at.  It is on a bluff looking out over the ocean.  There are great workout facilities, but it was too beautiful to exercise inside, the coast is a great place to run if you are not afraid of hills.  The pools were beautiful!  My only complaint is that the bar at the pool closed at 6pm, so we didn't ever take advantage of it.  I would love to visit there again!!!

Summary Heading: Gave it a second chance but should have stuck with first impression, worst staff and service
Summary: We tried villas last year and while the location is gorgeous, we had horrible experience and maid went through suitcases and jewelry, leaving dirty cleaning rag in our suitcase. Hotel gave us a bottle of wine as make good. We decided to try a second time because we love area and with three months to go before we have twins we thought it might be relaxing.  Big mistake! We were told we could check in at 2 and would be close to pool. We got to hotel at 2 and were told to come back at 4, and that the Marriott vacation rental people we had been dealing with had nothing to do with the hotel so they could nothing about 4 pm checkin.  We finally got to the villa and we have a five minute walk and two flights of stairs to the pool. The staff was not remotely apologetic or accommodating.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to provide a review on Trip Advisor regarding your recent stay at Marriott's Newport Coast Villas.  We apologize the (level of service) did not meet your expectations.   Your satisfaction is important to us. In order for us to appropriately address your concerns, please contact our Customer Care office at Marriott Vacations Worldwide via email at Customer.Care@mvwc.com or at  800-860-9384.   Marriott Vacations Worldwide Customer Care

Summary: These 2 bedroom condos/villas offered us great value and high quality amenities for a superb off season price. We enjoyed our stay so much that we are returning in high season (July) with another couple. The property is expansive and has all the touches you would want with 2 exceptions. Unless you are a property owner you will not likely get Ocean view and you ahve to take a shuttle to get to the beach area. While the resort is not on the Ocean, it is just across the Coast Highway and certainly smack dab in the middle of sme of the most beautiful countryside you will ever see. A long walk down the Beach at Crystal Cove park will take away any stress particularly when you take the time to see the restoration of the original beach cottages at the rustic Crystal Cove.  This is

Summary Heading: Wonderful place to stay in Orange County, CA
Summary: I spent a week at Newport Coast Villas 3/17-03/22. This is my third time there. It's one of my favorite marriott vacation resorts. It's right off Pacific Coast Highway. Across the street is Crystal Cove Park and the Pacific Ocean. It's a 15/20 minute ride from John Wanye Airport.  -Resort provides a Free Shuttle Service around the resort and to Crystal Cove State Park, Laguna Beach, and Fashion Island (Big Outdoor Mall in Newport Beach) -1 mile or so down the road is Crystal Cove Promenade. They have a Trader Joes, Starbucks, Local Restaurants, and other stores.  -Laguna Beach is a fun artsy town. In the downtown area, they have stores/restaurants with the beach right there. "Crazy Shirts" has some fun t-shirts you can buy. "Bubbles" is a fun bath/body shop.  -Shake Shack -

Summary Heading: Love the condo and the grounds were beautiful
Summary: We had a two bedroom condo that was very spacious and comfortable. The grounds are very hilly so a walk around the grounds becomes quite an exercise.  There is a shuttle that is free and will take people to the beach and shopping, but the shuttle has only limited pick up and drop off hours.    The views from some on the units is wonderful, and from others just so-so, depending on what direction your condo looks out from.  There is a meeting offered at least once a week which offers ideas about what to do in the area along with vendors.  I would highly recommend going since it was very helpful and informative if you are not already acquainted with what activities are close by.  The kitchen was well equipped.  Furniture was attractive and comfortable.

We live an hour away from the Newport Coast Villas, and we originally bought a week at the timeshare in order to escape the scorching inland summer heat.  However, last year due to scheduling conflicts we ended up booking our week over Thanksgiving vacation.  As mentioned by the other reviewers, the units themselves are spacious and wonderful, while the grounds are lovely.  I was especially happy when the management switched out to flat screen TVs a couple of years ago.  The higher the floor you can secure the better your view of the ocean; plus due to some construction flaw, if you are on a lower floor you can always hear the people walking around above you (but surprisingly, I can't say that I've ever heard any noise from the units on the same floor next to ours). There are

We stayed here for a week.  The unit was very nice, well equipmed and spacious.  The only restaurant was the pool area and the menue was very limited. I liked the suttle service to the shopping mall and the beach.  They give you a time schedule for the shuttle but if you call and make arrangements ahead of time you can use the shuttle to fit within your schedule.  If you want a great view of the ocean and a good milk shake and burger go to Chrystal Gove Rubys Shake.  Its right off the highway and the sunsets are awesome.  A fun trip is Balboa island.  Some nice shops and fun places to eat.

We stayed at the Marriott Newport Coast Villas on an exchange thru Marriott.  On the whole, we were very pleased. The resort is built on a hillside, and many, if not all, units have at least some view of the ocean.  It’s a Marriott, so the property is beautiful and the units are very nice.  It’s just off the Pacific Coast Hwy. with all of its coastal towns full of shops and excellent, albeit expensive restaurants.  I thought at first that our 2BR unit was was a bit small by Marriott standards, but my wife pointed out that out that it was just oddly shaped.  I don’t know it they’re all like that or not.  The furnishings and appointments were all fairly new, very clean, and tasteful.  We had no problem with the check-in.  There was a teen center and poolside activities.  There was

Terrible! The dry sauna was not working for five days. We asked the staff about it, to which they replied that they were working on it and were not sure when it would be fixed. There was no way to find out until what time the steam room was open. We were in the steam room when the cleaning man came. He was very rude and asked why we were still there because apparently, it had closed at nine. There were no signs that said that it closes at nine. It was all dependent on what time the cleaners came. There is no more desire to stay here again.

I stayed here with my son and husband. He had to work all day so my son and I made the best of the surroundings. There were lots of stuff for kids to do, there is a teen hangout called the Shack, , there are video games etc, there are ping pong tables, a huge chest/checker set for kids and adults to play with. The pools are very warm when its a bit chilly outside. There is a grill/bar next to the pool, very convenient. There was a band playing next to the pool as well...they were good.. I think they were called the Trish and Cissy show. Towels were plentiful and easily accessible.Playground for kids, sandbox, basket ball courts, tennis courts... lots of stuff to do.   There are shuttles that take you /pick you up(free) to Fashion Island, laguna beach, Crystal Cove at pre

Wow, I mean this place looks just as it does in its website pictures. Simply beautiful setting and great amenities. My husband and I stayed here with my sister & my niece who stayed in the second bedroom and my mom who slept on the sofa sleeper. It was just perfect. We did make use of the pool and marketplace. Other great amenities were the huge workout area and arcade room. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. We had requested a room in a quieter section and definitely got that. The view was great and the room was spacious. The only complaint was that we were on the second floor and could hear the people above us walking around. Other than that, this place was awesome. It was also only 30 minutes from Disneyland and the huge soaking tub in the master bedroom was great

Stayed four nights in March at the Marriott Vacation Club.  AAA rate at the last minute.  Very nice and clean 2 bedroom and 2 full baths villa with large balcony and view of Pacific Ocean.  Great activities for all ages.  Many children but the villa was very sound proof.  We stayed on the first of 4 floors.  Plenty of parking.  Full kitchen with full size oven and frig.  Dishwasher.  Great price for the area.  Close to everything.  We do not have the time share and we were not in any way bugged to go to the 90 min. sales talk.  However, if both my husband and I went to the 90 mins. we were offered at $275.00 Amer. Exp. card.  Daily maid service.  What more can I say - I was very surprised at how nice the villa was.  Only thing that stood out was the landscaping was awful.  Trash

Summary Heading: Great location, scenic views, wonderful stay
Summary: The Villas are spacious, the pools are plenty, the views, grounds & sunsets amazing. Staff is very professional and helpful. Great fitness center & easy access up and down the coast.

We have two weeks of a timeshare program at this property and we purchased them because the property and location are amazing!  The 2 bedroom villas are top of the line, with 2 full bathrooms, a full kitchen, balcony, and if you get the right one, a fabulous view of the pacific ocean!  The property is right off of the Pacific Coast Hwy., minutes from Laguna Beach, Newport Beach, Balboa Island, Newport Fashion Island, and many other popular locations.  The pool are is beautiful, with a place to get some food/drinks while sitting by the pool.  If you like to walk, you can take a lovely walk down to the beach and stroll around while taking in the ocean air.  This is one of the top Marriott locations to stay for out of town visitors, so book early if you want to get in!  and enjoy!

This resort was amazing and the room was probably one of the nicest that I have stayed.  The rooms had everything you could possibly want and were so spacious.  I really liked the tub in the master bedroom and the dual shower heads.  The bed was very comfortable as well.  I stayed on the first floor so the views weren't as great.  Next time I stay here I am going to request a higher floor.  Other than that, the experience was great and look forward to the next time I can stay here.

We are time share owners and as we were in LA on business, we used a week staying at this property in Newport. Even though it was a 45-60 minute drive each way to work, the peaceful location made it all worth while. The rooms were really lovely. Nice and spacious and it was great having the second bedroom spare. Unfortunately we were too tired and too late home each day to make use of the gymnasium, sauna etc and the spa pool but we had a look and they were well appointed. The complex was very clean, the gardens beautiful, reception roomy and accommodating, and the staff very helpful(apart from the concierge which we discovered were not employed by the hotel but were there to sell tours etc so when we asked for help they were quick to say they could not help us or even attempted

This resort is beautiful. Nicely appointed kitchens with granite countertops, seperate dining area, living room space, etc. Every villa on this property is a 2 bedroom/2 bathroom. My husband and I were vacationing alone, but I have to admit it was nice having the extra bathroom and bedroom for closet space. We really spread out and were quite comfortable having breakfasts on the balcony. Our room was in building 48 on the 1st floor. We had a very nice partial few that gave us a perfect view of the sunset every night. The resort itself is not directly on the beach. The Pacific Coast Highway seperates it from Crystal Cove, which is a really beautiful beach to walk at sunset. The resort is in a great location, to the left 10 minutes is Laguna Beach--great little shops and

We spent 4 days at this beautiful resort in February 2012 (we are timeshare owners).  As usual, the Marriott standards were very high and we thoroughly enjoyed this resort.  It is just a mile from the ocean and most villas have some sort of view of the Pacific.  This resort is in expensive real estate properties and meets the criteria of high class villas.  The Tuscan theme is carried throughout and the lovely ochre hues of the villas are soothing.  We were in the 2300 building, room 227 which was on a corner.  There was never any sounds from neighbors and we rarely ran into other people although the resort was 85% full. We were even graced by wonderful weather which made walking around on the beautiful grounds even more lovely.  They must employ 100's of grounds personnel as

My wife and I stayed in here in late February with our two children, ages 8 and 5. This is a timeshare community but they accept reservations from the general public off season.   The accommodations were perfect for a family. With two bedrooms, two bathrooms, three flat screen tvs, and the full kitchen and laundry, we were very comfortable. We preferred this over a regular hotel room since everyone could call it a night or wake up as they wished without disturbing anyone else.   The grounds were beautiful in a neo-California way, with lush tropical landscaping. The ocean views from the public areas are incredible. Anyone from the West coast knows an unspoiled view like that is a million dollar luxury. My parents, Southern California residents, stopped by and were blown away by

Summary Heading: Great views if you have the right unit
Summary: We spent a week at Marriott’s Newport Coast Villas in early February.  We were very impressed to receive an email about two weeks before our visit asking us if we had any special requests for villa locations, amenities, etc.  We requested a top floor villa with an ocean view.  When we checked in, this is exactly what we received.  We had a lovely ocean view where we could watch the sunset behind Catalina Island.  One suggestion – the villas in the lower part of the property (numbered in the teens) would not all have ocean views.  The trees from the adjacent golf course have grown so tall that the first two floors have views of trees and only the top floor would have ocean views.  Villas higher up the hillside should have ocean views on all levels.   As other reviewers have

Great location near beach, shopping, attractions, luxurious furnishings & amenities plus great recreation on-site make this a fantastic vacation for families and/or couples.  The master suite had everything we wanted except spa jets in the bath, but who is complaining? Not us! We loved this place. The kitchen was well equipped, HD TV's in living room and bedroom, DVD player, wifi, swimming pools, hot tubs, workout room, activities on-site. In fact, this resort is so comfortable & entertaining it would be easy not to go anywhere at all but the grocery store. Speaking of that, be sure to visit Pavilions, the grocery store at the top of the hill. How I would love to have one of these near me. BEST grocery store I have ever shopped. We also loved Crystal Cove, the beach at the foot

Our family of four enjoyed a very nice stay at the Newport Coast Villas. We flew into John Wayne airport in Orange County and made the short trip southwest to Newport Beach. The drive from the airport to the resort was less than 20 minutes and very easy. Check-in was fast and easy and we were pleasantly surprised by the size of our two bedroom suite. Plenty of room and beds for everyone and a nice kitchen and living space. The pools at this resort in February were very warm and we all swam and enjoyed the hot tubs. We requested a room close to the pool and we ended up in one of the alternate pools on a lower floor. Although we had no view of the ocean, the proximity to the empty 'second' pool was worth the trade off. The one time we ventured up to the main pool we were surprised

Recently stayed one week at Newport Coast Villas. Rooms are clean and spacious. 3 of us in our family, Our son was thrilled to have his own room! But, boy oh boy can you hear your neighbors! Luckily, we were on top floor. 2200 building with a pretty view. Our son (9) had fun at the pool and did a few things at Triton's Cove. The young man that works there(forgot his name) was fabulous. It was great dealing with Aaron at the front desk.  We had a minor repair done lickety split which as nice.  Yes, the carpets are unravelling a little bit and the appliances are outdated and didnt work that well(dishwasher) but none of that took away our enjoyment.  Used the shuttle to visit Crystal Cove one day, that was fun.

Summary Heading: Nice property if you skip the timeshare sales pitch
Summary: After countless calls from Marriott Vacations regarding their timeshare properties with promotional rates, we finally gave in a booked a stay at this property.  We traveled with our kids for fall break and were pleasantly surprised by the property.  Our room was very spacious with 2 separate bedrooms, 2 baths, a generously sized living room with sleeper couch, dining room and a well-appointed kitchen.  We were on the third floor of our building and would have liked a view, but instead looked out over a service parking lot.    We stayed busy off-property during the daytime, and took our kids to the pool at night.  The pool area was large and there were plenty of self-serve towels.  My husband and I found the pool temperature to be far too cold for us to dive in, and the kids

Summary Heading: Lovely Accommodations with Beautiful Ocean View
Summary: I live in Los Angeles, and was taking my parents to a concert in Orange County. I wanted two rooms with an ocean view, and looked quite extensively online. I decided that this hotel would be good, because we would have a two bedroom suite with a great view, for about the same price. When we arrived, we were charmed by the beautiful landscaping and ambience, and were greeted wonderfully in the lobby, in an atmosphere of booming activity.  Service at the registration desk was outstanding. All of the many employees on hand were directly engaged when talking with each client, seeming to be 100% involved in making sure everyone was checked in correctly and was happy. It was seriously impressive! We had to wait for the room until check in time, but were offered appetizers and an

Wow!  This hotel was probably the nicest place we have ever stayed.   The room itself was spotless with an incredible master bath area and plenty of closet and storage space.  The kitchen area was large and usable, even though we never ate a meal there.  But the biggest surprise were the things to do for the kids -- besides the pool, there was a basketball court and game room.  The views from the room itself were breathtaking. The location can't be beat.   It is a quick 5 minute drive to Laguna Beach which combines a free beach, with waves, and shopping in one trip. Can't say enough good things.

Summary Heading: Our last minute booking worked out!
Summary: We headed to California without a very specific plan of where we would be going.  I only booked the villa a couple of days before.  We had stayed at Marriott villas before and had an idea what to expect.  We were not disappointed.  Staff was friendly, grounds were immaculate, facilities and room were very clean.  Housekeeping popped in daily for tidy ups and were there quite quickly following my son's wake up nose bleed!  We were 5 of us in a 2 bdrm villa and had plenty of space.  Love having laundry (bring extra detergent and dryer sheets) and kitchen.  The weather was unseasonably warm for early January and the pools were kept at comfortable temperature too. The upper pool by the fitness center is less busy, great for lap swimming - even in the middle of the day.  We felt

Summary Heading: Stunning ocean views with lots for kids to do
Summary: I just returned from a week at the Newport Coast Villas, with a total of five people, three adults and two children and we had a wonderful time.  To my surprise, the pools were heated well so that we could swim, even in Jan/Feb and there were lots of activities in the kids club (many were free).  I was annoyed that they don't clean your room even once during the week (which is standard at all other non-Marriott timeshares) but the otherwise great service and truly stunning surroundings and ocean views made up for that one annoyance.  Someone noted that the pull-out couches were bad but I have to totally disagree.  Maybe we were in a newer or refurbished unit but we used both of the pull-outs in our unit and it was a new and unique design that was made of some type of foam

Stayed here in January with Family.  First off, the general grounds are impeccably maintained.  The area is actually more beautiful in person.  Pictures do not do it justice. There are some beautiful outdoor gas grills scattered throughout the complex.  There are plently of nice grassy nooks with chairs to just sit and gaze off into the pacific. The gym facilities were adequate, and could be crowded at times.  The pool was very nice, but a bit cold (it was January).  Never had any problems getting a chair by the pool or a chair anywhere.  They have some decent happy hour specials at the pool bar.  Nice place to watch the sunset.  We walked from our unit down to crystal cove beach.  A nice 15 minute walk to get the beach.  In terms of the unit, they are spacious enough.  The

Our family of four, including two teenagers, enjoyed our 4-night stay in a two bedroom suite. But we have a daughter and a son, so one had to sleep on the sofabed, which had a terrible mattress. You know the bed is bad when a teenager says it's bad!  Other than that, the suite was lovely, and the property is very conveniently located, within walking distance to a beach. I would stay there again, but not if we bring both kids, because I wouldn't want one of them to have to sleep on that awful sofabed again. They really, really need to update those sofabeds.

Stayed here the week of January 15, 2012 in a 2 bedroom suite.  Lots of room, clean with a lovely view.  The staff were very friendly and helpful and the amenities were top notch.   The only complaint I have is that the hideaway bed mattress is terrible, would not even be comfortable for a child.   Would definately stay again.

Summary Heading: Great location, great suite, great facilities, it's great
Summary: This is a terrific facility.  It is well located, situated with an unrestricted ocean view, modern, well furnished, and very well maintained. We had a two bedroom, two bath, suite.  There were three of us but as many as five or possibly six could have been accommodated adequately. The exercise facilities, pools and grounds are universally superior. A slight complaint; there is no on site restaurant but many are nearby.

Summary Heading: One of the finest Marriott properties anywhere
Summary: One of the finest vacation properties I've ever stayed at -- this one has it all.  Situated on the beautiful Newport Coast, one of the finest stretches of California coast.  The villas offer beautiful views of the Pacific Ocean and close proximity to the wonderful Crystal Cove State Park, one of the last stretches of pristine coast.  We love going for walks on the beach, exploring the tide pools, the pelicans flying by overhead, the dolphins swimming by.  The property has lovely and very comfortable two bedroom suites and other great amenities, like a large fitness room, multiple swimming pools, tennis courts, park, etc.  The staff is always helpful and friendly, and the location puts you in the heart of Orange county, with all its fine shopping, dining and tourist activities.

This Tuscan resort nestled in the low hills overlooking the Pacific is terrific.  There is no question my wife and I would return again and again.  It is a timeshare so you do get the offer, but not a hard sell.  Shortly before you arrive an email is sent by their staff for any special requests.  Based on a composite of various reviews, I requested and received two weeks in a "new" building, "ocean" veiw, and "top" floor.  Judging by our veiw, the 3rd floor would be fine, but the view would be obstructed from first or second.  Pricey.$$$$ but worth every penny.January weather cool jacket, but very pleasant with days over 70.

This is pretty much the standard Marriott timeshare villa - two excellent rooms, kitchen, living room, etc., but the location and views are also very exceptional as well.  The Villas have all of the accomodations that make Marriott timesharing a "good value" - if one can say that about timesharing.  But seriously, the property is excellent and the rooms are first rate.

Customer service lives on at the Newport Coast Villas! We have been timeshare owners for 15 yrs and this is by far the most customer service oriented property I've ever experienced. The amenities are wonderful and there is a bunch of great stuff for kids to do. The villas are beautiful and will have everything you need.  Our vacation with my parents was mainly for relaxation and enjoying the resort. We also enjoyed a round at the amazing Pelican Hill golf course which is located across the street.  If you're thinking of staying in Orange County you should book your stay at the Villas. You will not be disappointed!!

We recently stayed here for three days. The resort is beautiful, and the villas roomy with washer/dryers. We had a pool nearby , and were able to use it in January!! Overall, Greta place for families, with full kitchen and access to everything OC has to offer.

This place is wonderful. My sister and I took the water class done by white tiger and it was great. We enjoyed the pools, hot tub and market. 2 bedroom units make it very comfortable and affordable because we ate in most of the weekend. Had a great weekend visiting Laguna beach. We will be back!

Stayed at the hotel the week of Jan. 15,2012.  Stayed in one of the newer buildings, #4800.  Check in was easy, hotel is clean and beautiful.  Rooms are big with plenty of room for our family of four.  This was our second time at this hotel.  Our kids are 7 and 5.  Went to Hollywood, Disneyland and Legoland.  Easy drive to all three.  Tip- Legoland is for really young kids, like 5 and under.

My wife and I had just gotten back from a 3 week trip in Nepal hiking EBC and I wanted a REALLY nice beach hotel to reward ourselves. I felt like I did my homework, but I failed. This place would be perfect for a family of 4 who wants to be close to the beach, but the resort is neither on the beach or "overly nice." I am a platinum Marriott member and while this was a good hotel, I would not come back for an over-the-top romantic night like I mistakenly did.  Another negative: I had forgotten to put the customer parking sign on my car dash (it was on the seat) during our one-night stay and the security guard put a really messy sticker on my window that said something to the effect of, "Last warning, next time we'll tow your car." This Marriott is not in a big town and I couldn't

We stayed at the Newport Coast Villas for a week this past Christmas and it was absolutely fantastic!!  At check-in, I requested a higher floor (thanks to past reviews on this property) with or without a view of the ocean, and got more than what I asked for!  We were booked in the 46 or 4700 building, it was at the end of the cul-de-sac and our villa had amazing views of the Pacific from every window.  I was traveling with my husband and 1 year old son, so having the kitchen and spare bedroom was a lifesaver. (That's also why I requested the higher floor -- after reading all the reviews about noise, I was anxious that my little one wouldn't sleep well, but we never heard our neighbors.) The decor was a bit dated, but honestly, who cares!  The kitchen was stocked with eveyrthing

We chose this location because we wanted to have a family vacation with our daughter, who goes to school in Oregon, and had a short break - which put Hawaii, Florida and Mexico out of consideration. Marriott was offering a great deal on its Vacation club properties - so "why not".  We found we really lucked out.  The facilities are beautiful and wonderfully maintained and the staff super nice and friendly.  The 2 BR Villas are laid out really well and furnished nicely. We had a rental car and it was really easy to get in and out explore the area - Newport Beach, Balboa Island, Laguna Beach.    The health and fitness center was really excellent - its open 24 hours and they provide headphones and a really full set of equipment.  It was never crowded.  Even though it was January,

Our family spent Christmas week here and really enjoyed the resort. The property is one of the best Marriott vacation resorts I have been to, very clean, updated and well maintained. The heated swimming pool was a treat in winter season for us and our one year old! Two-bedroom villa made it a home away from home. It's spacious (good size guest room and living room with full kitchen) and comfortable. The shower room in master bath room is oversized and has two shower heads. The location is perfect for us as we visited family and friends in orange county area. SNA airport is conveniently located about 10 miles away. Plenty shopping malls around such as Fashion Island and South Coast Plaza. If you love Asian food, you will find plenty authentic restaurants in nearby cities like

Our family, 5 adults & 2 children, stayed in a 2 bedroom suite in mid-December, 2011.  We are mature adults and were with our adult children & grandchildren.  This property was impressive from the start.  Beautiful area and lovely mature landscaping.  The lobby is large and beautiful with a grand view of the Pacific and pool area.  Our room was on the 2nd level and we had a great view of the ocean.  The suite itself was huge at almost 1300 sq. ft.  The master suite, very large which had a large roman tub separate from the bathroom.  The 2-person shower was also very large with sliding glass doors and shower heads at both ends.  There is also a separate bathroom connected with the other bedroom.  Both had beautiful tile & granite countertops.  The kitchen was very nice with

This is the second time we have stayed here and I would definitely go back. All the units are two bedroom, two bath units with full kitchens. The master bedroom has a king size bed, and the other has a queen. There are three flat screen t.v.s if you have nothing else to do. We loved having the extra room and a kitchen to eat breakfast. Keep in mind that it is a time share property, therefore there isn't daily maid service. As long as you know that in advance you won't be disappointed. There are two grocery stores nearby, a Pavillions (basically a Safeway) and a Trader Joes.  We never ran out of things to do. We sat on the balcony each morning drinking coffee and reading the paper. We walked to the state park twice. We rented bikes in balboa. We shopped at Fashion Island. We

The earlier post which suggested this place is a Motel 6 must be NUTS!  The Villas offer clean rooms, a friendly staff, great gym, great view, great pools and within a great walk to the beach (also provided).  What else could you ask for on vacation???  Let me know if you find a better spot in the "OC"....

My wife and I have owned here for a number of years and primarily use the property as place to stay while visiting family during holidays. We have traded for vacations all over the world.  Over time we have become more and more pleased with the property.  The location, grounds, rooms, views and staff are all stellar.  The one thing i would urge every visitor to do is to Get Down to the Beach.  Walk right out the enterance take a left and go straight down to Crystal Cove Beach.  There's a great little beach restaurant a mile or so down.  Do it as early on your vacation as you can and you will want to go every day.

I love you Marriott for creating such a beautiful hotel on the cliffs of Newport.  I can see everything and everyone.  It is so magestic, I dont even think about my problems.  There is nothing but relaxation.  I ran across the street to the other hotel and jogged the entire golf course..Love YOU

Arrived here around 5pm on Christmas Day after a long day of flying with wife and 2 young children.   We stayed in the first floor of the 4500 building which has a view of the nearby canyon and partial views of the Pacific Ocean above Crystal Cove beach.    Only two minor criticisms to start.    Even though the rooms are nice the living room furniture and kitchen appliances could use an upgrade.   We are spoiled after staying at the Mariott Suites Singer Island Florida which are brand new.    Also, if you stay on a lower floor you will hear people on above floors walking occasionally but it wasn't that big of a problem.   Other than that,  the 2 bedroom suites are spacious with 3 big screen TV's and an open feel that is conducive for entertaining friends or family that may

Summary Heading: Wonderful resort in the middle of Southern California
Summary: This resort was beautiful.  You'd never know you were just minutes from L.A. and Disneyland.  The view of the ocean from our room was amazing.  The staff were friendly; we even did a timeshare presentation and felt no obligation or pressure.
