My kids had a great time too, the pool and hot tubs were great, and they have a teather ball court which was so much fun because I haven't played since I was a kid!  I would love to go back someday soon.

I stayed here for two nights with friends that were staying from out of town.  It was very enjoyable.  I have no idea how someone can compare this to a Motel 6 or a Salvation Army hostel.  I travel a lot and if anyone knows of one of those places that include the following, please let me know and I will there in a heartbeat.  All of the units are the same and include: --2 BR's/2Bathes --2nd BR has a queen size bed plus a fold-out sofa bed --There is another fold out bed in the living room --2nd bath is pretty standard as in most hotels but probably a bit larger --Full Kitchen with full cookware, serviceware and dishwasher --Dining room --Living room --Patio/balcony dining for four --Master bath is equiped with a double shower, double sink and a Roman soaking tub --Most units,

Really enjoyed our 4 night stay at the Newport Coast Villas. We are not timeshare members and paid for the stay. Absolutely loved it!! Having a family of 4 with teenagers we really enjoy having some space to stretch out in. We had a 2 bedroom condo. It was perfect for us. Fabulous location to Newport and Laguna Beach. Would love to return!

We stayed here before, this time with the grandkids (12 & 14).  We all had a great time.  They would rate the "Shack" (a teens' hangout) as a c+.  They had a few screens for Wii games and the sort and had some seating options.  Need more activities, but it was Christmas week after all.  OUtside they had more games, pool, ping-pong, giant chess. There was a game arcade for most any age, you pay the std prices.  They loved the warm pool and beautiful grounds to walk around.  We visited Balboa Island and peninsula.   The villas were a little smaller than ours in Palm Desert Villas, but very nice.  The 2nd room had a double and a mini-couch with pullout for my grandson. There was a very inviting balcony with 4 chairs/table.  The furnishings are fine with the standard kitchen

Spent the week of 9 December at this place. The good point: a beautiful spot on the earth, waling distance to Crustal Cove State Park and the spectacular beach. The timeshare facility looks just fine, but that's the building and property. The rooms are basic. The amenities would compare with a Motel 6 or a Salvation Army hostel. Towels are the cheapest plain white probably  on the market. The pillows - hard even to call them that - are about half the size of a normal pillow and would be better suited to a cat bed. So basically, you get a decent room but after that not much. Unless you want to pay and here is where the overall cheapness of Marriott is seen. Want your sheets changed? 19.00 please. Want 'tidy' service? 35.00 PER DAY please! And want your room cleaned the way your

Newport Beach is a very upscaled area which offers alot to see and do.  The lobby of the check in for guests was beautifully appointed and very attentive service by employees. The room was very spacious and nice, but I thought the resort was directly on the beach, which it is not, you have the highway separating the resort, the beach and it is not an easy walk to the beach.  There is a starbucks on property which is a nice amenity.

Summary Heading: Perfect location on the California Coast
Summary: This resort commands the best views of the California Coast anywhere.  You are close to everything, spacious units and great balconies to enjoy the view.  These are Marriott's so nice but not over the top.  Soft sheets, great beds and fast service to get replacement sheets or towels.  Kitchens are well equipped.  Come enjoy the view.

We stayed here because of having the extra space versus a hotel.  Traveling were myself, husband, 23 month old son, 4 year old son, 12 year old niece and my parents.  The unit itself was nice, well appointed and fit our needs well.  As others have stated, there are many buildings so you may have to do some walking.  They had shuttles but we never called for one.  The pool/hot tubs were nice but we also enjoyed the rec. area.  They had a basketball court with adjustable goals, an artificial putting green with putters/balls, tether ball and a large sand bunker that served as a sandbox for the kids.  This area was large and nice.  I didn't notice anything within walking distance, seemed we drove alot but it wasn't bad.  Enjoyed Laguna Beach just a short drive away.  Many

We were happy with our room.  It was clean with a kitchen and washer/ dryer. I did not like the service I received. 2 out of 3 days there was no internet access.  i called to inquire and i was given the run around by resort staff and told to pay to use the hotels computers near the pool area. why should i trek all the way over there and pay to use a computer when internet access should have been provided?? I requested that our room be cleaned by 2:30pm, whoever i spoke to on the phone said "NO PROBLEM!", and when we returned at 6:30pm, the housekeeper was just entering our room. I requested a room near the childrens park at check in, and was told again, "sure, no problem" and sure enough our room was far away from the park. What I HATED the most was being harrassed before and

Summary Heading: Marriott Newport Coast: comfort and quality
Summary: The Marriott Villas offered predictable Marriott quality for a sound nights sleep and luxurious facilities.  The resort was quiet and yet very family friendly.  It's located in the most vibrant area of southern California, with fantastic ocean views, great restaurants, and numerous recreation and entertainment opportunities.
Beautiful views!  Quiet.  Across street from pelican hill restaurants and golf.

Our villa was perfect - 2 bedrooms, each with their own huge bathroom.  One bedroom has a queen sofa sleeper, and living room has another.  Perfect for girlfriends weekend.  Beautiful, new & clean furnishings.  We asked for a quiet room with an ocean view - the pre-arrival management gave us a corner unit, top floor, with 180 degree view of the ocean (#3946).  Didn't have any time for spa or other resort activities - so we will be back.

We stayed here for 3 nights on a deal where we had to go through a timeshare presentation. The property is ideally located on quiet section of Pacific Coast Highway, near Crystal Cove Beach (but on the opposite side of the road). The resort is wonderfully maintained and looks so pretty. We got our villa after 4 PM but we were given a passkey to use the pool and other facilities while we waited (unfortunately it was raining so couldn't do much outside). All villas here are 2-bedroom with kitchen and living room. Our villa had the most magnificent view of the ocean and the resort. The resort has 5-6 pools, tennis courts, golf course, basketball court, spa, fitness center, arcade. My daughter loved the pool. We played table tennis and tennis outside. The rooms were spacious for 4

We own Marriott timeshares which we exchange.  We always ask for 2 bedrooms and 2 baths although there are only 2 of us.   Also, the top floor is requested.  We had a wonderful week at this Marriott in Newport Beach.  We went to a presentation to have the "point system" explained to us.  My husband became annoyed because the presenter kept making statements that he knew were not true.  When we returned home he called Marriott and talked with a person in charge who was quite pleasant and apologized for this presenter.  All in all, this is a beautiful property on top of the hill with a view of the ocean from our balcony.  These properties are clean and beautifully furnished.  I do not recommend buying a timeshare, but since we own this we take advantage of it.  They do not permit

We've stayed in these condos several times as an exchange with our Park City Timeshare.  We love the location and view from these condos.  The facilites are first class and everything is well maintained.    We like best is proximity to so many things:  15 minutes to Laguna Beach, 20 minutes to Newport Beach and Balboa Island, and 30 minutes to Disneyland.    We will be back.

Summary Heading: Fantastic Price for a Spacious 2 BR with kitchen
Summary: I am a frequent traveler and where possible try to stay at luxury properties yet stay within my budget.  This business trip I was traveling with an assistant and did not want to share a room so I thought of this property where I have stayed before.  Located near Fashion Island with a ocean view (if you cannot see it from your room, the pool has a gorgeous ocean view but is up the hill from the ocean).  The rooms are two bedroom units with full size kitchens with most major utensils, pots, pans, etc.  There is a dining table and living room space with a pull-out couch and a couple of chairs.  Two bedrooms - one king with a LARGE bathroom with both a huge tub and a shower for two.  Second bedroom has a queen and a couch with it's own bathroom. This is an ideal spot for both a

We loved our stay at the Marriott Vacation Club in Newport Beach.   The unit was clean and very well maintained.  When staying at the Vacation Club Rentals, you know what to expect each and every stay.  The layout of the units for the Vacation Clubs are the same.

After this visit I think our family prefers a full service Marriott.    All of the rooms are the same layout: two bedrooms, two baths, kitchen, dining area and living room.  There is a TV in each bedroom and the living room.  Living room TV has a DVD player.  (You can rent DVDs at The Market.)  The only difference between rooms is the floor you are on and the location on the resort.  The resort is very spread out.  Not all rooms have a view.  Cons:  Free wifi is VERY slow.  Free wifi to me usually means slow wifi.  Everybody is happy to use it and because the hotel is not making any money, they have no incentive to purchase higher speed internet connections.  And this one is not Marriott’s fault, but this location didn’t have any Verizon 4G service.  Not sure about AT&T.  Don’t

Summary Heading: Shabby, dirty, grossly in need of renovation.  Couldn't wait to leave!
Summary: We just left this horrible resort after a one week stay and I spent much of it sick from the mold and mildew in our 2 bedroom suite.  The carpet was unraveling in much of the suite.  The kitchen sink faucet was coming out of the sink and the top rack of the dishwasher had no prongs left standing so glasses could not be loaded into it.  The towels and sheets were needing replacement and when we requested new ones, they came with a garbage bag filled with clean towels.  The view from our room was lovely and it had a nice porch for having coffee and breakfast but the overall feel of the room was drab and dismal because everything needed to be redone.  We couldn't wait to get out of our suite because it just was so old and dirty looking.  Also, there were no flat screen TVs in the

I was quite impressed with the property's landscape and layout. We were fortunate enough to have an ocean view room in the 4200 area which is far from any pool which was ok . Panoramic views of the ocean and golf course below were delightful. The room was clean and in good shape except for the carpet lifting in places which I thought was unusual. The only negative comment I have is that housekeeping didn't show up until close to 5pm but you better believe they were knocking at my door at 10 am which is check out time. I would go back in a heartbeat especially when they have discounts on their room rates.

This is a great resort!! The location of this property is awesome. Great views of the ocean and the grounds of the property are beautiful. The rooms were big and spacious and well done. The kitchen is wonderful, has everything you need. Washer and Dryer in the rooms. The pools and hot tubs are great. Exercise room is great. Basketball court, putting green, fire pit, sand pit, grassy areas for picnic and BBQ. This is just a great property for kids. Resort has fun activities for kids and families, can rent bikes, DVD's, etc. They have a shuttle bus that will take you right to the beach, it's awesome. Or the shuttle will take you to Fashion Island and pick you up. Wonderful place for a family vacation. The location is great, next to wonderful beaches, shopping, etc. I can't wait to

I have stayed at this resort several times.  This stay has been disappointing.  I arrived at night and the signage is very poor and not lit.  I couldn't find the registration in the dark, there is no parking at registration and the bellman at the front wouldn't let me park for 10 minutes to check in.  Had park and walk, then couldn't find the room.  This resort is huge with multiple buildings and in the dark the building numbers are not well lit (understatement).  The building numbers don't make any sense and all in our party of visitors spent at least 20 minutes driving around trying to find their rooms.  Our room was on a lower floor in the 2000 building and had no view.  The rooms are very spacious and well appointed.  Ask for an upper floor and don't arrive after dark.

Summary Heading: Great Location and Awesome Hollywood/LA Tour Suggested
Summary: The resort is beautiful with well kept grounds.  It is a huge resort, a type of condo community.  It is located in a very upscale area and is not in the 'city' but is within a few miles of everything.  The main pool is huge with a wonderful view of the ocean and sunset.  The resort is not adjacent to the beach but the shuttle will take you there.  We had a rental car and just went up and down Costal Highway 1 to explore.  We decided not to tackle LA and Hollywood traffic with the rental car and took a tour through SurfaceJet.net.  Ask for Douglas...he was awesome.  It was so nice to be taken to all the sites and not worry about traffic or parking.  We did the all inclusive tour including the former MGM studio tour.  Highly recommended!!  SurfaceJet and Douglas were well worth

Really great place. A very clean hotel. Many things too do nearby. The room was very spacious, 2 beds 2 baths, balcony with a view of the ocean and 3 flat screens. Check in was easy even though there was a long line, it went quick. It was a little over an hour from LAX. Rolling hills everywhere, takes getting used to when driving around to find your way around. Pool was pretty and heated. Small bar by the pool area.  Perfect place for my southern California vacation. Loved it here!

We stayed here for 3 nights , The Villa's are set out very nice with a full kitchen with anything you need it has, bath in main bedroom is big enough to lay down in and the view from our room 4441 was absolutely magnificent. They have differnet activities each day for children to Adults. We travel from Australia every year and stay at Marriotts, this would be the first one we have stayed that supply shampoo but dont supply conditioner, this I would expect at super 8! who supply all amenties. I emailed the manager and he said they have never supplied it and gave me a complimentary conditioner to get me started. I am now at another Marriott Vacation Club Grand Chateau in Las vegas where they supply it along with lotion as well. But in all we had a great stay apart from a few minor

We only spent Wednesday night through Saturday morning here - bummer, because there is so much to do at the resort and in the surrounding area. We can't wait to go back for more fun.  The resort is very nice - believe all of the reviewers: big, well-appointed rooms, beautiful landscaping, lovely views, nice pool, etc. Service was amazing - the place is huge, but they will cart you around and help you get to places. On our first day there, they said the shuttle  to Crystal Cove left from the fountain. We stood next to a shuttle at the fountain and waited. However, no one came. So we went inside to the desk and they pointed to a second shuttle that was just leaving from the other side of the fountain. Instead of making that shuttle come back to get us, they just took us to Crystal

This is one of the most beautiful resorts I have ever seen.  We had a 2 bedroom villa, with an ocean view.  The villas are huge.  Our son used the "King Triton's Cove" kids club a couple of times and enjoyed that.  They have 3 pool areas.  The main pool area has 3 pools and 2 hot tubs.  Water was warm in the pools and we really enjoyed lounging in the sun.  I also got a facial with Bonnie at the spa, which I'd highly recommend.  Bonnie is awesome!  Check in was a breeze.  All staff were friendly and helpful.  We never encounted anyone who was rude.  The drinks at the pool bar are a bit expensive, but hey, you're on vacation!  They do have happy hour specials from 2-4 Monday-Friday.  They also have a small store onsite where you can get coffee, sodas, water, pool toys, check out

These Villas are nicer than my own home, but I guess thats the point when you're on vacation. The view is gorgeous and the amenities are all wonderful. The staff is also especially friendly and helpful. Wonderful rooms with all the comforts of home and a bit more. The only thing missing is a good restaurant! Also, their "market" could have a little more of a snack selection.

I always love coming to our home base.  The property is gorgeous.  My only thing is that I never feel as though the staff cares too much about their guests.  Nothing major, just a lack-luster attitude.  However, not nearly enough to keep us away.

Beautiful and clean 2-BR/2-BA villa with nice views of the ocean in the distance. The grounds were well-maintained and we had a great time at the main pool and pool bar. Nice entertainment at the pool during happy hour (on Tuesday anyway) was a great memory from our trip. Lots of things to do for adults, kids, and families and plenty of space to do nothing too. Only thing to ask for would be an on-site restaurant (pool bar has a limited menu) and a bigger store (the existing MarketPlace shop is pretty limited). Very convenient, just a few minutes drive to Newport Beach and Laguna Beach areas.

This is our 2nd visit to Marriott Newport Coast Villas.  One word, stunning!  It is built on a cliff overlooking the Pacific Ocean.  Although Pacific Coast Highway is between you and the resort, you would never know from the views!   Both times we were there was in February.  Although it was not beach weather, the pool was heated and the pool bar was hopping!  Great family resort with a beautiful kitchen and great bedrooms.  The resort is close to everything, including LA and Disney Land.  My family and I really enjoyed staying here.

Summary Heading: Having an appartment on our vacation was very convenient to us
Summary: It was great to have a full-size kitchen, washer and dryer when on vacation. We like to eat meals cooked at home better than going out to restaurants.   Everything was very clean. Spacious showers in the master bathrooms. There was plenty of parking. The complex is very peaceful and the area is very nice. We only wished we stayed more!  There are two baths in the unit and the 2nd bedroom has the bathroom attached to it. You can also get to that bathroom from the living room.  The one downside was that there were no coffee filters, so we bought some and left them over for the next guests.  Another downside was that people in the unit below were very noisy and smoking, despite the facility being non-smoking -- we could hear them and smell the smoke from our unit with windows open.

We recently stayed at the Marriott Newport Coast Villas for a weekend wedding, and wished we could have taken advantage of the many amenities that the resort offered!   I should start by stating how accommodating the hotel staff were with us from the start. We thought the wedding was going to be cancelled three days out from the wedding, so we called and were able to get a full refund. Then, the next day we found out that the wedding was BACK ON! We had received a very nice discounted rate before, but we could not find that special rate on such short notice, so we contacted the hotel directly and they generously offered our original reservation/rate price that we had previously reserved.  We arrived very late for check in and the front desk representative was extremely welcoming

Summary Heading: Nice accommodations, location and service average
Summary: Stayed in a well appointed 2 bedroom condo.  Full kitchen, dining, living room.  2 bedrooms, 1 king, 1 queen.  Queen room had a pull out sofa (twin size) and living also had pull out.  2 bathrooms, master had very large walk in shower and separate garden tub.  Nice patio, overall decor and cleanliness was great.  Some units face the ocean, ask for an upper floor.  Many of the buildings don't have elevators.  It is a very hilly resort, be prepared if walking to climb a lot of inclines!  Pros: Very well appointed condo's, good if you want larger accommodations. Full amenities including washer/dryer. Nice area, need a car to get around the local area and beaches Gas grills available for use Daily maid service Playground, basketball court, pools   Cons: Location - for the price, it

We recentely attended a wedding at Palican Hills resort.  Which is wonderful.  We opted to stay across the street at the Marriott Coast villas,  I was so impressed with the units, the courtesy of the staff and the lay-out of the villas.  Each had fully furnished kitchens, courtesy coffee, dining room, living room and two completel bedroom suites..  It could easily accomodate a family of six, extremely well.  My suite had a large walkin shower, a sunken tub and the most comfortable bed.  The othr suite had its own bath-room and lovely bedroom.  Three TV's in the unit and also balcony sitting.  It was a great surprise and a terrific price.  It['s location is perfect, close to Crystal Cove, Laguna and Fashion Island.   Lovely grounds and close to the beach.  It was a real treat and

True with other reviews--you MAY hear someone above you--but otherwise very quiet.  fabulous views and location, nearly all villas have a view.  Also the bbq grills convenient to each villa so you can buy some meat and through on the grill for a quick meal, Trader Joe's just down the highway 2 miles to get the supplies you need.  Fashion Island near with lots of restaurants for meals.  No need to drive too far to find something to do.

Summary Heading: Plenty of room for families or couples sharing
Summary: While this place is beautiful it is like a large apartment complex with a really great pool. The rooms all have 2 bedrooms and 2 bathrooms and are quite nice. The hotel also offers shuttle services to various beaches and shopping areas. If you get back late, and you are driving, good luck finding a parking spot. It's all first come first serve and the grounds are extremely large so it can be a hike to one's room. Nothing is within walking distance so leave your car and take the shuttle to avoid parking issues.

This place is beautiful. It has a very comfortable feel and the villas are great! The bedrooms are spacious, clean, and so comfortable. They have a big screen in each room and every necessity that you need. The bathrooms are clean and big. Master bath had a double shower head and plenty of room. The housekeeping worked hard and fast. Front desk fulfilled our need for extra coffee and made sure we had it right after we requested it by bringing it to our room. There is plenty of parking and a parking garage. Didn't use the pool but I'm sure it was nice. The location is nice, in between Laguna Beach and Newport Beach. Overall, this place is excellent and I would definitely recommend and return. No complaints at all!!

We are timeshare owners at another resort and this was our 2nd time staying here.  We lucked out the first time we stayed here and had a full on ocean veiw that we were able to watch gorgeous sunsets from..  Guess you can't always be so lucky.  This time they tried to put us in building 1100 that is right by a pool but with absolutely no view.  The nice gentleman at the front desk (can't remember his name but he was training someone and I think he was a front desk lead) made a call to see if there was another room avilable. We ended up with a room that had a view of a canyon and the beautiful, very large and expensive homes on the other side.  If you stepped out onto the balcony and stood over to the left hand side, you could see the ocean.  It was very quiet.  We were fortunate

We stay in at least 10 different hotels annually and have done so for about 10 years - so we have had a fair amount of exposure to different hotels across several sections of the U.S.  But our experience at these Villas was our best.  Now, some of our glowing review probably comes from the fact that we pre-paid for an extended stay during the slow season, which reduced the cost considerably.  But still, the folks  there could not have been more helpful.  The fitness center was terrific, the 10-minute walk down to Crystal Cove State Park and the Ocean was enjoyable and the beautiful surroundings of the Villas property made it even better!  The villas are huge, I have never received more room for the price.  Even though we were cautioned that as a non-owner we could not expect

Summary Heading: Spacious accommodation, with all of the amenities that you need
Summary: This the third occasion that we've stayed in this resort as part of a time share exchange.  We really like the accommodation.  It's extremely spacious and has pretty much everything that you need to make the apartment feel like home for a week.  We never really use the on site facilities.  We have however always found the staff to be extremely helpful whenever we've needed their assistance. The shuttle buses drivers are particularly accommodating and will generally give you a lift pretty much where you want when their scheduled shifts are over.  The on site supermarket has a somewhat limited stock, though is ok if you run out of bread and milk.  The local supermarket Pavillions (out of the resort and turn right up the hill) offers Marriott residents discount on their bills (they

My husband and I, along with another couple, stayed at this vacation club the first week of September. We are owners at another resort and traded for this beautiful place. We got a 2 bedroom villa with a great view of the Pacific and the surrounding hills.  Our villa was very quiet and up to the usual excellent standards of Marriott properties. You have to walk a ways to the beach, (Crystal Cove park) and driving would be better if you have lots of stuff like chairs or kids. There is a shuttle, but we never took it.  Pools are very nice, good gyms to work out, although we found that just hiking the property was a good workout.  It is built into a big hill and there are lots of stairs to get up to different levels.  50, 70, even 90 steps are available to huff and puff up!  And

My husband and I along with our son and a friend stayed at the Marriott's Newport Coast Villas for our 3 year Wedding Anniversary. We had a wonderful experience. We had a 2 bedroom villa and each bedroom had a bathroom. We enjoyed the full size kitchen for making some of our meals and the full size dining area. The rooms were very clean and updated. The view was amazing!!!!  We had a view of the Pacific Ocean along with a side view of the hills and golf course. The property has all the amenities of a resort such as tennis courts, basketball courts, along with 5 very inviting pools. The property also has all the conveniences of home with the flat screen tvs, gas grills and chase lounge chairs everywhere on the property just to name a few things.   If you could not have a good

5 women stayed last week in a unit with a wonderful ocean view.  The units are very spacious however the hide-a-beds could use new mattresses.  The location is fantastic, in a quieter zone above Crystal Cove beach with panoramic ocean views. The pool and facilities are as close to a resort property as I have experienced at a time share, and there are ample restaurant and shopping facilities nearby.  The workout facility is very nice, the small spa is adequate and convienent. It is a great place to access all that Orange County has to offer, just minutes from both Newport Beach and Laguna Beach, and is a pleasant location to spend a whole week in a few mile radius. Nearby Corona Del Mar is a little gem, and Fashion Island has great shopping. We also appreciated the lit tennis

We stayed at the villas for the weekend and so glad we did not commit to a longer stay.  We are Orange County locals and have always loved Crystal Cove, so we decided to stay here for the weekend to celebrate my husband's birthday.  The positives are that the price is decent for a relatively spacious 2-BR villa.  The location right across the street from Crystal Cove (our favorite beach) is great.  The kids loved feeding the Koi fish (one of the free planned activities provided).  Unfortunately, that is about it.  The first room we were given had more updated appliances, but faced somewhat of a garage or work area with a loud street right outside our balcony.  The second one was a bit better facing a small yard and shrubs.  There was no elevator access down the the lower floor

We stayed here with our extended family in Oct. 2010. We rented two 2-bedroom units and with the sofa sleepers, 15 slept comfortably. The facilities were immaculate, the rooms were spotless, and the view amazing! It was about a 20 minute drive to Disneyland, and grocery stores were about 10 minutes away. It was definitely a $ saver to have kitchens in the units. We loved it here and would recommend it to anyone!

We  rented two units and were lucky to be placed side by side. We were  assigned the golf view rooms which do not have elevators since only a few floors. Also to access the units there two level of steps going down. This area is not for clients with physical challenges The Master bedroom. has a king bed, soaking tub and a  marble shower  with dual shower heads.  The 2nd bedroom has a queen bed with a pull out sofa. The living room has a pull out sofa. . HD television in each room and free WIFI. They offer a great BBQ area with stainless steel BBQ grills.  The only negative is cell phone service is poor to none,. All of the cell phone providers were represented in our group along with BlackBerry, Iphone, Android. none worked anywhere on the property, Skype on your computer would

Marriott's Newport Coast Villas was a wonderful place to return to after full days of enjoying all the attractions & beaches that the area offers. The grounds are beautiful & well maintained. Our unit was spacious & very clean. It was great to have a glass of wine on our balcony & watch the sunset over the Pacific.  As others mentioned, we did not have any maid service, but we also didn't ask for anything. The resort is located half way between LA & San Diego. Crystal Cove is on the PCH at the foot of the resort; have at least 1 meal at the Beachcomber, you won't be sorry. Trader Joe's is close for the evenings we chose to grill at the resort.The ferry to Catalina is located on Balboa Island, very covenient. Corona del Mar & Laguna Beach are full of great shops & restaurants.

My family and I have stayed at this hotel several times, and normally we have experienced nothing but great service ---not this time. Unfortunately, we were told we'd be given a room on the top floor (my 2 year old is a very light sleeper) when I called, but upon arriving 2 hours later the front desk said that they don't have available on the property and that we'd have to stay on the first floor. After going back & forth, the manager did provide a credit to the resort's pool bar and snack shop. However, the entire stay was ruined by people in the room above us running back & forth the whole night. Even after we called to notify the hotel of this matter, nothing was done to resolve it even though we were told security would take care of it.  The property itself is beautiful and

We are loyal Marriott customers and as such Marriott invited us to preview this property and their Vacation Club plan.  The room rate was enticing, but we live in Texas so I was skeptical.  The salesperson insisted that I would not be disappointed and specifically promised that we would have a view.  So, we flew from Texas, and had NO view.  Our room (#1112) was sort of a basement room with a bare hillside outside the front door and a huge sign on a fence ouside the the other side.  Absolutely no place to sit outside for a cup of coffee or glass of wine with any kind of view.  I don't like to complain, but I just couldn't get past this.

A wonderful spot to vacation at! There was lots to do and great shopping. The hotel staff really went out of their way to make you feel welcome and Newport Beach was breath-taking! We had a wonderful room away from everything and spent a lot of time in it! The bed was very comfortable, the bath was nice an big and the food was great! We had most of our breakfasts in our room which was very nicely presented and had some of our evening meals in the restaurant. It was a relaxing place to stay and very nice and quiet.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay because of location.  Decent accomodations.  Not enough parking.
Summary: We stay here for 2 weeks every year because of its wonderful location and close proximity to great shopping, restaurants, events and because family is nearby.  This facility is really more of a time share although rooms are available for rent like a hotel based upon availability.  We look at this facility almost as a second home and will often stay here when we visit family during Thanksgiving or Christmas.  Summertime is the best time to be here but good luck finding availability from June to August.  It isn't beachfront but you get wonderful views of the Pacific ocean and the beach is within walking distance (just cross Pacific Coast Hwy to Crystal Cove Beach).  It's close to premiere shopping (Fashion Island, South Coast Plaza) and excellent restaurants which is great as

I stayed here with 4 other girlfriends in a two bedroom villa and it was wonderful.  It had two bathrooms which made it great for 5 women.  The kitchen was well stocked.  I had asked for early check  in because I am a Marriott member so that made it nice.  The only thing I did not ask for was a view and that would have made it perfect.  But all we had to do was step outside a few steps and we could see the ocean. We love to have breakfast as the Beachcomber at Crystal Cove so being close made it nice.  We could have walked down if we had wanted.  We would all go back anytime.

I had nothing to complain about as far as accommodations go - we had a 2 bedroom villa that slept 7 of us comfortably and we had everything we needed in that respect.  It was the PARKING that really frustrated us, because there was -literally- no place to park at one point in the day. They also have this ridiculous placard system that dictates where you're allowed to park:  Villa or Garage. Even if you have a parking placard that identifies you as a guest, you're basically screwed if you can't find a spot in the designated area. They slap a warning on your car that's difficult to remove if you violate the parking rules.   There was also little consideration for handicap parking - it was located so far away from our villa that it barely made a difference. Somehow we made it work

The Marriott Newport Coast Villas is the perfect location for a Southern California vacation, close to everything, but out of the congestion of most beach cities.  Easy parking, great views, lots of ammenities.  Nice to have a well equipped kitchen, property is well cared for.  Only downside is the prices of the food/beverage poolside - but I suppose to be expected at any beachside resort.  We have stayed there 3 times now, and became owners on our first visit.  I am hoping future visits we will enjoy the resort more as we spend alot of time going to attractions and area beaches.  Our favorite nearby location is Balboa.  We love the beach (family friendly), the fun zone, and the pier.  During our stay at this hotel we have traveled to Disneyland, Legoland, Huntington Beach,

Summary Heading: Wonderful resort, lives up to the Marriott name
Summary: Two bedroom/two bath villas, many with ocean views from the patios.  Resort activities.  Pools, tennis courts, volleyball, basketballs, activities for the kids.  Nearby upscale restaurants and shopping.  Nearby Crystal Cove beach.

Before moving down to the Newport Beach area the Newport Coast Villas was our vacation spot of choice. We used to talk about how we didn't need to spend the money to go to Hawaii, because we could just drive from LA down to Newport Coast and have a great time at the Villas.   The Marriott N.C. Villas are actually a time-share property, however you can stay here by booking a villa through any travel website as if you are booking a regular hotel. All the villas are decorated the same, so you don't have to worry about the inconsistency between villas. This property is located in my favorite spot in Orange County. The villas are staggered up the hill overlooking the ocean and the main areas of the Marriott (i.e. pools, etc.) have breathtaking views.... It's just a short walk across

Spacious apartments that were very well equipped and maintained. Good pool areas and plenty for the family to do. Well situated for the local area but you do have to drive everywhere but I guess it is Southern California. Free wifi and parking in contrast to some of the hotels we stayed in durig our vacation. I would definitely recommend it for a few days as long as you dont need to be in a location where you can walk to bars and restaurants.

First of all, I am a Newport Coast Villa owner.  But I will stay away from that part and just talk about the place.    You can find all the pics on the website.  It is a beautiful place near the ocean (however, the walk down to the beach is a 20 min walk).    The pros: (1) Nice rooms.  4 beds (master, living room pull-out, 2nd bedroom, 2nd bedroom pull-out) enough for 10 rowdy teenagers.   (2) Fully-equipped kitchen.  Nearby groceries (Trader Joe's and Pavillion) (3) Nice pools (total of 5).   (4) Lots of activities for kids including a kid's club, teenager's shack.  Cons: (1) You don't always get the room you request.  Don't settle for a lower-than-ground level room if you can.  The view is poor and you always have to climb to get anywhere.  The 4000 and 5000 rooms are the

We LOVE Marriott, and this resort is top notch.  Clean, 5 star, spacious, perfect for families.  The pool is great, and the site is gorgeous.  Definitely the place to stay for your Laguna Beach vacation!
This is a condo property. The units sleep 6 and are 2 bedroom. Great kids program and good beach at Crystal cove. The hotel provides a free shuttle to the beach and fashion valley mall.

Summary Heading: Beautiful, well maintained property.  Services sometimes lacking
Summary: I've stayed at this property several times over the past five years and have always enjoyed my visits.  The property is set on a hillside overlooking the Pacific at Crystal Cove.  Most, but not all, of the rooms have expansive ocean views.  I have always had very good to excellent views.  Had I not, I suspect that my reaction would be different.   The rooms are all the same (some have been remodeled more recently than others).  The kitchens are were well equipped.  The property is beautifully landscaped and well maintained.  The property now has three pool complexes (one with three pools and two hot tubs).  In the summer, the main pool can get very crowded.  The others are less crowded even in summer.  The major weakness of the the property (assuming you get one of the rooms

This is a great place for a family vacation. We really like the location of the property, having enough room to spread out and having a kitchen for meals and snacks.  We have stayed here several times and in several different buildings and good room locations are hit and miss. If you get a good location the view is beautiful.  We used the free shuttle to Laguna Beach and that was very handy so that we didn't have to find parking there. The check-in and check-out were very quick and easy and the service was very good.  We keep going back because it is such a great place for a family vacation.

This is a beautiful Marriott resort. This is a gorgeous property with several nice swimming pools. The grounds are clean and beautiful. If you can book a room on the third floor that will increase your odds of a good view. The lower floors can have some noise problems; hearing guests in the above units. I think we had a McDonald's play-land above our unit. OK maybe not that bad but for the price and being a Marriott they should not have skimped on the sound barrier quality between floors. We could hear the people walking above us at 5:30 am.  The resort is great the location to the Beach not so good. Crystal Cove state park is across a very busy street and really not within walking distance for families with beach equipment, umbrellas, boogie boards etc... The resort will tell

Summary Heading: LATE check in EARLY check out....not so friendly NOR accommodating.
Summary: They said we could check in by 2PM but kept us waiting and spending money at pool bar until 5PM. THEN stood in huge line, for thesecond time. Even the desk clerk said this place sucked. They really should get their act together. Of course the room had awesome view...but when they wanted us to check out at 10AM -- maids knocking at door --- that was it. I am Marriott gold member and have NEVER been treated like such cattle.   If you like being treated like cattle and herded through major long lines and kept waiting, then this IS the place for YOU. I spend thousands of dollars every year on Marriott as my hotel of choice for business travel and since this episode I am HYATT all the way.   I will be calling them in the AM to complain.

We have been coming to Marriott Newport Villas for a number of years as guests of timeshare owners and as hotel guests.  It is mostly a weekly timeshare condominium resort. There are many compelling pluses-- great views, lovely landscaping, great location, nice communal areas, freee wifi and generally well equipped, clean, 2b/2ba units.  As to the minuses--crowded pools, small fitness areas, no restaurant, not enough parking, no room cleaning services, no room service and no flexiblity about checkin and checkout times. Hotel rates are quite high and only time share owners have a chance to get ocean views. Customer service responses usually default to "NO".  As timeshare owners, you must be on the phone at 9  a.m. PST a full year before you wish to visit in order to have any hope

Reserved tree months before and got an underground apartment . Changed it with another one with no view . The second room faced in the corridor ( as in a Motel ) so it was not possible open the window. The " villa" was dirty : hairs in the tub ,  dirty carpets and sheets with  mold, told it two times and nothing . The pool was overcrowdy... never gone. Dont know who wrote good reviews, they are not true. Stay away from this overrated, overpriced orrible place !

I highly recommend the Newport Coast villas for anyone who hasn't been to Southern California. Great views from many rooms. Very spacious 2 bedroom villas. Short drive to many of Southern California beaches. This hotel is not on the beach. Make sure to tour Laguna and Newport Beaches when visiting. Make sure to book Ocean view villa as many of the villas do not have a view.

Stayed here on a special offer from Marriott, only had to attend a 90 minute sales presentation – no pressure, just say no.  I am not an owner but must say this is a 5 star resort.  We didn’t have a view of the ocean from our room, but I didn’t expect one either.  Plenty of parking available including a parking deck.  Of course there isn’t a full service restaurant on the premises, these are large 2 BR condos with Full Kitchens – everything you need accept the food is in the room.  Excellent location, views of the Pacific Ocean and friendly pool side service.  We had great drinks at the pool; food also looked good.  The owners bought access to this property which is first class in a multi-millionaire’s location.

Loved the proximity to the beach...the free shuttle to the beach and Fashion Island was great. The pool activities were a lot of fun for the kids. Kids utilized the activity room filled with games and free movies to check out. DJ around pool and movie night were also great fun. Would come back again with our grandkids. Rooms were extremely comfortable. Great flat screen tvs in the two bedrooms and the living room. We were very happy.

Summary Heading: Great Marriott resort and location.  I highly recommend.
Summary: We're an owner of a Marriott timeshare in Hilton Head.  We stayed at this resort a couple of weeks ago and loved it!!!  Definitely the nicest Marriott timeshare we've stayed at.  Double headed showers in master and a separate huge tub.  (Didn't use the tub though.)  Great views of the ocean!  Quite.  Heated pools.  Great service.  You can open up the doors and windows and enjoy the awesome view and weather!  I would write down the negative if there was one.  Great location!!!  Within 20 minutes of Huntingdon Beach, Corona Del Mar, Dana Point, Laguna Beach etc.  We didn't go to the beach at the resort but there is a shuttle that will take you.  (It's kind of a long walk.)  Pelican Hills Golf Club is right across the street.  Personally I loved seeing all of the Ferrari's,

Marriott's Newport Coast Villas are located on a hillside overlooking the Pacific Ocean. Walking to the beach is problematic.  However, almost all villas provide private balconies that offer ingenuous views for nearly 180 degrees.  We have traded into Marriott's Newport Coast Villas several times, and have always been thoroughly impressed by Marriott quality.  As Marriott owners we are guaranteed ocean front views.  We always select a two-bedroom and two-bathroom villa.  All villas are air-conditioned; feature state-of-the-art kitchens, in-unit laundry facilities, as well as entertainment centers. The outdoor pool, gas grills, and exercise room are all well-maintained.  Adults will want to avoid Disneyland, Knott's Berry Farm, Universal Studios, and the ilk. The J. Paul Getty

i stayed at this resort in march 2011 . I was looking for something different and luxury and i came to the right place. The price is very good for what u getting and comparing to other resorts in the area like this one. Most resorts charge about $250 a night for a small room 400sq ft ,but here for the same price you are getting a huge villa over 1,000 sq ft. I love the space and how clean and new everyhting is there . It is a very huge property overlooking the ocean . To walk to ocean is about 20 min ,but it looks much closer then that . My room had a huge living room with separate dining room and full kitchen with everything you need.The master bedroom is big too and have a huge jacuzzy/bathtub. 2nd bedroom is just regular but have its own bathroom. 2 balconies looking over the

We love this place!! We are a family of four and stay here every year for a week. I can't say enough about how much we love and enjoy our stay. This place has it all. From the pools to the playground, basketball, putting green, I could go on and on...and the rooms were Clean, Spacious, and and have beautiful ocean views! I can't wait to go back!!

The Marriott Newport Coast Villas are very nice.  Our family of 9 stayed there in two 2 bedroom villas.  It has plenty of room and we loved having a kitchen so we could eat meals there.  The pool is nice and it is close to the beach, shopping and restaurants.  The only complaint I had was the beds seemed a little too firm for my taste.

The villa we stayed in was beautiful, plenty of room for us and the other couple we invited.  Very tastefully decorated and clean. Did have one problem towards the end of our stay with a backed up sink, which they tended to that night. The other issue we had is we never scheduled housekeeping, so they were going to come the last day of our trip, so we just told them to forget it. Other timeshares we didn't have to schedule it, they just came on the 3rd day.   Everyone working at this resort was so helpful and friendly. The property was beautifully landscaped and you can see the Pacific Ocean from almost anywhere..try to request a corner unit since they have a better view,  (we didn't get one)  We loved sitting out on the balcony having wine and snacks. The weather this time of

Summary Heading: Stay twice and will be back again
Summary: Newport Coast villas had become a great little winter getaway for our family for a few year now (we are not timeshare owners). Two bedrooms, full kitchen, wonderful views of the ocean, pool, activities for the kids, big and small playgrounds, proximity to the ocean, wonderful customer service makes this place one of our favorite places to stay while in CA.

Summary Heading: We loved it so much, we're returning in November 2011
Summary: For an east coast family, the Newport Coast (Beach) area is exciting.  Even in winter, the view from these Spanish style villas is magnificent.  The two bedroom suites are truly large with two large bedrooms, two large bathrooms, and a living room/dining room/kitchen that could accommodate a gathering/party for 20 guests.  The balcony just adds to the roominess.   Silence is golden - never heard the neighbors below or next door.  The pool and common areas are elegant.  Parking is close by to the door to your building with, of course, elevators and AC.  We felt pampered and relaxed.....would like to make this an annual adventure since our daughter lives in Los Angeles !!
This resort is beautiful.  We love the location and the closeness to the Orange County Beaches.   Ask for more soap and shampoo at check in.   The shower in the master bedroom is for 2 people.

We are owners at this resort and were very happy staying in our 2 bedroom villa on the second floor in the 4000 building with a beautiful view of the ocean and golf course.  We were able to check in upon arrival at approximately 4:30p.m.  Chairs were abundant at the pool area as the sun was sparse most of our 1 week trip.We enjoy the pool at the top of the hill as we are not traveling with children and you can move your lawn chair anywhere amongst the grass, overlooking the canyon.  We spent a lot of time hiking at Crystal Cove Beach for hours on end from one end to the other as we enjoy excercise.  The excercise facility at the Villas is great, but can get a bit crowded, or did while we were there. The $5 pass for Crystal Cove can also be used at Huntington Beach State parks.

We stayed here for 3 nights on one of the vacation plan previews. The suites were huge but needed some renovations, especially the kitchen, it was kind of dirty so we didn't use it. Having a washer and dryer in the suite was a plus but they are very small.   The pools were wonderful but can be crowded. The view was gorgeous and there are many fun activities available for kids, some were free but some had a nominal fee. Ping pong, chess and video games proved to be a big draw.   Cons included the distance between our villa and the main activity center, the marketplace or pools and the lack of a restaurant on site. The pool has a bar/burger stand but it closes really early and although the marketplace is open late they shut down food service an hour or so before closing. Pizza

Summary Heading: The view doesn't get better than this.  Can't wait to go back!
Summary: After reading reviews and seeing photos, we decided to give this Marriott property a try.  We stayed at their Maui property last year and loved every minute of our stay.    As we drove down Newport Coast Dr. we were so excited to see that the property was even more beautiful than we hoped.  The view was a little slice of heaven!  Check in was smooth but we were sad to learn our villa was on first floor with no view.  Once we got to our villa, we were happy to see it was very spacious, clean and quiet.  At check in you get a list of activities.  Highly recommend you look over as they had some fun stuff for adults and kids.   Some are free and some have a fee.  We took advantage of Kid's Night Out which my kids really enjoyed.  Also had movie night at pool and ice cream party.

I'm writing this review late and only because we just stayed at another Marriott resort (Palm Desert) in which I was disappointed.  My review of Marriott Shadow Ridge in Palm Desert was only 2 star. This Marriott in Newport Coast is by far an exceptional value. Pool was very nice. Location is great and the rolling grounds are wonderful. Tucked in between buildings away from the main area are playgrounds for the kids, tether-ball, and other game areas. Beautiful basketball court too. When we were there it wasn't crowded, and that always helps the whole experience. Sp does the proximity to the ocean. Plenty to do. My only complaint was when my wife lost her cel phone, the staff was not very helpful.

This was a gorgeous facility!  My family loved the Villas, the pools and Giant sized chess board at the main pool.  We did have one mishap with the shuttles.  Be VERY careful that you are at the main shuttle stop if you want a ride to the beach.  We sat and waited at a stop near our Villa because it had the shuttle stop sign and schedule.  When it never came we called the front desk and were told you can only get on at the main stop....  Pain!  The beach is not very close either.  Parking was terrible, so you definitly want to take a shuttle.

Stayed at the villas for a family beach trip. We normally stay at coronado beach when we travel to california for a beach trip but this time we decided to try newport. We loved the spacious rooms at the villas and really appreciated the extra space with a kitchen and living room. We bought fruit from a local market and ate most breakfasts in the condo. Crystal Cove beach was a 10-15 minute walk from our villa and laguna beach and newport strand beach were a short drive. we loved the area and the local restaurants. The property was great with an amazing resort pool and VERY friendly and attentive staff. The trip could not have been better. We loved the villas, the town and the different beaches in the area.

currently staying in a timeshare villa.  Complex is akin to a small town of condos/twins/apartments.VERY limited parking.  While there is plenty to do in the AREA, staying in the villas leaves alot to be desired.  No Restaurant, no bar - only option for either is poolside (sandwiches etc), and closes before dark. Nothing is really in walking distance - even walking to small marketplace store in main lobby can be 1/4 mile walk. Rooms are very nice but only a few of the rooms have a view of the ocean - as a timeshare owner, I was very disappointed in my view of trees.

We stayed for a week. Great location. Up on a hillside with a million dollar view of the pacific. We loved the look and feel of the property. Very upscale Tuscany like. People were very friendly. Concierge "Nancy" gave us great tips for dining and parking at Balboa Island. Thanks Nancy.   Things that bothered us but not a deal breaker: We didn't get the room we wanted at first even though we were told it had a view. Even after calling the front desk for another room, we were told there was nothing so we went to front desk in person to give one more try and sure enough we got another room. I guess it depends on who u speak to. We also didn't like the small basketball area. A full size court would have been nice and theres plenty of room to build one.    We would go back again. I

We loved this place.  We went a year ago, but I never wrote a review until now.  The pool with a view of the ocean was the best ever.  The condos were great and just like new.  The only downside is that in the daytime you can find parking easily, but after 9pm you might have to park a little bit away from your particular building.

Summary Heading: Nice Resort, Nice Area, would go back!
Summary: Our experience was much like WLAMom's review.  We stayed 2 weeks.  Some friends stayed as well.  The units are typical Marriott timeshare size -- these are all 2 bed/2 bath condos type with washer/dryer. Kitchen is fully equipped.  The resort is actually in Newport Coast, although Trip Advisor says Newport Beach and somewhere else says Laguna Beach.  The main pool is small for the size of the resort.  When it is not crowded, the pool is great.  Our unit was next to one of the smaller pools, which never got crowded.  Unlike WLAMom, we found lots of activities for our kids.  The ones in the kids center were typically free or nominal charge.  The ones by the main pool were vendors, brought in to provide the services, like temporary tattoos, face painting, etc.  Our kids loved the

Summary Heading: Very nice resort. Large units, but can be dark. Some prob with service.
Summary: We stayed 3 nights recently, and I enjoyed enough, but may not want to return.  The untis are large -- all 2 bed/2 bath condos type with washer/dryer.  Kitchen is fully equipped.  Our unit did not have an ocean view and was rather dark.    My problem is with the pools.  There are 5 pools in all, and the main pools were extremeley crowded, and not staffed at all.   I can understand the other pools not having staff, but the main pools?  Some pools were supposed to be quiet, and yet the signs were so small, no one noticed or paid attention.  There was no one to reinforce the rules.  The resort is huge, but there were not enough activities for the kids.  The Teens area was being renovated, so we didn't get to see it.  The location is not great either.  Can't walk to anything at all.

Summary Heading: Absolutely Wonderful Resort-Cannot wait to go back!!
Summary: We have been going to Marriott's Newport Coast Villas at least twice a year since 2001.  It is by far the best of the best in the Marriott Vacation Clubs.  Rooms are spacious and laid out well, the staff are gracious and accommodating and the resort is just perfect in every way.    With the location right in the heart of things, there are always fun things to do either at the resort or nearby.  We often find ourselves doing nothing, either by one of the 6 pools or at Crystal Cove Beach.  That is what a vacation is for, right?  In the 10 years that we have been going, there of course have been a couple of minor issues.  But the staff have always stepped up and gone above and beyond in making things right.  That is one of the things that we love about Marriott, besides the

It is great to walk into a suite with your family and say "Wow".  The view, the interior and exterior are beautiful.  The beach is a short walk away and the three pools met all are our needs.  The service when needed was fast and delivered what ever we requested.

As a timeshare owner at two other Marriott properties, I have had the pleasure of staying at many different Marriott resorts; and the Newport Coast Villas ranks among the best. With the exception of inadequate parking, both at the lobby and at our assigned building, our stay was memorable.  Our 2-BR, 2-BA villa (#4014) had an un-obstructed view of the ocean. The unit was very nice and perfectly suited for either family or friends traveling together. The dining and living areas were spacious and the full kitchen was furnished with cook and table ware for eight. In the master bedroom and located next to the bed was an oversized soaking tub. Also in the bedroom was a double sink vanity. A large, glass-enclosed shower with two shower heads and the toilet were in a separate

This may have been one of the nicest hotel I have ever stayed in. The villas were spacious and the king bathroom was amazing. It had a 2 headed shower and a giant bath tub. The view from the room was great and the pool area was fantastic. They offer a shuttle to the near by beaches and have plenty of activities on site.

Summary Heading: Love Newport Coast Villas - will definitely return
Summary: We have been to Newport Coast Villas once before and had splendid ocean view/golf course rooms. This time the view wasn't quite so splendid but that was only because some trees had grown very high and were obscuring the view which in actual fact was an ocean view if you looked through the trees as you will see from the photo I am posting.  We were more than happy with the room again. The location is second to none and visiting Fashion Island, Balboa, Laguna Cliffs, Dana Point is lovely and they are only a short drive away so you can go in the morning and spend the rest of the day back at the pool depending on weather of course - we had great weather this time which was unexpected so we tended to sunbathe for a few hours each afternoon. One thing we haven't had time to do yet is

Have stayed at the The Marriott Newport Coast Villas at least half dozen times.  Considering that literally across the street at Pelican Hill the exact same spectacular view  of the Pacific (not the same quality) costs 800% more...the Marriott Newport Coast cannot be beat. Staff is incredibly happy, responsible and courteous.  Smallest item is handled with a smile. Two bedroom suites (all) are comfortable and non-claustrophobic.  Always get a second floor oceanfront room (30% are oceanfront).  Walls and floors not very well sound-proofed and remember, this is a resort with lots of kids. Location cannot be beat.  Laguna Beach 10 minutes.  Newport Beach/Balboa Island 10 min.  Airport 15 min the most.

We've stayed at the Newport Coast Villas on multiple occasions.  We traded one of our Marriott timeshare weeks for a week here.  It's one of our favorite destinations.    The Villa's are beautiful and well maintained.  There is plenty of room to spread out and get comfortable.  We invited our friends to stay with us and had 4 adults and 4 kids staying in one villa and never felt cramped.  Our Balcony had an amazing view of the pacific ocean.  It felt like we were on the Italian Riveria.  The grounds are beautiful and well maintained.  Plus there is a lot of fun stuff for the kids to do (putting green, tether ball, ping pong, pool tables, etc).  Overall the staff is friendly and we know to aviod the "Concierge" people who are really timeshare salesmen.  If their is a negative

I had read the reviews about the noise and brought two sound machines with me- one for each bedroom.  Even with those going we could hear every step of our upstairs neighbors.  I had requested a ground floor out of courtesy for our fellow guests as I have 10-month old twins, a 3 year old and 5 year old.  I didn't want them waking up other guests when they wake up at 6-7 AM.  Big Mistake.    The first two nights were fine and then a huge wedding party moved in taking over our building.  Friday night they returned from their festivities at 2 AM and continued partying until 3:30 AM despite our 3 calls to the front desk.  We were offered the chance to move, but we had settled in after 3 days there and it was going to be a huge inconvenience to move us, the two rented full size
Been here twice My 5yr old and 8yr old love it Great location Spacious villas with a kitchen

Summary Heading: Wonderful Location, but can be very noisy
Summary: We are asked for a quiet room prior to arrival, just a quiet room if possible.  Instead we got a room next to the parking lot on the ground floor.  We did not need an ocean view or any other amenities, but clearly the hotel didn't really care.  We also were on the ground floor, a big no no for this particular resort.  You can hear pounding footsteps from the apartment above you.  Clearly they saved on the sound proofing and insulation, as you can tell when your neighbor upstairs is flushing the toilet, and walking across the rooms (just walking!  Not jumping or being loud or being obnoxious, just walking!)  The tripadvisor reviews that I read prior to staying here also said the same thing in some instances, so the reviews were definitely right on!  The location is great, it is

Summary Heading: annual trip, and many more to come
Summary: we visit this place every year for disney, s.ca beach trip, very lovely 2 bed room place this time we got brand new building - nothing special since all of this place are well maintained  love new pool that located top of resort - very clean but not crowd as much as main pool

This property is very large with many different things to don on property. The rooms are nice. Nothing over the top but pretty typically nice for a Marriot property. There are many outdoor activitis inside of the propert and all of the apce in our villa made our stay very pleasant! It is also right next to the beach which makes it very convenient. I will definitely stay again sometime.

Summary Heading: I wish I could live there!
Summary: I stayed over a Friday and Saturday night for a reunion with friends.  It was a fabulous property.  Our room was a very large 2 bedroom villa, fully equiped with anything I could imagine needing.  Our balcony overlooked the golf course and in the distance a view of the ocean.  Everything was pristine as far as cleanliness.  The staff were very kind and efficient.  The housekeeping staff were quick and did a very good job.  They showed up at around 11 am each day.  The Spa is very nice.  There are numerous patios that overlook the ocean that is a great spot to watch the sunset and have a glass of wine.  There is a Trader Joes just a mile or so down the road, also an Albertson's for any supplied you may need while you stay.    This is nearby Fashion Island and also several smaller

Summary Heading: A Wonderful Resort for a Wonderful Trip!
Summary: My family and I traveled to Newport Beach and stayed at the Newport Coast Villas this past April for Spring Break and had a fabulous time.  For one, the villa itself is great. There are two large bedrooms, two large bathrooms, an updated kitchen, an open dining area, a spacious living area, and an awesome balcony.  Secondly, there are fabulous resort amenities. The pool with views of the ocean, the large lawn area, and the fitness facilities, just to name a few, were all easily within walking distance of our villa. One of our favorite things to do each evening was to sit in a patio area near the lawn and simply enjoy the breathtaking view as we watched the sunset.  Additionally, the location was perfect. We chose to rent a car and were quickly able to locate groceries,

Summary Heading: Great family get together location--and awesome view!
Summary: The villas are a perfect location for a family get together. The villas are two bedrooms, spacious living room area,  a full kitchen, three pools, a spacious porch--some with partial or the most fabulous views!  The grounds are amazing!  A great place to get families together.  The summers are booked up with timeshare owners but off seasons there is availability --not cheap but when you think that the accommodations can accommodate up to 5-6 people--and getting family together-- a great deal!

Three of us wanted to stay together, but needed our space; so this hotel worked out perfectly.  One had to stay on a pull out (not so great... it squeaked.  Probably ok for kids).  But the beds were very comfortable with a fluffy comforter and pillows.  The kitchen was perfect for having breakfast so that we could get an early start.  Each of us had out own TV.  (yes, dvd too).  The shower had good pressure and the water was hot.  We were given a room with a view of the ocean in the distance.  Short drive to go down to the beach and watch the sunset.  The pools were nice, but we didn't swim (no time!) There is free parking and internet. This hotel/condo is very spread out so it's a walk to the pools and many of the out door entertainment provided.  Fashion Island and South Coast

Summary Heading: just a glorified hotel with lousy service and amenities
Summary: highway noise was so loud we could not keep doors and windows open (which they recommend to save on energy); broken light in bathroom that had melted to the socket and sizzled everytime you used it and was NEVER fixed; no restricter on hot water in tubs so there is a scalding risk to children; pull-out couches are EXTREMELY uncomfortable; large holes in sheets; outside barbecues shot flames out the front because they had been put together wrong but they did nothing about it; outside barbecues had not been cleaned; no customer service at all; many promises but absolutely no action; took 10 hours to get foam pillows instead of feather - BRING YOUR OWN PILLOWS!!!; knobs broken off furniture; they spent a ton of money on the lobby and pools and forgot about accommodating the guest

Our family stayed here for two nights during our spring break vacation. It is always hard and expensive to find accomodations for a family of five.  This 2 bedroom suite was fabulous - it was nice to have 2 bedrooms and 2 baths, along with a separate sitting/living room. The beds were quite comfortable and the shower was to die for!  The kitchen was great, although since we were only there for 2 nights we didn't really use the kitchen.  So many different places to eat out.  The landscaping was beautiful and very well kept. The pools were great, and the kids enjoyed playing a bit of basketball as well. Absolutely no complaints!

Villas are perfect for families. Sooo much room to spread out. Service was amazing. Our daughter lost her favorite necklace down the drain right before checkout. No problem, they got it out and mailed it to us. Can't say enought good things about this place.

Summary Heading: Great Location, beautiful surroundings plus its a Marriott Timeshare
Summary: This is the 3rd time i got the opportunity to stay at this great location! Beautiful surroundings plus on Sunday April 24 the timeshare had a egg hunt for all children ages 01-16! If you get the chance enjoy the  four pools, or go to Crystal Cove State Park a short walk from the resort. I can only report a Positive experience from everyone in our party!  Only Negative was the cloudy weather but We still got a perfect Sunset on that day!    Lots of places to eat within 1/2 mile of resort!

This hotel offers top notch amenities and service!  The grounds are beautiful, the pools are excellent, and there are many activities to keep you busy on site.  The hotel is located near many popular attractions, plus offers close beach access.  I would highly recommend this hotel.

We just got back from a one week stay at the Marriott Newport Coast Villas and loved it.  The villa was very nicely decorated, clean, comfortable roomy and had a great ocean view.  The landscaping was beautiful.  I loved sitting out on the balcony in the mornings sipping my coffee, looking at the ocean, listening to the birds, smelling the fragrant air and feeling the ocean breeze.  There was plenty to do at the resort, tennis, swimming, the gym, an ice cream party and a wine tasting.  Crystal Cove State Park is right next to the Marriott Villas and has great hiking trails.  The beach is right across the street, and is part of the state park, so it's quite pristine.  We were also a short drive to Laguna and Balboa Island, both great areas to stroll around.  My husband and I

Summary Heading: A Tuscan village in s Cali.
Summary: Had the pleasure of staying here while accompanying my fiance on business. While its predominantly a family oriented resort I had plenty of privacy by one of the resorts 3 large pools. Each pool area offering its own kiddy pool and Jacuzzi. There are plenty of bbqs for your use, and loungers to read a book, a firepit overlooking the cliff and ocean is a nice touch. Too many amenities to list.   Our 2 bedroom suite made even us ( seasoned) world travellers giddy. Stunning kitchen, living room with dining room, 3 flatscreens. Even down to the cute bath towel dog that greeted us on the master bed, where we were pleasantly surprised to see a Jacuzzi tub for 4. Only downside was lack of jets. It is very apparent this is an upscale time share resort, book ahead or you will not find

We stayed here for the first week of April over our spring break.  The location of this place is perfect.  Easy access to everything.  We didn't have an ocean view but the building was pretty quiet so that was nice.  I have the feeling that timeshare owners and people taking the high pressure sales tour get the nicer views and rooms.  Still for around $230 a night we had a spacious 2 bedroom apartment.  The pools were nice and they had a lot of great amenities for kids.  I probably wouldn't recommend this to people without children.  There is no restaurant or bar except for the one during the day that is poolside.  Overall, it was really fun staying here and we will be back again.

Summary Heading: Last stop in our 16 day vacation, we loved it!!
Summary: The last four nights of our trip, we decided to have some down time away from the amusement parks and city for the kids (4, 17 months)  This villa was perfect.  No real ocean view, well, we saw a glimpse over the trees but no biggy for us as we are from hawaii and see the ocean everyday.  The rooms were huge, the kitchen was perfect, loved the dbl head shower in the master bath! Housekeeping was great, lots of activities for kids, however the weather was really crappy when we were there so didn't get to participate in anything.  But we enjoyed the quiet downtime.  Having a washer and dryer in the room was awesome as well as we could do all our laundry before heading home.  Trader joes and other markets within short distances.  Fantastic, will definitely return one day!

Summary Heading: Check-in process failed, herd of elephants in the room above.
Summary: After traveling cross country, Jacksonville to LAX via Dulles, we killed a couple of hours to arrive at the designated 3:00 PM check in time.  Drove up to the curbside check-in kiosk and started the check in process.  Informed our room was not ready, they would call us.  2+ hrs later after several trips to the reservation desk, we received our key.  My wife was told that they had tried to call us several times.  Strange we never received any calls, and I confirmed they had the correct number on my first trip to the reservation desk (line was only 6 people on that trip).  We didn't get our requested top floor, we did get a third floor room with a herd of noisy elephants above us.  The sound transmission through the floor/ceiling is terrible.  We finally got settled and crashed

This was a great place to sleep. We were gone from early am to late night to anaheim, hollywood and la. We didn't experience any of the timeshare amenities. We requested a quiet villa and it was. We had a view of the trash dumpster area. Again this was only a place to sleep. The bed was comfy, as well as the pillows. The masterbedroom shower has two rainshower heads. Luv them. Flatscreen tvs in both bedrooms and the livingroom. The kitchen was beautiful. No ant problem here, maybe because we closed our food containers. Liked the free usa today outside our door during the week. Under ground parking was nice with the elevator. Didn't see security, but we felt safe. At checkin the timeshare sales guy tried the pressure squeeze for a tour. I replied with a firm no thanks. We

Completed exceeded our expectations.  We have stayed at many 4 and 5 star hotels that did not leave us as satisfied.  With a  daughter and son (10 and 12 year old), we decided it was important that we found accomodations for our Spring Break trip with a little more room than the typical resort hotel room.  No only did we have the perfect amount of room in our Villa, but the kitchen gave us the flexibility to not necessarily eat out every meal.  We spend the first couple days of our trip a Disneyland (Grand Californian), which was great.  But, the time spent at the Marrriott Newport Coast Villas allowed us to unwind from the theme park craziness.  The resort has excellent pools and outdoor activities that our kids absolutely loved.  They are still talking about the poolside

Summary Heading: Great hotel and service with a few problems...
Summary: Came down for a quick 4 day vacation with my girlfriend and her parents. In general I was very impressed with Newport, CA all around. Driving through Newport's main street will command a lot of attention in the way of cars. It’s a high class area with a lot of money behind it.  The resort is very well put together and has a great feel to it. The grounds are very well kept and it seems like a lot of thought went behind the design and landscape.  We had a two bedroom villa situated closest to the ocean but without much of a view. The room's are of great size and feel just like a two bedroom apartment. All the furniture is well placed with the couches and chairs being really comfortable. Unlike a lot of hotels Marriott has included 3 40-42 inch LCD LG's with plenty of HD channels.

This was a fast, 48 hour wedding anniversary trip. We checked in Friday afternoon and left Sunday morning. The villa was spectacular! A full kitchen allowed us to bring back the one meal we went out for Friday night. We had it for dinner Saturday night. The resort offers plenty to do around the pool as well as other nice amenities. The staff was very helpful.

We have stayed at several MVCs and Newport Coast before.  This time didn't live up to our expectations.  First, the check in was a hassle - had to wait past 4pm with many other delayed guests.  Room was nice but in need of some repairs - broken light, damaged dresser drawer, etc. Second, they no longer provide conditioner or body lotion. Third, someone knocked on door at 9pm saying he was just checking to see if unit was open.  My wife called security and expained the issue, but got no timely followup or reply. I feel the place has gotten too big, and the staff has difficulty supporting the quantity of guests. The location is great, the facility is  good, and the ocean is waiting, but I think we will wait awhile before we return.

Wow! The rooms are clean, comfortable and roomy. The grounds are spotless! Staff are amazing and made several requests happen with a smile. A great place to stay. Don't believe any negative reviews! This place is amazing and within walking distance to a great beach! Love, love, loved it!!!!!

If you've stayed in Marriott villas before, you know what to expect. Big villas -- we had two bedrooms, two baths -- beautiful grounds, lots of amenities.  The Newport Coast Villas are on the hills overlooking the Pacific Ocean. Beware -- not all rooms have a view so be sure to ask for one that does.  Even so, the beaches were a short drive away. We saw a whale practically on the shore the day we walked the beach (too cold to swim).  The villa complex was very nice. The pool complex was heated (not nearly enough though) with two big pools overlooking the ocean. The grounds also had a huge firepit to gather aorund, perfect for our chilly April evening. And there was a basketball court with regular and lowered hoops for kids (and dads) to play on.  We did take the timeshare tour

Stayed here 4 nights with family and had an good stay.  The place looked more like an apartment complex than hotel.  I was within walking distance to the beach and golf club.  Check-in was fast and the front desk lady was extremely nice and professional.    The size of the villa was huge.  We had 4 adults with us and the large size made it comfortable for everyone.
