There was a separate living roome, full kitchen, dining area and 2 bedrooms.  There were 3 LCD TVs and counting the sofa beds, there were 4 beds available.  Each of us had our own beds.  The decor was nice and upscaled with granite countertops, tile flooring, full tile shower, and a garden tub.  There were 2 balconies and our villa had an ocean view.  But the biggest negative was there were ANTS present!  I saw ants

we rented a two bedroom apartment for a bachelorette get together and were treated like royalty, from the moment we checked in until we left...we even got a great view of the ocean! during check in, we actually checked in outside with an amazing view of a fountain. the girl at check in was adorable, forgot her name, but she said she was new. there were five of us girls and none of us were treated any different, we were given a higher floor, with a view that you dream of, the ocean, a golf course and the sunset. dennis the bellman, very cute all women should ask for him! he was patient with and always ready to help us, he waved everytime he saw us. super cute blond, smiling and joking with us made checking in a lot of fun! joel at the bar is a total heart throb! cant wait to rent

Summary Heading: Nice spot, but they let a noisy party carry on for 5 hours despite 3 calls.
Summary: First off, this is a beautiful resort - the roooms are fantastic, and we were able to call ahead and ensure we had an ocean view room.  Problems are few, but very annoying.  When we checked in we were given a parking pass.  The resort is signed heavily stating that parking is restricted to those with passes, however this is not enforced in any way.  Most days we had to park illegally to unload our children who had fallen asleep in the car, then move the car to another location where parking was available, despite the fact that several cars were not displaying the appropriate pass.  While this was annoying, it was more of an inconvenience.  What became a problem was a friday night party held in the room next to ours.  The layout of the rooms places the headboard in the master

Loved this resort.  As with all Marriott locations, customer service is fantastic and the rooms are beautiful.  Newport Coast Villas are in a great location.  The place was very clean and was equipped with everything we needed.  They were nice enough to change our room for us during our stay as we had some kids running back and forth in the room above us.  They were quick to make things happen.  Thank you to Noah and Bunny for getting that done for us.  I appreciate the fact that like other Marriott resorts they only ask you once if you want to do a time share presentation.  We have stayed at other resorts (not Marriott owned) and have been bothered throughout our trip.    PROS Staff clean rooms location free shuttle (we had a rental car but just knowing it was there was nice)

We recently stayed at this property. We were blown away at the service levels. Every interaction was pleasant. Already well priced + they do not nickel and dime you: free wifi, reasonable menu etc. I have stayed at 5* resorts that do not put this attention to detail into their service. Will definitely be back.

We have just returned from a week at Newport Coast villas and can't wait to go back. The resort is sensational with plenty activities for adults and childrens. The staff were very helpful, especially at the Triton's Cove (kids area). Our apartment was spectacular, very spacious, well appointed and with gorgeous views over the ocean. The sunsets each nigh were spectacular (see photos). The location is great with lots to do locally and only 30 minutes to Anaheim, 40 mins to Legoland. We had to drag ourselves away from the place and look forward to returning.

Summary Heading: Great Orange County location and nice property
Summary: We stayed for a week In July. It was wonderful. We had an oceanview room across from the main pool area. All units are 2 bedroom/2 bath since this is a timeshare property/hotel.  There is a full kitchen, which is nice.  There are 3 pools. The main pool is enormous with small adjacent pools for kids only and adults only. This hotel is popular with families and there were lots of kids.  The hotel is built on hilly land and the pacific coast views are breathtaking.  The rooms were well-appointed. . The property is across the street from the beach but it's not really walking distance. There are 2 or 3 restaurants on the property. There are charcoal grills and patio furniture for outdoor grilling. There is a nice play area for kids, a child center where you can borrow movies and plan

We have stayed here one other time, 3-4 yrs ago when it was newly built, and were extremely happy with the accommodations.  This trip, we were very disappointed in the resort.  It seems the Marriott does not keep the units in very good shape as they age.  The thermostat in our unit was horrible! Set it at 73-74 and freeze you out! Set it at 75 and burn you out! Should have been able to set at 70 and been comfortable. Dishwasher shelf broken, table lamp broken, light bulbs broken or burned out in both bathrooms, washer/dryer...dryer did not work and had pieces rattling around, corrosion around kitchen faucet to the point it barely worked, mattresses were not regular Marriott quality/comfort, missing TV remote in one room.....basically, we were expecting 5 star quality and it was

Summary Heading: Enjoy Tuscany right in southern Cali
Summary: Stayed here with family during long weekend, Fri-Mon. Excellence like none other. Rooms were expertly-cleaned, kitchen was fantastic, location is primo! All our requests were honored in lightning time.  Has all the amenities you could ask for and the sunsets are magnificent.  Definitely need 5th floor villa facing the ocean. We will certainly be coming back here time and again...

We had a wonderful stay at the villas over Christmas this year.  The local's were complaining about the "bitter cold" (50 degrees).  We were quite pleased with the weather 50 degrees is warm compaired to our "bitter cold" in Kansas City which typically means below zero. The villas were nicely appointed everything you need to have a relaxed comfortable stay.  We enjoyed the hot tub, the game area, the gym, and oh the views we were spectacular!!  The sunsets over Catalina were awe inspiring!  If you have a chance eat at the  Beach Cafe at Crystal Cove, try a Bloody Mary yummy!! (the food is great also)

Summary Heading: It was very large and perfect for our family at Christmas.
Summary: Request a top floor and preferably facing the ocean.  It is quite spectacular.

I just returned last week from staying at the Newport Coast Villas - for the second time now.  And we will return again!!  What a great location- overlooking Crystal Cove.  The Villas are spacious - two bedrooms, two bathrooms, with a full kitchen.  Perfect for a family, and in my case - 3 friends.  The sofa in the living room makes up into a fairly comfortable bed.  It's quiet, spotlessly clean, and very comfortable.    We love having the extra space to stretch out in.  As always with Marriott, the staff is very helpful and friendly.

Very good value.  It is a large property, but well laid out.  I prefer accommodation where I am able to walk around, instead of having to get in the car and drive to get a coffee or milk, and I was able to do so here, it was nice to walk around the resort.  I was able to easily walk with my son to the playground.  We stayed near the pool with the kids pool, which was quieter, and better suited to our young child.  The unit was very comfortable for our family.  It was a bit dark inside the unit, but we don't tend to spend much time indoors on vacation during the day.  The kitchen was well stocked with utensils, we were able to prepare meals easily.  It was have been handy to have a restaurant on the resort, but there was a grocery store and take out places a short drive away,

We've just returned from the Newport Coast Villas and had a wonderful time.  Our condo was in the 4700 building on the top floor.  The view of the canyon was very nice, and we had a partial ocean view as well.  We had purchased a getaway week through Interval World and were very pleased.  Everything was well-organized, the front desk staff were efficient and pleasant.    We were traveling with our adult son and visiting a second son who lives in the LA area, who stayed with us a few days as well.  We settled in as if we were at home.  The kitchen was very well equipped.  Our two-bedroom, two-bath condo was nicely decorated, the furniture was comfortable and the beds were nice as well.  And the Marketplace in the main lobby area was well stocked, with fresh food items available,

Summary Heading: Platinum Marriot members can do better!
Summary: I'm a Platinum elite member with Marriott and used points for a 6 night stay.   It was nearly 300,000pts, but I felt it was worth it for several reasons.  One was all the amazing reviews on this site regarding the views from the two balconies.   Going with my wife and 3yr old daughter I felt it was worth the extra points to get two bedrooms, a kitchen and the fore mentioned views.     It turns out that vacation club properties do not take your Marriott status into account (only if you are an 'owner' or not).    We got a bottom unit with one patio that had a view of a fence.  The sound proofing is bad.  The people walking above us sounded like stomping and the snooring from next door kept us up.  The maid never showed up before 4PM and the first day put our trash bags outside our

This is a lovely and very upscale accommodation so it was a shock to realize that soundproofing was nearly non-existent as we were disturbed by every sound made by the guests in the unit above us from midnight till 2am. There is also a serious disconnect between the physical quality of the villa (very high) and the quality of service (low). For  example, we were out of the unit from 10am till 4pm. When we returned after a day at the beach to shower before dinner, the rooms were not made up. At 4:15 a housekeeper arrived at the door, asking if we wanted her to clean. We declined and called the front desk to ask if we could get housekeeping services later, after we finished showering. We were told that we should have let them know in advance that we wanted our rooms made up

Summary Heading: Beautiful property but lousy rental rooms
Summary: We are Marriott reward members and were contacted about visiting this property on a preview package.  We decided to go for 3 nights.  We were given a handicapped room with no view in one of the older buildings.  The villa had maintenance issues but the bed was comfortable.  Although the resort did not seem that crowded, the front desk told us that was all that was available.  Hard to believe.  We met a nice couple that were owners that traded their lockoff unit in Maui and were given a NEW ocean view villa.  You would think since they were trying to sell us a timeshare, they would've put us in a nice unit.  WRONG.  When we went to the sales presentation, we were told, yes, we were in one of the older units that is scheduled to be remodeled.  Oh, well.  Now about the

We had a great time at our stay at the Marriott Newport Villas.  We traveled with our 3 children ages 2, 12, and 14.  The resort was beautiful with gorgeous views of the Pacific!  We requested an ocean view and our unit did have a nice view.  It seemed to be an older unit, but still very nice.  It was close to the pool and recreation park.  My older sons enjoyed the basketball court and putting green.  The location was great because it was between LA and San Diego.  It was also close to Disneyland.  There was a lot to do in the area.  We went to Crystal Cove Beach with was about a mile walk (or you can take the hotel shuttle). The only negative was that the resort was not right on the beach.  Still, a great place to stay!

Summary Heading: Gorgeous Southern California Winter Vacation Spot!
Summary: We headed to the Newport Coast Villas after a fun filled day at Disneyland.  The Villas is about a 15-20 minute drive from Disneyland, yes, we could have stayed at a place in Anaheim, but there isn't a hotel in Anaheim with a view like the Villas!  Watching the sun set over the Pacific was breath taking and so worth the money!  Our room had 2 bedrooms, dining, living room, fully stocked kitchen and balcony with seating for 4. The sofas in the living room and in one bedroom converted to sleeper sofa. The Master Bedroom had a King size bed.  The rooms were very clean and nicely decorated.  We had a party of 14 and were able to get 2 rooms next to each other, very convenient since the kids loved going back and forth from room to room. This place was very quiet and peaceful! We only

Lovely property and setting, with gorgeous ocean views and fountains.  Only dislike was that they ordered everyone (quiet adults) out of the pool/hot tub at 11 pm sharp.  That's a bit disappointing at the rates they charge for rooms.

It has been our fourth time in this resort and we just love it. The appartments are spacious and well equipped for a family of 3 and more. The location close to the beach and a few minutes away from the center of Newport is perfect. The resort is equipped with ok gyms and various pools which are average. We have done great trips from there to LA, San Diego and Palm Springs etc. Its a great area for running and biking and Newport is even a great location for shopping.

Villas - Located around rolling hills of southern California. All villas face the ocean...upper units have ocean views in most. All two bedroom fully furnished villas with balcony/lanai. Has everything you need for eating in with outdoor gas grills available.  Staff - Very friendly and accommodating  Amenities - three separate pool areas and two workout facilities. La Vista bar at main pool serves adequate food for lunch/snacks. Wide variety of beverages available. Main pool  are has three pools and two spas. One pool & spa designated as quiet area for adults only.  Location - Perfectly located near many destinations & attractions. Definitely take in Balboa Island, Laguna Beach & Huntington Beach. Watch surfers from the peir at Huntington Beach or watch competitive beach

Summary Heading: Another great experience in So. California
Summary: This was our 3rd time at this hotel.  It doesn't really seem like a hotel, more of a resort/apartment.  It is a very nice facility with things to do for kids such as a nice central pool, games, activities daily and a game room.  There is also a pool side restaurant/bar and spa services.  We had a view of the ocean (need to be on the 2nd or 3rd floor) and it is in a non-populous area, so not too much noise or traffic.  The beachs and shopping are not too far either.  The only thing I would say is a negative is that if you get a room on the upper part of the resort and want to go to the main building you will have a bit of a hike to get back, it's on a steep hill.

We traded our timeshare through Interval International to stay here last year. It's only about 20 minutes from Disneyland and just down the road from the beach. The resort offers activities for the kids, but most of these come at an extra price. The pools are NOT heated after October, so beware. It was a bit cold to swim.  Our room was perfect for our family of five with plenty of beds for each kid to have their own. The kitchen was stocked with pots and pans so we could cook some of our meals which saved a lot of money! The hotel was clean and the kids loved the deep bath tub! The resort is beautiful and the area is very nice. The room service was great. We asked for extra soft blankets for the kids and they brought them right up to our room.  One thing we didn't understand is

Summary Heading: This was a trip to remember!
Summary: The Marriott Newport Coast Villas are very beautiful, spacious and clean.  Our Villa had all the conveniences of home.  The view from our villa was magnificent and we enjoyed the sunset each night from our patio! The resort was very large so they provided shuttle service within the resort but we opted to walk for the exercise.  The staff at the Marriott was so friendly and helpful planning our daily activities.  We will definitely return to this resort!

Summary Heading: Great Place - something for the entire family
Summary: From the time we arrived to the time we left the service was absolutely the best.  Anything we needed - no matter what tme.  The room was amazing , clean with a fantastic master bath. We found everything to do right on the location - games, crafts, swimming - we never had to leave and everyone was happy. We loved it so much we are planning to return again soon.

Summary Heading: The week went by too quickly
Summary: We stayed in a corner villa with a beautiful view of the ocean & golf course from the balcony.  Scheduled activities at the resort & neighboring attractions kept us busy.  Be prepared for the steep stairs to get to the main pool.  If you are willing to wait, a golf cart can transport you around the resort.

Summary Heading: Beautiful spot for that California feeling
Summary: The purpose of our stay was a wedding but the location was beautiful and  the weather was great . We ran on trails down by the beach, went on a boat trip around Balboa Island looking at stars homes, and saw many great places to shop if time wasn't an issue. The rooms were spacious and clean and quiet.  There was a restaurant outside near the pool, but I wish there had been more eating options on the  property. I'd love to go back...

We traded off our Hyatt Tahoe timeshare this year to stay a week at Marriott Newport Coast Villas. Our condo was on 4th floor 3500 bldg w/fabulous views of pacific.   The living space was well laid out, decorated very nicely and extremely comfortable.  Parking was a little skimpy riight in front but good lot next to the building with elevator.  We were a little concerned due to a few posts indicating the place might be under construction but this was not the case; there are some buildings being constructed but these are out of the way now at the south end.  No real sales pressure to buy in but we learned Mariott not participating in Interval swaps any more.  Great pool area, lots of recreation on site for kids, plus right by beach and convenient to Laguna, Newport, etc.  We had

Summary Heading: Fabulous location, great for families, and gorgeous views
Summary: We have stayed at this Marriott twice now, both times for one week in August.  After the first time we became timeshare owners. We love the location.  It is next to the ocean with a variety of kid-friend beaches (Laguna Beach, Crystal Cove beach, Corona and Little Corona) within a 5 minute drive.  There is whale watching nearby, kayaking, and biking along the shore, Balboa Island and many other nearby attractions.  Farther away but still within a day's trip are Legoland and Disney.  The property itself is perfect.  The rooms have two bedrooms and baths with all the usual appliances etc that you find in a Marriott Villa timeshare. We have always stayed in the older buildings but are perfectly satisfied with the quality of the furnishings.  There are barbecue pits nearby and many

We stayed this past July  at Marriot Newport Coast Villa and loved it.  It felt like being in our own house.  We were two family 4 adults and 4 children and the place never felt crowded.  I loved the fact the we did not get any cleaning services unless you requested it ( which cost extra)  It was nice not to have someone coming in and out of our place.  Since we had a washer and dryer in the unit we would wash our towels if we needed it.  They also have outside of unit behind closed doors a big trash dumpter  for you to put your trash.    The kitchen has everyting you need to cook and serve, including real wine glasses.  The place had  all the linnens and bankets and table servings  you need to accomodate 8 people.  The beds were very confortable.  No one in our group complaing
The Newport Coast Villas is by far the best hotel in Newport Beach.  The rooms are huge, everything is clean, the pool overlooks the ocean, and the service is top notch.

We have stayed at this hotel for the past 4 years and my children love it, the atmosphere is great and plenty for them to do. It is also only half an hour from Disneyland and across the street from the beach!

Summary Heading: Beautiful...I would recommend it to anyone!
Summary: Amazing hotel, for a romantic getaway or for the whole family. Big and comfortable villas, great service..definitely a must! Very very clean and very well maintained. The social areas (pools, lobby, cafeteria) are really pretty. Very well located, near the beach, close to Fashion Island, cinemas, supermarket...and more. Amazing view!!!

Summary Heading: Very comfortable and fun for our family!
Summary: We had a fabulous time at this resort. The villas a quite large and fit our family of 4 perfectly. We bought all of our groceries from Trader Joe's a couple of blocks away and made our food in our villa. Lots to do (beaches, pools, activities for the whole family). Checked out a beach parking pass and went to Crystal Cove to explore. Drove about 10 minutes to Laguna beach, which was less rugged than Crystal Cove. The resort is about 25 mins from Disneyland. The property felt more like a vacation resort than a hotel. Excellent!

Stayed with wife and two year old.  The villas are awesome for a family.  The rates are comparable to paying for two hotel rooms, except that you get all the amenities of an apartment - two bedrooms, full kitchen, patio, dining table for six, living room, and washer/dryer.  The master bath has a huge tub, very big shower with dual heads, and two sinks.   These villas make breakfast and nap time for little ones very comfortable.   You can definitely save a lot of money on food alone with the full apartment style.  For families with older children, there is enough room to sleep eight or nine comfortably with all the pull-out couches.  There were lots of activities going on during our stay, but unfortunately, most are for kids 4+ and adults only.  Maybe next time we will be able to

We stayed here as a party of 5 people. The villas are very nice, spacious and clean. First I was overwhelmed by the size of the resort, but after 1 day you find your way around easily. Everything is very well organized, e.g. renting umbrellas and chairs for the beach is no problem at all. The whole resort is very well maintained, pools and public area are beautiful. Newport Beach is just a short drive with plenty of shops and restaurants. The Crystal Cove beach is also just a 2 minute drive. This is not your classic hotel, there is no restaurant or bar, but therefore it is a very good value and a comfortable way to travel with family. I would definately return!

Just returned from a one week stay at the end of August with 2 adults and 2 children 7 and 8 and we had a wonderful stay.  We booked a 2 bedroom/2 bath unit from a private timeshare owner and got a great rate on a one week's stay.  Units are amazing and we had a glorious view of the ocean from our 4 th floor unit.  Very clean, very spacious and very nice.....lovely kitchen with granite counters and lovely washrooms.  Very nice to have your own laundry facility and it came in very handy with 2 small kids.  Great location to explore Disney (30 minutes), beaches and Santa Monica/LA (1 hour drive).  In fact we wished we had spent more time in the Newport Beach area as it is gorgeous.  I was worried that my kids might get bored as there weren't any kids pool amenities like a splash

Summary Heading: Great Amenities, Fun for the Kids!
Summary: I stayed at the Marriot Newport Villas with extended family for a week, and went to DL a couple days. We had a two 7 year olds, a 9 year old, a 4 year old, and a 2 year old. All of them had a blast!  The rooms were impeccably clean, and the rooms were very tastefully decorated. We were a party of 9, and between a crib for the 2 year old, the futon, the two beds, and a hotel proided cot, we all slept comfortably! the kids enjoyed the pool, giant chess set, and kids play area with games crafts, and free popcorn. We also rented videos, games, and books many nights from the hotel's large collection. All in all, the staff was very pleasant, even after one of us left a belonging in the room after we had checked out. The staff retrieved the item with no trouble. Nice pool, nice rooms,

Three of us went down to Newport for a 4 day, 3 night look see for buying into a timeshare. This Marriott is right across the road from a state beach, and not far from shops and restaurants. The front desk greeted us warmly, and managed to move our unit near our friends, thankfully. This place is huge and there were a lot of people staying there the last week of July. As others said, it is a very nice 2 bd.2 bath, full kitchen, furnished comfortably. We had to attend a 90 minute, informative, absolutely no pressure meeting with a nice salesperson, Pat Farber, if you get the chance to go. We said no, and that was the end of it.   Oh, remember to put the parking tag in your car, as we forgot one night, and found a green sticker on the driver's window. However, all you have to do

Summary Heading: Pretty views, Pretty villas, Very large resort
Summary: I want to say this resort was beautiful and clean. The Marriott vacation clubs always have top notch quality and service. We had a nice time and I will give you the straight up pros and cons of the resort. Villas: Beautiful, clean and spacious. We had a pretty view from our patio. The villa had everything we could need. Some people compained about hearing the neighbors from above. We did hear kids running around upstairs for a couple nights, but we just put some music on to drown out the noise.  I not a complainer, but if this bothers you, then ask for a top floor. Grounds: Beautifully manicures with gorgeous views. There are lots of hills and I went on some great runs around the complex for a couple mornings.  My husband and kids did not use the shuttle, however my parents had

Summary Heading: 2 families in one room, no problem
Summary: We stayed here on the first night of our 4 week west coast holiday. We met up our friends from San francisco and both families stayed in a 2 bedroom unit. We arrived early after our long flight from Australia and they were happy to put us in well ahead of the normal check in time. The room was clean and spacious and well equipped. The 8 of us had a great time, drinks at the pool bar, BBQ dinner in our room then ping pong by the pool, basketball and s'mores at the firepit. I'd have liked to stay at least 3-4 days longer but we had a cruise to board the next day. Great place.

Summary Heading: Great location, terrible staff and service
Summary: My husband and I recently stayed at the Marriott Newport Coast property.  We traded one of our other Marriott properties for the Newport Beach property.  Overall, the villa was very nice, large rooms, well cared for, and extremely clean.  The TVs in the units are old, not flat screens, do not have HD and need to be replaced.  Location of Newport Beach villas is great with access to Laguna Beach, Huntington Beach and other local attractions.  However, the staff at the Marriott was not accomodating and did little to help with any of our problems.  We were given a villa on the first floor of building 2300, what a mistake, do not acccept any first floor units.  The walls and ceilings are paper thin and we constantly heard pounding, jumping and stomping from the villa above us.  We

I read the reviews before we selected this property and it did not disappoint us.  The grounds were spectacular and even though the resort was full with the July 4th long weekend, we never felt like it was congested because everything was so spread out.  The fitness center was well equipped (new equipment) and it  was a nice touch to have pitchers of ice water in the change rooms along with iced face cloths.  The service was excellent.  Our non-stick frying pan was scratched (I cooked eggs every morning for breakfast) so I called down and within ten minutes, I had a new pan delivered to my door (they even had a grocery service if you didn't have a car and you needed groceries).  Another day we needed more towels after visits to the pool.  Even though they said that it may take

Amazing property, spectacular villas with so much space, 2 bedrooms, 2 baths full kitchen for each villa. Beautifully landscaped, several pools to choose from. Take a yoga class, you will be on a bluff overlooking the pacific ocean. This resort is not on the beach, you will have to drive or take the shuttle to get to the beach. No restaurant on site. Quick drive to many restaurants/ mall/shops.

Summary Heading: Overall OK Service Could Be Better Crowded
Summary: Stayed in June with my 13 and 10 year old.  Showed up at 2:00pm room was not ready.  Asked to come back at 4, but told which building we would be in.  Showed up at 4 they changed the building, never called although they had my cell number.  I was given a room facing a canyon at the far edge of the resort.  When I asked the lady at reception if it would be a long walk she responded that it was where she parked and it was OK for her.... "not very professional but OK.  The room was clean and updated.  The accommodations were good for a family.  The main pool was very crowded.  The staff seemed overwhelmed at times.  Good for the money, but do not expect too much.  I think that you need to be a member of Marriott vacation club to get a good room.  OK if you are going to use it as a

Stayed at Marriott's Newport Coast Villas for a week in June 2010. Arrived at 2:30 and registered at the front desk where a woman provided me with parking passes, a map and told me that the room should be ready within half hour. 3:30 comes around and we have not heard from the desk. My hubby, 3 year old daughter, 10 month old son and myself during that time had grabbed something to eat and was waiting on the veranda right outside the lobby. We came from a gruelling 6 hour plane ride and a 1.5 hour car trip from LA. I asked the front desk about the readiness of the room and was told that the room is still being cleaned and will be ready in half hour. They were supposed to call me on my cell once room is ready. 4:30 rolls around and we see folks who came right after we registered

Hotel is in a great location for summer stays.  Our villa, advertised to accomodate 8, was  uncomfortable for our group of 7.   I think if  part of our 7 were children it would have been manageable.  The 3 bedroom villa would be better suited for parties over 6.  The food served at the poolside restaurant was dissappointing both in service and meal for the price.

I'm from Orange County, California where this resort is located, and sometimes the beauty of OC can distract from even the negative aspects of a resort. So I thought my review would provide an unbiased look at the good and bad of the resort. My husband and I came to this resort for a relaxing getaway close to home since I'm pregnant.  While this is an all villas resort, they are NOT freestanding villas--so you have people above and below you. Walls are paper thin so we hear everything from our upstairs neighbors--we asked for the highest floor but timeshare owners will ALWAYS be given preference.  The villas are VERY BIG--TWO BEDROOMS, TWO BATHROOMS, a HUGE living room, laundry room, and a fully stocked kitchen with every amenity you can imagine (you can see why the resort is so

Summary Heading: Nice place - shame about the weather
Summary: We are MVCI owners (6 properties). We bought our Platinum week in Newport  Coast in 2009, while in Arizona and dropped by to see it in July 2009 on our way back to LAX. So this was our first actual vacation stay there.  The property sits on a hillside overlooking part of Pelican Hill golf course and with CA Route 1 between it and the sea. It is built in an Italianate style with the apartment blocks "scattered" over the hill-side.  In summary the property is just fine. Our 2-bed unit had a nice ocean view. The only 3 (minor) complaints are: 1. There seemed to be little excess parking space and each night, on return from dinner, we had to park between 50 and 200 yards from our block as all the spaces were taken up. 2. The free Wireless Internet service was the most unreliable I

We stayed over Memorial Day weekend, the hotel was very busy. We had a beautiful view of the Pacific Ocean, very close drive to the beach, and Disneyland. We flew into John Wayne airport, 15 minutes away. The two bedroom and two bath condo was wonderful with 4 adults and an 11 month old infant. We loved the gym, very impressive. everything you would want and a beautiful view. The main pool is amazing. There are so many activities for families, something for everyone. Many other reviews expressed concern with noise; I was impressed that with the resort being so full on a holiday weekend and tons of children, we heard no noise.  Parking was allowed for only one car and was enforced. The resort is built on a steep hillside, it was quite a hike to the main pool and lobby area, be

Summary Heading: perfect place for multi-generation family vacation
Summary: The villas are lovely, well arranged, spacious and outfitted with attention to the things traveling families need, like unbreakable drinking cups for children, pizza cutters and wine glasses and openers  for grown ups.  The grounds and pools are stunningly beautiful and great for all kinds of recreation and all ages.  Staff were unfailingly helpful.   This is one of the few occasions when I've felt a property was even better than it looked and sounded on its own web site.

Summary Heading: One of the nicest resorts in America
Summary: We have stayed at many resorts in Mexico and the Carribean,that were advertised as 5 stars and did not shoot the ball out of the park the way this complex did.Jaw dropping views from our balcony of the canyon and the Pacific! Incredibly spacious suite with every possible amenity you could ask for.Impeccably clean and modern room.The grounds were impressive with lush landscaping and views of the ocean everywhere as the resort is situated on a cliff side facing west. Proximity of the Crystal Cove State Park a real bonus, with it's pristine undeveloped beach and interesting rocks off the shore.Beachcomber Restaurant right on the beach serves very tasty simple food.We would return in a heartbeat!

Summary Heading: Inconsistent but not a complete disaster....
Summary: Am currently staying with my two young daughters (both under 7) at Marriott's Newport Coast Villas.  When given a choice, I tend to stay at Marriott brand properties as I find that they typically do a good job.  This is, however, my first stab at one of their "Vacation" properties--i.e. TIMESHARES.  I got my reservation on the Marriott Webpage and was very pleased with the midweek rate we got for the two bedroom unit.  The Good First, let me say that the location of this property is absolutely outstanding.  From my balcony (actually, EITHER of my balconies!!), I can see the Pacific Ocean in all its glory.  Wow, wow, wow.  We are a few minutes drive to wonderful shopping and great restaurants.  Freeway access is easy.  The beach is a long walk but a very, very short drive.

we just came back from 7 night from here - and this is our 3rd time we stay here, i think it is great place for S.CA attraction such as Disney(20 min) san diego(bit over hour) and of cause balboa island and laguna next door  place is always clean - never been disapointed of cleaness however the smaller pool one in very bottom side (gratto) had green stuff all over around hot tub - i think they didn't clean as much as main pool this is all 2 beds room property so we had very roomy stay and last time we went down with my mom was comfortable usually service in this hotel is very minimun but this time was nice...i guess doesn't take much only one person who's nice will make hotel look bette  anyway we love this place and when we go back we will surely stay here more information

Summary Heading: Gorgeous property; lacks some basic amenities
Summary: This property is luxurious and generally very clean and well-maintained.  The grounds are absolutely HUMONGOUS, with jetliner views nearly everywhere you go.    We had a handicapped unit, but I seriously wouldn't recommend this property for anybody with mobility issues; it is simply too big to navigate comfortably and there are steep stairs throughout the grounds.  There are four or five pools onsite (though we only used the centrally-located ones; experienced owners cautioned us that the outlying ones were cold and windy and not worth visiting).  However, I seriously question the claim that the pools are heated...on a sunny day in May, they just weren't warm enough to stay in for very long at all.  There are lots of chaise lounge chairs and tables, though on the busiest day

Having read good reviews, I was looking forward to staying here.  Was not disappointed.  Amazing view to go along with well-appointed accomodations.  Was able to rent chairs and an umbrella for the beach....whatever you need they seem to have it.  Normally being the amusement park go, go go type, resorts such as this make it easier to slow down and relax for a while.

Summary Heading: My new favorite place on the west coast to enjoy the ocean, the sun, and the food
Summary: What a beautiful playground for the rich and famous at a modest price.  The customer service at the Marriott was above and beyond.  Every employee, regardless of their title, was willing and able to answer questions and offer help to make our stay exceptional.  Our room had a full ocean view  (Ask for a high floor) and every aminitey you need.  If you needed a new light bulb they were there in 10 minutes etc.!!!   The workout room was bigger than most Marriots.  The grounds were spotless and constantly being cleaned. The pools were  clean and not crowded.    We were 15 minutes from John Wayne Airport and just minutes to every fabulous restaurant.  Our weather was only 68-70 degrees, but that is May.  This is definitely our new favorite place to unwind!!!!!  PS...great golfing

My wife and I stayed at the Newport Coast Villas for 7 nights in the first of May. I personally did not check-in, though my father who did reported no problems and quick service. The grounds were great, very nicely manicured, and offering some great views of the ocean from different locations, especially next to the front lobby. The pools were all very nice. We were in building 11XX, which had a very nice pool outside of it, that was never very busy. It was pretty cool in May, highs in the very low 70's, but there were still swimmers as the pools are heated.  The rooms are nice and have everything you would expect from a Marriott timeshare property. Full kitchen, very nice master suites with soaking tub and separate shower. Nice living area with flat screen t.v.'s. The second

We just returned from a great 2-night getaway @ the Marriott Newport Coast Villas.  We've stayed in the Marriott villas in South Lake Tahoe before and absolutely loved them!  We read some of the reviews about the Newport Coast Villas and found it hard to believe some of the comments. We had a wonderful weekend to say the least.  Our unit was located in the 3800 building, #3841, we had a beautiful view of the ocean.  The rooms were clean, the beds were so cozy, definitely the Marriott standard of bedding. The staff was very helpful and very friendly.  It was my husband and I, with our two grown kids (27 & 31).  We drove to Huntington Beach, had lunch at Dukes, walked up and down the streets, had some delicious Italian gelato @ Mangiamos.  Also stopped at th Huntington Beach

We had a wonderful stay at the beautiful Newport Coast Villas.  We are Marriott Vacation Club members and had requested a unit on the top floor but were given one on the third floor in Building 2800, which did have a wonderful view.  The beds were comfy, even the fold-out couches, and the setup (for 7 of us including two small children) worked well.  DH was a little disappointed our unit still had tube TVs instead of flat screens.  As “owners” we did not opt to pay for daily maid service, so as instructed, we set our bags of garbage outside the front door for daily pickup between 8 and 10 AM.  The problem was that the local crows have noticed this system and immediately rip into the plastic bags.  It happened every morning, so I imagine the resort will work on some alternate

The rooms were very nicely appointed - 2 bedroom/2  bath.  Our room had a broken shower head and the phones did not work.  Not really a big deal, but I didn't really expect to find broken items in a room at this price point.  We did get a lot of noise from the unit above us - they kept their music playing 24 hours, and we could hear it all, so the walls are fairly thin.  We did have a bit of a misunderstanding with the front desk staff over the definition of "view".  We were told the room had "a view overlooking the golf course", and what the room actually had was a view of asphalt, a fence, and a hedge.  The "grotto" pool was wonderful - not too crowded, very clean and lots of lounge chairs.  Overall, the issues we had were minor, but I do have a higher standard for top of the

great resort, grounds were wonderful,wish they had a restaurant on site.newport coast is an upscale area, great restaurants. try the beachcomber at crystal cove state park its right on the beach. also modo mio on the pch,2 lights south of newport coast drive,have the spinach stuffed ravoli. excellent. visit laguna beach, and dana point. bathrooms lighting is poor,same as in marriott in aruba. hard to put on make up or shave.pools were beautiful with many lounge chairs. pool bar is expensive, bring your wine with you in solo cups. would return as all marriott timeshares are great.

We are staying at one of the new buildings with an ocean view and it is fabulous.   Since we are traveling with no children we are away from the pool area and it is very quiet here.  The vill is 1,125. square feet with 2 bedrooms and 2 baths.  Very new and very well appointed. I got this villa through my time share and boy did I get lucky.  Love....love.....love.  This area is simply beautiful.  Newport Beach is gorgeous and Laguna is a hop skip and a jump.  Stunning ocean views and funky and upscale restaurants and shops.  This is the Hamptons of California.

Summary Heading: Not All That and a Bag of Chips
Summary: The location of the Newport Villas is unparalleled. They are placed high on a hill overlooking the Pacific Ocean. The grounds are lovely with lush landscaping. The facilities are wonderful. There are several pools and the view from the main pool is spectacular.  There is very limited food on site but within a short drive are several shopping centers, grocery stores, and restaurants. Balboa Island is a relatively short drive and worth a visit for its fine dining and wonderful beaches. If you like walking Crystal Cove is an easy walk and there are some great paths in the park. The Crystal Cove Restaurant is a great spot for breakfast. It's right on the beach and you feel like you're sitting right on the shore while you eat really good food. I highly recommend it.  I didn't get a

I've been a member here for 9 years now and i will never ever get bored of this place. every time i come here i fall in love with multiple girls and if your looking for party's and all kinds of fun you would have to go during spring break or anytime during the summer. everyone there is so curtious ive allways got so many chicks numbers and allways made new friends it's the greatest place on earth to be honest with you, there is no other place i'd rather be then newport coast villas.

The hotel staff, accommodations and landscape are of a Disney level experience. The Villas are so well designed and very comfortable, slept better there than at home and I sleep very well at home.   The staff could not have been more helpful and friendly, a very make it happen line d level staff and management.  The location is excellent for Newport and Laguna shopping and dining which they have an abundance of. Our 9 and 11 year old children had a blast with the recreation and swimming pools.  Thank you Marriott Villas for our best Spring Break ever, we can't wait to return!  Studio City

We stayed here over spring break with our 5 and 6 year old.  Newport Beach is an ideal location for the LA area because it's out of the bustle of LA and fairly short drive to most of the attractions that you visit southern California for.  We stayed in a two-bedroom villa.  It was huge, first of all, 1200 sq. ft., with a large living area and kitchen.  It is a very new development so everything is still very nice and shiny, but the decor is a tad old-fashioned.  There are three pool areas, with one large one in the middle that most people visit.  There are tennis courts, fitness centres, you name it. The pools and all else are top notch.  There is also a schedule of non-stop activities for kids and adults.  We used the activities at Triton's Cove and the kids loved it.  A

Our family of five is currently staying at the Marriott in Newport Beach.  I booked our two bedroom villa a few months ago and if we stayed three nights the rate was $189.  The property is huge- a little overwhelming at times and the front desk is not that helpful.  We are in the building across from the main pool on the third floor.  Lots of families with loud children.  The walls are pretty thin so we can hear people upstairs and in the morning getting the elevator.   Newport and Laguna are beautiful, but the only thing to do is go to the beach/shop or stay by the pool.  Currently it is 65 degrees so swimming is not an option.  We started our trip in San Francisco and drove the coast which is beautiful so it is fine that we are not doing much and relaxing, but we would be

Summary Heading: Beauty, convenience, entertainment... all in one
Summary: Stayed here over spring break with several friends. (Adults and chldren).  The grounds were meticulously maintained, the villa was beautifully decorated.  There were ample activites provided on the property for all ages.  We attended the family camp fire on Friday night and made 'smores.  The staff assisting with the campfire were very friendly and helpful.  Our kids enjoyed all the pools, the basketball court, tether ball and putting green.  The property is close to numerous popular beaches, laguna, newport and huntington.  We enoiyed venturing out to the local beaches in a short amount of time.  the housekeeping staff did a great job and were very accomodating.  My ONLY complaint was the constant 'sales' push.  My husband was not traveling with me so we were not able to

We are Marriott timeshare owners and exchanged to this property -- it met all our expectations and then some.  We were able to get our preferences - top floor in one of the new buildings and had a gorgeous view of the ocean.  The staff were very helpful every time we had a question or needed some help.  Such a great location...Lots to do if you choose to do so.  We loved just sitting on the balcony reading and looking at the gorgeous view; however, we did take a side trip to Balboa and rented a little Duffy boat and cruised around -- so much fun -- saw sea lions...

This is the second time I've stayed at the Marriott Newport Coast Villas.  I flew down with a friend for a girls weekend of fun and shopping.  Our villa had a wonderful view of the Pacific Ocean.  For families with children, I would highly recommend as there is tons of things for kids to do and you have plenty of space.  It's less than a 10 minute drive from the Orange County/Santa Ana/John Wayne Airport.  I definitely will stay here again.  Also, make sure you get a Grazie card - discounts for restaurants.  We ate at Tommy Bahamas and it was great!  You won't be disappointed.

This is one of the top Marriott properties in the US. The location is great- close to beachfront activities, seafood dining and shopping. The property is quiet with great views of the ocean. There are plenty of grills located near the buildings and they are spotless! Plenty of on-property activities if you are interested. We will be back soon

Summary Heading: One of the better timeshare properties
Summary: Loved this place.  Perfect location, close to everything for family or adult activities.  Very well kept grounds.  Villas are clean.  Only possible complaint was our villa didn't have a good view - whereas others on property have stunning views of the ocean.  Definitely on the list of places to visit again in the future

Summary Heading: Best Kept Secret On The Coast!!!
Summary: My wife, two children, boys age 15 and 8 stayed for one week Feb 6th-13th.   This is our second time here so we knew what to expect.  We Made sure you ask for a newer unit since they are the ones that have Flat Screens TV's.  The best thing is the location, Newport Coast is a very Classy Upper Class Local and this resort fits right in.  We had a cold weather week but the Pools are heated.  My Kids love Crystal Cove with the Tide Pools.  Just make sure you park in the Los Trancos lot and walk through the tunnel this way you will be by the historic cottages.  We did Disney and Knotts which is about 20 min's away.  You def. will need to drive to places as the resort is huge, but there is a shuttle but we did not use.  The only negative thing to say is that on Saturday we received a

We stayed there for a week, beautiful resort.  Will definitely come back.  I would rank this resort the best Marriott resort in the US. The Fahioned Island Mall near by is also very nice place to shop.  Kids  enjoyed playing tennis, looking out to the ocean from way up high. BBQ Grills every where, beautiful park, beautiful swimming pools in the resort.    Lots of activities for all ages.  Love that place !

This was our third trip to this location so we knew what to expect. A beautiful location and a great place to take day trips from. On our last visit we experianced some difficulty with the check in process but not this time, it went very smooth and we got a room with a great view and top floor as we requested during check in. The facilities were very nice and clean with the only negative that we saw was very minor, the sofa in our unit is getting worn and uncomfortable to sit on for any long period especially for that unexpected nap that might occur. We were looking for the spa for a massage and found out that it is no longer there and you must got to the Hotel in Newport Beach ( 10 minute drive) for those services. We dined at the Bluewater Grill one evening and it was

My familiy of 5 had only had one night to spend so we could not take advantage of all this beautiful hotel had to offer.  Very large two bedroom apartment, comfortable pull out sofa, luxurious amenities, and the grounds are outstanding.  They were doing some construction during the stay, but it was not intrusive.  The view of the ocean from the pool area is particularly nice.  The only thing to advise other travelers about is that it was further away from downtown Newport Beach than I had thought.  Maybe a fifteen minute drive.  It actually is closer to Laguna.  This is definitely a place I would stay in again.

Summary Heading: Nicest place I have ever stayed in.
Summary: I hesitantly write this review because this property is one of the best kept secrets around.  On most resort websites, the accomodations/amenities usually look better in photograph & on the website than in person. I would say it's just the opposite with this website.  We just could not believe how nice this place was.  My only regret was that our trip was too short.  It helped to have perfect weather and wonderful views of the ocean.  I can't wait to go back.  This place is wonderful.

We had a great week at NCV and wish we could have stayed another week. We love to travel in the off season to places that are normally busy because we don't like fighting with crowds so we were very happy that NCV was probably half full during our stay. We got an upstairs end unit (1620) that faced the ocean and golf course. We really liked exploring the Orange County area. We were short drives to Mission San Juan Capistrano, Laguna Beach, all the Costa Mesa shopping malls. We also enjoyed spending two half-days at Crystal Cove Beach. You donate $2 to the hotel for the pass and you get it for all day, thereby saving $13 from the gate price. At low-tide the tide pools were awesome. So many anemonies, mussels, hermit crabs and even a sea slug or two. We spent a day driving up to
Our villa was very cute and contemporary with a wonderful view and a short walk to the state park/beach :)

Summary Heading: Great - quiet, squeaky clean, & a terrific value
Summary: These free-standing units of about 8 condos are quiet.  Ours was recently re-done like new with brand new carpet, granite counters, etc.  For under $200/night, we had a 2 bedroom, 2 batch unit w/ kitchen & living room, plus 2 fold out couches, plus a $25 gift cert. to use on site.  Beautiful pool area.  Location was very handy - site was beautifiul.  Highly recommended.

Summary Heading: Beautiful views and fun for all
Summary: Our room was spacious, extremely clean, and had everything we could need.  Gorgeous views from balcony and many locations on resort.  Activities, pools, and assorted play areas and sport courts conveniently located and supplied with whatever was needed.  Sand lot even had buckets and shovels provided.

Summary Heading: It depends on what you want...
Summary: If you want a self-contained resort that does not require a car this could be your place. This is a large (even by Marriott standards) resort with several pools, shuttle, in/out grocery/snacks, and 1/4 mile walk to the beach. However, restaurants, attractions, shopping, more beach, and ncesssities all require a car. The villas are spacious and the resort is incredibly clean. The walls are very thin so noise is a factor; stay above the first floor. Oddly, the appliances are substandard. Don't expect economy in this high end southern CA area; golf was $$$$. Do go to the Pacific Whey Bakery & Cafe for pastries and Pomodoro for ultra fresh Italian cuisine. This resort is for the outdoor sports minded and families.

Summary Heading: We had a great time, the kids loved it
Summary: Last August, I took my friend's two kids (7 and 9) to Disneyland and was able to book a $199. promo stay at Marriott Newport Coast. I met Rima Solomon at the Marriott kiosk at Newport Beach Fashion Island on a previous trip and book the stay through her ( I have her contact information if you send me a message). The promo included 4 day/3 night stay and a $100. gift card for Fashion Island. You must attend a timeshare presentation.  We arrived at John Wayne/Orange County airport and rented our car right there (typically, Enterprise has the best deal). Do not use the Mapquest directions, as it will take you on the toll road (which is a pain, you have to have change or single bill). The property is close and easy 15 minutes from the airport, take MacArthur, to Pacific Coast Hwy 1

My husband booked the hotel online for one night. As soon as we checked in I asked him to phone reception to extend our stay. After  a few weeks of travel it  was so nice to find this haven. Rooms are spacious and very comfortable. Loved the double shower! My only gripe is the noise factor- it sounded like a herd of elephants were staying upstairs. We were on the ground floor (no view). I'd request a  top floor room next time and be happy to pay extra. All in all a wonderful end to our trip. The most helpful and friendly staff I have ever come across.

The only thing that would make this hotel any better is if it were right on the beach!  This place is pure relaxation.  The grounds are gorgeous, the views are fantastic, and the rooms are PERFECT for a family needing a little more room than your average suite-hotel.  There is no on-site restaurant, so be sure to go up to the market (Pavilion's) and stock up on food/drinks.  The on-site market in the lobby is a bit pricey, as is the poolside grill.  The kitchen in the room is fully stocked with every pan/utensil you would need to prepare a meal.  I do wish there had been a restaurant on-site; I didn't go on vacation to cook & clean!!!  The pools are immaculate and gorgeous, and there are many to choose from.  Be sure to check out Crystal Cove State Park, just down the road (take

We booked this through Interval International and it was 5 star through and through. Rooms were huge, grounds were very impressive, pools are to die for. The only down side was that it was at least an hours drive to LA, 40 minutes to Disneyland

We recently rented a timeshare at the Marriott Newport Coast Villas (through http://www.redweek.com).  It's on the coast near the towns of Newport Beach and Laguna Beach and is built on a cliff with absolutely spectacular views of the Pacific Ocean.  This resort is within an easy drive of so many fabulous beaches, starting in San Diego all the way up to Hermosa Beach and Redondo Beach.  We actually "beach hopped" and tried many of them out!  I felt like I'd become quite an expert on luxuriating in surf and sand!  The Marriott Villas resort itself offered so much to do that a couple of days we just stayed there - from swimming pools and hot tubs to a spa, a sauna, and tennis.  We even used our timeshare kitchen a lot with access to the resort's BBQ grilling area.  This has to be

Summary Heading: Stay On The Top Floor Or You're Doomed!
Summary: This is a beautiful property at a great location (although NOT on the beach or within walking distance of the beach).  There is however, one major problem. Unless your on the top floor the noise above you is simply unbearable! It sounds like an 800 pound gorilla is above you and the noise is terrible.  After several calls to the front desks they assured us that they would "send someone to investigate" but that never happened. The noise persisted and we got very little sleep the whole week (we requested a top floor several times but none were available according to the staff).  Unless you're guaranteed the top floor NEVER stay at this property!

Summary Heading: Beautiful hotel, close to all attractions
Summary: We got there around 2:30 and they let us check in early, which was great!  The room was HUGE!  It was a two bedroom, two bath, with a living room, dining room and full kitchen.  The grounds are huge.  There are two pools, basketball court, putting green, store and small bar/restaraunt.  There is also a gym, a kids room and a seperate arcade.  They even have activites for kids!  The location was close in driving distance to the beach, golf, dining, shopping and even Disneyland and the Angels Stadium.  The thing that we liked best was the the full kitchen and the thing we liked the least is that there isn't much within walking distance.

We loved this hotel!  It is so close to the beach and the views are gorgeous!  Several different swimming pools and beautiful walking paths make for plenty of activities right on the grounds of the hotel.  The rooms were clean and spacious.

Summary Heading: Large Condo Style Rooms, Comfortable for Friends Traveling Together
Summary: This was a very nice hotel and since they had a two bedroom to two bathroom set up it was very comfortable traveling with another friend. We had plenty of room and an amazing view of the ocean. Good location as well and if your a golfer the course is amazing!

The rooms were not exactly what I would expect from a Marriot experience but the resort had a lot of nice amenities and the staff seemed helpful and friendly. The cons: the sofa in the living room was not at all comfortable and the master bedroom's size and layout were lacking. I also missed having a fireplace in the unit. It would have been nice to have both bedrooms with the blackout curtains. We naturally put our children in the smaller bedroom but with the noise from upstairs and the light coming in from the drawn shades, the kids were up by 7am every morning- not my idea of a relaxing vacation unless you bring the nanny. I enjoyed the double shower and the overall decore and as I mentioned previously, the resort had a lot of nice amenities and best of all it was close to

We stayed here for 7 days and had the best time! It is less than a mile from the beach with tide pools, hiking trails, big rocks to have a picnic on. You are close to everything, Fashion Island, Upscale resteraunts, Family freindly ones as well, the Supermarket. Anything and everything you might needs is just a short distance away. The Villas have heated pools, Tennis, BBQ's, Kids Arcade and much, much more. We will be going again very soon. Enjoy

Summary Heading: Resort with beautiful view and large villas
Summary: My family stayed at this property for 3 nights on a timeshare "preview package."  We had a beautiful, large villa -- 2 Bedroom, 2 baths, 3 tvs, full kitchen, dining area, living area and balcony.  The kids had a bedroom with a queen (maybe full?) bed and pullout sofa,  TV & dresser as well as their own bathroom with tub/shower.  Fully equipped kitchen was stocked with paper towels, dish soap, and dishwasher detergent.  Living area had a TV and DVD player (kids/family movies are available to checkout for free - 2 per night from the activity center).  Master bedroom had a king bed, tv, whirlpool tub, 2 sinks, with adjoining restroom and large glass door shower with 2 shower heads.  The mini clothes washer and dryer was fantastic as we went home with clean clothes in our suitcase!

Summary Heading: Nice but a little bit pricey
Summary: Clean hotel and the the room is spacious and did give us feeling of home away from home.  We do feel safe in the facility.  Nice pool but very crowded during summer time.

Beautiful resort - very relaxing.  Prior to going, I called and requested a villa that was in their newer section (4000 range), with an Ocean View.  We arrived around 2:30 - they took my cell # and we hung out at the pool.  It took a while to get in the room (4:30pm) but the wait was worth it - beautiful Villa with an amazing view.  Had a great week at this resort and would come back again in a heart beat.  We spent a lot of time at their new pool, high on the SouthEast end of the resort (we dove there in the car).  The newest Villas (5000 range) arn't furnished & occupied yet, so this pool is not crouded at all, with all new lounges.     Here are some more pointers that might help:  Kept running out of ice; no ice machines outside villas that I could see; we just called

We just returned from one week at Newport Coast Villas 8/28 to 9/5. We are Marriott owners (Park City and Orlando).  This was our second stay at NCV's and we loved every minute of it.  Check in was a bit chaotic but it's a very busy property so we expected it.  The first room we were assigned had about 20 stairs to get down to it.  I have a problem with stairs so we were reassigned to a first floor room in the 1100 building.    We overlooked one of the smaller pools.  I thought there might be a lot of noise but there was'nt.  It was great having such close access  to the pool.  I will always ask for this building in the future. All of the furninshings were in great condition.  The beds are very comfy and the pillows are better than home!  We had no maintance issues.    The last

We stayed 5 nights here this August and really liked the place. The pools are great and the accommodation is excellent, even tho we were in an older block (2500). Try to get one in the 3000s or 4000s I think.  Other  than that there's loads to do aboth on site and off (we went to Sea World and whale watching, among others).  One tip - the Pavilions supermarket up the road give syou a discount of about 30% if you say you are staying at the Marriott.

This was a 5 star Marriott.  We are Marriott timeshare owners in Orlando and came here for 4 days on a preview deal.  The resort was very large - lots of walking.  It was beautiful though.  The lobby/check-in area was spectacular and overlooked the pool and ocean.  There was a small store there for chips, pop, etc. and prices were normal.    Our room was a 2 bedroom which was beautiful.  Our son had his own room with attached bathroom.  As in all Marriott's, there was a washer and dryer which really comes in handy.  They supply soap for one load which we used before leaving for our next destination.  The kitchen was fully stocked with dishes, glasses and utensils so we had small meals in the room.  There really was no restaurant on the premises - just the pool area had small
We stayed here with our 5 children and everyone had a blast.  Great property with room and fun for everyone.  We especially liked the beach at Crystal Cove and dont forget the Shake Shack!

Summary Heading: Awesome area of Southern Cali, very relaxing
Summary: My girlfriend and I stayed there for about a month in March. She was there through work. The facilities are great. The locker rooms are very nice and have a sauna and steam room plus all kinds of spa type products.   The rooms have nice decor. The room we stayed in didn't have any flat screen tvs compared to her co-workers but who goes to Cali to watch tv. Some models haven't been updated yet (in March anyways)  There are no real restaurants on property. You can walk to the beach but its about a mile away (depending where on the property you are).   The views are incredible.  Would I own there, probably not because I will never buy a timeshare but the facility is incredible.   There also is free wifi all around the property. If you want to use a computer with a printer it costs

We have stayed here twice now. We really love the property, the rooms and the pools, etc. It is a great place for a family! We really like this place but have a couple of gripes. First, we reserved a year in advance and asked for a top floor with a view. (We were told by the sales person that 80% had a view. I'd like to know what their definition of a view is.) We called in the morning to ask for an early check-in and they said that the sooner we got there the better room we'd get. We hurried there (noon) and were asked for our cell phone number to call when a room was ready. We said we would wait longer if we could get a better room. When the room was ready I asked if it was a top floor or if it had a view and was told no that there aren't any available the whole week. Got to

We truly enjoyed the resort and loved the weather.  Beautiful resort overlooking the Pacific Ocean.  The staff was very friendly and helpful.  I rented my condo through Lifetime Leisure.  The owner of the company, Christopher, helped me secure a room with a great view.

Summary Heading: Great Place if you're lucky enough to get a week
Summary: Marriott Newport Coast is one of the most beautiful resorts, but sadly, is one that I would not purchase again.  The sales representatives are very good at showing you all of the amenities and the resort truly sells itself.  What they fail to mention is that it is extremely difficult to actually reserve your week(s).  For a one week owner, you have to reserve your week 12 months in advance of when you want it and have to call at 9:00 am or try and reserve it online.  For multiple week owners, you can call 13 months in advance.  On numerous occasions, my wife and I have called and been online only to be told that all of the units had been reserved.  This was at 9:04 am.  We have several weeks and due to our past frustration, we are selling two of them.  If you are considering

Summary Heading: Very Dissapointing Stay at Newport Coast Villas
Summary: We are a Marriott time share owner and will never stay at this place again.  I called approximately one week ahead of time and asked for a room with a beach view and a feather free master bedroom.  My wife is allergic to down so this was an important one.  The person I was talking to didn't understand this so I had to repeat the request three different times.  He said he had it in our  record and it wouldn't be an issue.  On the day we checked in we had a beautiful view of the ocean but our excitement was quickly tempered when we realized they didn't provide us w/ a feather free master.  We had to strip the bed of all the pillows and the down comforter.  We stripped the sheets off the bed and used sheets in the closet for the sleeper sofa.    That night as we were getting ready

Summary Heading: Need a car to get around
Summary: The resort is huge & requires walking up steep stairs & hills to access the amenities.  The two bedroom unit has enough room for a family of four.  Great place for small kids They have playgrounds, a park & scheduled activities.
A beautiful resort on ritzy coast. Views to die for. Nice pools & amenities. Games for babies, kids & teens. Crystal Cove Beach is unique, safe, fun. Be sure & get a shake at Rubies on the cliff.

The hotel was beautiful. 5 star. Nothing more to ask for. We stayed in a 2 bedroom villa.....beautiful.........great view and spotless. The location is great, not to far from LA or San Diego. Our room also, like a few others was not ready until 400pm..... so there is not an early check in here. We did have a problem with the water and the staff came and fixed it within 1 hour. The staff members at the hotel were nice, but did not go out of thier way to assist you like other places I have been. We took an independent tour that left from the hotel to LA, which we were not pleased with. The woman was not friendly and seemed to want to rush us....(so we went to Hollywood on our own and enjoyed it .......many tours leave right from Hollywood Blvd). So dont recommend the LA/ Hollywood

This hotel is great especially with two teenagers each had their space, great being able to do wash, great location, super nice villa, beautiful grounds, terrific location - we really enjoyed.   The only thing - expect to check in at exactly 4 and they have a 10 am check out time.

Summary Heading: Nice but a distance from anything.
Summary: The villas are great, I stayed here for a week. I would suggest a car, being that everything is off site. They have a bar opened from 11am- 5pm, if it is summer it is opened until 8pm. If you are planning on having a few bring at least  $75 it's expensive. 8.95 for a mojito and 11.00 for a cheeseburger. Draft is less expensive, the sign said 4.75. Washer/dryer, dishwasher, 2 bedrooms the same as other time shares.

Summary Heading: Great Place - if you have the right expectation
Summary: My wife, 9 year old daughter and I stayed here for 6 nights and overall we really enjoyed ourselves.  We arrived around 2pm, and as other reviewers noted, there doesn't seem to be any early check-in here.  We "pre-registered" and were quickly and rather cooly  told that there would be no ocean view rooms available.  Not surprised by that as I was using Marriott points and I'm not a time share owner and will NEVER be.    So we went into Newport Beach and did some exploring and shopping for supplies.  At 3:57pm, my cellphone rang and sure enough, our room was ready!  We hurried back and I went in to get the room number and keys, and tried again to get a room with a view.  This time, I was helped by a very nice man with a Caribbean accent.  While he wasn't able to get us full ocean

This is a great place to relax.  The resort is very large and built into the hills.  Walking anywhere will give you some exercise but you can drive if you like.  The pool area was large and it's nice they have some quiet areas.  All of our requests were met with no problem including where we wanted our villa but we did request in advance.  Many guests are gone during the day so the resort doesn't feel crowded at all.  We did day trips to Laguna Beach, Balboa Island, and Balboa Peninsula.  I recommend all because they are so close.  Definitely use the Pavillions grocery store east of the resort.  If you're used to Marriott Vacation Clubs this lives up to or exceeds expectations.

This is my 1st review ever and I felt like it was time to help out those that have helped me with great reviews in the past.  We stayed for 8 days, 7 nights at Marriott's Newport Coast Villas and LOVED it.  My wife, 4 year old daughter, mother and father in law all stayed very comfortably in this beautiful (Room # 2320) villa.  We were able to just unpack for the week and felt like we were at home, or as close as you can feel. The rooms were clean, spacious and we had no complaints!  The rest of the resort was amazing, especially if you have kids.  At one point, we were the only people in the LARGE pool on a Sunday.  Unfortunately the weather wasn't the best, but we are from Idaho and didn't mind. We swam in the pool, played ping pong and checkers on the patio and relaxed in the

Summary Heading: Fantastic place - but watch out for the staff!!
Summary: My fiancee and I have stayed here twice, and plan to stay many more times.  The location is great, the villas have amazing views, the amenities are very nice.  However, the employees are less than helpful.  Be forewarned - if you arrive before the 4pm check in time - even 5 minutes before! - you will NOT be allowed to check in.  You will be forced to wait with the other "guests" who are treated like cattle until the magical hour of 4pm.  You can't request a room or even know what room you have been assigned to so that you can park near there.  It is almost comical the way they withhold this information, as if it were a state secret.  That being said, we did get a room on the upper floor of a bulding in the 3000's with a decent view and flat screen TV's.  The sofa was old, lumpy,

Summary Heading: Excellent room, perfect for a family
Summary: Me and a colleague had each a "villa" (room). The villa consists of two bedrooms, each with a bathroom. Also a living room, dishwasher, equipped kitchen, cooler, fridge with ice-maker, washmachine and dryer. Needless to say the room is a small apartment and really too big if you stay there solo. I never used the other bedroom and bathroom.   We had our villas in the lower part of the hotel complex and they are the oldest, the newer villas are higher up. Although not ultra-modern I found my room to be perfectly ok despite old tv's instead of flatscreens. Did I mention there are three tv's? Living room, and one in each bedroom. About 70 channels provided including many movie channels.  Pool area was great with plenty of beds. Also a pool grill where you can get burgers and simple

I researched this place like crazy and when it finally got down to it, I wasn't too impressed with how the rooms looked online and in pictures. However, it is a great place to stay at with a group of friends or family especially if it is for more than one day. While the electronics in the room are not "modern", the hotel facility is great. The BBQ's are really nice and come in handy if you are travelling with a group. I stayed in one of the newer villas, and everything was great. Staff was great as well. The place exceeded my expectations. My only complaint was that the room did not have plasmas, but who watches that much TV at a place like this?? Make sure to go to grocery store, there aren't many options in the area to go out to eat without having to drive.

Summary Heading: Not over the top but very nice and relaxing.
Summary: After reading dozens of reviews on this website I booked a week at the Villas through Interval International.  The reviews are really accurate.  This hotel should not be chosen if you're looking for them to occupy your attention for the whole stay.  It's basically a "home away from home" except with a million dollar view that allows you relax comfortably between trips out to Southern California.  Me, my fiance and her sister utilized the resort primarily in the mornings and late evenings as we spent the days traveling to nearby cities such as San Clemente, Newport Beach, San Diego and a trip to Hollywood.  As far as my rating, I'm biased because of the room.  Due to recent knee surgery, I was on crutches and asked them to find me a room closer to the main pool to eliminate

Summary Heading: AMAZING VIEW, amazing rooms, service was so-so
Summary: Here's a fresh review of this property.  Please be aware, they have new buildings being built and are undergoing construction.  During our stay, we couldn't hear anything and it did not bother us. My wife and I arrived on Friday for a two night stay for our anniversary.  We got a good deal from the Marriott site for 199 per night.  I think that is a good deal? I asked for a top floor oceanview room, with early check-in.  We arrived 1.5 hours early, before the 4P check-in.  Our room was not available and was being serviced by engineering.  After checking back in several times, no luck, no room.  Same answer.  Then 4:30 came around and I asked for a different room.  The front desk attendant said we don't do that for people staying two nights.  Holy s---!  You what!?!?!?  Ok, I

Summary Heading: Beautiful views, great location between LA and SD!
Summary: We stayed at the Marriott Newport Coast while visiting relatives in San Diego and Los Angeles.  It was a great location between the two cities, about an hour to LA and 1 1/4 hours to SD.  It is right on the coast, built into the side of a hill with gorgeous views.  The rooms were very clean and nicely decorated.  We had a view of the ocean from the master bedroom and living room.    We headed to Warner Brothers Studio, Joshua Tree National Park and the San Diego Zoo.  Joshua Tree NP was just over two hours away using the toll roads (about $10 each way), with WB and the SD Zoo each just over an hour.  Our only complaints were minor.  The master bath area sink and tub are not separate from the bedroom.  The light in the master shower was a little dim. (I said they were minor).  In

Our family of four stayed here at NewPort Coast Villa's April 4-11 and had a wonderful relaxing week. It was Spring Break for most schools so it was a little busier than normal. The room we stayed in was very generous in size with two very large bedrooms to accomodate our family. We had a spectacular view of the ocean and the sunsets. We could see Catalina island everyday, it was so clear. The kitchen is full of everything you could possibly need and we used their gym facilities a couple of mornings. They have increased in size since we last visited and learned there was another gym on the other side of the resort near the tennis courts. There are 5 pools and 4 jacuzzi's to choose from. We mostly stayed at the quiet pool and quiet jacuzzi. We never had any problems finding

Summary Heading: Great Location -- Still working out some bugs
Summary: Two moms traveling with tween daughters loved the villa and the location.  Weren't nuts about the highway-side room, but still nice proximity to Crystal Cove Beach and striking distance of all kinds of OC attractions.  The access to Crystal Cove parking passes was not smooth as we were at the mercy of others who didn't turn theirs in on time.  The Activities Center needs more passes or a better system.  Hot tub too full of diaper brigade to be a real respite.  Spa personnel were nice but the facility and the fitness center too small for a property of this scale.
