Marketplace on site is virtually useless.  Go to the Pavillions to shop nearby.  Loved the beach and the cruiser bikes on Newport boardwalk and also going to Wilma's on Balboa.  Rooms are nicely appointed. Did Disney,

We had a view of the highway and the traffic noise was awful!  But, we got the room for a great price and knew we wouldn't have a view, so we can't complain.  We enjoyed the beach pass and the chair rentals and then came back to the pool area in the late afternoon to avoid the crowds.  Sure, some people don't understand "quiet hot tub" is not meant for kids splashing.  We shopped Trader Joe's and made all our meals at the condo.  Noisy dishwasher, recommend you run when you aren't there.  But otherwise, very convienent.  Enjoyed soak tub and gas grills.  We'd stay there again, even with the noise.

Loved our week at this hotel. The grounds were well kept and beautiful. The staff was friendly. We borrowed a pass to use for the beach across the street and they were so nice about it when we returned it a little late! My daughter participated in some craft projects in the kids activity center. She had fun. The main pool was a little crowded, so we used another one that was close to our room. It was quiet and relaxing. I wish we could have stayed another week to just "hang out" at the hotel and not be rushing around, trying to get all of our activities in. We missed Easter Sunday by one day and my daughter was sad. They had fun activities planned for the kids.

We stayed here two nights after planning on only staying one.  Just as we were checking in we had a 5 minute wait and were looking out the lobby to the pools and saw the ocean and decided to extend our stay by a night based on the first impression.  We were so happy we did this.  We were traveling with three children and three adults and we loved the two bedroom villa's.  The kitchen was great and modern, the space was plenty big enough and it was wonderful to have a washer and dryer right in our room. We went to the lobby where they have a little market where you can get pizza and sandwiches for very reasonable prices.  It was great to eat outside on the patio. The location of this resort is perfect.  A very short drive to Main Beach in Laguna and we spent some time there.  It

Summary Heading: Great location, kid friendly, and lots to do.
Summary: We went on a time share presentation so we stayed for very little. We had a canyon view, and a 2bedroom suite. Fully equiped kitchen made it even better. We have two young boys and they loved it. The pool area has a life size chess/checkers set, ping pong tables, pool tables etc... Open areas to BBQ or just enjoy the view. The beach across the street was wonderful. Really enjoyed this property. Time share salesman crossed the line with his techniques.

Stayed at this location during the first week of March, 2009. Since I was concerned about the fact that we'd be checking in at 2am, I made sure to call a # of times with my concerns, especially about getting the last and worst rooms on the proerty. I read other reviews here and knew to ask for a villa in the higher # so as to score a new one and  a villa with a view. I asked for a bldg layout and was sent a fax, so I knew what to ask for. Every time I called I got a recording from Room Control Dept and so I made my requests. Finally I got a call that nothing was guaranteed, but they would accomodate us because we were owners.    It all depends on location. Sure enough we got in so late they put us in bldg 2000, one of the oldest villas - no view since it overlooked another bldg.

Summary Heading: Can't wait to go back - we loved our stay at MNCV!!!
Summary: Just got back from a week stay at the Marriot Newport Coast Villas and had a wonderful time!  The hotel is perched on the side of a hill overlooking the pacific ocean.  The grounds and buildings were beautifully designed.  We are timeshare owners in Aruba and got this as an exchange through Interval International.  We were lucky and got a villa (#3020) with a nice view of the ocean.  Each night we could see a beautiful sunset from our balcony!  Our villa was spacious and clean: The MASTER bedroom had a plush king size bed, soaking tub, TV, and double sinks in the same room; a huge glass panel stand up shower (with 2 heads) and toilet were also part of the master in an adjoining room.  The 2ND bedroom had a plush queen size bed, a comfortable pull out sofa, TV, and a door that

Summary Heading: We had an excellent week and highly recommend NCV
Summary: We spent a week at Newport Coast Villas in mid February, 2009 on a time share exchange.  We stayed at a unit in the 2700’s.  The Unit was fine.  We had no complaints and were satisfied with everything in the Unit.  We felt like we were in an upscale apartment instead of a hotel.   There was a washer and dryer.  The kitchen facilities are very good for breakfast/lunch and heating up meals. The unit was very spacious.  It had two big bedrooms, two bathrooms, one of which had a tub, a large living room, a kitchen with a lot of counter space, three TVs and a patio with chairs and a table.  Each building has an outdoor gas grill you can use for cooking.  We had a limited ocean view from the unit.  There was free WiFi.  There are two separate pool areas (with hot tubs that you can use

We loved our stay at the Marriott Villas!  Great for our group of 4.  Lots of space to spread out, enjoy the views, drink wine on the deck with appetizers we bought at Trader Joe's down the street, on and on.   We did our laundry right in our Villa during our 5 night stay.... we won't have to bring a lot of clothes next time!  Maybe our #2523 unit was one of the originally built units... so no flat screen TV... but who really cares with so much to do?  Afterall.....there were 3 TVs!  Almost one per person!   You could cook some of your meals in the fully equipped kitchen...dishes , pans, utensils, wine glasses.  There's a full-size frig, oven, micro, dishwasher, granite countertops.   We bought some good coffee at Trader Joe's...they only provided coffee for the first day.

Summary Heading: and to think I almost didnt go!!
Summary: I have a timeshare thru Marriott and requested an exchange thru Interval International. I accidently entered the wrong search date. I intended to go in the summer but immediately received a confirmation for January 10 thru the 17. Oh Boy, I thought who wants to go on vacation in January when the chance of a flight from CT to anywhere has a good chance of being cancelled due to weather. Then I read the reviews, which were mixed. I almost cancelled but something told me not to. I decided to keep the reservation got a great deal on airfare and started to read more positive reviews. CAN I TELL YOU HOW THANKFULL I AM THAT I DIDNT CANCELL??!! The Newport Coast Villas are spectacular!! Ive been to several Marriott timeshare villas and have to say this is the nicest one so far! I got

We are owners at NCV and stayed here Christmas week.  The property is beautiful, but very large and hilly – getting from one end to the other is more than a casual stroll.  I called two months prior to arrival and again two weeks before check-in with room requests wanting something in buildings 4000, 4100, 4200, or 4500.  When we arrived I was disappointed to find we were given a room in 4500.  The front desk clerk was not concerned and said “well, we try to accommodate everyone’s requests.”  The room was spacious and well-appointed.  The kitchen had everything we needed to prepare the meals we ate in.  The couch (that doubled as a fold out bed) was not very comfortable, but we did not spend a lot of time in the living room.  The balcony had a round table with four chairs that

I, too, am staying at the Marriott Coast Villas as I type my review.  We scored and got a 2 bedroom suite in the 3900 block with a killer ocean view.  I can't say enough about the view as we have a balcony overlooking Crystal Cove.  The master bedroom also has a mini balcony where you can open up the french doors to enjoy the ocean breeze.  The rooms are quite spacious and the bedrooms are nicely furnished.  We really enjoyed our balcony during sunset hours.  The 3 TV's we have are not of the HD variety and on the one in the common area had a DVD player.  The walls are not as well insulated as you would expect from a Marriott category 5/6 property.  You can hear voices outside as well as from the grounds below (despite being on the 4th floor).    No restaurants on the premises,

Summary Heading: Depends on the unit/view you get and on whether you need a resort or apartment
Summary: We are staying at the villas as we are writing this review - we have two weeks here from December 21 to January 3 (we got the first week as an Interval International exchange and rented the second week from an owner at a great last minute price).  I will summarize the good and the bad.  First, there were differences between the two units - the first week we had an older unit (unit #2813), first floor, with parking lot view, no flat screen TVs, some outdated furnishings, etc.  Unless you are an owner and you book 12-13 months in advance, it is hard to get a view.  In the first unit we had no cell phone reception, and we do have two cells - one with Nextel and the other is T-Mobile; we had to walk on the patio or out on the parking lot to catch a few lines of signal and be able to

The folks at the Marriott Newport Coast Villas have nailed down the 'home away from home" theme with this Villa Resort.  I've never felt more at home than I did at the NCV.  My family and I are Marriott Owners and this was a great vacation.  The Good: Pretty much everything!!!  They have free WiFi, King Triton's Cove for the little ones was fabulous, as was the arcade and teen area in the main building.  Just below and off the main building, there is a little park with a playground, putting green and basketball court.  There was also a tennis court but it wasn't in this area.  The Marketplace served Starbucks, Pizza Hut, it's own signature Subs and some other grocery items  Many, many awesome views are seen throughout the grounds as words just can't say enough about this

First class all the way.  Suite was gorgeous, wiifi, quiet. Front desk staff very organized and helpful.  The grounds and views are excellent. Two differernt  friends have stayed here and their praises were right on.
GREAT resort. very nice place to stay. LARGE two bedroom suites. It will be a waste to not bring either two couples or the family. Too much room to waste.

Summary Heading: Marriott's Newport Coast Villas is Awesome!
Summary: My husband and I stayed here for the long Thanksgiving weekend and we couldn't have chosen a better place to stay since we wanted to visit Disneyland and explore Newport Beach and Laguna Beach.  This resort is very impressive and very upscale.  The unit where we stayed was very spacious for 2 people (2BR/2BA).   We didn't get one of those units with spectacular view (we got the 'parking lot' view) but  the room more than compensated for the lack of it (we're from San Diego so ocean view is not a big deal).  My only complaint is that our room does not yet have one of the flat screen tv's.    We attended a very low pressure  time share presentation and toured the grounds.  The pool area was impressive.  The staff were helpful (I was able to get a late checkout) and very attentive

My friend owns Marriott timeshare in Vegas and decided to trade it in to visit California. So we paid the difference and 4 of us spent 8 days in beautiful Newport Coast Villas.  1st thing. We landed at LAX because thats where most international flights land. The distance to Newport Coast Villa's from LAX is approx. 46 miles. We knew this ahead of time and we rented a hybrid SUV, good thing. So if your planning to fly here make sure you have transportation. Recommend renting a vehicle to get around as you will definitely need it to get around Newport and Laguna Beach.    The area where Newport Coast Villa's is located is simply amazing. The best way to describe it is upper-class Californian cottage country. I mean super rich, rich, rich area.  The resorts are mostly aimed at:

The resort is beautifully maintained and very upscale inside and out.  The two bedroom has the King designer beds (a little higher than normal) in each bedroom with adjacent bathrooms for both.  The front bedroom's bathroom had sink and tub/shower and can be used from the main hall as well as the bedroom or the doors can be locked.  The rear bedroom has a whirlpool tub and two sinks that are open to the bedroom giving it a more spacious feel.  The shower is huge with two shower heads and floor to ceiling tile.  The toilet is beside the shower and a door encloses it from the rest of the bathroom. Both bedrooms had their own Plasma TV as did the living room. The large living room had a sofa and two chairs with large plasma TV.   The two pools and hot tub were warm and very clean.

My husband and I recently stayed at Marriott's Newport Coast Villas in Newport Beach, CA through an Interval timeshare.  We had a wonderful experience.  The villas are beautiful, clean and well stocked.  The staff is friendly and attentive, especially the fellows at the pool bar and the ladies at the spa!  Although the complex is quite huge, we were able to walk everywhere in just a few minutes...pool, fitness center, spa etc.  If you're not up for the exercise, then just call the front lobby and they're all too happy to pick you up in one of the many golf carts onsite for a quick lift.  Our villa was close to a second pool (the Grotto) which I highly recommend b/c it was clean, huge and often empty. On two of the days we had the entire pool to ourselves! The main pools are

This place was so nice!!!!!! The rooms, the view the property was all awesome. In fact this was the 1st place that after the week went buy, that I DID'NT want to go.  The location is perfect being in newport coast. No crowds! THAT was very nice! The whole area was so perfect.  My only complaint is that this is the 1st place in all my travels EVER that no one cleaned the room EVER,Sum time shares will clean mid-week and/or change out towels.But here.......NOT one thing? I was kinda takin back...being that this was a Marriott.  But aside from that......All else was 1st class.

We own a Marriott timeshare in Palm Desert and have stayed at several properties over the years.  This one did not disappoint.  We have found that most properties are fairly similiar in terms of villa layout, amenities and staffing.  The only difference in this one was the second bedroom was smaller than usual with a loveseat pullout instead of a second bed.  This was fine for us because we have children but I doubt you would comfortably fit 8 people in this villa as advertised.  There are several pools - one heated and one small hot tub.  There is lots for kids to do under 12 or 13.  Beyond that teens might be a little bored although lots of entertainment within a few miles.    Walk to beach is great way to start your day, although the climb back up would be a challenge for the

Summary Heading: Nice Stay - glad I read trip advisor
Summary: I had a business trip to California working between LAX and San Diego. My girlfriend was traveling with me for some R&R so I wanted to find a place on the ocean. This was not easy when you have to get government rates which is in the neighborhood of $118/night for a hotel in SO. Calif. - My business partner found the Marriott NewPort Coast Villas. I was a little afraid of this place after reading the other reviews. We arrived by car the place is huge! Found the main office and spoke with a very nice young man. We asked if we could get a room close to the main pool since my girlfriend would be hanging there while I worked. He obliged and we got a room that sorta backed up to the busy road. New Port Coast Highway is a busy and fast road - posted speed limit is about 65mph... When

Summary Heading: Nice Property in Beautiful Location, But With Some Problems
Summary: Four of us spent three nights here for an annual girls weekend.  We had a 2 bedroom/2 bathroom villa with a queen bed, a king bed, a pull out sofa & a pull out love seat.  We stayed in villa # 1713 and it was spacious for the four of us.  The unit was updated with a full kitchen & a nice outdoor patio for breakfast.  Views from the property were beautiful...when it wasn't foggy.  The concierge was very helpful in making restaurant recommendations & providing information about the area.    A car is necessary & there are some excellent restaurants within a 10-20 minute drive.  In addition, there are several shopping malls, streets lined with shops & restaurants, & a ferry to Balboa Island or Catalina Island.  The beach is located down the road & is an easy 1 mile walk down hill

Summary Heading: Senior Living Community at it's finest!!
Summary: This hotel is for old people... there is nothing fun to do without driving 20 minutes down the road. You can not go out and enjoy yourselves if you are young. There is a state beach across the street that is nothing special and you must pay to go to. There are no restaraunts or bars nearby or even at this hotel. They have a lousy pool side bar that closes at 5 pm! They claim to have HDTV's in all the rooms, but this is not the case. It feels like an apartment in the middle of nowhere. If you are under the age of 64 I reccomend you DO NOT STAY HERE. Oh and they promise you a $150 gift card if you attend a stupid timeshare presentation and that is a LIE... they give you $50. What a waste of time...

This is a time-share property. They call it a resort...but It is nothing more than a Motel 6 with a kitchen and a view. There is no restaurant or lounge. No place for adults to relax and have a drink, or get served a meal. Better off going to a motel in Monarch Beach or Dana Point or anywhere. What a disappointment.

This is a great resort. Location is awesome. Views are great. Great part of town. Balboa Island is really close. The Beach is right there. They have several shopping miles within a few miles. The location and views can't be beat. The rooms are large and updated. They are clean and well decorated. The main pool is large but the hot tub for kids is tiny. I don't get that part. They have these huge pools and then this tiny hot tub. It didn't make any sense. The excersice rooms were a joke. This resort is huge and they could have a couple thousand people staying at the sametime and they have two tiny workout rooms, good luck trying to find a treadmill or some free weights. Plus, you do have to walk around the resort. It's is large but it's nice to have some grass to play on. Our

Summary Heading: Magnificent Views at the Newport Coast Villas
Summary: Marriott Newport Coast Villas sits on 76 acres above the Newport Coast with magnificent coast views and lovely, spacious guest "villas."  This is a vacation ownership property.  There are four pools, each pool has a hot tub.  There is one grill at the main pool; the property does not have a restaurant at this time.  Cool stuff:  frequent, free shuttle service to Crystal Cove state beach, Fashion Island Mall and Laguna Beach. I cannot recommend this stretch of the California coast more highly; it is exactly like the French Riviera.  Perfect beach weather.  At the property there is also a koi pond and a park.  The landscaping is very appealing.  It is, however, a rather expensive place to stay.

Summary Heading: MVCI Newport Coast: The good and the not so good...
Summary: Stayed for a week at Marriott's Newport Coast Villas in April.  While we own a Marriott timeshare, and exchange for travel all over the world, we had not been to this location before.  Here are a few tips.  Resort:  Very large resort with  buildings that are a long way from the main action at the pool and clubhouse.  Recommend that you ask for a villa near the main building if you are going to be using facilities.  Pools were very nice, with an adults-only pool that made it quieter for us, since we didn't have the kids with us.  Villas were done in a mediterranean motif in good Marriott style, but little things like extra towels had a fee.  Newport area:  You definitely need a car to get around, as the resort does not have any access to local restaurants or beach within walking

The Marriott villas were clean and comfortable.  We had a villa close to one of the outer pools, which was very pleasant.  The pool was lovely and usually fairly quiet. The villa was well equipped and it was great to have a washer/dryer.   Loved the Newport beach area and the neighbouring Laguna Beach and Dana Point.   We had a nice stay, but for some reason the Marriott Villas felt slightly impersonal.  It would probably have been great if we had been travelling with family or friends.  It was a bit of a hike and a steep one at that to the beach, but it was worth the trip, quiet and beautiful.

Just got back from a long weekend at this resort. Located on a hillside overlooking the ocean, our villa was extremely clean and comfortable, with tons of amenities that cater to families with children both very small, and teens. Our villa had two very nicely appointed bedroom and bathrooms, with a full kitchen and living room area. The resort is very large, but regular shuttle service runs every twenty minutes to the main reception area, where you will find a marketplace complete with a full service Starbucks, two large swimming pools (though there are other pools located elsewhere on the property) an arcade, a Teens Only club, and many other amenities. The hotel provides a shuttle service on the hour to many spots of interest in Newport Beach, such as Crystal Cove and Fashion

Stayed here with two teenagers and a five year old as part of our tour of the California coast.  Really we were using it as a stopover on our way down, as my daughter had read something about Fashion Island and wanted to visit.    We realised when we arrived that really this is a place for people to spend a longer holiday.  It was nice to be able to stay in a villa as opposed to a hotel for a change, and it was great to do some washing, but we didnt really use the villa properly.   The villa itself was quite nice, nothing more I can say about it really except I found a ball of someone's hair on the floor so the cleaning wasnt quite perfect!  We went out to the grotto pool for half an hour a couple of times and nipped in the shop, so we didnt really get the benefit.  Fashion

We are MCVI owners and traded through Interval for a week at Newport Coast. We have previously stayed at other Marriott Villas and found this one not up to par with what we have come to expect.  The only overwhelming advantage this property has is its location.  If not for being located right in Newport and central to other California destinations, we are not sure we would even give it 3 stars.        The property itself is located on a hillside/cliff/mountain so the buildings are all located up and down  the hill from the main recreation and lobby area.  We were staying in the 1400 building which means we were 2 steep flights of steps away from the activity center. We did not see that many elevators so unless you are in great shape, you will need to be ready to climb alot of

The Marriott Newport Villas were amazing! The rooms were big and roomy with two bedrooms. The pools were huge and gave enough room for every one of their guests to swim. Views from any point in the resort painted a beautiful picture of the Pacific Ocean. There were so many wonderful activities for children, teens, and adults to enjoy all day. Also, the paths, workout room, and tennis courts let me exercise regularly.   LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION!!! We went to three different beaches within a few minutes away (Hystler Park is a great beach in Laguna). Disneyland was about twenty minutes away with no traffic. The towns of Newport and Laguna are lovely and have many stores with necessities for your stay.   Overall, the vacation was great and I would recommend this hotel to anyone

The Marriott Newport Coast Villas are very average. Although the resort is in a beautiful location in Newport Beach and close to many tourist attractions, the actual villas need LOTS of work.  The carpets are FILTHY and many of the villas are run down.  Our bathroom had lots of mildew stains. The villas are well equipped with everything one would need to cook a decent meal and the amount of space is excellent.  The biggest issue we had with this resort was its absolutely awful service!  We arrived to check in at 3:50 (10 minutes prior to the published check in time) and had to stand in line for 20 minutes.  After waiting with 3 tired children we were told our villa was not ready and that they would call our cell phone when the villa was ready.  We left the property to buy

My family just returned from a 7 night stay at the resort and we truely enjoyed it. Our villa was the furthest building from the pools and activities center and the closest to the new construction that is taking place. It was walkable to get to the main area of the resort but we often drove our car over and parked near the activites office. It was easier for us. However we did walk back and forth several times and that was fine too. My teen aged son used the gym and said it was great. The front desk suggested that we call for a shuttle when needed, we didn't utilize this option. We either walked or took our car.    The construction noise was not a bother. Also a down side with this building is that there is no view. We overlooked a hilly area. I did request a villa close to the

I'm with the people who are ambivalent about this place.  First we went on a marketing package - I think $99/night for three nights plus a gift card.  If you get offered one, take it as it's amazing value.  Aside from that:  Pros:  Amazing piece of Orange County real estate in a beautiful spot above the completely unspoiled Crystal Cove State Park.  Free shuttle down to said beach - very reliable and convenient.  Very close to other great beaches in Newport Beach and easy access to shoping whether grocery (Traders Joes or Albersons) or everything else (Fashion Island).  Condos are better than hotel rooms with kids.  Cons:  Pools very basic and crowded - unlike every other resort we've ever seen, the pools are shallow and basic - no water falls/slides, rivers or any of the other

Stayed here this April with a couple friends and had a great time.  I went in December and it was freezing, but April was a decent time to go.  Keep in mind that this is not the warmest place in California to go.  It is about a mile from the beach, and it tends to get pretty chilly at night.  The villas are spectacular!  We were able to get an ocean view (realized they're not guaranteed) and the villa was huge and spacious.  It is literally 30 minutes or less from every major theme park and attraction, and all the nightlife is only a quick cab ride away.  I can't wait to go back.

Reserved 3 nights thru a member.    We had a 2 bedrooms unit overlooking the ocean and golf course.   We arrived at night and I was suppose to have had a mobility scooter waiting for me.  The front desk was very accomodating calling around trying to locate the scooter (calling other Marriott's in the area, the company, etc.).  Turns out the guy broke down and ended up bringing it around midnight.   My only complaint is that the 2nd bedroom should have 2 beds rather than 1 queen.   We were traveling with 2 teenagers (1 boy 1 girl) and it meant 1 of them sleeping on the pullout.   The resort is huge.     The unit was very clean and comfy.   There was construction around us but we heard nothing.    Would definately stay here again.

We just spent three nights in building 2200. Let me preface this review by saying we were offered a special rate as Gold Rewards members w/the mandatory Vacation Club presentation. Prior to our stay we were contacted several times, sometimes late at night (after requesting they contact us via email,) on the phone for what purpose I can't quite fathom. Very annoying and unnecessary. Then the week prior to our stay we were yet again contacted by phone-this time someone informing us what time our presentation was scheduled, which was 1 pm in the afternoon. I requested an earlier time slot and was met with attitude-apparently the rep felt I wasn't entitled to ask considering the "deal" we were getting? Contacting the supervisor didn't resolve the issue to my satisfaction either,

Summary Heading: A few minor issues but the view and location make up for it!
Summary: We exchanged our timeshare week through Interval Int'l and was able to stay here. Our timeshare is NOT a Marriott so we were quite pleased to be able to deposit a "mud season" week in Breckenridge for June 8-15,2008 at Newport Coast Villas!  This is a Marriott property and the location is prime - right on the coast and most of the buildings have lovely ocean views. Even though we were low on the totem pole in terms of priority (non-Marriott owners exchanging in), our villa was in building 4500, which was less than 2 months old, with awesome ocean views. They are still building up the hill, but I NEVER heard any noise. There are TONS of resort activities going on daily, starting practically every hour, different things based on age group (2-5, 5-12, 13-17). The teenagers have

Stayed at the Villas for 3 nights with my family.  Ocean view above/through the tree tops.  Villas (over 1200 sq ft) were nicely decorated and essentially clean.  Spacious kitchens to prepare meals. We shopped at a local store to get essentials, the marketplace at the resort is convienent but pricey (they have Starbucks and Pizza Hut).  Washer & dryer in the villas, it was nice to be able to do laundry in the middle of a 10 day vacation. Large resort area, but pools, playgrounds, bonfires, and MAZE (Marriott Activity Zone) all within walking distance.  Parking near villas, not always right out front. Great location:  Crystal Cove Sate Park a shuttle ride or mile walk away.  My family explored the tide pools, played in the ocean and watched Dolphins swim by.  Balboa Island and

This is our second stay at the Newport Coast Villas.  We stayed in the 3300 building, which was run down and in need of a complete renovation.  This is not what you would expect from a Marriott property.  The kitchen sink was broken along with the tub in the master bedroom.  There was mold all over the walls in the bathroom and the sliding glass door screen was off the track.  Several lights did not work and two lamps were broken. When we asked to change rooms we were told we would have to wait for 3 days and we would have to check out at 10 am and would not be allowed to check into the new room till 4pm.  Stay away from this place.

We recently spent 3 nights at NCV.  We received an unbeatable rate for agreeing to tour the property with consideration for "vacation ownership."   The property is wonderful.  The villas are very spacious, clean and well-appointed.  Felt like a home away from home.  At first, we were placed in one of the brand new units --beautiful, but far from the center of the resort where all the activities are.  Would have had to drive to take the kids to the pool or other play areas.  So, we asked to move to a closer villa, which was clearly older and not as well maintained, but had the same floorplan and decor.  So, we were happy, as it was a convenient walk to all the amenties.  I think there are very few units that actually have a view of the ocean, but some have a decent view.  The

My wife and I are Marriiott Vacation Club owners at Ocean Pointe at Singer Island, Florida so we know Marriott quality.   At first look, the Newport Villas are breathtaking with their beauty.  It is set up on a series of hills overlooking the Pacific Ocean and the Pelican Hill golf course.  The views from the balconies are great and it is wonderful to have morning coffee or evening drinks on that balcony.   We stayed in the 4500 Building which is one of their brand-new buildings.  In my opinion, the construction is not up to Marriott standards at all.  We were the 2nd family to stay in the unit and already there were problems.  Some of the lamps did not have functioning switches, the bathroom fan made a constant rattling noise when switched on, ants crawled up the bathroom

My daughter and her husband stayed here a few years ago and we visited them as we were over in the states at that time as well. It was a beautiful property then but now it has been extended it is even more beautiful with additional villas that have lovely views over the pacific - amazing when you open the curtains in the morning and see the sun rising. The reception, concierge etc are all excellent and we were greeted upon arrival and told our villa had full ocean view - wow, it certainly had ! The property itself is as most Marriotts beautifully furnished throughout with spacious bathrooms, lounge, kitchen and bedrooms. The bedrooms are very comfortable. Although in that part of California you cannot guarantee the weather we had several days of beautiful sunshine and the rest

Summary Heading: A unspeakable find on the Newport Coast
Summary: We received a mailer that offered us a 3 night stay here for $199 if we took a time share presentation. We called to book the stay because the pictures in the mailer brochure would make your jaw drop. We booked then when I called back to confirm the agent mentioned that I would be staying at another Marriot down the street and a shuttle would take us to the Villas to listen to the presentation-huh? I called the orginal agent back and told him that's not what I agreed to, he quickly apologized and made the necessary changes to accomodate us at the Villas-point is I guess that its not typical for them to put timeshare people in the Villlas but it can be done.  If you can get that deal this PLACE IS PHENOMENAL! The view is unparalleled the pools are 5 star, driving down the street

Summary Heading: Happy We Purchased a Marriott Property!
Summary: Arrival:  We traveled from Newark to LAX on Sunday 18-May.  The trip was happily uneventful and we arrived at the Newport Coast Villas at about 7 pm.  There were two people in line when I entered the large tasteful lobby.  Although I requested an upper level ocean view villa, I was not optimistic we would get one, since this was a free bonus week given to us when we purchased our Marriott Ocean Watch property in Myrtle Beach.  To my surprise, I was informed that although the property was filled at capacity we were assigned a second floor ocean view villa.  Nice start to the vacation.  Villa:  The villa indeed had a legitimate ocean view from the terrace without hanging over or straining your neck (as in some “ocean view” accommodations, we have been assigned).  The villa had a

Our check in was very easy.  They put us in the 2700 Bldg. with a beautiful view of the ocean. The place was immaculate. Everything we needed was right on the premises.  The little store was great. There is plenty of good eating within a short distance. The Eltorito Grill is excellent.  We highly recommend it.  The only suggestion that we have is not having people put their garbage outside the door.  Something gets into it and spreads it around.  The trash closets are close to all the rooms and should be used to dispose of your garbage.  great place to stay.

Summary Heading: Great vacation spot for groups or families
Summary: This resort is part of the Marriott Vacation Club, but if there is availability, you don't have to be a member of the club to stay here.  I was organizing an annual weekend getaway with my girlfriends. There were 6 of us and we wanted to stay in a suite all together. This place was a perfect weekend getaway from Los Angeles. It's right on the coast and we had a great view of the ocean from our balcony that had patio furniture.  The layout of the place was great...2 bedrooms each with 1 king bed, living room with sofabed and 1 of the bedrooms also had a sofabed. It easily slept 6 of us and could have slept 8. Complete kitchen stocked with plates, cutlery, cutting board, full refrigerator, everything you would need if you were on an extended stay. Two bathrooms: 1 bathroom was one

We stayed in one of the two-bedroom villas at this resort in late April, and loved just about everything about it.  Each bedroom had very comfortable beds with plenty of pillows, very high quality bedding (no bedspreads!), and flat panel televisions.  We had a gorgeous view of the ocean from our living room and master bedroom.  The kitchen was well-equipped and there is an Albertson's grocery store just a few miles north on the Coast Highway.    The resort provides a free shuttle to Fashion Island and Crystal Cove State Park, which borders the resort.  This beach park is just wonderful with an extensive array of tide pools (check times for low tides), safe swimming beaches, and an excellent restaurant, The Beachcomber.    Be aware that the resort pool area, although large, is

Summary Heading: Excelent Family Trip for Families with Little Ones
Summary: Had a wonderful trip to this location with out family. Great Location!! !! Condo is nothing specail, but it worked for the 5 of us. We went to Laguna Beach every day. You must go to Las Bris for lunch up on the hill. Great Mexican food and Sunday brunch.    It was great having a kitchen and washer and dryer. Trader Joe's is just down the street so you can pick up what you need. The property does not have a resturant as of April 2008, but will open one soon.  Over all a great family vacation.

Our stay here was from March 15th-18th.  A little spring break getaway is what we made it.  Since my husband stays with Marriott when he travels they call us every once in awhile to try and sell timeshare presentations.  At first they tried to sell me a Vegas timeshare presentation and after a repeated "NO, NO, NO" they then switched to "what would you be interested in?"  My answer "What do you have other than Vegas?"  So that is where Newport Beach came in.  It was for a 3 night 4 day stay for under $200.  Mind you this place if you are able to book it due to it being full of timeshare owners starts at $350 a night.    Check in was smooth.  They did put us on a ground floor close to one of the pools.  It  didn't bother us.  Plus it was very windy and chilly so there weren't

This resort was beautiful.  Every night we would sit on our balcony and watch the incredible sunset over the pacific ocean.  Our unit was spotlessly clean, and very spacious.  The location of the resort was just perfect for a short drive over to Disneyland.  The staff was very helpful with all of our questions.  I would love to return to this resort.

Exquisite property.  Actually has time shares on site also.  Gorgeous grounds, beautiful ocean view from most units.  You do have views of the ocean from some 1st floor rooms from the balcony/patios. I recommend that you get a 2nd floor room.  The rooms were bigger than my college apartment.  Over 1000 sq ft in their 2 bd/2ba units.  Huge open living area and full, full kitchen (complete with fridge, microwave, stove and sink).  Has garden tub off the main bedroom and a hugigantic shower.  I could have lived here forever.    The staff was very friendly and patient (A group of women wanted to try and rearrange villas so they could get oceanviews).  Found their store to be better equipped than most hotel stores.  Also have various activities for kids and adults.    Free internet

We stayed at the Newport Coast Villas from Jan 12-19, 2008.  As described in many other reviews, the villas are quite spacious, with two bedrooms, two bathrooms and a good sized common area (kitchen and living room).   There were five of us in the room -- four adults and one child -- and we never had an issue with space.  The kitchen is well equiped with pots and pans, a toaster, blender, cooking utensils, etc.  It is basic, but adequate.  (In fact, we were happy to see that this Marriott remembered to include a corkscrew!)  They provide a few packets of dishwashing detergent, but if you find yourself eating in often, you may want to throw a few Cascade tabs into your suitcase before you leave home.  (I'm sure housekeeping would bring more packets to you, but for sake of

Our stay at the Marriott Newport Coast Villas was amazing.  It is a time share property and I traded into it.  I don't own here, but would recommend it.  Our room was about 1200 sq. ft. and had two large bedrooms and two baths.  The master bath shower is large and has two seperate shower heads.  There are two sofa sleepers in the room which they say can sleep eight.  We had four adults and six children under fourteen in our room and still had plenty of  room.  We brought two air matresses for kids to sleep on.   We used the full kitchen for breakfast everyday and some other meals as well.  The room had a view overlooking the Pacific Ocean.  Most days we could see Catalina Island from our balony.  The room had nice furnishings and the beds were comfortable.  The pools were nice

We stayed here through our time-share from 12/21 to 12/28 and really enjoyed our two bedroom two bathroom villa.  We were located on the first floor in a wheelchair access unit so our view of the nearby ocean was not that great.  There were lots of things to do on the property, though we did not participate as we were out taking in the Southern California sights.  I noticed 4 heated pools with 3 or 4 hot tubs, a kids activity center with scheduled activities each day, an onsite spa, a kids play area, basket ball court, tennis court, and a video game room.  There is no daily room service unless you're paying for your room by the day.  There is a washer and dryer in the villa so we just washed our towels every few days.  We did request extra towels and soap and they were delivered

Stayed at this property Nov. 16-19.  We had read the reviews and knew that there were no restaurants nearby, so we shopped before arriving and had all of our meals at our unit.  The 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom unit was very nice.  The bathrooms were adequate with the master having a separate tub and 2 sinks.  The beds were extremely comfortable too.  Three TV's were in the unit, and a DVD player too.  They had many activities on site.  A basketball court, putting green, ping pong tables, pool tables, 3 pools, 2 jacuzzis, and walking trails.  They also had a video arcade, lending library, gym, and a spa.  Definitely enough to keep you busy all day.    Shopping at Fashion Island is fun, and they have a shuttle that will take you there.  Maid service rang our doorbell everyday, and we

I would like to inform everyone a little about this resort before i jump to the review. It seems like many of the reviewers are not aware that the Marriott Newport Coast Villas are timeshare apartments, not really a hotel. Basically, it's like renting an apartment, it's normal not to get daily maid service included, although you can get it for an additional fee.  Anyway, My fellow travelers and I stayed there for 4 days and 3 nights. We paid 199$ for everything (promotional offer). So i must say, the value is extremely good, although, if i paid what most others pay, it's not too great.  The resort has some stupid 'faults'. Let me explain:  Entertainment - I've been to many resorts in my short life, most of them have included some type of entertainment. And it's usually quite fun

When we arrived, we thought WOW! Extremely nice rooms, great facilities, everything that you could think of was there. Unfortunately upon "closer" inspection, we started to see the flaws...door handles loose, about to fall off and couldn't be locked, the tiled kitchen floor was sinking in. Air con didn't work and the next morning at 8 am housekeeping knocked on the (despite the do not disturb sign), once we told them that we are not ready yet, they didn't come back...for the whole week!! If you would be paying the normal fee of $800 a day I would be leaving...instantly! Since we paid for our stay in advance, we didn't have this option. And then the last night...didn't appreciate getting a phone call at almost 10 pm, complaining about noise, the fact that it was the kids next

I would really give this place about 4.5 stars...however, the only other timeshare I might prefer is in Carmel.  Other than that this is the NICEST property we've seen! Beautiful Italian-style architecture & themes, terraced down to golf course (and PCH) and ocean. It is packed in and parking is probably difficult in high season, when extra guests park in an underground facility. We do not have kids with us, but we did travel with grown family/relatives.  It was super and we found plenty to do: San Juan Capistrano mission, Cove Point State Park, Laguna Beach & Catalina Island, Getty Museum in LA; Duffy boats, plenty of shopping & restaurants in the area (if you like to eat out some). [Didn't have time to try the on-site spa, but there are 2 fitness centers and 3 tennis courts.]

To be honest and up-front - We are owners of (now) 2 weeks at Newport Coast Villas.  Please factor that into your view of my comments.  Overall Picture: We own 4 weeks of Marriott timeshare, 2 weeks in Newport, 1 week at Grande Vista, Orlando, and 1 week at Manor Club in Williamsburgh, VA.  As East Coast residents, Newport Coast Villas represent an amazing oasis on the West Coast, where we have been visiting for the past 4 summers.  The location is ideal: Perched on the hills overlooking the Pacific, surrounded by an unobtrusive golf course (Pelican Hills), and an unobstructed view of the coast from 70% of the villas.  The villas (rooms) are all 2-bedroom units, and are furnished in what I'd consider a pleasant motif.  The entire resort is currently getting all new soft and case

Summary Heading: One of my favorite Marriott Timeshares
Summary: Loved this place!  The grounds and buildings are absolutely beautiful.  Villas are spacious and clean.  The pools are very clean and have a great view over the cliffs that view the beach.  The architecture of the buildings reminds me of Italian Villas. Very photogenic and impressive.  This place exceeded our expectations.  Staff was friendly.  This Marriott timshare is always booked ( because it really fabulous) so we were happy to get a reservation in October.  The weather was PERFECT!!  October is a great time to go.  LOVED Laguna Beach which was right down the road.  Also took day trips to San Diego, Hollywood, Santa Monica and LA.  Great location to travel from as it is very convenient to the PCH and other highways.  Can't beach Marriott Newport Coast Villas.  My husband and

Summary Heading: Really great place for families to stay
Summary: We stayed in a 2 bdrm villa that was very clean and nicely appointed.  The beds were very comfortable, the rooms were quiet, and the showers were good.  The grounds were GREAT - a really nice playground area for litte kids, basketball courts, nice pools, etc.  The location is great for shopping, and less than a half hour drive to Disney and other fun attractions.

We did a timeshare exchange for a week and were very pleased with this resort.  The grounds were beautiful and serene.  This was a great time of year to come.  The weather was perfect and it wasn't very crowded.  Our 2 bedroom villa was looking out to the ocean and the pool.  We brought our 20 yr old and 17 yr old.  They shared the 2nd bedroom and bathroom.  It had a queen size bed and a pull out couch and tv. It worked out perfect for them.  The master bed was very nice with a beautiful ocean view, very deep soaking tub and a huge double shower.  The villa was nice and even had a stacked washer/dryer.  The carpeting was a little worn.  The deck was nice to have breakfast in the morning and looked out to the ocean.  The main pool is very large and there are two other pools,(1

This place was as good as advertised. We had our family of 2 adults and 4 kids. Having the separate rooms, full kitchen and pullout couches were a plus. The beach is very close, just a short drive away. We went to the state park beach just below the villas and down to Newport Beach another day.  Great restaurants  nearby in Newport and Laguna Beach.  This time of year the place was not that crowded. One night we had the pool and the jacuzzi all to ourselves. Pool  was perfect temperature. Kids had fun with the already stocked ping pong table, putting course and basketball court. We did use the barbeque just outside the room one night.  The carpets were a little worn but most everything else looked brand new. Check in was fast and easy. No problem with construction at all. Wil

This is supposed to be a top notch property and they charge top prices. We requested an ocean view but they claimed they had none available even though the property didn't seem very crowded. We were put in a bottom floor room next to a generator which was very loud and it went on and off all night with a loud vibration and noise in the master bedroom. When we asked to change units, the front desk was very apathetic and unaccompodating. They said we might be able to change units the next day, but we would have to check out of our current unit by 10am and not be able to check into a different unit before 4pm. That would mean we would have no where to change or go to for a whole day of our stay which we were paying for. I explained that I was getting married the next day and really

We rented a timeshare week from an owner at Redweek.com.  This was a newly constructed 2 bedroom/2bath with washer/dryer and full kitchen.  We were in bldg 4200 with an awsome view of the ocean.  These are not oceanside or oceanfront.  The villas sit on top of a hill/cliff about 1 mile from the ocean, but the views are great.  The room also included a full bath connecting to the living room and 2nd bedroom.  The master bedroom had a 2 person soaking tub, (no whirlpool), and a two head two person walk in shower.  The kitchen was huge, had a breakfast bar with stools, and was fully stocked with all supplies (except food).  A large patio with dinette was off the large living room.  Inside a dinning table for six.  Couldn't have been better.    Shared pool was nice.  Mobility issues

We stayed at this resort for a week (June 8-15) and we were very much impressed with the whole resort - the suites are HUGE (all units are 2br/2ba) with a full size kitchen, dining room/living room area and washer and dryer inside each unit.  The master bedroom has a king size bed.  The guest room has a queen size bed and a pull out sleeper sofa.  The location itself is great - nearby shops and restaurants and not to mention the beach (there is one that is about half a mile away and Laguna Beach is about 6 miles away).  If you are traveling with kids they have a kids center and they do offer different activities everyday (some of them you have to pay for).  The amenities in the resort seemed endless - there are bbq grills almost everywhere, there's a putting green for golfers

We stayed at Newport Coast Villas June 16-23.  Very nice resort.  Rooms are very nice and modern.  Beds are wonderful so comfy.  We had a nice ocean view, but a little far from the pools.  The pools are different from any I ever been in before.  They are a mix of salt water/chlorine.  Just was not expecting that when we jumped in, YUK.  Having the grills by your buildings was great.  We went to Albertsons and cooked almost everyday.  That saved a bunch of money when you have 4 adults and 3 kids.  Disney was fairly close no major traffic problems, but San Diego Zoo on the other hand was a different story.  The drive there was ok but on the way home we ran into alot of traffic and construction.  More than what we are used to and we live in Chicago.  We have 2 seasons Winter and

The rooms are nice, but we ended up with one, not only without a view, but actually a view of a wall!!!  The entry was in a dark stairwell area.  the back had a view of a service road!  The resort is nice, but its huge and all the amenities are concentrated in one area.  You have to walk a long ways to use the pools or hot tub.  And the hot tubs are tiny.  Two tiny hot tubs for this entire HUGE complex.  There should be hot tubs near each cluster of buildings.  Check in staff didn't tell me anything.  No information at all.  I didn't know if there was breakfast, if there was maid service, anything.  I had to call the front desk numerous times to get infomrmation.  They did answer quickly each time.  I was not impressed by this place at all.

Just back from NCV.  We had a great time.  The resort is great, we had no issue with ongoing construction.  Stayed in Villa 3525, directly across from the main building and pools.....had a decent but not great ocean view from the balcony.  Villa had a handicapped shower in the guest bath (not requested or asked for), villa was nicely furnished, looked recently updated and everything was in good order.   Highlights from the week included Disneyland, Sea World, SD Zoo, Mission San Juan Capistrano, Nixon Library and Duke's in Huntington Beach!  While we loved NCV and rank it in the top 5 of Marriott resorts we have been too, here are a few Thoughts, Gripes Suggestions on the property.  1.  Lots of tours coming in and out.....we did the tour and got $150 in Marriott vouchers for my

We loved our stay May 2-5.  We had an ocean view room, 2 bedrom, 2 bath with beautiful kitchen and washer/dryer.  We went to both Trader Joe's and Pavillions.  Would recommend Pavillions overall.  We utilized the grill twice and loved it! Had grilled shrimp and steak on our balcony with ocean view!  We travelled to Disney twice, it was an easy 22 minute drive.. the carpool lane helped.  The pools were heated and warm in early May when it was 68 degrees.  (children are not allowed in the hottubs in this facility, just so you know.)  We loved it and would highly recommend!

We had a great stay at the Newport Coast Villas.  Everything in our 2 bedroom/2 bath villa was in great shape.  It was very clean and the beds, furniture and appliances were all in great condition.  There were 3 TVs and a DVD player.  We had a great view of the ocean and had a nice patio to sit on to enjoy the view.  The pools were nice and never too crowded while we were there.  We ate at the restaurant there one day for lunch, and that was pretty good, expensive, but about what I'd expect for a resort.  They had a lot of activities for kids at the resort.  At the front desk they have some free parking passes for Crystal Cove State Park.  You just have to return it at the end of the day.  We went down to the beach and had a drink at the restaurant down there.  The restaurant

This is a wonderful resort to stay if you are looking to explore Southern California.  The rooms are large with 2 bedrooms and 2 bathrooms.  We cooked our own meals, which saved us quite a bit of money and loved the "at home feel" although the amenities in the room were plush.  The landscaping was beautiful and view was a million dollars!  The resort offered many acitivities for kids and had a spa.  The overall feel was very nice and upscale.  You will not be disappointed.  The only complaint we had, was that we were on the bottom floor and had kids in the villa above us.  We could hear them running around each morning.  Also note, that if you go in May or June there is something that we call "June Gloom".  Each morning until noon, the sky was cloudy and grey and then beautiful

We were at the Villa's 05/19/07 for a week, wish it could have been longer.  The property is well managed and  maintained.  The staff could not have been more accommadating.  Quiet and peaceful except around the pool, of course.  There is an adult only pool but it is adjacent to the family pool and unheated so we stayed around the heated, family pool.  We had a beautiful oceanview room.  Easy walk to Crystal Cove Park where you have beach access.  The weather was cooler than expected but we had lots of sunshine and beautiful sunsets.  This property is great for family and couples alike. Highly recommend this vacation for the location.  It is approximately half way between LA and San Diego right at Balboa Island.  We plan to revisit this property again.

We stayed here for a week via a timeshare trade.  What a great place.  The villa was immaculate.  We had a two bedroom which had a bathroom in each room, a double sink and double shower in the master, a decent sized living room, a full kitchen with full sized appliances, a dining room with a good sized table, and a washer and dryer.   Both bedrooms and the living room have a TV.  The living room TV has a DVD player and there is a DVD rental place on site.  We stocked our fridge up on day one at Albertson's (about a 5-10 minute drive) and ate breakfast and dinner at home each day.  The kitchen had everything we need so we weren't missing anything.   The three pools (and hot tubs) were open until 11pm each night.  It wasn't difficult for us to find an empty one each day (perhaps

Newport Coast Villas is right next to Crystal Cove State Park on the Pacific Ocean which was not crowded (it was a little cool in mid-April) and had beautiful beaches.  It seems like everything else is an hour away...LAX, Hollywood, Queen Mary, Dana Point and San Juan Capistrano, but not bad as long as you don't mind driving on the freeway at 80 mph with about a milllion other cars (we used the HOV lanes and saved lots of time).  The resort is under construction, however we were on the other end of the property and didn't hear any of the noise.  There was a smaller pool (the grotto pool) right outside our unit that was not as crowded as the main pool and it had a small jacuzzi pool, too.  The Pavillion grocery store is within a couple of miles and they gave us a discount for

We stayed here for 2 nights as part of a promotion for us to buy Marriott's Vacation ownership. The condos were huge (2bd/2ba)and nicely appointed-we were told that Marriott redecorates every 3-4 years to keep up with styles. Sleeps 8 with more room on the floor for the kids. The master suite is wonderful with a HUGE dual head shower and extra deep soaker tub. The kitchen is fully stocked if you want to cook/eat in. Very relaxing heated pool areas but spendy poolside grill. The onsite market is very lacking but is apparently going to be enlarged within 3 years or so. Fashion Island is about 10 minutes away and easy to get to for shopping and restaurants. The property is stunningly beautiful but far too spendy. I like the review about the cars in the area - very true. Don't drive

Summary Heading: Loved the Location and Wonderful Amenities!
Summary: We have an timeshare at Orlando and was able to use IntervalWorld to exchange for a  2 bedroom/2 bath unit with a full kitchen, living area and dining area.  We had a beautiful view of the ocean from our balcony.  As with many of these time-share locations, there was no room service but there is a small grocery mart on site as well as food delivery services.  There is a full-service deli/grocery store just up the road so there is no problem to buy all of your food needs there and bring them to the villas every night.   The hotel was right between Los Angeles and San Diego so it was easy to visit sightseeing sites in each area with just a hour or so drive on Interstate 5.    We can recommend San Diego Zoo, the San Diego Zoo Wildlife park, the LA sightseeing tours, Disneyland and

We purchased a time share with Marriott last year and our home resort is Horizons in Orlando. Have yet to stay at Horizons, but after staying at Newport Beach, maybe we should've bought one here. Very nice place, landscaping and pools. Service was excellent, and had a decent view of PCH and the coast from our unit. BBQ area next to our building was very convenient, and used every night. We were in the same building as The Cove which was the room for all the childrens activities, actually right below our room. Lots of games you can bring to your room and movies (free) for a night of popcorn eating. Our sixteen year old even hooked up with some others his age, so we had both kids happy and occupied, our youngest is 7. Newport Beach area is apparently one of the more expensive

Last August we spent three days at the Marriott New Port Coast Villas and hereby report that it was an exceptional experience. Although not right on the water, the beach was easily accessable, however there was so much to do, we never went to the beach. Both LA and San Diego are drivable for day trips, with all their respective amenities. The Villa was spacious, clean and well decorated.   I highly recommend this resort, however it is extremely difficult to get summer reservations.

Summary Heading: What a Find!-So Glad we did
Summary: We purchased a week here during the holiday season.  We own 4 timeshares and this is the most beautiful.  The room was a little difficult to get to by elevator but had stairs close, which we used sometimes but was a little inconvenient.  The master bedroom had a gorgeous view of the ocean and we really enjoyed having breakfast on the patio.  One thing we didn't like was you had to get in your car to go anywhere-nothing close you can just walk to.  The staff was not friendly at all-but it could be that we were there during the holiday season and the regulars were off.

We stayed a week here during presidents week.  The property is very pretty, and the views from the main pool are lovely.  We had no view at all from our room however.  The rooms are very spacious and well equipped, the master bathroom is beautiful.  But, I couldn't believe that they do not supply ANY toiletries.  One very small bottle of mediocre shampoo was ALL that was in the bathrooms.  Also, there is absolutely NO service to the rooms during your stay.  We had to call and request clean towels, which took them forever, so I finally washed a load of towels.  This would be fine if they provided detergent, which they do not.  They barely supply enough garbage bags for the kitchen for five days and 4 packages of dishwasher detergent (no regular dish detergent at all).  All of

I own in Puerto Vallarta Mexico and exchanged my week for the Marriott Newport Coast Villas.  Although this was not my Mexican Riveria vacation, the property was excellent.  The two bedroom units are spacious and nicely finished out.  The only major complaint I have is no maid service during the week.  You can call for a towel exchange for free - otherwise any other service costs you $$.  I paid $40 for one partial cleaning with sheets changed out.  I'm used to daily maid service at my condo.  Otherwise, the staff was friendly, the resort was fun - big fire pit, video game room, large pools, etc.  I was able to get a late check-out at 11:00 and a free parking voucher for the state park across the street (otherwise $10 - just ask at the front desk for one).  We ate their pizza

My wife and I stayed the week of Feb 3-10 as a trade in another Marriott timeshare which we bought last year so this was our first timeshare experience.  We specifically picked this time as we hoped all the kids would be in school.  Another couple were to join us but backed out so we ended up with 2 large bedrooms, kitchen, dining area, living room etc. all to ourselves.  Our was in the 1600 block (its a huge overall facility) which overlooked a golf course (not Marriotts).  While I new we had others all around us we never heard any sounds (no toilets flushing, doors slamming showers running - it was the quietest place I ever stayed in.  Unlike what others may have experienced I found everything 100% immaculate.  But I would agree that the tiles are loose and cracking in the

Summary Heading: As wonderful as a fake designer handbag!
Summary: It's a lovely resort if you don't look too close.  We had a  fully stocked suite with a wonderful view. The location is convienient. The grounds are beautifully landscaped and the pools are warm.  On the surface it seems luxurious but in reality it is more like a fake designer handbag. You think you're getting Italian leather but it's actually pleather made in China.  Our first night we ordered from their laughable onsite food menu via roomservice. Cold sandwhiches. The quoted wait was 1 hour. It took over  2 hours because they lost our order the first time around.  All that hassle for a dry club sandwhich and bland potato salad.  My main complaint is that the rooms were dirty. The basics like the showers and sinks were clean but the decor had obviously never been cleaned more

We exchanged our time share through Interval International for the Marriott in Newport.  I had read past reviews and was sure we wouldn't be able to get an ocean view but it was our 30th anniversary and I hoped maybe since it was low season we may be able to get a view even if it wasn't the ocean.  I called in advance and told the staff it was our anniversary and asked if we could have a room with a view.  They couldn't promise me but put in a request for me.   Much to our surprise we got a beautiful ocean front room.  The room and view could not have been more perfect.  Management sent us a complimentary bottle of champagne and candy.  This was far more then we expected knowing that we were staying there on an exchange.  The tub and double shower are extra special.  Was so nice

Summary Heading: My most memorable wedding anniversary!!!!  Newport Coast is incredible!!!!
Summary: My husband and I came down here from Santa Barbara and fell in love with the property instantaneously!!  The whole experience was just amazing!!!  The trip itself was a surprise from my husband for our 25th year wedding anniversary!  The room we stayed in had a fabulous view of the ocean and Catalina Island.  When we walked into the Villa there was a bottle of champagne and chocolates and a card that said "Happy 25th Anniversary" - I guess my husband had told a gal at the front desk that it was our anniversary and she said she would make sure our stay was memorable!  Everyone at the resort was so friendly!!  The concierge was very courteous.  They recommended Mastro's Ocean Club for a romantic dinner.  We loved it!!  The next day we went out on Dolphin Dave's catamaran and saw

This was our first visit to this resort and we absolutely loved it.  It is set away from Newport and overlooks a section of beach that is a state park. Staff was great, villas were spacious and beautiful. Pools and grounds were gorgeous.  We are Marriott owners at another resort and were very happy with our trade.  You get the feeling you are far away from LA yet it is a fairly short drive to Disney etc.  There is so much to do within an hours drive that we didn't feel like we were able to spend as much time at the resort as we would have liked -- guess we will just have to come back!!

From check-in with Ben to check-out, our group of 3 adults and 1 child were very pleased with the great property. I had read all the reviews of the property and was slightly concerned about the location and upkeep of the villas-but we had no issues.   -Unit was nicely laid out and furnished with taste and comfort.   -Great welcome packet with coffee and some goodies, bring your own lotion and conditioner. -Facilites (pool, activity centers, etc) were clean and easy to access. -We did not expect a villa with a view (based upon earlier reviews), nor did we recieve one-but we still enjoyed the patio. -We cooked many meals in the unit and found all the pans and utensils we needed.     -Our 5 year-old daughter loved the childrens activity center, pool, and the magician that

Wow!  Loved it here.  I own @ Marriott's Aruba Surf Club, & i traded into this resort.  i (turned 38 this trip) traveled here w/my aunt (63) & my mother-celebrating her 60th. flew in from Boston flying into Los Angeles. We rented a car @ the airport, & we traveled 50 minutes to the resort. we had the 2-br villa. we did request a oceanview & highest floor. we got 1st fl., & a tiny, tiny view of ocean. they rate your request on a 3-tier basis. owners @ that resort 1st preference. marriott owners elsewhere who do a direct swap 2nd preference, & we fell in 3rd w/guests who exchanged through Interval International. I was a bit disappointed @ 1st as I live in NY-5 hrs from the ocean, but I was later fine as we were a 2-min. walk to the main pool. This is a huge resort, & you could be

Summary Heading: Oh I wish I could buy a timeshare here!!
Summary: So beautiful!  Awesome room, great double showers, great kitchen, decor, rooms, etc.  Best hotel I've ever stayed in in my whole life!  I fell in love with the deep jacuzzi tub and barely left the room.  Took a bubble bath every night!  Would be totally awesome for a small party!  Fits 8 people!

The views from this resort are breathtaking and the grounds are beautiful.  We had a great time.  Here's my top ten  list of pros and cons: Pros: 1. Gorgeous views 2. Great accomodations for a larger family- we could find nothing comparable in this area (ocean view- sleeps our family of 6) 3. Plenty to do for the kids: game room, teen room, ping pong, pools, water volleyball,  basketball, playground, kids program etc. 4. New, clean, decorator room interiors. Large master shower and tub. 5.Easy access,  light traffic and convenient to freeways for area sightseeing. Cons:  1. We requested ocean view and centrally located to lobby/pool etc. due to a family member's mobility issues.  We were thankful to receive an ocean view,  but because this resort is built into a steep hillside,

Summary Heading: Expensive Coastal Real Estate, but lacks amenities
Summary: We thought the views here from some of the public spaces were the best feature.  The grounds and public spaces are more luxe here than at other Marriott timeshare properties but the units themselves are smaller.  Ours has a slice of ocean view but was rather dark.  There isn't beach access and you will find most guests at the pool area so the pool is always crowded--that's the only place to be.  The pool bar is the only restaurant and the wait for a burger was over half an hour which we thought pretty unacceptable.  I wouldn't really call it a restaurant--it is just a snack bar where you place an order and then wait forever until they call your number and you pick up your styrofoam box.  It's a big place and right now there isn't the infrastructure to support the number of

Summary Heading: A Very Nice Week at Newport Coast Villas
Summary: We just got back from a two week California vacation.  The first week was spent with my family at the Newport Coast Villas. My parents have a time share property and they exchanged a week for this vacation.  The Newport Coast Villas are very lovely - set up on a hill above the ocean.  Everything seemed to be very new and in good shape.  The landscaping was beautiful.  We were in the 1100 building, which was far from the main lobby/market/pool area, so I didn't spend much time up there, but from what I saw, it seemed like a nice area.  The 1100 building has the grotto pool right in front of it.  We were on the first floor, so we did not have an ocean view, but our access to the pool was great.  I would not have wanted to be up by the main pool (too crowded) and other units had to

Summary Heading: Great location, bad services and bad check in/out time
Summary: The location is great.  There are plenty of great restaurants and shops nearby.  If you have kids, there are plenty to do on the premises for them.  We stayed at the place for our girlfriends’ getaway this year.  Some of us are moms so it was our 24 hours away from our children.    The check in time is 4pm and check out is 10am, which leaves you not much time to enjoy the place if you are there for one night only.  We requested an early check in by phone a week ahead.  They told us to come by around 1pm and they'll see what they could do.  Of course they couldn't do anything until after 4pm the day we arrived.  We requested for a late checkout, which is 11:30am.  11am was the best they can do.  11am sharp, we received a call in our room asking if we need help to move our luggage

We returned from Marriott’s Newport Coast Villas on July 1st and were wholly disappointed with the resort, facilities, rooms and staff.  The main reason we chose MNCVs was that our family of 5 often have difficulty finding accommodations to suit us all. The 2 bedroom/2 bathroom set up here sounded perfect. I actually found the resort on TripAdvisor and contacted them direct. I had no problem making a reservation and was later offered a ‘special deal’ - 3 nights for $295 which was when I found out it was a timeshare resort. I was happy to attend the presentation as we have considered buying a timeshare. This deal plus the 2 extra nights we paid full price for ($330 - $400 per night) should have worked out very well for us.  Prior to our visit I was contacted numerous times by the

The resort and the area are a little pricey, but I would definitely go here again, we had a great time.    We stayed at the Newport Coast Villas at the end of June with my in-laws who are owners at the resort.  It was a beautiful 2 bedroom suite with a full kitchen.  There were 5 of us and we never felt cramped or crowded.  It is a large resort, luckily our room was close to the main buildings and pool.  If you were out in one of the farther buildings, it would be quite a walk to the pool.  There are 3 main pools in the center of the complex with plenty of chairs and umbrellas.  There was only 1 day that we went out and had difficulty finding a place to sit.   There are no restaurants on site, but there is a little market with some food items, Starbucks and Pizza Hut.  You can

Summary Heading: A week in Newport Beach Ca
Summary: We used a week of our timeshare at the Marriott Newport Coast Villas in Newport Beach Ca from May19-26. The villas are simply lovely. We were in building 1900 which has no other buildings in front of it. The pools are warm and huge. There is even a quiet pool for adults. The place is immaculate and in a great location. We ate several meals at restaurants at the Crystal Cove Promonade, about 1 mile away. All were excellent, though rather pricey. We ate at Rouge at Fashion Island. Delicious. We shopped for food at Pavillions, 1 mile away and had dinner in the shopping center one night also. Great for families. We travelled to Catalina Island and took the Skyline Tour. Very well done and most interesting. We travelled to Mission San Juan Capistrano and loved the old mission and the

My wife, two teenage boys and I stayed at NCV during the holiday week.  We are owners at Marriott’s Grande Vista in Orlando and found this resort to be very comparable.  The units  are smaller, which shows in the dining, lack of a pantry closet in the kitchen and any storage closet, but the living room and master bedroom is quite roomy.  The grounds were beautiful.  We stayed in unit 2520, which was an end unit.  It had a nice view of the ocean and it was quiet.  I would mention that the unit has no immediate parking, so we parked near another building and walked.  No big deal for us, but for anyone with an ambulatory problem it could be an issue.  For that matter, being located on the side of a hill like it is, the whole NCV complex would be difficult for anyone who does not do

We just returned from staying here.  I must report that many of the criticisms of prior reviewers have been rectified.  There is wireless internet.  The restaurant around the pool has longer hours.  The front desk staff were friendly (almost too friendly to the point where i didn't feel it was sincere, but i may be a skeptic).  We had a great room, very comfortable, with an ocean view and quiet.  It rained very heavily the entire time we were there, but that wasn't their fault.  We lazied around the room, not waking up and getting out of the room until about 1 or 1:30 p.m.  Based on prior reviews, we assumed they would not clean our room (we were "hotel visitors" not owners, so we were provided cleaning service at no charge).  To our surprise, when we returned to the room around

It couldn't have been a better place to stay.  With a family of 5 we were very comfortable with the accomodations.  This is a 5 Star facility!  The insulation of the units was excellent (didn't ever hear any neighbors), the quality of construction and appointments inside the units was very good as well.    A couple of suggestions that Marriott should take in regards to this property would include: (1) Improve the wireless Internet access.....even with the "booster" that the front desk provides, the access was only intermittent at best with an Apple Powerbook G4, (2) Provide pool wait staff that would service you while at the pool, (3) Give people - at "Check In" - directions to the local grocery stores (i.e. Albertson's, Trader Joe's, Gelson's).  I'd challenge anyone to go to

I stayed at the resort for 2 nights to celebrate my birthday with my husband. When we arrived, the front desk clerk was very attentive(Aaron. Our original assigned room did not have an ocean view, which Aaron quickly changed. The rooms are beautiful, big, and the view was amazing. I may consider buying a timeshare with this resort.

Summary Heading: A great place to spend a Thirty Something Anniversary
Summary: Marriott’s Newport Coast Villas Who are we? My wife and I celebrated our 30+ anniversary (allowing a ten year time frame helps keep you right!) while we were at the Villas on Vacation. I am sixty one (also celebrated that milestone on this vacation.); my wife is five years younger. We are time share owners, since 1997, in Florida, Westgate Vacation Villas. We exchanged one of our weeks for Marriott’s Newport Coast Villas. We were on our first California visit. We were on holidays in California from January 26 to our return to Winnipeg, Manitoba Canada on Valentines Day February 14th. We arrived home to -40 degree temperature. (It is the same temperature in C. or F.)  . We often travel with another couple but this time we were just the two of us. Unforeseen circumstances

This really is the best choice in the area if you need more than a single bedroom for your family.  We did not spend all that much time on the property so can't comment on the activities, etc. but the grounds, facilities and location are all great.  Housekeeping was fine; our only issue was they came at odd times and refused to come back later if we asked.  Having the kitchen and laundry facilities is great, and the property is very close to an upscale shopping center with fine groceries, etc.  Proximity to the beach and state park is great.  We will certainly stay here again.

This is not a hotel but a timeshare development. Like in all timeshares you have to pay extra for housekeeping if you want it more often than weekly. That being said, you find all amenities of a condo rental, like a full kitchen with utensils. Marriott's Newport Coast has only two-bedroom-villas. They are located in two- or three-story buildings. The three-story buildings have elevators, not the others. Be aware of the fact that in two-story buildings you can only get to the units on the ground floor via a steep and (when it rains) slippery stairway because the development is situated on a slope. You have to carry all your luggage down those stairs. A major design flaw! The villas themselves are beautiful: great floorplan that makes them look bigger than they are, tasteful
