We enjoyed our stay in Marriott's two bedroom "villa". The master bedroom had a king bed and a deep soaking tub.  The other bedroom had a queen bed and a sofabed.  There was an additional sofabed in the living room, if we had more people to accomodate. We paid the nightly rate of 281.  This is also a timeshare property, but we experienced no sales pressure. The best thing about the units is that they are set up for longer stays, so they include a washer/dryer and more space than a typical hotel room. The grounds are nicely landscaped and the pool is pretty.  There is a jumbo chess game next to the pool, as well as a ping-pong table.

Summary Heading: Fell in love with Newport Coast
Summary: I agree with the above post that guests need to understand this is an extended stay timeshare property not a hotel.  There are amenties offered here that regular hotels don't have.  There are tons of activities planned throughout the week for adults and kids, which proved to spread a community atmosphere throughout the property. The property is VERY large and layed out over quite a few acres. Depending on where you are staying it may be a bit of a hike to the pool but from everywhere on the property you are graced with beautiful views of the mountains and the ocean.  Our rooms were more than adequate (very similar to all other Marriott Vacation Club properties).  We enjoyed getting to cook breakfast together in the morning and bring it out to the patio as we looked over the
It's a timeshare NOT a hotel and only inexperienced travlers would criticize this place. Can't get better views, service and overall facility. December will be my 8th visit.

Summary Heading: Not such a good stay at Marriott's Newport Coast Villas .
Summary: There is no service at this hotel; it's "self-serve" like a motel. For the price you pay ($300+), you should get real maid service and not have to put your garbage outside your door to be collected. Oh, and room service would be nice as oppose to being limited to stale pizza in their store lobby. The sheets and towels are old. No valet parking and limited convenient parking. Potential guests beware!

Stayed a week in October through a timeshare trade. This is definitely a timeshare. If you're expecting hotel-level service, you may not be happy. For those familiar with timeshare condos, this is towards the top level of timeshares.  The villas are wonderful - tastefully decorated with a good layout. The beds are comfortable. I felt as if I could live in this place. I really enjoyed being able to watch TV from the oversized bathtub. A small disappointment - the tub does not have jets so it is just a large soaking tub. I'm not sure why there isn't a whirlpool.  The full kitchen came in handy. Trader Joe's is nearby (south on PCH) and we don't have one back home, so we tried a lot of food from Trader Joes for dinners. I rarely have time to cook at home, so I didn't mind cooking

My wife and I along with our two kids (9yrs & 7yrs)spent 5 terrific nights here (Oct 9-14).  The landscaping is absolutely beautiful.  All rooms are 2br 2ba with 3 tv's.  It's location is great.  You are only 5 mins to Laguna and 10 mins to Balboa beach.  The front desk has boogie boards ($10) and beach chairs ($3) that you can rent.  We rented 3 boards and the lady at the front desk thought it was too much money so she only charged us for two.  All staff members were great.  The front desk has 3X5 index cards that they can give you with pre-printed directions to any destination you can imagine.  A previuos reviewer stated that there was a $50 charge for towels and room cleaning.  Not true (unless you are a time-share owner).  We had fresh towels and complete room cleaning

Summary Heading: Never again to Newport Coast Villa's
Summary: From the minute we entered the resort we had concerns.  At the desk several customers where having problems with the bill or were unhappy with there rooms.  When we were finally helped the person who checked us in needed some additional training in customer service.  We were so tired after traveling with a baby we overlooked these problems anxious to go to our room with a view of the ocean.  After we found our room we realized that we had nothing but a view of the highway.  And the noise was unreal.  We had to keep our windows closed to be able to hear the TV.  The bed in the master was broken.  The heat did not work just blew constant cold air.  We tried to make reservations to the SPA and they took 5 hours to return our call.  We never did get SPA treatments.  After I

Summary Heading: Not bad but not great either
Summary: Our family stayed here for a week at the beginning of September.  The grounds are gorgeous and the suites are very spacious and new. The master suite is nice, complete with a large tub and double shower. The location is ideal as it is close to Fashion Island, South Coast Plaza, Disneyland, the beach, Laguna Beach, etc.  They let us check in about 1/2 hour early. They brought us a gift for our baby (baby wash, lotion, etc.) which was a nice touch.  They provided a crib, as well as laundry and dishwasher detergent.  Our son loved the chess pieces and the koi pond, as well as the pools (there were 3 of them).  You will definitely need a car if you stay here.  It isn't within walking distance to anything.  Our biggest complaint is that they seem to be tremendously understaffed, and

An absolutely perfect experience.  We went for a getaway retreat at Newport Beach and were so impressed that we surprised ourselves by purchasing a timeshare.  We found the sales presentation to be very informative and we never felt pressured to purchase anything.  This is a resort that is only going to get better and there will never be another like it because of its unique location and the restrictions on building similar facilities anywhere on the south coast.  Fitness facilities are too small and there is no restaurant, other than the snack bar at the pool, but we were assured that both of these deficiencies are in the process of being corrected.

This was our 3 year at Newport (we are owners) and as always, had a great time.  There were six in our party....plenty of room in the villas for that number....never felt crowded.  We have always done the 'in home' cooking and used the kitchen constantly.  There is a Von's (Safeway) up the street, very close to the condo, and also around the corner a Trader Joe's.  The day we check in, we do our weeks worth of grocery shopping at those two places.  The kitchen is well stocked with utensils, pans, coffeemaker, anything you need...even tupperware. :)  If BBQ is your choice, each building has an outdoor area for that--gas grills and usually a round table set for 4.  Over the years we have seen more added to the grounds, and they are doing a great job.  New this year was the

The location was beautiful along with the villas that we stayed in (brand new....one week old).  This is a wonderful place for a family.  We booked for 2 villas as we brought along another family with us.  We couldn't hear them and they were next to us.  However, we could hear those above us.  If you excange for the location (if you don't have time share ownership), which we did, the ocean view is limited only to the owners.  Which was OK with us.  All in all  this place was beautiful.  The scenery was beautiful......a panoramic view of the ocean from the lobby area over looking the swimming pools.  The overall appearance of the resort was taken care of......free of any debris.  They really take pride of the resort and the staff is really helpful and kind.  What a great

We loved our stay.  The rooms are well kept, extremely clean and huge!  The grounds are fantastic.  The pools are awesome.  The kids had so much fun.  At the pool they had  two ping pong tables pool table and a ground chess/checkers game.  Unfortunately it was cloudy while we were there so we weren't able to enjoy the views, but I know they are lovely.  Service was excellant.  They don't have an on-site restaurant, but there are a great many restaurants nearby to choose from.  We did attend the sales preview.  We actually were tempted to buy.  We did catch the sales person up on a couple of things that were contradictory, however, had we had the money right there we might have bought.  Would definitely go back.

we stayed at this lovely property for a week we booked from the marriott website. the condos are the best place to stay for a family the condos are top notch and very close to the attractions of all of orange county I do not think I would buy a time share only because we do not believe in them

Summary Heading: So good, we a stayed longer!!
Summary: I have to say,  we were very impressed with this property.  My husband enjoyed it so much, we are considering purchasing another week at this property.  We own at Shadow Ridge in Palm Springs.    We stayed at this property for 3 days and ended up extending it one more day because we loved it so much.  We stayed in a 2 bedroom/2bath room, that reminded us of our set-up at Shadow Ridge.  This is the perfect size if you have 2 or more kids or family with you.  The decor is beautiful and the quality is fantastic.  The kitchen is well equipped.  Remember this is a condo set-up not a hotel.  So there is lots of space.  Also, if you are from out of town, you must have a car to get around the general area and be sure to pick up groceries too.  We enjoyed the pool area and my kids

Summary Heading: We liked it so much, we bought... and would do so again...
Summary: We love the place - and are looking forward to another visit next month.  The rooms are amazing. Large bedrooms, two full baths - the master bath has a two person tub and a large two-person (multiple head) shower. Marble and granite everywhere.  I've stayed in many nice hotel rooms around the world, and while not quite the Shangri-La in Singapore, it was certainly comparable to the Grand Hyatt in Sydney and the Grand Wailea in Maui.   Tastefully decorated rooms with all the nice little perks (in-room washer/dryer, plenty of utinsils). And of course, the views (which will vary greatly it seems....). Several sunsets were enjoyed from the chairs on the balcony.  We have not experienced any outside noise or that from snoring neighbors. We were actually right above the entrance to

This was our first stay at a Marriott Vacation Club property and we were very impressed.  The staff at the front desk was very friendly and really went out of their way to make us feel welcome.  We checked in around 2 but our villa wasn't ready.  The property is absolutely beautiful.  Grant was our main contact person at the front desk and he was extremely accomodating.  He knew that it was our anniversary and sent up a bottle of wine along with some Ghiradelli chocolate!  What a wonderful surprise.  Since it is a time share property they do reserve the ocean view rooms for owner's, so it is next to impossible for anyone else to get an ocean view, but to be honest with you we hardly spent any time in our villa.  The pool complex is gorgeous and very relaxing and there is a

We returned today from a 2 night stay with our two kids (ages 3 1/2 and 1 1/2). The resort is gorgeous with a beautiful ocean view and italian style buildings and decor. I had requested a villa with an ocean view, but the desk clerk had no record of that. We were given our room keys and were greeted by a constant drilling sound from the floor below. After returning to the lobby to complain, we spoke to 3 staff people (of increase heirarchy) and were told "they are building a restaurant at the floor below your room and will finish at 5 today." We were insulted that the staff thought that we'd be happy with that. After requesting a room change, we learned that the hotel was fully booked.  After some more complaining, our first night there was comped. It would not have been if we

We stayed at the Newport Coast Villas that overlooked the Pelican Hill Golf Club in a 2-bedroom unit, one bedroom with a king bed, second bedrooms with a queen bed and a livingroom queen sofa bed, full kitchens, dining room & living room. The rooms were spacious and clean and the only fault we could find was the condition of the Kitchen Cabinets. (we didn't cook in so it didn't matter) People considering this place should keep in mind that it is mainly a time-share condos. No full service restaurants, room service is an extra fee (there is a washer & dryer in each unit). Great pools (heated to 85 degrees which was warmer that the air temps). There are new units under construction and the original condos are being renovated & updated. We walked down to the Crystal Cove State Park

Summary Heading: Do NOT stay at the Newport Coast Villas by Marriott
Summary: Staying here was a miserable experience for my family. The walls are so thin that we heard our neighbors snoring every night. Outside there was the loudest electrical equipment (compressors, heating systems, etc.)noises I've ever heard at a hotel. It was deafening and constant. We tried to move to another room, but learned that it was loud everywhere on the property.   The customer service was a joke. Everytime we called the front desk, they never answered. They had us on hold for a long time every single time we called. There are no speaker phones so you just sit there listening to a recording until they pick up. Also, there is no other button to press except front desk. You cannot call housekeeping, bellman, pool, etc., so you waste a lot of your vacation on hold. When they

This is a very special place and an amazing value. They are all two bedrooms, very luxurious and brand new! Fabulous location right off pacific coast highway, two minutes to fashion island, and five minutes to downtown Laguna Beach! The pool is amazing which overlooks the ocean, in fact there are three huge pools and jacuzzis. There is no restaurant so you must go off premise to have actual meals, but coffee, danish etc.......is sold in a small cafe type place near the lobby. There is also a putting green, really nice basketball courts for the kids and tennis courts are being built. The value here was excellent as we have three kids and this was less than half of what we paid at the Ritz for two rooms, and here we had much more space. This is an ideal place for a family. This is

Summary Heading: The Secret Costs Of Newport Villas
Summary: Absolutely stunning property and location.  Very high sales pressure - they want you to committ before you can fully comprehend the real costs.  The $28,000 per week charge was not the problem. The problem is the ongoing charges year after year of $1000 per week, $820 of which goes to Marriott for maintenance and management fees. That amounts to about $21,000 a year in charges per unit exluding real estate taxes. That is where Marriott is making their large profit margin - they get $21000 a year, every year, for each unit.  Being familiar with condo association fees,  it is clear these costs have been inflated many times over by Marriott.  It is a brilliant marketing stragegy. Sell units for $2 million each and continue to get return on the sale into perpetuity. The maintainence

My husband and I spent a week there with his family in October 2004.  The rooms are very clean and nice.  We had 2 bedrooms and 2 bathrooms, living room with pull out couch and a kitchen.  We had a great view of the ocean and the pool.  I requested this a month in advance which I'm glad I did b/c the rooms without a view seem to outnumber the ones that do.  The pool is very nice...we stayed at the main pool.  The other 2 were WAY too cold.  They have a snack bar but it closes at 2pm which is TOO early!  There is nothing else to eat there so go food shopping!  There was a small deli inside the resort but it was closed due to renovations.  And the renovations do not end there...there is a lot of building going on outside the resort so there was a lot of noise.  The staff seems

As a gal' on the go I always choose Marriott when I go away on business.  This particular trip was actually part of the Company’s timeshare "marketing" promotion package.  I had the opportunity to stay for 4 days at an extremely low [promotional] price, with the exception that I had to attend a 90 minute sales meeting. From the moment I arrived on the property, I was blown away with its beauty. From hand-crafted fountains to plush gardens, I immediately felt as if I were in Tuscany. I was greeted at the front desk by a young handsome gentleman who made me feel welcome. The rooms were large and spacious with a nice contemporary decor. The only negative comment I can say about my stay with the Coast Villas, is that I wish I could have gotten an ocean view. I would defiantly

Summary Heading: went to time share sales seminar, and got eaten alive by the sharks!!!
Summary: My husband and I went to this Time Share seminar, because we love the Laguna Beach area.  The condos are gorgeous, as are the views of the water.  The Tuscan themes and fountains are also nice.  However, the 90 min. meeting turned into three hours.  We had to tear ourselves away, from the high-pressure sharks.  We almost succumbed to the pressure.  The financial officer was a shark with huge diamond earrings.  I felt that I was being abused by a used car salesperson.    I was tempted to buy, but to be honest, $28,000 for one week a year?  And,,, is it really yours, if you don't get to decorate, or get the same unit each time???   Think about it... how many beautiful hotel stays in that area can you get for $28,000?

Property is beautiful with full 2BR villas, very good pool complex.  However, hotel is more if an apartment complex with pools than a hotel.  Very few amenities, such as restaurant, room service, available concierge, good children's activities etc.  Definitely do the barbecue and smores around fire pit at beach.  Staff that run it are wonderful.  Expect to see dozens of people trooping thru property to consider time-share buying.  Great location for trips to Newport/Balboa, Laguna, even Del Mar.

Summary Heading: great location but just alright villas
Summary: Beautiful place in a great location but needs some more amenities.  First of all they could use a restaurant.  I know you have the kitchen facilities but sometimes we like to just grab something quick. Although you could get a sandwich or some soup at the general store .  On their website they had mentioned that tennis courts would be complete at the end of June.  We got there to find out they won't be complete until either the end of this year or possibly next.  We own a timeshare with Hyatt and there really is no comparison.  The staff was okay but didn't seem to go out of their way.  The girls taking drink orders at the pool seemed to only ask the people they wanted to, we were never asked when I was with my mom.  It was different when I was with my husband.  They were

I was a little disappointed with the resort given that it got a lot of good reviews here. I've stayed at lot of vacation properities (including other Marriott Vacation Clubs). The best I stayed at was the Hyatt's Pinon Pointe in Sedona (excellent clubhouse, great gym, all around a solid deal).  I paid $400 for the unit, per night  CON: crowded pool, pictures on the Internet look better than in real-life, not as much amenities, small gym, there aren't that many public areas to sit and enjoy the view, staff is medicore, not friendly but not rude  PRO: good location halfway between Newport and Laguna (you will need a car to get around). Proximity to Crystal Cove park (down the street), very spacious at 1,200 square feet and all the furnishings are new.  Try to get a condo close to

Stayed here for a week with my parents (who are time-share owners) Really loved the pools, the views and the beach.  Organizing meals is definately a MUST since the rooms have FULL kitchens stocked with all the equipment you need... saves money and leaves more time to enjoy the beach and pools.  Go to Crystal Cove Beach just down the street.... turn right after the ranger station where you pay and park in the 1st lot on left.... walk down to the beautiful beach and tidepools.... ENJOY!!

Summary Heading: Time share kiosk in Irvine Spectrum
Summary: Hello,  A few weeks ago I was at the Irvine Spectrum in Irvine with my two young daughters.  We approached the Marriott timeshare kiosk in interest because our friend has invited us to his Marriott Aruba timeshare in July.  I was told about the $125 gift certificate to Fashion Island that would be given as a Mother's day gift if I would attend a brief seminar on the Marriott timeshare opportunity.  I was advised to bring my husband.  When I informed the gentleman that I was divorced I was then informed that I was not eligible to attend.  I was insulted and hurt.  I am a hardworking single mom who just purchased a third home in Aliso Viejo, CA. I feel I have been discriminated.

Summary Heading: I liked Newport Beach and Laguna Beach - great area.
Summary: This appears to be the smallest of the Marriott timeshares I've visited, and I missed not having a fireplace on a cool evening.  The 2 bedrooms are well separated.  The master tub is 3 ft deep by 4 ft square, no jets, just for soaking, but you can't stretch out in it.  Used it only once.  Master shower had 2 showerheads.  Got locked out of the suite on the balcony when the sliding doors closed and locked behind us one night - had to ask someone walking by to call security for us.  The services close at 6 or 7 p.m. and you can't get as much as a chocolate bar after that!  No stores nearby - you need a car, but there are great restaurants nearby like Mortons, Ruth's Chris, Five Crowns, Arches, and more.  Full kitchen so you can load up if you want to cook instead.  Beds were just

Summary Heading: Now I know why housing is so expensive in Southern CA.
Summary: What an incredible Marriott Vacation Villa. Marriott spared no expense, the pool, facilities were outstanding - with fantastic views of the Pacific Ocean and in some rooms a view of the Pelican Hills Golf Course and Ocean. The staff did a great job with kids activities, especially the family barbeque on the beach in Corona Del Mar. Since the Villas are still under construction we had to travel 10 minutes north to play tennis (not completed on site yet) at the Marriott Newport Tennis facility in Newport but Robin and Rene' and the rest of the staff were great at setting up matches for both singles and doubles. I also highly recommend Mike Lindsay, a former New Zealand Davis cup player, for lessons. He was as good if not better than any instructor we have had. It's also worth a

Summary Heading: Beautiful and gracious location, still building.
Summary: Beautiful location on a hillside across from the beach and very nice villas. Grounds and buildings very well maintained and clean. Staff very responsive to inquiries as to local activities. An onsite restaurant would add to the experience.

My wife and I stayed here for a week and didn't want to leave. Stunning ocean views. Perfect location, nestled between Laguna Beach and Newport. Rooms are fabulous. We were there in late 2002 and they were still doing construction, a little noisy during the day. Other than that, if you are visiting the west coast and want to relax you found your spot.

Very impressive resort complex perched on a bluff above the Pacific Coast Highway. across from a quiet stretch of beach (State Park). Beautiful fountains,gardens and pools. Location, location, and again location can't be beat. Short drives in either direction to tons of classy shops, dining and activities. Only surprise was the one mile walk "down" from the villas to the beach. Just plan ahead, and wear walking shoes instead of sandals.    Great floor plans in these 2bdrm.villas. Master suite and 2nd bdrm/bath completly separated with living quarters inbetween. I moved the coffee maker into the master suite and had my own perfect quiet time each  morning. Fully enjoyed the newspaper waiting outside my door too.     Would advise requesting a veranda/balconey with a wrought iron

The setting, the views and the villa itself, were all absolutely beautiful. The biggest downfall to our party of 8 (all family members); was that there were not any restaurants, deli's, or any other on-sight establishments located within the resort. Nor was there any shopping facilities located within walking distance. The resort is basically just a group of "villa's". We've been at other "villa" resorts, which were basically small cities within themselves. Just about anything that we would be in need of, without leaving the resort, would be available.  This is a very important necessity, especially when children are involved.  Regardless, I can honestly say that it was the most beautiful area, as well as the setting that we've ever vacationed at. Updating to a more family

Summary Heading: Nice villas with very little services
Summary: We stayed in a 2 bedroom villa. The hotel caters to timeshare owners.  It's not very likely, as a non-owner, that you would get a room with a view. The hotel also has no restaurant or room service. If you are self-sufficient and do not mind grocery shopping and cooking for yourself, it's a great hotel for that. Most villas are very far away from the main building and main pool. You must drive there, but it's also not easy to find parking. I would recommend the hotel for family with young children. I would not recommend it for couple looking for pampering.

We loved it! It is new and they were in the process of completing all the buildings. We were the first people to stay in our room, our building had just opened the week we were there. The resort was gorgeous, it overlooks the Pacific, the staff was extremly nice and helpful. We were one mile from Laguna Beach and about twenty minutes from LA. The whole Newport area was great. We have just booked another week for next June, we can't wait to go back!
Excellent accommodations, luxury villa with great views.  New property, so there was some construction outside our villa.
